###12491503
background	The potential cardiotoxicity of the doxorubicin-paclitaxel regimen , when paclitaxel is given shortly after the end of the anthracycline infusion , is an issue of concern , as suggested by small single institution Phase II studies .
population	In a large multicenter Phase III trial , 275 anthracycline naive metastatic breast carcinoma patients were randomized to receive either doxorubicin ( 60 mg/m ( 2 ) ) followed 30 minutes later by paclitaxel ( 175 mg/m ( 2 ) 3-hour infusion ; AT ) or a standard doxorub
other	Both treatments were given once every 3 weeks for a maximum of six cycles .
other	Close cardiac monitoring was implemented in the study design .
outcome	Congestive heart failure ( CHF ) occurred in three patients in the AT arm and in one patient in the AC arm ( P = 0.62 ) .
outcome	Decreases in left ventricular ejection fraction to below the limit of normal were documented in 33 % AT and 19 % AC patients and were not predictive of CHF development .
outcome	AT is devoid of excessive cardiac risk among metastatic breast carcinoma patients , when the maximum planned cumulative dose of doxorubicin does not exceed 360 mg/m ( 2 ) .

###18483004
background	A debilitating consequence of complete spinal cord injury ( SCI ) is the loss of motor control .
background	Although the goal of most SCI treatments is to re-establish neural connections , a potential complication in restoring motor function is that SCI may result in anatomical and functional changes in brain areas controlling motor output .
background	Some animal investigations show cell death in the primary motor cortex following SCI , but similar anatomical changes in humans are not yet established .
population	The aim of this investigation was to use voxel-based morphometry ( VBM ) and diffusion tensor imaging ( DTI ) to determine if SCI in humans results in anatomical changes within motor cortices and descending motor pathways .
outcome	Using VBM , we found significantly lower gray matter volume in complete SCI subjects compared with controls in the primary motor cortex , the medial prefrontal , and adjacent anterior cingulate cortices .
outcome	DTI analysis revealed structural abnormalities in the same areas with reduced gray matter volume and in the superior cerebellar cortex .
outcome	In addition , tractography revealed structural abnormalities in the corticospinal and corticopontine tracts of the SCI subjects .
outcome	In conclusion , human subjects with complete SCI show structural changes in cortical motor regions and descending motor tracts , and these brain anatomical changes may limit motor recovery following SCI .

###8515864
population	We examined the distribution of mRNA for the peptide cholecystokinin ( CCK ) with in situ hybridization in adult rat lumbar dorsal root ganglia following unilateral section of the sciatic nerve , as well as the effect of systemic CI 988 , a selective antagoni
outcome	There was a dramatic increase in the number of neurons in dorsal root ganglia synthesizing the peptide cholecystokinin ( CCK ) after sciatic nerve section .
outcome	Furthermore , the autotomy behavior of rats was significantly inhibited by chronic i.t. administration of morphine in conjunction with subcutaneous ( s.c. ) injection of CI 988 .
outcome	Neither i.t. morphine nor s.c. CI 988 alone produced a comparable effect on autotomy .
outcome	Our results suggested that up-regulation of the mRNA for CCK in primary afferents after nerve injury may be related to the clinical phenomenon of opioid insensitivity .
outcome	Thus , coadministration of CCK antagonists in combination with opioids may offer a new approach in treating neuropathic pain .

###12505953
population	This case history describes the treatment of a patient suffering with persistent pain .
other	He was treated surgically with implantation of a spinal cord stimulator .
intervention	After surgery , a partial paralysis that could not be explained medically and that was probably related to emotional factors occurred , and cognitive behavioral treatment was begun .
outcome	This paper discusses the importance of considering social and psychological factors when medical treatment options are considered .

###10962609
study design	Prospective monocentric follow-up study .
background	To assess long-term functional and urodynamic results of augmentation enterocystoplasty in spinal cord injury ( SCI ) patients with detrusor hyperreflexia and reflex incontinence who failed to respond to conservative treatment .
other	Department of Urology ( PitiÃ©-SalpÃ©triÃ¨re Hospital , Paris , France ) , Department of Neurological Rehabilitation ( Raymond PoincarÃ© Hospital , Garches , France ) , Assistance Publique - Hopitaux de Paris , University Paris VI and V , France .
population	Prospective study of 17 SCI patients ( four above T6 level , nine between T6 and T12 , and four below T12 ) with history of refractory urge incontinence to pharmacotherapy .
intervention	Partial cystectomy ( subtrigonal for 15 ) was performed with Hautmann enterocystoplasty ( 15 ) or detubularized clam cystoplasty ( two ) .
outcome	Mean follow-up was 6.3 + / -3.8 years ( range 1.25 - 10.5 years ) .
outcome	Fifteen of 17 ( 88.5 % ) patients were completely continent under self clean intermittent catheterization ( CIC ) ( mean 4.6 / day , range 4 - 7 ) .
outcome	The remaining two patients with pudendal nerve denervation had persistent stress urinary incontinence .
outcome	No operative complications were noted .
outcome	Long-term complications included recurrent pyelonephritis for one patient .
outcome	Maximal cystometric capacity increased from 174.1 + / -103.9 to 508.1 + / -215.8 ml ( P < 0.05 ) .
outcome	Maximal end filling pressure decreased from 65.5 + / -50.2 to 18.3 + / -7.9 cm H2O ( P < 0.05 ) .
outcome	Urodynamic evaluation and clinical assessment demonstrate long-term success of augmentation enterocystoplasty in an homogeneous population ( SCI ) without delayed complications in SCI patients .

###14504374
background	Motor complications are a common cause of treatment failure in Parkinson 's disease ( PD ) .
population	Although the underlying mechanisms remain obscure , research with 1-methyl-4-phenyl-1 ,2,3,6 - tetrahydropyridine ( MPTP ) - treated primates may facilitate their investigation .
population	Repeated administration of L-dopa to MPTP-treated primates results in a loss of drug efficacy ( `` wearing off '' ) and periods of immobility ( `` on-off '' ) .
outcome	Immediately after each dose of L-dopa , animals show an initial worsening of motor performance ( `` beginning-of-dose deterioration '' ) and , at the end of action of each dose , they exhibit a decline to levels of disability below those seen at baseline
outcome	Dyskinesia ( chorea , dystonia , athetosis ) appears rapidly in MPTP-treated primates given L-dopa .
outcome	The greater the degree of nigral denervation , the less exposure to L-dopa that is required to induce dyskinesia .
outcome	The onset and intensity of dyskinesia are related to the dose and frequency of L-dopa administration .
outcome	Increasing brain exposure to L-dopa increases the severity and intensity of involuntary movements .
outcome	In contrast , long-acting dopamine agonists ( DAs ) induce a far lower incidence of dyskinesia , and continuous dopaminergic stimulation may provide a means of avoiding its onset .
outcome	Recent data from MPTP-treated primates suggest that switching from L-dopa to a long-acting DA may reverse the priming process associated with induction of dyskinesia .
outcome	Responses of MPTP-treated primates have proved to be highly predictive of antiparkinsonian activities of drugs in humans and their ability to induce dyskinesia , but they may also have utility in evaluating the mechanisms that underlie a range of long-term

###16737404
background	Following spinal cord injury ( SCI ) , paralyzed muscles undergo physiological changes that alter their force responses to electrical stimulation .
background	The purpose of this study was to investigate the effects of SCI on the contractile properties and force-frequency relationship ( FFR ) of the paralyzed human quadriceps femoris muscle of adolescents and young adults .
population	Thirteen subjects ( 11 male , 2 female ; age range = 11-24 years ) with motor complete SCIs and 13 matched control subjects ( 11 male , 2 female ; age range = 9-23 years ) without SCI participated in the study .
other	Both groups of subjects underwent the same testing protocol using similar equipment .
outcome	The paralyzed muscles of the subjects with SCI produced 62 % of the peak twitch force and had a fatigue ratio that was 65 % of that of the control subjects .
outcome	The paralyzed muscles contracted 14 % and 25 % faster and relaxed 38 % and 46 % faster than the nonparalyzed muscles in nonfatigued and fatigued conditions , respectively .
outcome	Compared with the control subjects , the subjects with SCI had twitch-to-tetanus ratios that were 84 % and 127 % greater in nonfatigued and fatigued conditions , respectively .
outcome	Relative to the control subjects , the FFR of the subjects with SCI was shifted to the left in the fatigued condition .
outcome	Relative to their respective nonfatigued conditions , the FFR of both groups of subjects shifted to the right with fatigue .
outcome	These findings may have important implications for designing stimulation strategies to reduce the rapid fatigue that limits the clinical efficacy of functional electrical stimulation .

###17253537
background	Disabling tremor or ataxia is common in multiple sclerosis ( MS ) and up to 80 % of patients experience tremor or ataxia at some point during their disease .
background	A variety of treatments are available , ranging from pharmacotherapy or stereotactic neurosurgery to neurorehabilitation .
population	To assess the efficacy and tolerability of both pharmacological and non-pharmacologic treatments of ataxia in patients with MS.
other	The following electronic resources were searched
other	Cochrane MS Group trials register ( June 2006 ) , the Cochrane Central Register of Controlled Trials ( CENTRAL ) ( Issue 2 , 2006 ) , National Health Service National Research Register ( NRR ) including the Medical Research Council Clinical Trials Directory ( Issue 2 , 2006 ) , MEDLINE ( January 1996 to June 2006 ) , and EMBASE ( Jan 1988 to June 2006 ) .
other	Manual searches of bibliographies of relevant articles , pertinent medical and neurology journals and abstract books of major neurology and MS conferences ( 2001-2006 ) were also performed .
other	Direct communication with experts and drug companies was sought .
other	Blinded , randomised trials which were either placebo-controlled or which compared two or more treatments were included .
other	Trials testing pharmacological agents must have had both participant and assessor blinding .
other	Trials testing surgical interventions or effects of physiotherapy , where participants could not have been blinded to the treatment , must have had independent assessors who were blinded to the treatment .
other	Cross-over trials were included .
other	Three independent reviewers extracted data and the findings of the trials were summarised .
other	A meta-analysis was not performed due to the inadequacy of outcome measures and methodological problems with the studies reviewed .
outcome	Ten randomised controlled trials met the inclusion criteria .
outcome	Six placebo-controlled studies ( pharmacotherapy ) and four comparative studies ( one stereotactic neurosurgery and three neurorehabilitation ) were reviewed .
outcome	No standardised outcome measures were used across the studies .
outcome	In general , pharmacotherapies were unrewarding and data on neurosurgery or rehabilitation is insufficient to lead to a change in practice .
outcome	The absolute and comparative efficacy and tolerability of pharmacotherapies to treat ataxia in MS are poorly documented and no recommendations can be made to guide prescribing .
outcome	Although studies on neurosurgery and neurorehabilitation showed promising results , the absolute indications for treating with those methods can not be developed .
outcome	Standardised , well validated measures of ataxia and tremor need to be developed and employed in larger randomised controlled trials with careful blinding .

###18484790
background	Spinal cord injury ( SCI ) has a number of severe and disabling consequences , including chronic pain , and around 40 % of patients develop persistent neuropathic pain .
background	Pain following SCI has a detrimental impact on the patient 's quality of life and is a major specific healthcare problem in its own right .
background	Thus far , there is no cure for the pain and oral pharmaceutical intervention is often inadequate , commonly resulting in a reduction of only 20-30 % in pain intensity .
background	Neuropathic pain sensations are characterized by spontaneous persistent pain and a range of abnormally evoked responses , e.g. allodynia ( pain evoked by normally non-noxious stimuli ) and hyperalgesia ( an increased response to noxious stimuli ) .
background	Neuropathic pain following SCI may be present at or below the level of injury .
background	Oral pharmacological agents used in the treatment of neuropathic pain act either by depressing neuronal activity , by blocking sodium channels or inhibiting calcium channels , by increasing inhibition via GABA agonists , by serotonergic and noradrenergic reu
background	At present , only ten randomized , double-blind , controlled trials have been performed on oral drug treatment of pain after SCI , the results of most of which were negative .
background	The studies included antidepressants ( amitriptyline and trazodone ) , antiepileptics ( gabapentin , pregabalin , lamotrigine and valproate ) and mexiletine .
outcome	Gabapentin , pregabalin and amitriptyline showed a significant reduction in neuropathic pain following SCI .
outcome	Cannabinoids have been found to relieve other types of central pain , and serotonin noradrenaline reuptake inhibitors as well as opioids relieve peripheral neuropathic pain and may be used to treat patients with SCI pain .

###14656249
background	Large outbreaks of Legionella pneumonia are rare , but when they occur provide an opportunity to assess predictors of mortality and efficacy of drug therapy .
background	Although erythromycin has been the treatment of choice for many years , newer antimicrobials with increased activity against Legionella are available .
background	A large outbreak of legionnaires ' disease associated with the Melbourne Aquarium occurred in April 2000 .
other	To describe the patterns and impact of Legionella therapy , and predictors of outcome in a large group of hospitalized patients with legionnaires ' disease .
population	A 6-month retrospective audit of hospitalized patients with proven legionnaires ' disease around the time of the Melbourne Aquarium outbreak was conducted .
other	Statistical analysis was performed using SAS version 8.0 ( SAS Institute Inc. , NC , USA ) .
other	Data were obtained on 104 patients ( 71 aquarium related , 33 not related ) .
outcome	There were six deaths ( mortality rate 5.8 % ) , three of which were attributable directly to progressive legionnaires ' disease .
outcome	The major predictors of death were pre-existing cardiac failure ( P = 0.0035 ) and renal disease ( P = 0.026 ) .
outcome	Erythro-mycin is still the most commonly used antibiotic ( 80 % received i.v. erythromycin ) with clinicians prescribing more than one active Legionella drug in the majority of cases ( 76 % ) .
outcome	Choice of initial antibiotic therapy did not statistically affect outcome as measured by death , length of hospital stay or time to defervescence , although there was a trend towards improved survival with i.v. erythromycin ( P = 0.063 ) .
outcome	Intravenous erythromycin was associated with a 19 % rate of phlebitis , whereas side-effects from other antibiotics were uncommon .
outcome	The most commonly used Legionella therapy in Australia remains erythromycin .
outcome	This continues to be an effective agent , however , side-effects are common .

###11301617
background	The term osteoporosis often conjures up an image of deformed spines , -- small stooping ladies burdened with back pain .
background	Most modern medication against osteoporosis has documented effect first and foremost against vertebral fractures .
background	However , are vertebral fractures a public health issue , and are they frequent and serious enough to warrant aggressive and expensive preventive measures ?
other	Through search in Medline with the terms `` osteoporosis '' , `` vertebral fracture * '' and `` vertebral deformities '' , we identified and reviewed a total of 222 scientific articles on vertebral fractures .
outcome	Incident vertebral deformities entail temporary complaints , and the consequences of prevalent deformities are minute unless there are several deformities .
outcome	Less than 8 % of back pain among the elderly can be attributed to vertebral deformities .
other	A large double-blind , randomised clinical trial demonstrates that treatment that halves the risk of new vertebral deformities barely affects the occurrence of back pain or disability .
outcome	Even if some patients ' suffering is attributable to vertebral deformities , we conclude that vertebral deformities represent a minor public health problem .
outcome	As a consequence , studies exploring predictors of painful vertebral fractures are warranted ; furthermore , more documentation on prevention of non-vertebral fractures is needed .

###15188794
background	Our aim was to evaluate the efficacy of maintenance oral nifedipine in pregnant women initially treated with intravenous ritodrine plus verapamil for preterm labor .
population	The study included 73 patients with preterm labor with intact membranes .
intervention	Patients were randomized to receive either maintenance oral nifedipine therapy ( n = 37 ) administered 20 mg every six hours or no treatment ( controls , n = 36 ) after discontinuation of acute intravenous tocolysis .
outcome	Compared to the control group , the mean + / - SD time gained from initiation of maintenance therapy to delivery ( 26.65 + / - 18.89 vs. 16.14 + / - 12.91 days , p = 0.007 ) and the gestational age at delivery ( 37.03 + / - 2.06 vs. 35.1 + / - 3 weeks , p = 0.003 ) were highe
outcome	The proportion of patients who required one or more courses of subsequent intravenous therapy and perinatal outcomes were similar in the maintenance therapy and control groups .
outcome	The gestational age and time gained from initiation of maintenance therapy to delivery were longer in women receiving oral maintenance tocolysis with nifedipine .
outcome	However , maintenance therapy did not decrease the recurrence of preterm labor episodes or improve perinatal outcomes .

###16455365
background	This study evaluates the reliability of type 3 portable monitoring ( PM ) in a home setting .
study design	Prospective study in sleep laboratory .
population	Type 3 device ( Stardust II ) was evaluated in comparison with standard polysomnography ( PSG ) among patients with obstructive sleep apnea .
other	Quality of recorded data and agreement between PM and PSG results were evaluated .
outcome	Low quality of recorded data was observed only in 5 cases .
outcome	Pattern of disordered breathing was recognized correctly by PM .
outcome	Apnea/hypopnea index ( AHI ) correlated well with a mean bias of 3.7 + / - 13.1 / h.
outcome	High sensitivity of PM was observed generally , whereas specificity was lower in mild patients .
outcome	AHI , record time , and sleep position were found to be the main factors that would affect the accuracy of PM .
outcome	Type 3 PM is feasible in unattended home-setting for routine examination .
outcome	Influence of the factors above should be comprehensively considered especially for mild patients .

###16371678
background	Two experiments were performed regarding the effect of conscious control on handwriting fluency in healthy adults and ADHD children .
population	First , 26 healthy students were asked to write a sentence under different conditions .
outcome	The results indicate that automated handwriting movements are independent from visual feedback .
population	Second , the writing performance of 12 children with ADHD was examined on their usual medication with methylphenidate and under placebo .
outcome	In comparison to placebo , medication with methylphenidate resulted in a reduced fluency of handwriting .
outcome	Automated handwriting movements could be elicited in children with ADHD on medication .
outcome	The results suggest that both visual and mental control of handwriting movements affect the automation of handwriting movements .
outcome	Furthermore , a simple training procedure was designed and performed in a case study of a boy with ADHD .

###8567747
background	This article concerns traction lesions of the brachial plexus in adults , focusing on management and recovery .
background	Open wounds of the plexus are now treated surgically as soon as possible .
background	The subsequent rehabilitation is the same as that for closed traction lesions of the brachial plexus in which significant recovery is expected .

###16286345
background	The cognitive profile and outcome of Encephalitis Lethargica has not been systematically described in the literature .
background	Treatment has typically focused upon medical management .
population	The first case report of a patient with Encephalitis Lethargica who underwent a systematic programme of cognitive rehabilitation is presented .
other	Initial neuropsychological assessment conducted during her acute presentation indicated generalized cognitive dysfunction , including memory and executive function impairments .
other	An outpatient cognitive rehabilitation programme addressed the development of awareness and the remediation of memory and executive function impairments .
outcome	Repeat assessment indicated significant improvement in cognitive function .
other	The components of her rehabilitation programme are discussed .
outcome	She has been able to successfully return to her pre-morbid level of work responsibility within 8 months of her admission .

###9017028
background	In about 20 % of MS patients an increased CSF/serum albumin quotient ( QAlb ) has been observed .
background	The reason for this blood-CSF barrier dysfunction is yet unclear .
population	QAlb values from 48 MS patients in relapse were correlated with parameters of active CNS lesions as measured by gadolinium-DTPA MRIs .
population	QAlb values from 20 MS patients without relapse served as controls .
outcome	Mean QAlb values ( x 10 ( 3 ) of a group with spinal cord lesions ( 7.6 + / - 3.6 ; n = 16 ) differed significantly from those of a control group ( 4.6 + / - 1.5 ; n = 20 ; p < 0.005 ) as well as from those of a group with supratentorial lesions ( 5.0 + / - 1.8 ; n = 18 ;
outcome	QAlb values of patients with a spinal lesion tended to decrease with increasing time intervals between onset of relapse and lumbar puncture .
outcome	The data is in consent with the present knowledge on flow dynamics of both extracellular fluid and CSF .
outcome	As a clinical consequence , increased QAlb values in MS patients may hint at an active spinal or , less likely , infratentorial lesion .

###9710409
background	Pain resulting from a usually nonpainful stimulus ( allodynia ) is a common characteristic of neuropathic pain .
background	Among animal models of allodynia , tight ligature of lumbar spinal nerves has been of special interest because it has been reported to be relieved by sympathectomy .
background	The purpose of this study was to determine whether spinal analgesic agents , which have opposite effects on sympathetic nervous system activity ( clonidine decreases it and neostigmine increases it ) , have differing efficacy in this model .
population	Male Sprague-Dawley rats were anesthetized , and the left L5 and L6 spinal nerves were ligated .
intervention	At least 2 weeks later , a lumbar intrathecal or jugular intravenous catheter was inserted .
intervention	Withdrawal threshold to mechanical stimulation of the hind paw was determined by application of von Frey filaments before surgery ; after surgery ; after intrathecal injection of clonidine , neostigmine , or their combination ; after intravenous injection of p
outcome	Spinal nerve ligation reduced withdrawal threshold ipsilateral to the lesion .
outcome	Neither chemical nor surgical sympathectomy altered allo
outcome	Therefore , intrathecally administered analgesic agents , one that reduces sympathetic outflow from the spinal cord ( clonidine ) and one that increases it ( neostigmine ) , were similarly effective in this model .

###12647945
background	Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease ( COPD ) is a condition characterized by progressive airflow limitation and decline in lung function .
background	As seen in other developed countries throughout the world , COPD in the U.K is associated with considerable mortality , and morbidity from the disease places a significant burden on the healthcare system and society .
background	Despite the obvious burden of COPD in this country , there is a lack of recognition of COPD among the general public .
background	Healthcare professionals may also fail to recognize the burden of disease , as shown by underdiagnosis and inadequate managemen .
background	A key step in increasing awareness of the burden of COPD is obtaining comprehensive information about the impact of the disease on patients , the health service and society .
background	The large-scale international survey , Confronting COPD in North America and Europe , aimed to address this need for information , by interviewing patients and physicians in eight countries .
outcome	An economic analysis of patient responses to the survey in the U.K showed that COPD places a high burden on the healthcare system and society with annual direct costs estimated at pounds 819.42 per patient , and indirect cost at pound 819.66 per patient re
outcome	The cost impact of the disease was particularly marked in secondary care , as a result of inpatient hospitalizations , amounting to 54 % of direct costs .
outcome	These results suggest that reducing patient requirement for hospital care could alleviate the burden of COPD on the U.K. healthcare system .
outcome	This will require considerable improvements to the way the disease is managed by healthcare professionals in primary care , with earlier diagnosis and the use of interventions aimed at preventing exacerbations and delaying the progression of disease .

###18568717
background	To evaluate the feasibility of using a newly developed electromechanical gait device ( LokoHelp ) for locomotion training in neurological patients with impaired walking ability with respect to training effects and patients ' and therapists ' efforts and disco
study design	METHODS AND PROCEDURES : design : Case series .
other	setting
other	A neurological rehabilitation centre for children , adolescents and young adults .
other	subjects
population	Six patients with impaired walking function : two after stroke , two after spinal cord injury and two after brain injury .
other	Intervention
intervention	Twenty additional training sessions on a treadmill fitted with a newly developed electromechanical gait device and body weight support ( BWS ) , performed over a study-period of 6 weeks .
other	Patients ' progress was assessed with the following instruments the Functional Ambulation Category FAC ( walking ability ) , the 10-metre walk test ( gait velocity ) , the Motricity Index ( lower limb strength ) , the Berg Balance Scale ( postural capacity ) , the modified Ashworth Scale ( spasticity ) and the Rivermead Mobility Index ( activity ) .
other	After each therapy session , therapists completed a form , thereby indicating whether manual assistance was necessary and , if so , how much physical effort was expended and how much discomfort was experienced during the therapy session .
outcome	The therapists also indicated on the form information about the patient 's effort and discomfort .
outcome	No severe adverse events were observed during the locomotion training with the LokoHelp device .
outcome	Patients improved with regard to Functional Ambulation Category ( FAC ) ( from mean 0.7 , SD = 1.6 , to mean 2.5 , SD = 2.1 , p = 0.048 ) , Motricity Index ( from mean 94 points , SD = 50 , to mean 111 , SD = 52 , p = 0.086 ) , Berg Balance Scale ( BBS ) ( from mean 20 poin
outcome	Therapists required a low level of effort to carry out the training and seldom experienced discomfort .
outcome	Patients described their effort during training as being low-to-exhausting .
outcome	They rarely experienced discomfort , which was mostly related to difficulties with the BWS-System .
outcome	Training intensity had to be adjusted in one patient who complained of knee pain .
outcome	Locomotion training with the newly developed ` LokoHelp ' - system is feasible in severely affected patients after brain injury , stroke and spinal cord injury .
outcome	In addition , our results indicate that the described alternative method of gait training may decrease the exertion needed by therapists to carry out the training .

###1567030
background	We have recently reported a chronic allodynialike symptom in rats after ischemic spinal cord injury .
background	This pain-related behavior is resistant to a number of pharmacologic treatments , including morphine , clonidine , carbamazepine , baclofen , and muscimol .
outcome	In the present report , we present evidence indicating that systemic mexiletine , a local anesthetic and antiarrhythmic agent , effectively relieves the allodynia-like symptoms at doses of 15 and 30 mg/kg in these rats without inducing major side effects .
outcome	It is suggested that systemically applied mexiletine may be useful in treating central pain in patients with spinal cord injury .

###7163721
population	To assess the effect of 3 oz of 80-proof alcohol on the frequency and severity of obstructive sleep apnea ( OSA ) , we studied six OSA patients and six healthy subjects on 2 nights .
outcome	During the 1st night , when no alcohol was given , five patients demonstrated mild and one severe OSA episodes associated with a decline in arterial oxygen saturation to at least 92 % ( hypoxic event ) .
outcome	On the 2nd night after ingesting 3 oz of alcohol just prior to bedtime , all the patients demonstrated a significant increase in the number and/or severity of hypoxic events compared with the no-alcohol night .
outcome	Furthermore , the most severe hypoxic events occurred within 80 to 160 min after sleep onset , a significantly shorter latency after sleep onset than on the no-alcohol night .
outcome	In contrast , the healthy subjects had no incidents of hypoxic events or breathing abnormalities during sleep after ingesting 0.8 gm/kg of alcohol .
outcome	Possible mechanisms for these results are discussed .
outcome	An OSA provocation test using alcohol is proposed during a 2nd night of evaluation for patients with mild to moderate or intermittent OSA conditions , but not for patients demonstrating severe hypoxic events or with alcohol intolerance .
outcome	The alcohol provocation test would serve to determine the influence of alcohol on the frequency and severity of hypoxic events , providing the patient with a measure of the adverse effects of social drinking on their condition .

###8924951
background	Intracytoplasmic sperm injection ( ICSI ) , treatment of severe male infertility allows an accurate evaluation of oocyte maturity at recovery after corona-cell removal .
outcome	In cycles comprising a GnRH analog desensitization and a stimulation by hMG or FSH , 12 % of oocytes aspirated from follicles ( > 14 mm ) , 34 hours post-hCG are still immature , in prophase or metaphase 1 .
outcome	They are able to achieve meiosis in vitro in 66 % of the cases and will be fertilized ( 2 PN ) by ICSI in 51 % of the cases as the in vivo mature oocytes of the same cohort .
outcome	Nevertheless , the quality of cytoplasmic maturation and consequently of embryonic viability remains to be assessed as there still are few pregnancies arising from in vitro matured oocytes .
outcome	ICSI also represents the only way to obtain normal fertilization in some exceptional but observed anomalies of oocyte maturation , particularly when there is a lack of zona reaction leading to repetitive polyspermy in conventional IVF .

###8918965
population	We studied the respiratory muscles with magnetic transcranial stimulation ( TCS ) in four spinal cord injured ( SCI ) patients as compared to age-matched controls from a database of 40 healthy subjects .
background	These SCI patients all had spinal cord lesions above C6 level with a clinically incomplete tetraplegia .
background	One patient was artificially ventilated .
other	Motor evoked potentials ( MEPs ) were recorded from the diaphragm , the scalenes , the parasternal intercostals and the expiratory rectus abdominis during inspiration and expiration .
outcome	In patients with incomplete tetraplegia MEP latency times were significantly prolonged in the scalenes and the parasternal intercostals , both during inspiration and expiration , and were nearly normal for the diaphragm , which was found to be more or less p
outcome	The mean MEP amplitudes in these patients for all inspiratory muscles studied were significantly decreased in tetraplegic patients , in part due to a decreased number of innervating axons and muscle hypotrophy .
outcome	No MEPs could be obtained from the abdominal muscles , except in one C3 tetraplegic patient , in whom only a very small response was seen during expiration , with a very delayed latency time .
outcome	The much lower location of their innervating nerve roots ( T10 ) and the much longer distance of their spinal exit zone from the level of injury at the cervical spinal cord might at least partially explain this phenomenon .
outcome	In the ventilator-dependent tetraplegic patient no MEPs could be obtained from any of the muscles studied .
outcome	Thus , magnetic TCS is a painless and easily applicable technique to investigate the central motor conduction properties of the respiratory muscles , both in healthy humans and in tetraplegic patients .

###12910336
background	Despite an acknowledgement of the impact of serious mental disorders on informal caregivers , we still know little about how to best help them .
intervention	The aim of the study was to evaluate the effectiveness of a two-phased carers ' intervention comprising family sessions followed by relatives ' groups .
intervention	This intervention was designed to be of ` intermediate ' intensity , that is , one lying between brief educational programmes and long-term family psychoeducational treatments .
study design	An exploratory randomised controlled trial was conducted comparing the experimental support programme with ` standard ' care .
population	All carers of patients with a psychotic disorder from a defined population were approached .
other	Outcome measures were based on a ` stress-appraisal-coping ' model of caregiving .
outcome	Despite concerted attempts to engage carers , only 42 % participated in the study .
outcome	The carers ' programme did not offer any significant advantage on any of the outcome measures : psychological morbidity , negative appraisal , coping or social support .
outcome	The severity of caregiving difficulties decreased over the study period for the group as a whole .
outcome	There is still uncertainty about the most effective interventions for carers .
outcome	Meeting ` needs ' may not improve caregiver distress .

###10185991
background	To evaluate the status of transmyocardial laser revascularization ( TMLR ) from an evidence-based perspective to help hospitals make resource management decisions .
study design	Qualitative systematic review of the clinical literature .
other	We searched the reference databases MEDLINE , BIOSIS , EMBASE , SciSearch , and Current Contents to identify all articles related to TMLR published between January 1985 and March 1997 .
other	We collected , analyzed , and summarized clinical studies in evidence tables .
population	The cumulative evidence available in the medical literature regarding the safety and effectiveness of TMLR encompasses approximately 2000 patients treated worldwide , primarily those with medically refractory angina .
outcome	Preliminary data suggest that TMLR has an acceptable survival rate and effectively relieves angina in approximately 75 % of patients .
outcome	Data showing improved myocardial perfusion , cardiac function , or prognosis are inconclusive .
outcome	The mechanism by which TMLR relieves angina is not yet known .
outcome	Early evidence regarding TMLR suggests it will be useful for treating patients with end-stage coronary artery disease .
outcome	Definitive recommendations await critical analysis of the results of ongoing randomized clinical trials , post-market surveillance studies , and third-party payer acceptance .

###15746593
background	This article addresses measures of importance to women of reproductive age in the first National Healthcare Quality Report ( NHQR ) and National Healthcare Disparities Report ( NHDR ) .
other	The authors review each of the 4 components of quality of care effectiveness , safety , timeliness , and patient centeredness .
other	The effectiveness component topics with relevance to women of childbearing age include breast cancer , cervical cancer , HIV , AIDS , mental health , and maternity care .
other	The safety component includes 3 relevant measures of obstetric trauma .
other	The quality aspects of timeliness of care and patient centeredness will be discussed in terms of women , although the NHQR and NHDR did not include them as a separate topic because the data were so limited regarding women .
outcome	There is a foundation of knowledge about many aspects of quality health care for women of reproductive age .
outcome	However , gaps are evident in some measures , usually due to insufficient data .
outcome	Further development of the measure set would benefit from additional process and outcome variables that can link screening , diagnosis , and treatment with health outcomes .
outcome	Such linkages will expand our knowledge and capability to improve health outcomes for women of reproductive age .

###10080570
background	This study tested the hypothesis that female subjects may exhibit a higher prevalence than male subjects of depression associated with somatic symptoms but not a higher prevalence of depression not associated with these other symptoms .
population	The author reanalyzed research interview data on major depression from the National Comorbidity Survey , dividing respondents into those who met overall criteria for major depression and exhibited fatigue and appetite and sleep disturbance ( `` somatic d
outcome	Female subjects exhibited a higher prevalence than male subjects of somatic depression but not a higher prevalence of pure depression .
outcome	Somatic depression was associated with a high prevalence of anxiety disorder and , among female subjects , with body aches and onset of depression during early adolescence .
outcome	The gender difference in depression may result from a difference in a specific subtype of anxious somatic depression .

###15945300
background	The aim of this study was to evaluate retrospectively the tolerability , safety and efficacy of antialdosterone therapy in patients with heart failure admitted to our ambulatory from June 1995 to September 2003 .
population	One hundred and fifty-seven consecutive patients ( mean age 64 + / - 11.6 years ) were enrolled in the study ; they were in NYHA class I-IV , on ACE-inhibitor or angiotensin receptor blocker therapy , and were treated with canrenone if they were in NYHA class I -
other	The mean follow-up was 38.7 + / - 21.2 months .
intervention	Patients were divided into two groups according to either therapy ( group 1 : 124 patients , 79 % , on antialdosterone therapy ; group 2 : 33 patients , 21 % , on no antialdosterone therapy ) or ischemic and non-ischemic etiology ( group A : 71 patients , 45.2 % , and gr
other	Serum creatinine and plasma potassium levels , left ventricular ejection fraction , NYHA class , adverse effects , and mortality were evaluated .
outcome	The mean dose of canrenone was 37 + / - 19.9 mg/day .
outcome	Creatinine levels did not change significantly whereas potassium levels slightly increased in group 1 vs group 2 ( p < 0.01 ) and in group A vs group B ( p < 0.01 ) .
outcome	Treatment was discontinued by only 12 patients ( 8.1 % ) due to hyperkalemia in 8 cases ( 6.5 % ) , gynecomastia in 2 cases ( 1.6 % ) , urticaria in 1 case ( 0.8 % ) , and nausea in 1 case ( 0.8 % ) .
outcome	Left ventricular ejection fraction increased in all groups ( p < 0.001 ) with the exception of the subgroup B/group 2 ( p = NS ) .
outcome	The NYHA class improved significantly in group 1 ( p < 0.01 ) .
outcome	The total mortality rate was 10.8 % ( 17 cases ) , of which 10.5 % ( 13 cases ) in group 1 and 12.1 % ( 4 cases ) in group 2 and due to sudden death in 3 group 1 patients ( 2.4 % ) and in 2 group 2 patients ( 6 % ) .
outcome	This study shows a good tolerability , safety , and efficacy , and poor adverse effects of canrenone therapy in combination with ACE-inhibitors , angiotensin receptor blockers and beta-blockers in patients with chronic heart failure .
outcome	Therapy should be monitored by serial clinical and laboratory controls and gradually titrated up to the maximal tolerated dosage .

###15948458
background	The symptoms associated with lumbar spinal stenosis can decrease quality of life and may cause patients to seek treatment .
background	Except in rare cases of rapid neurologic progression or cauda equina syndrome , nonsurgical modalities should be the initial treatment choice .
background	Activity modification , a variety of medications , epidural steroid injections , and other methods are recommended for pain reduction .
background	A formal physical therapy program , which focuses on flexion-based exercises , may lead to improved patientfunction .
background	symptoms .
background	Adequate decompression of the neural elements and maintenance of bony stability are necessary for a good surgical outcome for patients with spinal stenosis .
background	Laminectomy has long been the method of choice for thorough lumbar decompression .
background	Preserving at least the lateral half of the facet joints bilaterally and bone in the area of the pars interarticularis minimizes the potential for iatrogenic instability .
background	Numerous other decompression techniques have been described , including multilevel laminotomies , fenestration , distraction laminoplasty , and microscopic decompression .
background	Arthrodesis , either with or without instrumentation , is also indicated in some patients .
outcome	Several studies report that surgical treatment produces better outcomes than nonsurgical treatment in the short term ; however , the results tend to deteriorate with time .
outcome	Lumbar decompressive surgery can be complicated by epidural hematoma , deep venous thrombosis , dural tear , infection , nerve root injury , and recurrence of symptoms .

###6356896
background	The Secretary of Health and Human Services denies Medicare reimbursement for certain indirect costs associated with health care delivery .
background	This Note reviews arguments supporting and opposing reimbursement of costs that providers incur in three common financial transactions : the use of equity capital , acquisition of providers , and loan financing .
background	The Note considers the Secretary 's regulations in light of the congressional mandate to encourage efficient delivery of health care and concludes that current reimbursement policy promotes inefficiency .

###17341051
background	Effective management of neuropathic pain is one of the more challenging endeavors for even the most experienced and skilled pain specialist .
background	Pharmacological therapy is frequently ineffective and/or poorly tolerated , especially in elderly patients .
background	Many if not most surgical procedures have yielded limited success in the treatment of these pain conditions .
background	Motor cortex stimulation ( MCS ) has emerged as a promising technique for the management of pain in patients with difficult neuropathic and central pain conditions .
background	Although MCS has proven most successful for patients with trigeminal neuropathic/deafferentation pain and central poststroke pain , other conditions are now emerging as potential targets for this therapy .
outcome	Based on previous as well as ongoing work , it would appear that the future of MCS is indeed bright .
outcome	Hopefully , as work continues in this area , investigators will be able to develop a better understanding of the mechanisms underlying this modality and be able to further refine the technique of MCS .
outcome	It is also possible that with the use of noninvasive tools such as transcranial magnetic stimulation , practitioners will be able to predict with accuracy which patients are likely to respond favorably to MCS .

###15473411
background	Patients with refractory angina are not candidates for revascularization and have both class III or IV angina and objective evidence of ischemia despite optimal medical therapy .
background	An estimated 300,000 to 900,000 patients in the United States have refractory angina , and 25,000 to 75,000 new cases are diagnosed each year .
background	This review focuses on treatment strategies for refractory angina and includes the mechanism of action and clinical trial data for each strategy .
intervention	The pharmacological agents that have been used are ranolazine , ivabradine , nicorandil , L-arginine , testosterone , and estrogen ; currently , only L-arginine , testosterone , and estrogen are approved by the Food and Drug Administration .
outcome	Results with the noninvasive treatments of enhanced external counterpulsation and transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation are provided .
outcome	Invasive treatment strategies including spinal cord stimulation , transmyocardial revascularization , percutaneous myocardial revascularization , and gene therapy are also reviewed .

###18494629
background	Foot ulcers are a common complication in patients with diabetes .
background	Negative pressure wound therapy ( NPWT ) is a wound care therapy that is being increasingly used in the management of foot ulcers .
other	This article presents a systematic review examining the effectiveness of this therapy .
other	The review question is how effective is NPWT in achieving wound healing in diabetes foot ulcers ?
other	The primary outcome for this study was the number of patients achieving complete wound healing ( secondary outcomes , other markers of wound healing , adverse events and patient satisfaction ) .
study design	A systematic literature review and tabulative synthesis of randomised controlled trials ( RCTs ) .
other	The review identified four RCTs of weak to moderate quality .
outcome	Only one study examining NPWT in postamputation wound healing reported data on the primary outcome .
outcome	These data show a 20 % improvement in wound healing [ odds ratios = 2.0 % , confidence interval ( CI ) -1.0 to 4.0 ] and number needed to treat = 6 ( CI 4-64 ) .
outcome	No serious treatment-related complications were reported by any of the studies .
outcome	One study suggested a reduction in the risk of secondary amputation ( absolute risk reduction = 7.9 % , CI 0.5-15 .43 ) .
outcome	Studies also reported an increase in granulation and wound-healing rates in patients treated with NPWT therapy .
outcome	No data on patient satisfaction or experience were reported .
outcome	While all the studies included in the review indicated that the NPWT therapy is more effective than conventional dressings , the quality of the studies were weak and the nature of the inquiries in terms of outcome and patient selection divergent .
outcome	There is a strong need for larger trials to assess NPWT therapy in diabetes care with different groups of patients and in relation to different clinical objectives and parameters .

###8591067
background	Spinal cord injury ( SCI ) impacts metabolic function and deranges various hormonal axes .
background	Previous studies characterizing thyroid hormones in SCI reported depressed triiodothyronine ( T3 ) and thyroxin ( T4 ) , primarily in acute tetraplegics .
background	These studies cited an 11-13 percent incidence of low T3 syndrome ( LT3S ) in SCI patients , with an increased incidence in tetraplegics ( 20-36 percent ) .
background	The purpose of this study was to evaluate thyroid function and determine the incidence and clinical relevance of LT3S in the chronic SCI population .
population	Thyroid function tests were performed on 30 chronic SCI patients ( 14 tetraplegics and 16 paraplegics ) and 30 age - and gender-matched controls .
outcome	Mean T3 and T4 levels were significantly depressed in SCI patients relative to controls , while T3 resin uptake ( T3RU ) values were significantly elevated .
outcome	LT3S only occurred in the SCI population with an incidence of 23.3 percent .
outcome	SCI patients with LT3S did not differ significantly from those without in the level or completeness of injury , age or the interval since injury .
outcome	When SCI patients with normal T3 were compared with controls , they still had depressed mean T3 levels .
outcome	We conclude that LT3S occurs frequently in the chronic SCI population and suggest that depressed serum T3 levels may predispose SCI patients to sick euthyroidism in the face of minor pathologic insult .

###16185123
background	Morbid obesity is increasingly recognized in children and adolescents .
background	The National Institute of Health Consensus Conference has concluded that bariatric surgery is the only consistent effective method for achieving long-term weight loss .
outcome	Advantages of the laparoscopic approach , which include decreased hospital stay and morbidity , have been demonstrated in randomized controlled studies .
intervention	Herein , we describe our technique of laparoscopic Roux-en-Y gastric bypass .

###18564886
background	Our purpose in this cross-sectional study with 1,598 adult clients who had intellectual disabilities was to obtain valid prevalences of sensory impairments and to identify associations .
intervention	The diagnoses were made through ophthalmologic and audiometric assessments , applying WHO/IASSID definitions .
outcome	Re-weighted prevalences were 5.0 % ( 95 % CI 3.9 - 6.2 % ) for the total adult population ; 2.9 % ( 1.9-4 .1 ) , less than 50 years ; and 11.0 % ( 7.9 - 14.7 ) , 50 years and over .
outcome	Apart from being 50 years of age and over , p = .000 , risk factors were more severe intellectual disability , p = .0001 , and Down syndrome , p = .001 .
outcome	Results show that the risk of combined sensory impairment in this population is considerably increased compared with the general population .
outcome	Part of the underlying conditions are treatable or can be rehabilitated .
outcome	However , the complete diagnosis had been identified in only 12 % .

###16648330
background	The purpose of this study was to examine symptoms of posttraumatic stress disorder ( PTSD ) in a community sample of low-income pregnant women who met the DSM-IV diagnostic criteria for the disorder .
population	Pregnant women ( N = 948 ) were screened for trauma , PTSD , depression , and co-occurring illicit substance use .
other	PTSD symptoms were compared in traumatized pregnant women and a sample of nonpregnant traumatized women from the National Comorbidity Survey .
outcome	Suicidal thoughts and a high degree of psychiatric comorbidity were common in pregnant women with PTSD .
outcome	Pregnant women were selectively and significantly less likely to endorse reexperiencing symptoms of PTSD ( 29.5 % , N = 82 ) , compared to nonpregnant women ( 79.4 % , N = 464 ) .
outcome	PTSD in pregnancy was associated with comorbidity , poor health behaviors , and lower recall of memory-related PTSD symptoms .
outcome	Further prospective study is needed .

###8169923
background	To examine the relationship between oral contraceptive ( OC ) use and bone mineral density ( BMD ) , we conducted a cross-sectional study on 352 white , nonsmoking , perimenopausal women aged 40-54 years .
other	We measured bone mineral density of lumbar vertebrae 2-4 with dual photon absorptiometry and mid-radius and distal radius with single photon absorptiometry .
outcome	After controlling for age , body mass , current physical activity , current calcium intake and history of breastfeeding , our analysis did not find substantial differences in BMD at any site between OC ever users and never users .
outcome	However , OC ever users had slightly higher lumbar BMD among premenopausal women .
outcome	No significant association was identified between recency of OC use and BMD .
outcome	The results of our study suggest that when other factors are accounted for , OC use is not strongly associated with BMD among perimenopausal women , although we can not exclude a slight beneficial effect.This document reports the findings of a cross-sectiona
background	In postmenopausal women the loss of bone density and mass is well documented .
background	This situation , if left unchecked , could lead to osteoporosis , and the financial impact on the U.S. public health system could range from $ 2 to $ 6.1 billion per year .
other	This study controlled for the variables of age , body mass , current physical activity , current calcium intake , and history of breast feeding , all of which affect BMD .
outcome	Of the 352 women in the study , 7 currently used OCs , 92 women had never used OCs , and 253 women were former OC users .
other	These women were subdivided into 2 groups based on OC usage .
other	These were the never users group and the ever users group .
other	Bone mineral density was measured using dual photon absorptionmetry ( Norland Duel 2600 ) on the 2nd , 3rd , and 4th lumbar vertebrae and single photon absorptionmetry on the midradius and distal radius ( 5-mm site ) .
other	Separate analyses were conducted for premenopausal and postmenopausal women .
outcome	It was found that in the premenopausal group , with increasing OC involvement , that the BMD increased slightly but was not considered statistically significant ( P = 0.21 ) .
outcome	After adjusting for the variables of age , breastfeeding , body mass , physical activity , and calcium intake , no dose-effect relationship could be found between premenopausal and postmenopausal women .
outcome	Women considered recent OC users were associated with an increase in BMD , though overall this was not statistically significant .
outcome	The results of this study suggest that when variables are statistically adjusted for OC use is not strongly associated with BMD in perimenopausal women.americasbiologycontraceptioncontraceptive methods -- side effectscontraceptive usagedeveloped countriesfa

###17414485
background	To systematically review studies that examined the effectiveness of wrist guards in preventing wrist injuries among snowboarders .
other	PubMED was searched for the year 2005 to capture any recently published studies not yet indexed in MEDLINE .
other	The reference lists of included studies and conference proceedings were also searched .
population	Studies were included if the number of wrist injuries between wrist guarded and unguarded snowboarders could be ascertained .
other	Randomized controlled trials ( RCTs ) , cohort studies , and case-control studies were included .
other	Six studies were included .
other	Information regarding study design , patient characteristics , wrist guard characteristics , data source ( for cohort and case-control studies ) , and results ( type and severity of injury , compliance , and adverse events ) were extracted .
other	Data were extracted by one reviewer and checked by a second reviewer .
outcome	Data from RCTs and cohort studies were expressed as relative risks with odds ratios presented for case-control studies .
outcome	The risk of wrist injury ( RR : 0.23 ; 95 % CI : 0.13 , 0.41 ) , wrist fracture ( RR : 0.29 ; 95 % CI : 0.10 , 0.87 ) , and wrist sprain ( RR : 0.17 ; 95 % CI : 0.07 , 0.41 ) was significantly reduced with the use of wrist guards .
outcome	Among the case-control studies , wrist guards significantly lowered the odds of sustaining a wrist injury ( OR : 0.46 ; 95 % CI : 0.35 , 0.62 ) .
outcome	In an RCT , the risk ratio suggested wrist guards protect the shoulder ( RR : 0.22 ; 95 % CI : 0.01 , 4.60 ) .
outcome	Nonexperimental data suggested the possibility that wrist guards may increase the risk of finger and elbow-shoulder injuries .
outcome	Wrist guards reduce the risk of wrist injuries among snowboarders .
outcome	For every 50 snowboarders who were a wrist guard , one wrist injury will be averted .
outcome	Future research should focus on determining the optimal type of wrist guard and if they increase the risk of other upper extremity injuries .

###11860325
background	Diffuse and focal traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) can result in perceptual , cognitive , and motor dysfunction possibly leading to activity limitations in driving .
background	Characteristic dysfunctions for severe diffuse TBI are confronted with function requirements derived from the hierarchical task analysis of driving skill .
background	Specifically , we focus on slow information processing , divided attention , and the development of procedural knowledge .
background	Also the effects of a combination of diffuse and focal dysfunctions , specifically homonymous hemianopia and the dysexecutive syndrome , are discussed .
background	Finally , we turn to problems and challenges with regard to assessment and rehabilitation methods in the areas of driving and fitness to drive .

###15893192
intervention	The goal of this study was to examine whether higher consumption of total linolenic acid was associated with rate-adjusted QT and JT intervals ( QTrr and JTrr , respectively ) .
background	Higher intake of fish omega-3 fatty acids and plant omega-3 such as alpha-linolenic acid is associated with lower risk of myocardial infarction .
background	While long-chain omega-3 can inhibit ventricular arrhythmia , it is not known whether alpha-linolenic acid influences ventricular repolarization .
population	We studied 3,642 subjects from the National Heart , Lung , and Blood Institute Family Heart study who were free of myocardial infarction , left ventricular hypertrophy , pacemaker , and with QRS < 120 ms.
other	We used the 95th percentile of the gender-specific distribution of QTrr and JTrr to define abnormally prolonged repolarization .
other	Within each gender , we created age - and energy-adjusted tertiles of linolenic acid and used regression models for analyses .
outcome	Mean age was 50 years , and average intake of total linolenic acid was 0.74 g/day .
outcome	There was an inverse association between consumption of linolenic acid and QTrr and JTrr ( p for trend 0.001 and 0.0005 , respectively ) .
outcome	From the lowest ( reference ) to the highest gender - , age - , and energy-adjusted tertile of linolenic acid , multivariable adjusted odds ratios for prolonged QTrr were 1.0 , 0.74 ( 95 % confidence interval [ CI ] 0.57 to 0.96 ) , and 0.59 ( 95 % CI 0.44 to 0.77 ) , resp
outcome	Corresponding values for JTrr were 1.0 , 0.73 ( 95 % CI 0.52 to 1.03 ) , and 0.59 ( 95 % CI 0.40 to 0.87 ) , respectively ( p for trend 0.009 ) .
outcome	Exclusion of subjects taking drugs known to influence QT did not influence this association .
outcome	Higher intake of dietary linolenic acid might be associated with a reduced risk of abnormally prolonged repolarization in men and women .

###14746657
background	Although antiretrovirals can prolong life , medication adherence also poses a constant challenge for HIV-infected individuals because the success of antiretroviral regimens demands nearly perfect adherence to medications .
background	This paper describes the psychiatric and social barriers to adherence in a convenience sample of HIV-positive clients in methadone treatment in the Bronx , New York .
background	The study sample was part of a national study of HIV treatment adherence and health care utilization among triply diagnosed populations , the HIV/AIDS Treatment Adherence Health Outcomes and Cost Study .
population	The triply diagnosed study sample is defined here as HIV-infected individuals who screened into the study with at least one psychiatric diagnosis in addition to opioid dependence on agonist therapy ( methadone treatment ) and at least one substance use diag
other	Interviewers utilized modified versions of the Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-IV Disorders ( SCID-I ) , the Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-IV Axis II Personality Disorders ( SCID-II ) , and the Addiction Severity Index ( ASI-Lite ) , among a battery of Cost Study instruments .
outcome	Results showed that within this sample , borderline personality disorder was significantly associated with nonadherence to HIV medications .
outcome	A related finding showed a significant relationship between serious social/family problems and nonadherence .
outcome	These findings build on previous research on the impact of psychiatric illness on HIV medication adherence and suggest that psychiatric assessment and treatment options be linked to adherence interventions .

###9744167
background	We have used inexpensive off-the-shelf equipment for store-and-forward teledermatology and compared the precision and accuracy of digital image consultations with conventional , clinic-based consultations .
population	Thirteen lesions were studied on 12 patients referred to a dermatology clinic for a suspected skin cancer .
other	Patients were examined by two dermatologists .
other	Subsequently , digital images were examined by two different dermatologists .
outcome	There was almost complete agreement , both among and between the clinical and digital examiners , on different diagnosis and biopsy recommendations .
outcome	Agreement on the single most likely diagnosis was also good .
outcome	Digital imaging shows promise in teledermatology .

###16309046
background	To find out an effective therapy for obesity induced by antipsychotic agents .
population	One hundred and one cases of obesity who were being treated with antipsychotic agents were randomly divided into an observation group and a control group .
intervention	The observation group were treated with electroacupuncture at Quchi ( LI 11 ) , Zusanli ( ST 36 ) , Fenglong ( ST 40 ) , Shangjuxu ( ST 37 ) and Xiajuxu ( ST 39 ) , once a day for 8 weeks ; and no treatment was given to the control group .
other	The Brief Psychiatric Rating Scale ( BPRS ) was used for assessment of therapeutic effect and the Treatment Emergent Symptom Scale ( TESS ) for adverse effects .
outcome	The clinically effective rate of the observation group ( 54.9 % ) was superior to the control group ( 10.0 % ) with a significant difference between the two groups ( P < 0.05 ) .
outcome	The BPRS score-reducing rate was 24.92 % and 28.62 % in the both groups respectively , and with no adverse effects .
outcome	Electroacupuncture has a good therapeutic effect on obesity induced by antipsychotic agents , and it improves the patient 's compliance with no adverse effect .

outcome	Carotid intima-media thickness is a strong CAD predictor in both pre-and postmenopausal women , in contrast to the menopausal status .

###16857765
background	Prenatal long-chain polyunsaturated fatty acids ( LCPUFAs ) and trans-fatty acids may affect neurodevelopment .
background	In healthy term children , we determined relationships between relative fatty acid contents of umbilical arteries and veins and neurodevelopment at 18 mo. .
population	The study comprised a mixed group of 317 breast-fed , formula-fed , and LCPUFA formula-fed children .
other	Study endpoints were the Hempel neurologic examination resulting in a neurologic classification and neurologic optimality score ( NOS ) , and the Bayley Psychomotor Developmental Index ( PDI ) and Mental Developmental Index ( MDI ) .
outcome	Fifteen children showed minor neurologic dysfunction ( MND ) .
outcome	The umbilical vein trans , trans-18 :2 n-6 content was higher in children with MND than in the normal group .
outcome	The NOS was significantly reduced in infants with an umbilical vein docosahexaenoic acid ( DHA ) content within the lowest quartile .
outcome	Umbilical vein arachidonic acid ( AA ) was related to NOS in univariate statistics but not in multivariate analyses .
outcome	The sum of trans-fatty acids and that of C18 trans-fatty acids showed a negative association with NOS in both univariate and multivariate analyses .
outcome	No associations were found between AA , DHA and total trans-fatty acids with PDI or MDI .
outcome	In conclusion , neonates with a relatively low DHA status and those with high trans-fatty acid levels have a less favorable neurologic condition at 18 mo. .

###12451340
background	Multiple sclerosis ( MS ) with clinical onset after 50 years old is unusual and frequently misdiagnosed .
background	Clinical presentation and course seem also to be different that in MS occurring between 20 and 50 years old .
other	The aim of this study was to evaluate the clinical and paraclinical characteristics of late onset MS.
population	We respectively studied MS patients older than 50 years at the onset of the disease .
other	We evaluated demographical data , clinical symptoms , cerebrospinal fluid ( CSF ) , visual evoked potentials ( VEPs ) and MRI of these patients .
other	We also studied clinical data during the follow-up with the occurrence of new symptoms and the evolution of the disease by the index of progression ( EDSS unit per year ) .
outcome	In a population of 1 417 MS , 3.4 p.cent had their first symptoms at 50 years old or older and 0.45 p.cent after 59 years old .
outcome	At the time of the study patients had more frequently a progressive form : 37 p.cent had a primary progressive form and 35 p.cent a secondary progressive MS.
outcome	None of the patients with onset after 60 years old had relapsing remittent MS.
outcome	Motor symptoms were the most common neurologic presentation ( 54 p.cent of patients ) .
outcome	Very few patients had a clinical optic nerve involvement during the follow-up .
outcome	The mean progression index was 1 suggesting a most severe evolution in this subgroup of MS patients .
outcome	76 p.cent of patients had oligoclonal banding detected by CSF electrophoresis .
outcome	The VEPs were abnormal in 81 p. cent of patients tested .
outcome	71 p.cent of the brain MRI were consistent with the diagnosis of MS.
outcome	60 p.cent of patients had spinal cord MRI abnormal .
outcome	This study highlights the differences between the late onset MS and earlier onset .
outcome	As previously reported , our study underlines the high frequency of progressive course , motor function involvement and poor prognosis .

###8455123
background	The goal of the present study was to determine whether dietary supply of omega-3 essential fatty acid ( EFA ) influences visual development in healthy pre-term and full-term infants .
population	Visual status was examined in human milk-fed infants ( ample dietary omega-3 EFA supply ) and corn oil-based formula-fed infants ( no dietary omega-3 EFA ; standard formula prior to 1987 ) .
outcome	At 57 weeks postconception ( 4 months adjusted age ) , both pre-term and full-term human milk-fed infants had significantly better visual evoked potential ( VEP ) and forced-choice preferential-looking ( FPL ) acuity than formula-fed infants .
outcome	Acuity was correlated with a dietary omega-3 sufficiency index from red blood cell membranes obtained at 57 weeks postconception .
outcome	At 36 months , full-term human milk-fed children had significantly better random dot stereo acuity and letter matching ability than formula-fed children .
outcome	Stereo acuity and performance on the letter matching test were correlated with a dietary omega-3 sufficiency index from red blood cell membranes obtained at 4 months .
outcome	These results suggest that dietary omega-3 fatty acids play an important role in visual development .

###16364136
background	There is growing evidence that cyclic alternating pattern ( CAP ) and arousals are woven into the basic mechanisms of sleep regulation .
population	In the present study , the overnight sleep cycles ( SC ) of 20 normal subjects were analyzed according to their stage composition , CAP rate , phase A subtypes and arousals .
other	Individual SC were then divided into 10 normalized temporal epochs .
other	CAP parameters and arousals were measured in each epoch and averaged in relation to the SC order .
outcome	Subtypes A2 and A3 of CAP in non-rapid eye movement ( NREM ) sleep , and arousals , both in REM and NREM sleep when not coincident with a A2 or A3 phases , were lumped together as fast electroencephalographic ( EEG ) activities ( FA ) .
other	Subtypes A1 of CAP , characterized by slow EEG activities ( SA ) , were analyzed separately .
outcome	The time distribution of SA and FA was compared to the mathematical model of normal sleep structure including functions representing the homeostatic process S , the circadian process C , the ultradian process generating NREM/REM cycles and the slow wave act
outcome	The relationship between SA and FA and the sleep-model components was evaluated by multiple regression analysis in which SA and FA were considered as dependent variables while the covariates were the process S , process C , SWA , REM-on and REM-off activitie
outcome	Regression was highly significant ( P < 0.0001 ) for both SA and FA .
outcome	SA were prevalent in the first three SC , and exhibited single or multiple peaks immediately before and in the final part of deep sleep ( stages 3 + 4 ) .
outcome	The peaks of FA were delayed and prevailed during the pre-REM periods of light sleep ( stages 1 + 2 ) and during REM sleep .
outcome	SA showed an exponential decline across the successive SC , according to the homeostatic process .
outcome	In contrast , the distribution of FA was not influenced by the order of SC , with periodic peaks of FA occurring before the onset of REM sleep , in accordance with the REM-on switch .
outcome	The dynamics of CAP and arousals during sleep can be viewed as an intermediate level between cellular activities and macroscale EEG phenomena as they reflect the decay of the homeostatic process and the interaction between REM-off and REM-on mechanisms wh

###17132408
background	The authors investigated the weight loss and maintenance in type 2 diabetic obese patients undergoing biliopancreatic diversion ( BPD ) .
population	Two series of diabetic and non-diabetic obese patients matched for gender , age and baseline body mass index ( BMI ) were evaluated prior to BPD , on the occasion of the regular follow-up visit at 1 , 2 and 3 years following the operation , and at the fifth pos
other	At each follow-up point , body weight ( BW ) , BMI , and serum glucose concentration were measured .
outcome	In all type 2 diabetic patients , the serum glucose level fell to within the normal range at the first postoperative year and remained within normal limits without any medication throughout all the follow-up period .
outcome	In preoperatively diabetic subjects , mean values of BW and BMI were closely similar to those of non-diabetic subjects at all follow-up points , and the stabilization weight was independently related to age and to initial BW values .
outcome	In obese patients with type 2 diabetes , the glucose level steadily normalized in every case following BPD , and values remained unchanged throughout the follow-up period .
outcome	After the operation , the type 2 diabetic obese patients experienced the same stable weight reduction as their non-diabetic counterparts .

###8735663
background	Substantial psychological and neurobehavioural evidence is available to support the hypothesis that traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) is a risk factor for subsequent psychiatric disorders .
background	However , studies utilizing established psychiatric diagnostic schemes to study these outcomes after TBI are scarce , and no studies have included an assessment of personality disorders in addition to the major psychiatric disorders .
population	This study utilizes structured psychiatric interviews to measure the prevalence of DSM-III ( R ) disorders in a sample of 18 subjects derived from a TBI rehabilitation programme .
outcome	Results revealed high rates for major depression , bipolar affective disorder , generalized anxiety disorder , borderline and avoidant personality disorders .
outcome	Co-morbidity was also high .
outcome	A preliminary study of postulated predictive factors revealed possible roles for sex and for initial severity of injury .
outcome	The study supports the association between TBI and psychiatric disorder , and suggests the need for monitoring , for prevention , and for treatment of psychiatric disorders after TBI .

outcome	Physical findings of congestion were infrequent and not associated with blood volume status .
