###14667870
background	To examine the implantation potential of embryos from assisted reproductive technology cycles with low embryo production and to assess the effects of clinical variables and embryo scores ( ES ) on pregnancy outcome .
study design	Prospective clinical study .
other	Assisted reproductive technology unit in a tertiary medical center .
population	From July 1998 to December 2001 , 280 cycles in 229 infertile couples produced a limited number of one , two , or three embryos 3 days after oocyte retrieval and underwent fresh embryo transfer ( ET ) .
intervention	Embryos with two or more blastomeres were scored and transferred .
other	MAIN OUTCOME MEASURE ( S ) ES and implantation rate per ET .
outcome	Of 863 fresh ET cycles during the study period , 32.4 % ( 280 ) were low embryo producers .
outcome	Among them , there were no significant differences in average ES of individual embryos in single , dual , or triple ET or in embryos obtained from patients with low or high E2 responses , or young or old age .
outcome	Embryos derived from conventional IVF had a better ES than those derived from intracytoplasmic sperm injection .
outcome	The clinical pregnancy rate was strongly correlated with the cumulative ES .
outcome	Implantation rates were similar among and between groups , with an average rate of 15.9 % .
other	Embryos of low embryo producers had an inherently low implantation potential that appeared to be unrelated to the number of embryos transferred , female age , ovarian E2 genesis , or fertilization method .
outcome	The cumulative ES can serve as a predictor of pregnancy .

###12130990
background	The aim of this study was to evaluate the relationship of patient care variables to survival and functional outcome in the pediatric population with traumatic brain injury .
study design	Retrospective chart review .
other	A 16-bed pediatric critical care unit in an academic community children 's hospital .
population	A total of 320 consecutive pediatric patients with traumatic brain injuries admitted to our pediatric critical care unit between 1992 and 1996 .
intervention	Patients were managed using our standard traumatic brain injury protocol .
other	A total of 230 patient variables encompassing demographic data , prehospital , emergency department , and pediatric critical care unit care were recorded .
outcome	A total of 79 patients were severely injured , with admitting Glasgow Coma Scale scores of < or = 10 .
outcome	There were 18 deaths .
outcome	Only two patients survived without cognition .
outcome	Ninety-five of 302 survivors required inpatient rehabilitation .
outcome	Of these , 73 were old enough to be compared using FIMTM scores .
outcome	At the time of discharge from rehabilitation , 52 patients ( 71 % ) were functioning independently , 20 ( 27 % ) were moderately dependent , and one patient was completely dependent .
outcome	Analysis of variables with respect to survival revealed that an inability to maintain a cerebral perfusion pressure of > or = 50 mm Hg on the first pediatric critical care unit day ( p = .0002 ) and the presence of bradycardia in the emergency department ( p =
outcome	By using the regression equation generated from this model , we could correctly identify survivors and nonsurvivors with a predictive value of 94 % .
outcome	The ability to maintain a cerebral perfusion pressure of > or = 50 mm Hg was the single most important predictor of traumatic brain injury survival in this study .
outcome	This suggests that monitoring and optimizing cerebral perfusion pressure is critical to the management of these patients .
outcome	The relationship between cognitive outcome and therapeutic interventions used to optimize cerebral perfusion pressure is unclear and requires further evaluation in a large prospective study .

###16009053
background	Physical activity is recommended for secondary prevention of several diseases but it is not always clear how reliable the evidence is .
other	We searched MEDLINE and The Cochrane Library for systematic reviews of randomised clinical trials published 1998-2004 .
outcome	We identified 30 eligible systematic reviews and excluded 13 that contained trials covered in larger reviews or were older than other reviews on the same subject .
outcome	Physical activity decreased all-cause mortality in patients with coronary heart disease , odds ratio 0.73 ( 95 % confidence interval 0.54 to 0.98 ) , increased maximum walking time in patients with intermittent claudication by 6.5 min ( 4.4 to 8.7 ) , and decreas
outcome	There were positive effects also in heart failure , chronic obstructive lung disease , type 2 diabetes and fibromyalgia , but they need confirmation in high-quality trials .
outcome	Exercise improved quality of life in several conditions and generally led to improved physical performance .
outcome	An effect was not shown in stroke , asthma , rheumatoid arthritis , acute or chronic low back pain , chronic fatigue syndrome , depression , cystic fibrosis or HIV/AIDS .
outcome	The occurrence of harms was generally not reported .
outcome	Physical activity can have important , and even life-saving , effects as secondary prevention of disease , but more and better trials are needed to fully assess its benefits and harms , in particular trials that compare exercise with drugs .

###11732748
background	Ursodeoxycholic acid possesses choleretic and cytoprotective properties and in cystic fibrosis ( CF ) it is used to treat the hepatobiliary symptoms of the disease .
population	This study investigated the effects of this bile acid on the transport function of the small intestine in normal and CF mice .
other	The effects of ursodeoxycholic acid were monitored as changes in short-circuit current ( SCC ) in stripped sheets of small intestine from normal ( Swiss MF1 ) and transgenic CF ( Cftr ( tm2Cam ) ) mice .
other	In ileal sheets from Swiss MF1 mice , mucosal ursodeoxycholic acid caused a biphasic increase in SCC .
intervention	The first phase was reduced by lowering the mucosal Na + concentration , while the second phase was inhibited by ( Cl - ) - free conditions , serosal furosemide or mucosal diphenylamine-2-carboxylic acid ( DPC ) , suggesting an initial Na + - dependent bile acid absorp
other	Serosal application of ursodeoxycholic acid to the ileum and mucosal or serosal application to the mid-intestine and jejunum elicited a secretory response only .
outcome	Secretion was Ca2 + - dependent , but did not involve neural mechanisms .
outcome	Mucosal mast cells , histamine and serotonin ( 5-HT ) were implicated in the secretory response .
outcome	Responses in tissues from transgenic wild-type mice were similar to those obtained with Swiss MF1 mice , but the secretory response to mucosal or serosal application of the bile acid was impaired in CF tissues .
outcome	In ilea from CF mice the initial absorptive phase of the response to mucosal ursodeoxycholic acid was still observed .
outcome	It is concluded that ursodeoxycholic acid induces secretion throughout the murine small intestine by a mechanism that involves degranulation of mucosal mast cells .
outcome	In the ileum Na + - dependent absorption can also be detected .
outcome	The secretory response is defective in CF intestine , but the absorptive effect is still present .

###11285007
background	Epidemiological studies show a markedly increased risk of cerebral palsy following the combined exposure of infection and birth asphyxia .
background	However , the underlying mechanisms of this increased vulnerability remain unclear .
population	We have examined the effects of a low dose of bacterial endotoxin on hypoxic -- ischaemic injury in the immature brain of rats .
intervention	Bacterial endotoxin ( lipopolysaccharide 0.3 mg/kg ) was administered to 7-day-old rats 4 h prior to unilateral hypoxia -- ischaemia and the neurological outcome was determined 3 days later .
other	Rectal temperature and cerebral blood flow was measured during the study and the expression of CD14 and toll-like receptor-4 mRNA in the brain was examined .
outcome	We found that a low dose of endotoxin dramatically sensitizes the immature brain to injury and induces cerebral infarction in response to short periods of hypoxia -- ischaemia that by themselves caused no or little injury .
outcome	This effect could not be explained by a reduction in cerebral blood flow or hyperthermia .
outcome	In association with the sensitization of injury we found an altered expression of CD14 mRNA and toll-like receptor-4 mRNA in the brain .
outcome	These results suggest that the innate immune system may be involved in the vulnerability of the immature brain following the combination of infection and hypoxia -- ischaemia .

###18049292
background	Obstructive sleep apnea , a common indication for adenotonsillectomy in children , has been linked to behavioral morbidity .
background	We assessed psychiatric diagnoses in children before and after adenotonsillectomy and examined whether baseline sleep apnea predicted improvement after surgery .
population	Subjects of this prospective cohort study were children ages 5.0 to 12.9 years old who had been scheduled for adenotonsillectomy ( n = 79 ) or care for unrelated surgical conditions ( n = 27 , among whom 13 had surgery after baseline assessment ) .
intervention	Before intervention and 1 year later , subjects underwent structured diagnostic interviews and polysomnography .
other	The main outcome measure was frequency of DSM-IV attention and disruptive behavior disorder diagnoses at baseline and follow-up .
outcome	At baseline , attention and disruptive behavior disorders were diagnosed in 36.7 % of adenotonsillectomy subjects and 11.1 % of controls ( p < .05 ) ; attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder was found in 27.8 % and 7.4 % , respectively ( p < .05 ) .
outcome	One year later , group differences were nonsignificant ; attention and disruptive behavior disorders were diagnosed in only 23.1 % ( p < .01 ) , and 50 % of subjects with baseline attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder no longer met diagnostic criteria .
outcome	Obstructive sleep apnea on polysomnography at baseline did not predict concurrent psychiatric morbidity or later improvement .
outcome	Attention and disruptive behavior disorders , diagnosed by DSM-IV criteria , were more common before clinically indicated adenotonsillectomy than 1 year later .
outcome	Surgery may be associated with reduced morbidity , even among subjects lacking polysomnographic evidence of obstructive sleep apnea .

###10229121
background	Tumor necrosis factor-alpha ( TNF alpha ) is a pleiotropic cytokine involved in inflammatory cascades associated with CNS injury .
population	To examine the role of TNF alpha in the acute pathophysiology of traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) , we studied its expression , localization and modulation in a clinically relevant rat model of non-penetrating head trauma .
outcome	TNF alpha levels increased significantly in the injured cortex at 1 and 4 , but not at 12 , 24 or 72 h after severe lateral fluid-percussion trauma ( 2.6-2 .7 atm ) .
outcome	TNF alpha was not elevated after mild injury .
outcome	At 1 and 4 h after severe TBI , marked increases of TNF alpha were localized immunocytochemically to neurons of the injured cerebral cortex .
outcome	A small population of astrocytes , ventricular cells and microvessels , also showed positive TNF alpha staining , but this expression was not injury-dependent .
outcome	Macrophages that were present in a hemorrhagic zone along the external capsule , corpus callosum and alveus hippocampus at 4 h after TBI did not express TNF alpha .
outcome	Intracerebroventricular administration of a selective TNF alpha antagonist -- soluble TNF alpha receptor fusion protein ( sTNFR : Fc ) ( 37.5 microg ) -- at 15 min before and 1 h after TBI , improved performance in a series of standardized motor tasks after injury .
outcome	In contrast , intravenous administration of sTNFR : Fc ( 0.2 , 1 or 5 mg/kg ) at 15 min after trauma did not improve motor outcome .
outcome	Collectively , this evidence suggests that enhanced early neuronal expression of TNF alpha after TBI contributes to subsequent neurological dysfunction .

###10812529
background	The use of antidepressants during pregnancy has undergone considerable scrutiny with respect to safety issues , though limited data with respect to dose management and symptom resolution is available .
background	Previous reports on tricyclic antidepressants ( TCAs ) have demonstrated the need to adjust maternal dose later in pregnancy to maintain therapeutic serum concentrations .
background	However , there is no data on the dosage of selective serotonin uptake inhibitors ( SSRIs ) required to maintain symptom resolution in women treated for major depression during pregnancy .
other	The purpose of this study , then , was to assess the medication dosage requirements of SSRIs during this time .
population	In this naturalistic study , pregnant women with a primary diagnosis of major depression were followed prospectively through pregnancy at monthly intervals with symptom assessment .
intervention	Subjects were included in data analysis if they presented prior to 28 weeks gestation , were treated with SSRI monotherapy , received all psychiatric treatment during the pregnancy at the Emory Pregnancy and Postpartum Mood Disorders Program , and achieved e
other	Medication selection was based on personal treatment history or family treatment history ( if any ) , and the published data on SSRIs in pregnancy .
other	All medication dose adjustments were based on depressive symptoms as measured by the BDI and a psychiatric interview ( ZNS ) .
other	Thirty-four pregnant women were included in final analysis .
outcome	Two thirds of the subjects ( n = 22 ) required an increase in their daily dose of medication to maintain euthymia .
outcome	The dose increases occurred at 27.1 + / - 7.1 weeks gestation , with mean BDI scores of 16.4 + / - 9.6 , compared to a mean treatment response BDI of 6.9 + / - 5.4 .
outcome	Subject 's age , education , past personal and familial psychiatric history were not significantly associated with dose adjustment .
outcome	These novel data on SSRI daily dose in pregnancy parallels the extant literature with tricyclic antidepressants ( TCA ) .
outcome	Further work to determine the predictors of dose adjustments will provide guidelines for minimizing fetal exposure to both medication and maternal mental illness .

###11240085
population	The analgesic effect of intrathecal injection of epibatidine , clonidine and neostigmine , compounds that elevate ACh , was examined in the formalin test , a model of post-injury central sensitization in the rat .
other	The compounds were injected alone and in combination .
outcome	Intrathecal injection of epibatidine alone did not alter pain behaviors , compared to vehicle-treated rats .
outcome	Intrathecal injection of clonidine dose-dependently reduced tonic pain behaviors ( ED ( 50 ) + / -95 % confidence limits = 6.7 + / -4.8 microg ) .
outcome	The combination of clonidine and epibatidine ( C : E ) , in the ratio of 26:1 , dose-dependently reduced tonic pain behaviors ; and the ED ( 50 ) of C : E was 1.1 + / -0.98 microg a significant 6-fold leftward shift of the dose response curve , compared with clonidine al
outcome	The antinociceptive effect of C : E ( 26:1 ) was attenuated by pre-treatment with the nAChR antagonist mecamylamine .
outcome	Neostigmine dose-dependently reduced tonic pain behaviors ( ED ( 50 ) = 1.5 + / -1.3 microg ) .
outcome	The combination of neostigmine and epibatidine , in a ratio of 8:1 , significantly shifted the dose response curve 4-fold to the left ( ED ( 50 ) = 0.4 + / -0.3 microg ) .
outcome	The effect is mediated in part by the activation of the nAChR and possibly by the enhanced release of ACh .
outcome	These data demonstrate significant enhancement of the antinociceptive effects of spinally delivered analgesics by a nAChR agonist , suggesting that this class of compounds may have utility as adjuvants when combined with conventional therapeutics .

###18708921
study design	STUDY DESIGN : Case description .
other	To describe a case of traumatic subluxation in association with a congenitally absent cervical pedicle , and review the pertinent medical literature .
background	The congenital absence of a cervical pedicle is a relatively uncommon developmental anomaly that is frequently mistaken for a unilateral facet fracture-dislocation in the context of acute trauma .
background	Because there is little evidence of recovery after surgery , and the symptoms are usually not disabling , surgery is not recommended for most cases .
population	A 62-year-old man presented with severe neck and right shoulder pain after falling .
other	Plain radiographs and computed tomography of the cervical spine showed the typical features of a congenitally absent pedicle at C6 with anterolisthesis of C6 on C7 .
intervention	We performed anterior interbody fusion at C6-C7 because of persistent neck pain and progressive instability .
outcome	Complete restoration of the C6-C7 subluxation was achieved with resolution of the presenting symptoms .
outcome	At 18 months follow-up , flexion and extension dynamic radiographs demonstrated good alignment with solid fusion at C6-C7 .
outcome	Although conservative treatment is the primary treatment for this clinical entity , surgery is an alternative option for those patients who fail to achieve recovery after conservative treatment or exhibit instability .

###7752827
background	In patients with chronic heart failure ( CHF ) , the addition of coenzyme Q10 to conventional therapy reduces the hospitalization rate for worsening of heart failure and the incidence of serious cardiovascular complications .
background	The present study was planned to assess the hemodynamic mechanisms underlying this phenomenon .
background	Cardiac hemodynamics was evaluated continuously using an ambulatory radionuclide detector ( VEST ) which allows a noninvasive monitoring of left ventricular function .
population	Six patients wit CHF ( mean ejection fraction ( EF ) : 29 % ) clinically documented were studied .
study design	This study was organized as a randomized double-blind , placebo controlled , cross-over trial .
other	The enrolled patients , after a washout period , underwent the first hemodynamic evaluation with VEST .
intervention	Subsequently they were randomized to receive placebo or coenzyme Q10 for 4 weeks .
intervention	At the end of this period they underwent the second VEST study .
intervention	The third VEST study was performed after a further 4-week period with inverted treatment .
other	Cardiac hemodynamics were evaluated during bicycle exercise .
outcome	The EF in control conditions ( CC ) changed from 27 + / - 11 % , at rest , to 24 + / - 8 % , at peak exercise .
outcome	During coenzyme Q10 treatment EF showed a significant increase both at rest ( 33 + / - 13 % , P < 0.05 vs CC ) and at peak exercise ( 30 + / - 12 % , P < 0.05 vs CC ) .
outcome	The same trends were recorded for the stroke volume and the cardiac output .
outcome	Our results demonstrate that coenzyme Q10 improves cardiac hemodynamic response to exercise in patients with CHF and suggest that noninvasive monitoring of left ventricular function allows a more reliable assessment of therapy efficacy .

###9440427
background	Posttraumatic syrinxes may extend many cord segments rostral to a spinal cord injury ( SCI ) and significantly dilate the spinal cord , yet few neurologic deficits may be noted .
background	Careful physical examination may reveal ascending loss of pain and temperature without evident functional motor decline .
background	We present a 49-year-old man with T4 paraplegia and a large posttraumatic syrinx who died 3 weeks after syringoperitoneal shunting .
outcome	Neuropathologic study revealed a large bilateral syrinx cavity from T1 to C6 that tapered to a small unilateral syrinx at C2 .
outcome	Light microscopy of sections from T1 to C2 showed massive loss of intermediate to intermedio-lateral gray neurons and moderate reduction of motoneurons at T1 to C6 levels .
outcome	Despite these findings , manual muscle testing results remained normal for wrist extensors and elbow extensors , and the patient continued to perform independent sliding board transfers .
outcome	We conclude that this large progressive syrinx did not merely dissect neural elements apart but caused extensive neuronal damage .
outcome	Loss of interneurons was evident in spinal segments with preserved strength and function .
outcome	Possible mechanisms to explain the relatively minimal clinical deficits in view of the neuronal loss are discussed .

###18256674
study design	STUDY DESIGN : Cross-sectional .
background	The objective of this study was to examine the association between the characteristics of individuals with spinal cord injury ( SCI ) and self-reported health-related quality of life ( HRQoL ) .
other	The United States .
population	Questions from the Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System ( BRFSS ) survey were sent to veterans with SCI .
other	The analyses included 2302 respondents .
other	Logistic regression analysis was used to examine the association between subject characteristics and the following four measures of HRQoL frequent physical distress ( FPD ) , frequent mental distress ( FMD ) , frequent depressive symptoms ( FDS ) and poor or fair self-reported health .
outcome	Approximately 19 % of the respondents reported FMD , 27 % reported FPD , 17 % reported FDS and 29 % reported poor or fair health .
outcome	Veterans who self-reported chronic illnesses , had higher odds of reporting FPD , FMD , FDS and poor or fair health than veterans who did not report chronic illnesses .
outcome	Smoking was significantly associated with decreased HRQoL .
outcome	Older veterans had higher odds of reporting poor or fair health and FPD than younger veterans .
outcome	Higher levels of education were associated with lower odds of FMD , FDS and poor or fair health .
outcome	Chronic illnesses and smoking have a substantial effect on HRQoL for persons with SCI , suggesting the importance of continued efforts to improve smoking cessation methods and to treat and prevent chronic conditions .

###9708839
background	To test whether instrumental behavior of some children with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder ( ADHD ) is more variable than control subjects , the sequences of responses by three groups of children were compared : ( i ) those diagnosed with ADHD who liv
intervention	The experiment consisted of rewarding children for responding in a computer ` game ' on two keys of a keyboard during each of three phases .
intervention	In phase 1 , rewards were provided independently of sequence variability ( IND ) .
intervention	In phase 2 , rewards depended upon highly variable sequences of left and right responses .
intervention	Phase 3 was a return to the IND contingencies .
outcome	The results showed that sequence variability was higher in the sequence variability ( VARY ) phase than in the preceding IND phase , but remained high when the contingencies returned to IND , thus replicating previous findings .
outcome	In none of the phases did the ADHD children respond more variably than the controls .
outcome	However , ADHD subjects made more off-task responses than did controls .
outcome	Thus , although the present research showed differences between ADHD and control subjects , there was no evidence to support higher behavioral variability in the ADHD subjects .

###12776867
background	Atrial arrhythmias often complicate congestive heart failure ( CHF ) .
other	We characterized inducible atrial tachyarrhythmias and electrophysiologic alterations in dogs with CHF and atrial enlargement produced by rapid ventricular pacing .
population	Endocardial pacing leads were implanted in the right ventricle , right atrium , and coronary sinus in 18 dogs .
intervention	The right ventricular lead was connected to an implanted pacemaker capable of rapid ventricular pacing .
intervention	The atrial leads were used to perform electrophysiologic studies in conscious animals at baseline in all dogs , during CHF induced by rapid ventricular pacing at 235 beats/min in 15 dogs , and during recovery from CHF in 6 dogs .
outcome	After 20 + / - 7 days of rapid ventricular pacing , inducibility of sustained atrial tachycardia ( cycle length 120 + / - 12 msec ) was enhanced in dogs with CHF .
outcome	Atrial tachycardia required a critical decrease in atrial burst pacing cycle length ( < or = 130 msec ) for induction and often could be terminated by overdrive pacing .
outcome	Calcium antagonists ( verapamil , flunarizine , ryanodine ) terminated atrial tachycardia and suppressed inducibility .
outcome	Effective refractory periods at 400 - and 300-msec cycle lengths in the right atrium and coronary sinus were prolonged in dogs with CHF .
outcome	Atrial cells from dogs with CHF had prolonged action potential durations and reduced resting potentials and delayed afterdepolarizations ( DADs ) .
outcome	Mitochondria from atrial tissue from dogs with CHF were enlarged and had internal cristae disorganization .
outcome	CHF promotes inducibility of sustained atrial tachycardia .
outcome	Based on the mode of tachycardia induction , responses to pacing and calcium antagonists , and presence of DADs , atrial tachycardia in this CHF model has a mechanism most consistent with DAD-induced triggered activity resulting from intracellular calcium ov

###11295898
population	A quasi-experimental design was used to compare the Symptom Checklist 90-Revised profiles ( SCL-90-R ) from a group of patients with whiplash injuries ( n = 67 ) and a group with mixed musculoskeletal pain ( n = 91 ) .
other	To test the discriminant validity of the characteristic SCL-90-R whiplash profile as proposed by Wallis and Bogduk using a multivariate statistical technique .
background	On the basis of two studies by themselves and their colleagues , Wallis and Bogduk proposed a characteristic SCL-90-R profile evident in samples of patients with whiplash injuries .
background	Their assertion has not been tested empirically in any published studies .
population	The participants in this study consisted of 158 patients at a rehabilitation hospital who completed the SCL-90-R under standard instructions and subsequently were diagnosed by a team comprising a chiropractor , physical therapist , and physician .
other	The participants were categorized as having whiplash-associated disorders or pain caused by other musculoskeletal injuries .
other	A profile analysis following Hotelling 's method was used to determine the comparability of SCL-90-R profiles from the two groups .
outcome	The profile analysis showed no statistically significant differences between the groups with regard to either the shape or the overall elevation of their psychological profiles .
outcome	The SCL-90-R profiles from both groups were similar to those reported from other chronic pain syndromes , with elevations on the Somatization , Depression , Obsessive-Compulsive , and Psychoticism scales .
outcome	The current study failed to support the validity of a distinctive SCL-90-R profile for patients with whiplash injuries .
outcome	Instead , the results suggest that the psychological consequences of experiencing chronic pain from whiplash-associated disorders are similar to the psychological consequences of chronic pain from other musculoskeletal injuries .

###8855093
background	To assess the efficacy of transvaginal sonography ( TVS ) in differentiating endometriomas from other adnexal masses .
population	One thousand thirty-five adnexal masses undergoing laparoscopy or laparotomy were evaluated prospectively using TVS .
other	Masses diagnosed as endometrioma according to their sonographic appearance were divided into two groups those with a round shape , regular margins , thick walls and homogeneous , low-level echoes ( group A ) ; or those with irregular margins , internal septations and an anechoic appearance ( group B ) .
outcome	The sensitivity of TVS in diagnosing endometriomas was 86.50 % and the specificity 99.11 % .
outcome	The positive predictive value ( PPV ) and the negative predictive value of the test were calculated to be 91.45 % and 98.14 % , respectively .
outcome	By using the criteria determining group A , the PPV of the test increased to 97 % , whereas group B had a lower PPV ( 70.85 % ) .
outcome	We propose that the accuracy of TVS in diagnosing endometriomas may be beneficial in various clinical conditions .

###12468478
background	To determine whether preoperative assessments carried out by appropriately trained nurses are inferior in quality to those carried out by preregistration house officers .
study design	Randomised controlled equivalence/non-inferiority trial .
other	Four NHS hospitals in three trusts .
other	Three of the four were teaching hospitals .
population	All patients attending for assessment before general anaesthesia for general , vascular , urological , or breast surgery between April 1998 and March 1999 .
intervention	Assessment by one of three appropriately trained nurses or by one of several preregistration house officers .
other	History taken , physical examination , and investigations ordered .
other	Measures evaluated by a specialist registrar in anaesthetics and placed in four categories correct , overassessment , underassessment not affecting management , and underassessment possibly affecting management ( primary outcome ) .
outcome	1907 patients were randomised , and 1874 completed the study ; 926 were assessed by house officers and 948 by nurses .
outcome	Overall 121/948 ( 13 % ) assessments carried out by nurses were judged to have possibly affected management compared with 138/926 ( 15 % ) of those performed by house officers .
outcome	Nurses were judged to be non-inferior to house officers in assessment , although there was variation among them in terms of the quality of history taking .

###16598402
background	Laparoscopic colon resection of the endoscopically unresectable polyp has been considered an ideal case for the surgeon with moderate laparoscopic colectomy experience because tissues are not inflamed and the lymphadenectomy may not need to be as extensiv
other	To assess the appropriateness of this approach , we evaluated the incidence of invasive cancer in a series of laparoscopic colon resections for polyps .
population	A retrospective review was performed of 55 consecutive patients undergoing laparoscopic colon resection for endoscopically unresectable polyps during a 35-month period .
other	Colonoscopy data , polyp characteristics , and final colon pathology were reviewed .
outcome	On final pathologic examination , 18.2 percent of patients had invasive adenocarcinoma .
outcome	Patient age , gender , indication for colonoscopy , polyp size , polyp location , polyp characteristics , and colonoscopic biopsy pathology were not predictive of adenocarcinoma on final pathology .
outcome	A significant number of endoscopically unresectable polyps harbor adenocarcinoma , thereby requiring a formal lymphadenectomy at resection .
outcome	Caution should be exercised when considering the laparoscopic resection of an endoscopically unresectable polyp as a `` learning '' case .

###10623052
background	To determine whether enhanced access to primary care affects the diagnostic evaluation , pharmacologic management , or health outcomes of patients hospitalized with congestive heart failure ( CHF ) .
study design	Multisite randomized , controlled trial .

other	Diagnostic evaluation , pharmacologic management , health-related quality of life , and hospital readmission rates .
outcome	About 80 % of patients who had enhanced access to care and patients receiving usual care underwent recommended evaluation of left ventricular ejection fraction .
outcome	Among the subset of patients for whom an angiotensin-converting enzyme ( ACE ) inhibitor was recommended ( i.e. , ejection fraction < 40 % ) , three quarters of the patients in both the enhanced access and usual care groups received the drug ( 75 % vs. 73 % ; P >
outcome	Enhanced access to primary care did not improve quality of life and increased hospital readmissions , with an average of 1.5 + / - SD 2.0 readmissions per 6 months of follow-up for patients who had enhanced access compared with 1.1 + / - SD 1.8 for those who r
outcome	Compliance with recommended CHF testing and treatment guidelines was equally high in both study groups .
outcome	Enhanced access to primary care did not improve patients ' self-reported health status and was associated with more frequent hospitalizations .

###15919588
background	Remodeling of myocardial cell membranes is a major feature of advanced age .
background	Mitochondrial function , crucial to sustaining energy production and management of myocardial metabolism , is impacted by age-dependent remodeling and ultimately exhibits a diminished threshold for excess Ca ( 2 + ) buffering during events that stimulate increa
background	Relative Ca ( 2 + ) intolerance , augmented superoxide formation and reduced efficiency in the management of reactive oxygen species , are important mitochondrial factors ( of many ) that are apparent in senescence and predispose the myocardium to be more vulnera
background	In addition to cell death , surviving myocytes increase in size and exhibit altered gene expression of key effector proteins , including those that sustain Ca ( 2 + ) homeostasis .
background	Age-associated mitochondrial membrane changes include increases in membrane rigidity , cholesterol , phosphatidylcholine , omega-6 polyunsaturated fatty acids ( PUFA ) , 4-hydroxy-2-nonenal , and decreases in omega-3 PUFA and cardiolipin .
outcome	These effects have been shown in animal studies to be exaggerated by diet rich in long chain omega-6 PUFA ( i.e. , arachidonic acid ) , and have profound consequences on the efficacy of membrane proteins involved with ion homeostasis , signal transduction , red
outcome	However , some of the age-related detrimental adaptations may be beneficially modified by dietary strategy .
outcome	Diet rich in omega-3 PUFA reverses the age-associated membrane omega-3 : omega-6 PUFA imbalance , and dysfunctional Ca ( 2 + ) metabolism , facilitating increased efficiency of mitochondrial energy production and improved tolerance of ischemia and reperfusion .

###8864710
population	The effect of oral treatment with acyclovir ( ACV ) on sensory axonal neuropathy , segmental motor paresis and postherpetic neuralgia ( PHN ) was studied in 105 patients with herpes zoster .
intervention	Forty-seven patients were treated with ACV at a dose of 4 g/day in 5 doses for at least a week ; the others did not undergo any kind of treatment .
intervention	Electrodiagnostic examination of the nerves and muscles corresponding to the dermatomeric lesions was performed , including sensory and motor nerve conduction studies , blink reflex and electromyography ( EMG ) .
outcome	The patients treated with ACV showed a significant reduction in the number of cases in which there was electrophysiological evidence of axonal damage in afferent fibres of nerves arising from roots corresponding to affected dermatomes .
outcome	The treated group also showed a smaller incidence of segmental motor neuritis , clinically evident or only detectable by EMG as denervation .
outcome	However , there was no significant difference between groups as far as the incidence of PHN was concerned .
outcome	Oral treatment with ACV therefore reduces peripheral sensory axonopathy due to ganglion damage and prevents the possibility of spread to anterior roots and spinal motoneurones .
outcome	In this way it reduces the incidence of segmental motor neuritis , but does not reduce the incidence of PHN .

###10850747
background	The Medicare Alzheimer Disease Demonstration tested a case management and community care benefit for persons with dementia .
outcome	The demonstration produced statistically but not clinically significant reductions in caregiver burden and depression .
outcome	It increased access to community-based long-term care services but did not affect the level of services used .
outcome	It did not reduce informal caregiver hours spent helping people with dementia .
outcome	It produced statistically significant but not budget-neutral reductions in Medicare expenditures in that the degree of reduction in regular Medicare expenditures was not enough to offset the added demonstration costs .
outcome	It did not reduce rates of nursing home placement .
outcome	Informal care networks providing care to demented enrollees were generally able to function effectively , regardless of whether a professional case manager was involved or whether a long-term care benefit was available .

###18977815
background	Spontaneous cervicocephalic artery dissection ( sCAD ) of more than two cervical arteries is rare .
population	Vascular and potential sCAD risk factors , triggering events , clinical and neuroimaging findings , and outcome of patients with multiple sCAD were studied .
other	Patients were drawn from prospective hospital-based sCAD registries .
other	Of 740 consecutive patients with sCAD , 11 ( 1.5 % ) had three , and one had four ( 0.1 % ) sCAD .
other	Eight of these 12 patients were women .
outcome	One patient had additional dissections of the celiac trunk and hepatic artery .
outcome	Vascular risk factors included hypertension ( n = 1 ) , hypercholesterolaemia ( n = 6 ) , current smoking ( n = 5 ) and migraine ( n = 6 ) .
outcome	No patient had a family history of sCAD , fibromuscular dysplasia ( FMD ) or connective tissue disease .
outcome	SCAD was preceded by a minor trauma in five and infection in four patients .
outcome	Clinical manifestations included ischaemic stroke ( n = 8 ) , transient ischaemic attack ( n = 3 ) , headache ( n = 9 ) , neck pain ( n = 4 ) , Horner syndrome ( n = 5 ) , pulsatile tinnitus ( n = 2 ) and dysgeusia ( n = 1 ) .
outcome	Brain MRI revealed ischaemic infarcts that affected one vessel territory in seven and two territories in two patients .
outcome	The 3-month outcome was favourable ( modified Rankin scale score 0-1 ) in 10 patients ( 83 % ) .
outcome	No new recurrent stroke or sCAD occurred during a mean follow-up of 50 ( SD 29 ) months .
other	Multiple sCAD occurred preferentially in women and caused clinical symptoms and signs mainly in one vascular territory .
other	In none of the patients was FMD or any other underlying arteriopathy apparent .
other	The majority of multiple sCAD was preceded by a minor trauma or infection .
outcome	Clinical outcome was favourable in most patients , and long-term prognosis benign .
outcome	The data suggest that transient vasculopathy may be a major mechanism for multiple sCAD .

###17513658
background	Congenital insensitivity to pain with anhidrosis ( CIPA ) is a rare , hereditary , autonomic recessive disorder .
background	The inability to perceive pain results from loss of nociceptive afferents , while anhidrosis is caused by loss of innervation to the sweat glands .
background	Insensitivity to pain and mental retardation lead to self-inflicted injuries , corneal lacerations , painless bony fractures , joint deformities with consequent chronic osteomyelitis , and septic arthritis .
background	There are only a few reports on the anesthetic management for patients with CIPA .
background	We describe the anesthetic management of a young woman with CIPA receiving bilateral arthrodesis of the ankle .

background	The goal of medical residency is to provide the best clinical education for future practice , while increasing quality and safety in current and future healthcare .
background	This goal is not being met .

background	All these factors create a system that serves no one-not the resident , the patient , or the system in which both interact .
background	Residency reforms are proposed to address these imperative concerns .

###17030685
background	Atrial fibrosis is an important substrate in atrial fibrillation ( AF ) , particularly in the setting of structural heart disease .
background	In a canine model , congestive heart failure ( CHF ) produces significant atrial fibrosis and the substrate for sustained AF .
background	This atrial remodeling is a potential therapeutic target .
other	The objective of the present study is to evaluate the effects of the antifibrotic drug pirfenidone ( PFD ) on arrhythmogenic atrial remodeling in a canine CHF model .
population	We studied 15 canines , divided equally into 3 groups : control , CHF canines not treated with PFD , and CHF canines treated with PFD .
intervention	CHF was induced by ventricular tachypacing ( 220 bpm for 3 weeks ) , and oral PFD was administered for the 3-week pacing period .
other	We performed electrophysiology and AF vulnerability studies , atrial fibrosis measurements , and atrial cytokine expression studies .
outcome	Only canines in the untreated CHF group developed sustained AF ( > 30 minutes , 4 of 5 canines ; P < 0.05 ) .
outcome	Treatment of CHF canines with PFD resulted in an attenuation of arrhythmogenic left atrial remodeling , with a significant reduction in left atrial conduction heterogeneity index ( median [ 25 % to 75 % interquartile range ] 4.96 [ 3.53 to 5.64 ] versus 2.52 [ 2.1
outcome	Immunoblotting studies demonstrated the drug 's effects on multiple cytokines , including a reduction in transforming growth factor-beta1 expression .
outcome	Treatment of CHF canines with PFD results in significantly reduced arrhythmogenic atrial remodeling and AF vulnerability .
outcome	Pharmacological therapy targeted at the fibrotic substrate itself may play an important role in the management of AF .

###17927294
background	Agmatine is an endogenous neuromodulator that , based on animal studies , has the potential for new drug development .
background	As an endogenous aminoguanidine compound ( 1-amino-4-guanidinobutane ) , it is structurally unique compared with other monoamines .
background	Agmatine was long thought to be synthesised only in lower life forms , until its biosynthetic pathway ( decarboxylation of arginine ) was described in the mammalian brain in 1994 .
other	Human arginine decarboxylase has been cloned and shown to have 48 % identity to ornithine decarboxylase .
other	In neurons of the brain and spinal cord , agmatine is packaged into synaptic vesicles and released upon neuronal depolarisation .
background	Initially , agmatine was conceptualised as an endogenous clonidine-displacing
background	In addition to activity at these receptors , agmatine irreversibly inhibits neuronal nitric oxide synthase and downregulates inducible nitric oxide synthase.Endogenous agmatine is induced in response to stress and/or inflammation .
background	Stressful conditions that induce agmatine include hypoxic-ischaemia and cold-restraint stress of ulcerogenic proportion .
background	Induction of agmatine in the brain seems to occur in astrocytes , although neurons also synthesise agmatine .
intervention	The effects of injected agmatine in animals include anticonvulsant - , antineurotoxic - and antidepressant-like actions .
population	Intraperitoneal or intracerebroventricular injections of agmatine rapidly elicit antidepressant-like behavioural changes in the rodent forced swim test and tail suspension test .
other	Intraperitoneal injections of agmatine into rats and mice also elicit acute anxiolytic-like behavioural changes in the elevated plus-maze stress test .
outcome	In an animal model of acute stress disorder , intraperitoneal agmatine injections diminish contextual fear learning .
outcome	Furthermore , intraperitoneal injections of agmatine reduce alcohol and opioid dependence by diminishing behaviour in a rat conditioned place preference paradigm.Based on these findings , agmatine appears to be an endogenous neuromodulator of mental stress .
outcome	The possible roles and/or beneficial effects of agmatine in stress-related disorders , such as depression , anxiety and post-traumatic stress disorder , merit further investigation .

###15042275
background	The investigation of rodent cocaine self-administration ( SA ) under conditions that promote escalating patterns of intake may provide insight into the loss of control over drug use that is central to human addiction .
other	This study examines the effects of daily long-access ( LgA ) SA of high or low cocaine doses on drug intake , extinction , reinstatement , and brain mRNA levels .
population	Three groups of male Sprague-Dawley rats were trained to self-administer cocaine during multiple-dose sessions .
other	Short-access ( ShA ) rats were tested daily for multi-dose SA then remained in the chambers for 7 h with no cocaine available .
other	LgA rats had access to low ( 0.5 mg/kg per infusion ; LgA-LD ) or high ( 2.0 mg/kg per infusion ; LgA-HD ) cocaine doses for 7 h after multi-dose SA .
other	After 14 days , responding was extinguished , cocaine-induced reinstatement was determined , and preproenkephalin ( ppENK ) , preprodynorphin ( ppDYN ) , corticotropin releasing factor ( CRF ) and dopamine D ( 2 ) receptor ( D ( 2 ) R ) mRNA levels were measured in various brain regions using a quantitative solution hybridization RNase protection assay .
outcome	Whereas SA was not altered in ShA rats and only increased during the `` loading phase '' in LgA-LD rats , a general escalation of intake was found in LgA-HD rats .
outcome	LgA , particularly LgA-HD , rats were more susceptible to reinstatement than ShA rats .
outcome	Caudate-putamen ppENK and nucleus accumbens D ( 2 ) R mRNA levels were elevated in LgA-HD rats .
outcome	Overall , D ( 2 ) R mRNA levels were positively correlated with reinstatement .
outcome	The escalation of cocaine SA under LgA conditions is dose-dependent and is associated with heightened susceptibility to drug-induced relapse .
outcome	The characterization of neurobiological alterations that accompany escalated SA should facilitate the identification of mechanisms underlying the onset of human addiction .

###17891468
background	Canine aggressive behaviour is one of the most common problems being reported by dog owners .
background	However , the biochemical basis of this phenomenon remains unclear .
background	In humans , alterations in omega-3 plasma polyunsatured fatty acids and elevated omega6/omega -3 ratio have been linked to behavioural alterations , including aggression .
other	Thus far , however , the relationship between plasma polyunsatured fatty acid status and aggression has not been investigated in the dog .
other	In the present study we sought to investigate whether polyunsatured fatty acid status could be altered in plasma of pathologically aggressive Canis familiaris .
population	Eighteen adult male German Shepherd dogs , aged 4.9 + / - 0.9 years , showing no clinical signs but aggression , were investigated .
population	Eighteen healthy male dogs , aged 4.8 + / - 0.7 years , with a negative history of behavioural and neurological disorders served as controls .
other	Baseline fasting plasma polyunsatured fatty acid composition was determined by gas chromatography .
outcome	Compared to normal dogs , aggressive dogs showed lower docosahexaenoic acid ( 22:6 n-3 ) concentrations and a higher omega6/omega -3 ratio .
outcome	In addition , they showed reduced cholesterol and bilirubin concentrations compared to their normally behaving counterparts .
outcome	Altogether , our results suggest that low omega-3 fatty acids may adversely impact behaviour in dogs , resulting in greater propensity to aggression .
outcome	However , given the cross-sectional design of our study , we can not claim any causal relationship between the presence of alterations in fatty acid status and canine aggressiveness .
outcome	Whether omega-3 fatty acids supplementation may be useful to reduce aggressive behaviour in the dog deserves further investigation .

###18066937
background	The prevalence and profile of adults with a history of traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) has not been studied in large North American forensic mental health populations .
background	This study investigated how adults with a documented history of TBI differed with the non-TBI forensic population with respect to demographics , psychiatric diagnoses and history of offences .
population	A retrospective chart review of all consecutive admissions to a forensic psychiatry programme in Toronto , Canada was conducted .
other	Information on history of TBI , psychiatric diagnoses , living environments and types of criminal offences were obtained from medical records .
outcome	History of TBI was ascertained in 23 % of 394 eligible patient records .
outcome	Compared to those without a documented history of TBI , persons with this history were less likely to be diagnosed with schizophrenia but more likely to have alcohol/substance abuse disorder .
outcome	There were also differences observed with respect to offence profiles .
outcome	This study provides evidence to support routine screening for a history of TBI in forensic psychiatry .

outcome	Tolterodine is as effective as oxybutynin for improving the symptoms of overactive bladder but it has superior tolerability .

outcome	Our analysis shows that testing of 4153delA , 5382insC , C61G BRCA1 mutations should be extremely effective and inexpensive tool in testing Lithuanian population aimed to identify individuals with high risk of breast and ovarian cancers .

###18333297
background	To characterize the matched maternal and cord plasma and the amniotic fluid concentrations of iodide in preterm and term human pregnancies .
population	Specimens were collected at the delivery of 121 singleton pregnancies ( 92 at term , 29 preterm ) with no pre-existing medical complications .
other	Plasma unbound iodide concentrations were measured by the difference between the protein bound iodine and the total iodine measured spectrophotometrically .
other	Total iodide was measured in amniotic fluid .
outcome	Maternal plasma iodide concentrations were 1.6 + / - 0.4 mcg/dL ( mean + / - S.D. ) for preterm deliveries and 1.5 + / -0.5 mcg/dL for term deliveries .
outcome	Cord plasma iodide concentrations were 1.4 + / - 0.5 mcg/dL for preterm deliveries and 1.7 + / - 0.7 mcg/dL for term deliveries .
outcome	Cord plasma iodide concentrations at birth correlated highly with maternal levels ( p < 0.001 ) .
outcome	The cord : maternal plasma iodide ratio for all pairs was 1.2 + / - 0.7 .
outcome	The average cord : maternal plasma iodide ratio was not significantly different between the preterm ( 0.9 + / - 0.4 ) and term ( 1.3 + / - 0.8 ) deliveries .
outcome	Amniotic fluid iodide concentrations did not correlate significantly with cord plasma concentrations .
outcome	Cord plasma concentrations of iodide correlate with paired maternal levels , indicating that , unlike the rabbit and other species , the human conceptus does not highly concentrate iodide .

###12235618
background	Randomized clinical trials ( RCTs ) are widely considered to be the gold standard of evidence for treatment efficacy , but they have not been widely applied to rehabilitation or , more specifically , traumatic brain injury rehabilitation .
background	Ethical , scientific , and resource factors may limit the application of RCTs .
background	Thus , rigorous observational alternatives to the RCT would be of great value .
intervention	In the article by Powell et al , an attempt to rigorously apply an observational design to assess the relative effectiveness of inpatient rehabilitation versus home discharge failed to control for important confounding factors .
outcome	It appears nearly impossible to successfully apply observational designs when the factors leading to the applications of different treatments are strongly related to the patient 's perceived prognosis .
outcome	However , observational designs may be successfully applied when regional or temporal variations in care are studied .
outcome	Moreover , a number of developments in measurement , study design , and statistical analysis may expand the role of observational studies in answering questions of rehabilitation efficacy and effectiveness .

outcome	Interventions conducted in primary care settings were not effective compared with those that occurred in hospital-based clinics or nonclinical settings .
outcome	The data on the effects of HBPM on patients ' medication-taking behavior are mixed .
outcome	Future studies should investigate the independent effects of HBPM in primary care practices where the majority of hypertensive patients receive their care .
