###12847782
background	Concordance between patients ' and informants ' reports of personality disorders ( PDs ) is low , raising the questions of which source provides more valid data and whether both contribute unique information .
population	This study compared patients ' and informants ' reports of PDs in predicting outcome in a 7Â 1/2 - year follow-up of 85 depressed outpatients .
other	Patients and informants were independently evaluated using structured interviews ; outcome was assessed using structured interviews with patients .
outcome	Both patients ' and informants ' reports of PD diagnoses and dimensional scores independently predicted depression symptoms and global functioning at follow-up .
outcome	However , only informants ' reports made a unique contribution to predicting social adjustment .
outcome	This finding indicates that both patients and informants provide unique information on Axis II psychopathology and argues for the use of both sources in the assessment of PDs .

###17907758
background	The main objective was to assess how group premiums can help poor people in the informal economy prepay for health care services .
other	A comparative approach was adopted to study four groups of informal economy operators ( cobblers , welders , carpenters , small scale market retailers ) focusing on a method of prepayment which could help them access health care services .
population	Two groups with a total of 714 operators were organized to prepay for health care services through a group premium , while the other two groups with a total of 702 operators were not organized to prepay through this approach .
other	They prepaid through individual premium , each operator paying from his or her sources .
other	Data on the four groups which lived in the same city was collected through a questionnaire and focus group discussions .
other	Data collected was focused on health problems , health seeking behaviour and payment for health care services .
other	Training of all the groups on prepaid health care financing based on individual based premium payment and group based premium payment was done .
other	Groups were then free to choose which method to use in prepaying for health care .
other	Prepayment through the two methods was then observed over a period of three years .
other	Trends of membership attrition and retention were documented for both approaches .
outcome	Data collected showed that the four groups were similar in many respects .
outcome	These similarities included levels of education , housing , and social services such as water supplies , health problems , family size and health seeking behaviour .
outcome	At the end of a period of three years 76 % of the members from the two groups who chose group premium payment were still members of the prepayment health scheme and were receiving health care .
outcome	For the two groups which opted for individual premium payment only 15 % of their members were still receiving health care services at the end of three years .
outcome	Group premium is a useful tool in improving accessibility to health care services in the poorer segments of the population especially the informal economy operators

###14770136
background	Postoperative rehabilitation for patients who have sustained a laceration to their flexor tendon apparatus is an important factor in maximizing functional outcome .
background	Quality rehabilitation is characterized by the development of a tailored exercise regimen .
background	There is currently no model available to tailor an exercise regimen for a person with an atypical physiologic response pattern .
background	If rehabilitation protocols were classified according to the criteria of forces applied across a tendon juncture and/or excursion , and a clinical method were available to assist in the identification of optimal tendon loading and/or excursion application ,
study design	The author conducted a literature review and case study .
other	A model for systematic application of progressive loading exercises to the intrasynovial flexor tendon injury and repair is conceptually developed .
intervention	The model consists of a pyramidal series of eight specific rehabilitation exercises in the following sequence : passive protected extension , place and hold , active composite fist , hook and straight fist , isolated joint motion , resistive composite fist , res
other	Concepts are developed to implement a three-point clinical adhesion-grading system .
other	Clinical application of the system is highlighted .
outcome	An excellent outcome was considered 112 % total active motion .
outcome	A model for systematic application of progressive loading exercises has been conceptually developed in concert with a method for determination of optimal tendon loading .
outcome	Further substantiation is necessary to validate the proposed theory .

###8580657
background	To compare the presence in levels of antiovarian antibodies ( AOAb ) in the pre - and postovulatory stage from serum of infertile patients undergoing intrauterine insemination ( IUI ) or in vitro fertilization ( IVF ) with outcome of the procedures .
population	Serum from 36 women undergoing IUI , 36 women undergoing IVF and 25 fertile , healthy controls were assayed for the presence of AOAb by a commercially available ELISA kit .
outcome	AOAb was positive in 59.7 % of infertile women , while none of the fertile controls were positive for AOAb .
outcome	The levels of these antibodies increased as the patient age and the number of treatment attempts increased .
outcome	Though the presence of AOAb did not affect oocyte recovery rate , it resulted in decreased fertilization rate , cleavage rate , and pregnancy rate in infertile women .
outcome	Our studies suggest that AOAb may be a cause of infertility and presence of these antibodies could have adverse effects on the outcome of assisted reproductive techniques .

###10527084
background	To examine the utility of quantitative sensory testing ( QST ) to characterize sensory dysfunction in patients with spinal cord injury ( SCI ) .
intervention	METHOD :
intervention	Three QST trials were administered to six lower leg dermatomes , on two different days , to estimate the reliability of measurement .
other	Regional Spinal Cord Injury Rehabilitation Center in Ontario , Canada .
population	Twenty-one SCI patients with incomplete neurologic deficits and 14 able-bodied controls of similar age .
outcome	ANOVA revealed significantly ( p < .05 ) reduced perceptual threshold values ( hypoesthesia ) for warm , cold , and vibratory sensation in the SCI group .
outcome	There were no differences between group mean values for cold pain because of the inclusion of patients with hypoalgesia and hyperalgesia .
outcome	Intraclass correlation coefficient estimates of reliability revealed large between-subject variability in the SCI patients associated with relatively small trial-to-trial variability within each day of testing , and appreciable between-day variances .
outcome	With QST in SCI there is a need for repeated measurements across days to establish stable baseline measures or outcomes following intervention .
outcome	QST is a useful adjunct to clinical examination for assessment of preserved sensation .

###11869583
background	Counsellors are prevalent in primary care settings .
background	However , there are concerns about the clinical and cost-effectiveness of the treatments they provide , compared with alternatives such as usual care from the general practitioner , medication or other psychological therapies .
other	To assess the effectiveness and cost effectiveness of counselling in primary care by reviewing cost and outcome data in randomised controlled trials , controlled clinical trials and controlled patient preference trials of counselling interventions in primary care , for patients with psychological and psychosocial problems considered suitable for counselling .
other	The original search strategy included electronic searching of databases ( including the CCDAN Register of RCTs and CCTs ) along with handsearching of a specialist journal .
other	Published and unpublished sources ( clinical trials , books , dissertations , agency reports etc. ) were searched , and their reference lists scanned to uncover further controlled trials .
other	Contact was made with subject experts and CCDAN members in order to uncover further trials .
other	For the updated review , searches were restricted to those databases judged to be high yield in the first version of the review MEDLINE , EMBASE , PSYCLIT and CINAHL , the Cochrane Controlled Trials register and the CCDAN trials register .
population	All controlled trials comparing counselling in primary care with other treatments for patients with psychological and psychosocial problems considered suitable for counselling .
other	Trials completed before the end of June 2001 were included in the review .
other	Data were extracted using a standardised data extraction sheet .
other	The relevant data were entered into the Review Manager software .
other	Trials were quality rated , using CCDAN criteria , to assess the extent to which their design and conduct were likely to have prevented systematic error .
other	Continuous measures of outcome were combined using standardised mean differences .
other	An overall effect size was calculated for each outcome with 95 % confidence intervals .
other	Continuous data from different measuring instruments were transformed into a standard effect size by dividing mean values by standard deviations .
other	In view of the diversity of counselling services in primary care ( the range of treatments , patients and practitioners ) tests of heterogeneity were done to assess the feasibility of aggregating measures of outcome from trials .
other	Sensitivity analyses were undertaken to test the robustness of the results .
other	Seven trials were included in the review .
outcome	The main analyses showed significantly greater clinical effectiveness in the counselling group compared with ` usual care ' in the short-term ( standardised mean difference -0.28 , 95 % CI -0.43 to -0.13 , n = 772 , 6 trials ) but not the long-term ( standardised me
outcome	Levels of satisfaction with counselling were high .
outcome	Four studies reported similar total costs associated with counselling and usual care over the long-term .
outcome	However , the economic analyses were likely to be underpowered .
outcome	Counselling is associated with modest improvement in short-term outcome compared to ` usual care ' , but provides no additional advantages in the long-term .
outcome	Patients are satisfied with counselling , and it may not be associated with increased costs .

###11686999
background	The prevalence of obesity and overweight is increasing world-wide .
background	Obesity in children impacts on their health in both the short and longer term .
background	Obesity prevention strategies are poorly understood .
other	To assess the effectiveness of interventions designed to prevent obesity in childhood .
other	Electronic databases were searched from 1985 to October 1999 .
other	Data from RCTs and non-randomised trials with concurrent control group were included .
other	studies with follow up of one year minimum were selected , A priori , this was subsequently amended to include studies with minimum follow up of three months .
other	The possible susceptibility of post hoc questions to bias is addressed .
other	Two reviewers independently extracted data and assessed study quality .
other	Seven studies were included , three long-term and four short - term .
outcome	The studies included were diverse in terms of study design and quality , target population , theoretical underpinning of intervention approach , and outcome measures .
outcome	As such , it was not possible to combine study findings using statistical methods .
outcome	The findings of the review suggest that currently there is limited quality data on the effectiveness of obesity prevention programs and as such no generalisable conclusions can be drawn .
outcome	The need for well-designed studies which examine a range of interventions remains a priority .

###16338278
background	The clinical outcome of acid-related disorders treated by proton pump inhibitors ( PPIs ) might be dependent on the polymorphically expressed cytochrome P450 ( CYP ) 2C19 , which is involved in PPI metabolism .
other	We tested whether esomeprazole-induced healing of gastroesophageal reflux disease ( GERD ) is related to CYP2C19 genotype .
population	Two hundred five patients with GERD ( Los Angeles classification grade A or B ) were included in a case-control study according to endoscopic outcome ( healed versus unhealed group , matched for confounders ) after treatment with 40 mg esomeprazole daily for 4
other	The frequency of CYP2C19 genotypes was determined as the primary outcome measure for both groups .
other	In a second trial plasma levels of esomeprazole and corresponding CYP2C19 and CYP3A4 metabolites ( 5-hydroxyomeprazole and omeprazole sulfone ) were monitored in 10 CYP2C19 wild-type patients with GERD after the first and last doses ( day 7 ) of 40 mg esomeprazole daily to calculate metabolic ratios .
outcome	CYP2C19 wild-type ( n = 148 ) and heterozygous ( n = 51 ) or homozygous variant ( n = 6 ) patients did not differ with respect to baseline characteristics .
outcome	The frequency distribution of CYP2C19 genotypes was not different between patients with complete ( 75/100 ) and incomplete ( 73/105 ) healing ( P = .65 ) .
outcome	When a single esomeprazole dose and multiple dosing were compared , the low contribution of CYP2C19 to the elimination of esomeprazole decreased further by 50 % .
outcome	In contrast , the CYP3A4-dependent formation of omeprazole sulfone increased by 40 % , and consequently , the metabolic ratio of omeprazole sulfone to 5-hydroxyomeprazole was elevated from 7.9 to 19.3 ( P = .0004 ) .
outcome	In contrast to other PPIs , esomeprazole-induced healing of GERD is unrelated to the CYP2C19 genotype , which can be explained by the metabolic shift toward the CYP3A4-mediated pathway .

###12271241
background	Telemedicine can be defined as the electronic transfer of medical information to remote sites in order to support patient care and medical education ( Norton et al , 1997 ) .
background	The concept of telemedicine has been around for more than 20 years ; however , with the advantages of affordable technology it is set to play a major role in the future of health care .
background	The use of telemedicine within the field of dermatological practice is well documented in the literature but the use of this referral system by clinical nurse specialists in tissue viability appears to be in its infancy .
background	This article seeks to dispel the myths around the use of technology to enhance clinical practice and uses the authors ' personal experience to describe its effectiveness for referring patients with complex tissue viability needs .

###17033947
background	To compare the appearance of superficial lymph nodes on standard two-dimensional ( 2D ) ultrasound examination and on three-dimensional ( 3D ) ultrasound examination .
population	Fifty two lymph nodes ( 35 cervical , 16 axillary , 1 inguinal ) in 52 patients were examined with ultrasound in 3D mode .
other	In standard 2D grey-scale examination and on a C-plane of 3D mode ( parallel to the surface of the probe ) , the shape of a lymph node and its hilum were assessed .
other	Final histopathological diagnoses included 36 lymphomas , 11 reactive or inflammatory lymph nodes , 3 metastases and 2 plasmocytoma infiltrations .
outcome	The appearance of hilums and lymph nodes as a whole changed on a C-plane of 3D mode ( as compared with 2D presentation ) in 28 % and 37 % , respectively .
outcome	The differences in lymph node shape on 2D and 3D ultrasound were apparent in a comparable percentage of reactive lymph nodes ( 45 % ) and lymphomatous lymph nodes ( 39 % ) .
outcome	The differences in lymph node hilum shape on 2D and 3D ultrasound applied to 56 % of reactive lymph nodes and 20 % of lymphomatous lymph nodes .
outcome	Three-dimensional imaging on a C-plane ( parallel to the surface of the probe ) may supply the examiner with different information concerning the shape of the lymph node and its hilum in comparison to standard 2D ultrasound .
outcome	Changes in the shapes of hilum and lymph node occurred in reactive or inflamed lymph nodes as well as in lymphomas .
outcome	Clinical significance of this fact demands further investigation .

###12461496
background	To examine pediatricians ' attitudes toward children 's participation in randomized controlled trials ( RCTs ) and identify possible barriers to participation .
population	Qualitative analysis of focus group discussions involving 16 pediatricians and 5 trainees from a pediatric teaching hospital in Australia .
other	Doctors varied in occupation , experience , research activity , age , sex , ethnicity , and parenthood experience .
other	A professional facilitator conducted the semistructured group discussions .
other	The transcribed audiotapes were analyzed by theme linkage by using the constant comparative method .
outcome	Pediatricians believed parents balanced perceived gains and risks when deciding about trial participation .
outcome	They thought the child 's condition , parents ' health beliefs and personal attributes , and the doctors ' beliefs and relationship with the investigators influenced parents ' attitudes .
outcome	Perceived gains included professional benefits for pediatricians , improved patient care , convenience for the families and themselves , and scientific advancement .
outcome	Perceived risks included inconvenience , inadequate resources , and potential harms to the patient and doctor-patient relationship .
outcome	Pediatricians with previous research experience were most knowledgeable about RCTs and perceived greatest gains from trial participation .
outcome	Pediatricians ' personal treatment preferences hindered trial support .
outcome	This study suggests that children 's participation in trials will be enhanced by increasing pediatricians ' awareness of RCTs through education and involvement in trials and by improving the gains-risk balance.biomedical and behavioral researchempirical app

###8938614
background	The aim of this study was to see whether results of anterior interbody lumbar fusion could be improved with the help of an external transpedicular device .
population	Anterior interbody lumbar fusion was carried out in 83 patients , using the technique described by Suzuki .
intervention	Fifty-six ( 67 % ) patients were fused with the Magerl-SchlÃ¤pfer external fixator device as a posterior support .
intervention	Twenty-seven patients had interbody fusion and a conventional plastic brace for support .
other	The clinical and radiological results of anterior interbody lumbar fusion were compared between these groups .
other	The mean follow-up time was 5 ( range , 2-10 ) years .
other	A total of 128 levels were fused .
other	There were no statistical differences in the clinical and radiological results between patients fused with or without the external fixator .
outcome	There were many complications associated with the use of an external fixator device .
outcome	We do not recommend the use of an external fixator in anterior interbody lumbar fusion .

###15503703
background	Although several reports characterize pain associated with adult-onset spinal cord injury ( SCI ) , little is known about the incidence and etiology of pain associated with pediatric-onset SCI .
other	The purpose of this study was to assess the incidence and type of chronic pain in the pediatric SCI population and to evaluate the resulting impact on activities of daily living ( ADLs ) .
population	Patients attending clinic in a pediatric tertiary care facility in a major metropolitan area having sustained an SCI during childhood were asked to participate .
other	Participants were assessed using the Adolescent Pediatric Pain Tool and the Lansky Play Performance Scale , 2 standardized assessments of pain and function , respectively .
other	In addition , a questionnaire designed to characterize the population and the types of pain reported was administered .
population	Thirty-one participants were enrolled with an age range at the time of injury from 5 months to 18 years .
outcome	Of this population , 65 % reported chronic pain .
outcome	The pain reports were classified as either nocioceptive ( 48 % ) or neuropathic ( 19 % ) .
outcome	Interference with ADLs and play was present in only 1 participant .
outcome	Based on these pilot data , pain associated with a pediatric-onset SCI is common .
outcome	The incidence of pain in this study approached the reported incidence of chronic pain in adult-onset SCI .
outcome	In the present population , nocioceptive pain was more common than was neuropathic pain .
outcome	These data suggest that although common , chronic pain associated with childhood SCI has a significantly smaller impact on daily activities than that reported in the literature for adult-onset SCI .

###18415716
background	At present there are no standardized recommendations concerning physiotherapy of individuals with traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) resulting in a high variability of methods and intensity .
other	The aim of this literature review is to develop recommendations concerning physiotherapy in the post-acute phase after TBI on the basis of scientific evidence .
study design	METHOD : literature review : data bases : PubMed , PEDro , OT-Seeker , Cochrane and Cinahl .
other	Keywords brain injury ( in PEDro , OT-Seeker , Cochrane ) , brain injury AND physical therapy ( in PubMed and Cinahl ) .
other	Fourteen studies met the inclusion criteria and were grouped into sub-groups sensory stimulation , therapy intensity , casting/splinting , exercise or aerobic training and functional skill training .
outcome	While for sensory stimulation evidence could not be proven , a strong evidence exists that more intensive rehabilitation programmes lead to earlier functional abilities .
outcome	The recommendation due to casting for the improvement of passive range of motion is a grade B , while only a C recommendation is appropriate concerning tonus reduction .
outcome	Strong evidence exists that intensive task-orientated rehabilitation programmes lead to earlier and better functional abilities .
outcome	Although some recommendations for the effectiveness of physical therapy interventions could be expressed , there are many questions concerning the treatment of humans with TBI which have not been investigated so far .
outcome	Especially on the level of activity and participation only a few studies exist .

###18487570
background	We surveyed cancer physicians to understand how patients ' age and comorbidity influence adjuvant chemotherapy recommendations and whether physician or practice characteristics also affect these recommendations .
population	National survey of surgeons and medical oncologists caring for patients with colorectal cancer regarding whether they would recommend adjuvant chemotherapy for hypothetical patients with stage III colon cancer who varied by age ( 55 v 80 years ) and comorbi
other	Repeated measures logistic regression was used to assess the influence of patient , physician , and practice characteristics on chemotherapy recommendations .
outcome	Of 1,096 physicians , nearly all recommended chemotherapy for patients who were 55 years old with no comorbidity ( 99.0 % ) , 55-years old with moderate CHF ( 88.6 % ) , or 80 years old with no comorbidity ( 92.6 % ) ; many fewer recommended chemotherapy for 55-year-o
outcome	Younger physicians ( P < .001 ) were more likely than others to recommend adjuvant chemotherapy overall , although physician factors explained little of the variability in recommendations .
outcome	Physicians agree with guidelines recommending adjuvant chemotherapy for young , healthy patients with stage III colon cancer but differ widely on recommendations for patients who are older and sicker .
outcome	Few physician or practice characteristics were associated with recommendations .
outcome	For older and sicker patients , the individual physicians seen may have a substantial impact on the likelihood of receiving chemotherapy .
outcome	Understanding better the sources of variation not explained by patients ' clinical characteristics may allow improved tailoring of therapy to patients most likely to benefit .

###10889563
study design	A multi-center longitudinal study .
background	To estimate the current trend in the incidence of first kidney stone among persons with spinal cord injury ( SCI ) and to delineate the potential contributing factors .
other	Twenty-one Model SCI Care Systems throughout the United States .
population	A longitudinal cohort of 8314 subjects enrolled in the National SCI Database between 1986 and 1999 was used to estimate and compare the incidence of first kidney stone with a previous report of 5850 SCI patients injured between 1973 and 1982 .
other	A Cox regression analysis was performed to identify risk factors for stones , including age , race , gender , severity of injury , and method of urinary drainage .
other	These variables have been routinely collected , on a yearly basis , by the collaborating SCI centers .
outcome	During the 12 years , 6 months of case ascertainment , 286 incident stone cases were documented .
outcome	The risk was greatest during the first 3 months after injury ( 31 cases per 1000 person-years ) , quickly decreasing and leveling off later ( eight cases per 1000 person-years ) .
outcome	It was estimated that within 10 years after injury , 7 % of persons with SCI would develop their first kidney stone .
outcome	There was no evidence that the risk has changed over the past 25 years ( P = 0.96 ) .
outcome	During the first year post injury only , a significantly increased risk of stones was observed in Caucasians and persons aged 45 years or older .
outcome	A positive association of the severity of injury and requiring instrumentation for bladder emptying with kidney stones was found after the first year post injury .
outcome	The type of urinary drainage , including indwelling , intermittent , and condom catheterization , had no significant differential effect on stone formation at either risk period .
outcome	The highest risk of kidney stones is within the first few months post injury .
outcome	Little progress has been made in reducing this risk .
outcome	Although inability to control bladder function is an important risk factor after the first year post injury , for those who need bladder management , the type of urinary drainage does not appear to be an important factor in determining risk .

###9454313
background	Despite advances in medical knowledge and available methods of treating spinal problems , the costs these problems generate are growing in a constant and exponential manner in western countries .
background	Back pain is not different , commoner or more severe than in the past .
background	This raises the question whether present-day management , which often runs counter to current scientific evidence , is appropriate .
background	Practically speaking , so-called specific back pain is to be distinguished from nonspecific or common back pain .
background	The former arises from a precise lesion ( infectious , tumoral , inflammatory or traumatic ) , while the latter has no obvious underlying cause .
background	Fortunately this preliminary differentiation is usually possible on the basis of the history and clinical workup alone .
background	In this paper we deal solely with common back pain , as being by far the most frequent in everyday practice .
background	Once a specific origin has been ruled out , the chief aim should be earliest possible resumption of the patient 's normal activities .
background	Various methods , embracing drug treatment , physiotherapy , and in appropriate cases ergotherapy , are available for this purpose .
background	If this fails , the physician must react as rapidly as possible to prevent the condition becoming chronic .
background	Regard should be had for the various psychosocial factors which interfere with the healing process , and a method should be adopted which is no longer based on the classic biomedical model but on a bio-psycho-social approach as proposed by Waddell .
background	If necessary the patient should be referred to a specialist ( rheumatologist , rehabilitation , orthopedist etc ) .
background	Back pain is extremely widespread in the population at large and is a frequent reason why people consult a physician .
background	On these grounds the primary care physician has a key role to play in the initial workup and also in the acute , subacute or chronic stage of the evolution .
background	This review of the principles which should guide the practical approach to the back-pain patient is intended to aid the practitioner in his tasks of diagnosis and therapy .

###12637183
background	Spastic equinovarus deformity of the ankle in adults with acquired brain injury can severely limit the achievement of rehabilitation goals .
population	This study examined changes in triceps surae muscle extensibility , passive resistive torque and soleus stretch reflex responses in 10 adult brain injured subjects undergoing serial casting to correct ankle equinovarus deformity .
intervention	Goniometric measurement of maximal passive dorsiflexion was used to evaluate extensibility of the triceps surae muscles .
intervention	Computer controlled ankle dynamometry and surface electromyography were used to identify passive resistive torque and soleus stretch reflex onset angle in response to stretches at two velocities .
other	The mean casting period was 5 weeks .
outcome	Casting was discontinued in one subject due to failure to achieve measurable gain in ankle range over three consecutive cast changes .
outcome	Median improvements in maximal ankle dorsiflexion , with the knee flexed or extended , of 30 degrees and 15 degrees , respectively , were achieved in the remaining nine subjects ( p < 0.0001 ) .
outcome	The median passive ankle range in response to a displacing torque of 10 Nm increased 4.3 degrees over the intervention period ( p < 0.0001 ) .
outcome	Consistent soleus reflex activity in response to passive stretches at 25 degrees x s ( -1 ) was elicited in only four subjects .
outcome	A trend for the stretch reflex onset to move further into the available range was demonstrated in these subjects .
outcome	In the present study , serial casting contributed to significant change in triceps surae extensibility and passive resistive torque , corresponding with improved maximal passive ankle dorsiflexion range and an increase in the angle achieved with a displacin
outcome	Increased stretch reflex threshold was observed in some subjects .
outcome	The use of pre-determined outcome criteria and careful measurement of responses to this intervention were important to prevent premature discontinuation of casting when gains were slower than expected .

###10471102
background	This questionnaire study looked at the diagnostics tests and specimens used to screen for Chlamydia trachomatis in UK genitourinary medicine ( GUM ) clinics .
population	Replies were received from 70 % ( 185/265 ) of clinics .
outcome	Half used only one site to screen women .
outcome	One-third took anal swabs from patients who had anal sex and 10 % took oropharyngeal swabs from patients who had oral sex .
outcome	Immunoassays were used to screen men for chlamydia in 86 % of the clinics and women in 88 % .
outcome	Only 60 % of male and 62 % of female immunoassays were supplemented by a second test .
outcome	Six per cent of clinics used molecular technique ( MT ) to screen men and 4 % to screen women and 4 % were trying to acquire it .
outcome	Culture was not available to 58 % of clinics .
outcome	MT was not available to 81 % , 89 % of which was due to non provision locally and/or cost .
outcome	Only 7 % of clinicians thought that using MT for screening was unnecessary .
outcome	There were significant differences in the availability of the technique between large academic and small clinics .
outcome	A national review of GUM strategies to screen for C. trachomatis with adequate funding is urgently needed .

###16142210
background	Neuropathic pain is responsible for a significant amount of the morbidity associated with generalized and focal peripheral neuropathies .
background	It is a consequence of alterations in neuronal function , chemistry , and structure that occur secondary to nerve injury .
background	These manifestations of neuronal plasticity occur in the peripheral nerve , spinal cord , and brain .
background	A variety of agents from diverse pharmacologic classes , the so-called adjuvant analgesics , have been used to treat neuropathic pain .
background	These include antidepressants , first - and second-generation anticonvulsants , antiarrhythmic agents , topical agents , N-methyl-D-aspartate receptor antagonists , and opioid analgesics .
background	The use of these adjuvant analgesics , either alone or in combination , should result in the alleviation of neuropathic pain in most patients .
background	Recent advances in the understanding of pain mechanisms at multiple central nervous system levels should pave the way toward more effective treatment modalities .

###11225952
background	A variety of central nervous system injuries , diseases , and developmental deficits can lead to motor disorders that present complex mixtures of symptoms .
background	Those that have a fundamental similarity characterized by the appearance of exaggerated velocity-dependent resistance to the lengthening of skeletal muscles are called spasticity .
background	Reports based on clinical observations of motor disorders have and continue to provide the essential database of information regarding the range and distribution of unifying and discordant features of spasticity .
population	Laboratory investigations employing animal models of motor disorders following experimental lesions of the central nervous system have reproduced some of the neurophysiologic changes that accompany injury of the central nervous system in humans .
outcome	Those experimental lesions produced by spinal cord contusion/compression reproduce many of the histopathologic features displayed in traumatic injury of the human spinal cord as well .
outcome	Studies using this model have revealed not only changes in reflex threshold and amplitude but also alterations in fundamental rate-modulation processes that regulate reflex excitability during repetitive stimulation .
outcome	This report characterizes insights obtained from a laboratory investigation in search of fundamental mechanisms that contribute to the development of spasticity and provides a vantage point for understanding therapeutic strategies for treatment of spastic

###17175479
background	Transitional cell carcinoma ( TCC ) of the ovary is a rare , recently recognized , subtype of ovarian surface epithelial cancer .
other	We present a case of TCC of the ovary , managed by staging operation and followed by postoperative chemotherapy with carboplatin and cyclophosphamide .
population	A 67-year-old postmenopausal woman presented with a 2-year history of progressive enlargement of an abdominal mass .
other	Pelvic sonography and abdominal computed tomography showed a pelvic mass measuring 210 x 165 x 203 mm .
other	The serum CA-125 titer was also elevated ( 65.01 U/mL ) .
intervention	A staging operation with total abdominal hysterectomy , bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy , infracolic omentectomy and pelvic lymph node dissection was performed .
other	After surgery , the pathologic report of the left ovarian tumor was TCC , grade 2-3 , stage IA .
intervention	The patient then underwent four cycles of postoperative chemotherapy with carboplatin and cyclophosphamide .
outcome	CA-125 levels declined to within the normal range after the first cycle of chemotherapy .
outcome	TCC of the ovary is a rare subtype of epithelial ovarian cancer .
outcome	It differs from malignant Brenner tumor by the absence of a benign or borderline Brenner component .
outcome	Surgical resection is the primary therapeutic approach , and patient outcomes after chemotherapy are better than for other types of common epithelial ovarian cancers .

###18698041
background	Previous conflicting results about the prognostic significance of estrogen receptor ( ER ) - beta in breast cancer may be explained by contribution of isoforms , of which five exist .
population	Our aim was to elucidate the prognostic significance of ERbeta1 , ERbeta2 , and ERbeta5 by immunohistochemistry in a large cohort of breast carcinomas with long-term follow-up .
intervention	Tissue microarrays were stained with ERbeta1 , ERbeta2 , and ERbeta5 antibodies and scored as percentage of positive tumor cells and using the Allred system .
other	Nuclear and cytoplasmic staining was evaluated and correlated with histopathologic characteristics , overall survival ( OS ) , and disease-free survival ( DFS ) .
outcome	Nuclear ERbeta2 and ERbeta5 , but not ERbeta1 , significantly correlated with OS ( P = 0.006 , P = 0.039 , and P = 0.099 , respectively ) , and ERbeta2 additionally with DFS ( P = 0.013 ) .
outcome	ERbeta2 also predicted response to endocrine therapy ( P = 0.036 ) ; correlated positively with ERalpha , progesterone receptor , androgen receptor , and BRCA1 ; and correlated inversely with metastasis and vascular invasion .
outcome	Tumors coexpressing ERbeta2 and ERalpha had better OS and DFS .
outcome	Cytoplasmic ERbeta2 expression , alone or combined with nuclear staining , predicted significantly worse OS .
outcome	Notably , patients with only cytoplasmic ERbeta2 expression had significantly worse outcome ( P = 0.0014 ) .
outcome	This is the first study elucidating the prognostic role of ERbeta1 , ERbeta2 , and ERbeta5 in a large breast cancer series .
outcome	ERbeta2 is a powerful prognostic indicator in breast cancer , but nuclear and cytoplasmic expression differentially affect outcome .
outcome	Measuring these in clinical breast cancer could provide a more comprehensive picture of patient outcome , complementing ERalpha .

###15600379
background	Recurrent depression poses a problem for up to 80 % of patients with major depressive disorder ( MDD ) during their lifetime .
background	Therefore , the optimal treatment goal established by the American Psychiatric Association and the Agency for Health Care Policy and Research is remission and virtual elimination of symptoms .
background	Patients who have a high risk of recurrence often require maintenance therapy and long-term treatment .
background	As a result , identification of antidepressants that are effective in maintaining remission in patients over the long-term and have acceptable tolerability profiles is important .
background	The efficacy of antidepressants in conferring full remission and long-term recovery is an important priority for clinicians .
other	Both selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors ( SSRIs ) and serotonin-norepinephrine reuptake inhibitors ( SNRIs ) have been examined for use in long-term treatment of MDD .
intervention	Recently , 2 long-term ( 6 to 12 months ) , double-blind , placebo-controlled studies have shown that venlafaxine is effective in preventing relapse and recurrence .
outcome	While long-term , head-to-head studies comparing SNRIs with SSRIs are rare , a recent open-label study compared venlafaxine to 4 SSRIs ( fluoxetine , paroxetine , sertraline , or citalopram ) in outpatients with MDD .
outcome	The results show that the SNRI venlafaxine is comparable to the SSRIs in terms of remission rates , and venlafaxine may bring patients to remission earlier than SSRIs .
outcome	Long-term treatment at maximally tolerated doses is also associated with similar incidence of common adverse events between venlafaxine and placebo and tolerability comparable to SSRIs .
outcome	Thus , there is increasing evidence that venlafaxine and SSRIs are effective and well tolerated in long-term therapy .
outcome	While it is unclear from the data if continued treatment with SNRIs confers advantages over SSRIs due to an early onset of remission , further studies will provide valuable insights into the efficacy of SNRIs and SSRIs in maintenance therapy .

###9316058
background	This is the first report of delayed cervical epidural hemorrhage caused by an onlay silastic graft placed over the dura after laminectomy .
background	There are several reports of intracranial hemorrhage associated with silastic implants in the literature .
background	A 49-year-old woman suddenly developed severe neck pain and quadriplegia during sexual intercourse .
background	A C5-C7 laminectomy had been performed 17 years earlier for cervical stenosis .
intervention	Magnetic resonance imaging showed an epidural mass compressing the cord at the level of the previous laminectomy .
intervention	Laminectomy was performed within 5 hours of symptom onset .
intervention	Postoperatively , the patient regained leg strength .
intervention	After 2 months of physical therapy , she had minimal residual leg rigidity and returned to work .
other	At surgery , the cervical cord was compressed by a solid fibrous scar surrounding a silastic onlay graft and the dura .
other	An epidural hematoma was beneath the silastic implant .
other	The dense scar tissue , hematoma , and silastic implant were removed .
outcome	Bleeding associated with silastic sheets starts with movement of this nonadherent implant .
outcome	The movement disrupts the underlying fine vessels on the surface of an encasing connective tissue membrane .
outcome	Overgrowth of this membrane can cause mass effect and simulate a tumor , even without associated bleeding , within weeks .
outcome	Delayed hemorrhage is more common .
outcome	We recommend removal of these implants electively , especially if a thick membrane surrounding the dura is detected with postcontrast-enhanced magnetic resonance imaging .

###18766106
background	To determine whether persistent metabolic dysfunction in normal-appearing frontal lobe tissue is correlated with long-term tissue atrophy .
study design	Prospective monitoring with retrospective data analysis .
other	Single-center academic neurointensive care unit .
population	Fifteen patients with moderate to severe traumatic brain injury ( Glasgow Coma Scale score 3-12 ) .
other	None .
other	Hourly cerebral microdialysis was performed for the initial 96 hrs after trauma to determine extracellular levels of glucose , glutamate , glycerol , lactate , and pyruvate in normal appearing frontal lobes .
outcome	Six months after injury , the anatomical outcome was assessed by measures of global and regional cerebral atrophy using volumetric brain magnetic resonance imaging .
outcome	The lactate/pyruvate ratio was elevated > 40 after traumatic brain injury in most patients , with a mean percent time of 32 + / - 29 % of hours monitored .
outcome	At 6 months after traumatic brain injury , there was a mean frontal lobe atrophy of 12 + / - 11 % and global brain atrophy of 8.5 + / - 4.5 % .
outcome	The percentage of time of elevated lactate/pyruvate ratio correlated with the extent of frontal lobe brain atrophy ( r = -.56 , p < 0.01 ) , but not global brain atrophy ( r = -.31 , p = 0.20 ) .
outcome	The predictive effect of lactate/pyruvate ratio was independent of patient age , Glasgow Coma Scale score , and volume of frontal lobe contusion .
outcome	Persistent metabolic crisis , as reflected by an elevated lactate/pyruvate ratio , in normal appearing posttraumatic frontal lobe , is predictive of the degree of tissue atrophy at 6 months .

###9747834
background	To investigate efficacy of three single dose radiation therapy ( RT ) regimens in the treatment of painful bone metastasis .
intervention	Patient self-assessment by using pain chart enabled evaluation of response to treatment that consisted of either one of the three single fractions of 4 Gy ( group I ; n = 109 ) , 6 Gy ( group II ; n = 108 ) , or 8 Gy ( group III ; n = 110 ) .
outcome	Patients in groups II and III had higher complete response rate than those in group I , but not significantly , and with no difference between group II and III .
outcome	However , both patients in group II ( 73 % ) and group III ( 78 % ) had significantly higher overall response rates when compared to those observed in group I ( 59 % ) ( I vs II , p = 0.025 ; I vs III , p = 0.0019 ) , and with no difference between groups II and III ( p = 0.39 )
outcome	Patients in group III had shortest time to the occurrence of any pain relief which was significantly better than those observed in group I ( Welch 's t-test , p = 0.012 ) , with no difference between group I and II and group II and III , respectively .
outcome	There was no difference between the three treatment groups in duration of response and retreatment rate .
outcome	No effect of histology or metastatic site treated was found .
outcome	No pathological fractures or spinal cord compressions were observed during the 8 weeks post-RT .
outcome	Results of this study seem to confirm that 8 Gy could be considered as probably `` lowest '' optimal single fraction RT in the treatment of painful bone metastasis , although single fraction RT of 4 Gy should not be easily discarded due to its applic
outcome	Since single fraction RT of 6 Gy achieved results not different from that obtained with 8 Gy , further studies are warranted in order to get more informations about `` lowest '' optimal single fraction RT in the treatment of painful bone metastasis .

###12448387
background	Obesity is now one of our major public health problems .
background	Effective and acceptable treatment options are needed .
background	The Lap-Band system is placed laparoscopically and allows adjustment of the level of gastric restriction .
population	A prospective study of 709 severely obese patients was conducted over a 6-year period at a university-based multidisciplinary referral center .
intervention	After extensive preoperative evaluation , patients with a body mass index > 35 were treated by Lap-Band placement .
other	Close follow-up with progressive adjustment of gastric restriction continued permanently .
other	Medical co-morbidities were monitored as part of comprehensive prospective data collection .
outcome	There have been no deaths perioperatively or during follow-up .
outcome	Significant perioperative adverse events occurred in 1.2 % only .
outcome	Reoperation has been needed for prolapse ( slippage ) in 12.5 % , erosion of the band into the stomach in 2.8 % and for tubing breaks in 3.6 % .
outcome	A steady progression of weight loss has occurred through the duration of the study with 52 + / - 19 % EWL at 24 months ( n = 333 ) , 53 + / - 22 % EWL at 36 months ( n = 264 ) , 52 + / - 24 % EWL at 48 months ( n = 108 ) , 54 + / - 24 % EWL at 60 months ( n = 30 ) , and 57 + / - 1
outcome	Major improvements have occurred in diabetes , asthma , gastroesophageal reflux , dyslipidemia , sleep apnea and depression .
outcome	Quality of life as measured by Rand SF-36 shows highly significant improvement .
outcome	Placement of the Lap-Band system provides safe and effective control of severe obesity .
outcome	The effect on weight loss is durable and is associated with major improvement in health and quality of life .
outcome	It has the potential to provide a broadly acceptable option for this common and serious disease .

background	A program of transitional ( or subacute ) care at Ontario 's Mississauga Hospital has been shown to fill this gap in the continuum of care by improving the functional level of frail elders and ensuring better bed utilization .

###8927414
population	Our experience with intracavernous injection of prostaglandin E1 in spinal cord injured patients with neurogenic erectile dysfunction included 15 men .
outcome	They received testing dosage starting from 5 micrograms with increasing dosage ( maximum 20 micrograms ) to achieve a rigid erection of Schramek 's grade 5 and lasting for at least 20 min .
outcome	All of them had achieved functional erection adequate for coitus after treatment except one patient who had been proved to have venogenic impotence .
outcome	We found that intracavernous injection of prostaglandin E1 had significantly improved the erectile condition .
outcome	No systemic side effect or any other complication was noted except that pain at the injection site was complained of in two patients with incomplete lesion .

###7110507
population	The effects of single oral administrations of tricyclic antidepressants ( imipramine and desipramine ) , an atypical antidepressant ( nomifensine ) , known anorexic agents , haloperidol , and diazepam on food intake were compared in Sprague-Dawley rats over a 4-d

outcome	In contrast , the anorexic agents ( d-amphetamine , cocaine , mazindol , fenfluramine and quipazine ) , and nomifensine , and haloperidol produced decreases in food intake only on their administration .
outcome	Diazepam produced an increase in food intake only on the day of its decrease food intake , this model appears to show some specificity for tricyclic antidepressants .

###15637647
background	Approximately 10 % of patients with cancer develop brain metastases .
background	Although usually appearing late in the course of the disease , the brain metastasis may be present before the primary cancer has been identified and may present as a single lesion or as multiple lesions .
background	The diagnostic and therapeutic approach depends on the number and location of brain lesions and the stage of the cancer .
background	Patients with brain metastases are rarely cured .
background	However , appropriate treatment can improve both the quality and duration of the patient 's life .
background	Treatment must be directed not only at the brain metastasis ( definitive care ) , but also at a multitude of other symptoms that plague patients with cancer and brain metastases ( supportive care ) .
outcome	Judicious selection of pharmacological agents can effectively treat many serious symptoms in patients with brain metastases , but injudicious selection of pharmacological agents , through side effects , may make the patients ' quality of life worse .
outcome	This article reviews some aspects of both definitive and supportive care with particular attention to the side effects of some commonly used pharmacological agents .

study design	This case study does not provide comprehensive information on current diagnosis and ADHD treatment guidelines , but explores the issues and management role of general practitioners treating patients with ADHD .

outcome	When the specialist formulation suggests there is little to gain from further treatment , the GP is likely to be the sole health professional remaining engaged in support and ongoing management .

###11792611
background	The `` Standards , Options and Recommendations '' ( SOR ) project , started in 1993 , is a collaboration between the French National Federation of Comprehensive Cancer Centers ( FNCLCC ) , the 20 French Cancer Centers and specialists from French Public Univ
background	The main objective is the development of clinical practice guidelines to improve the quality of health care and outcome of cancer patients .
background	The methodology is based on literature review and critical appraisal by a multidisciplinary group of experts , with feedback from specialists in cancer care delivery .
population	To define , according to the definitions of the Standards , Options and Recommendations project , the characteristics of the main tumor markers in colorectal cancer and their potential role in the management of patients with this malignancy .
other	Data were identified by searching Medline and the personal reference lists of members of the expert groups .
other	Once the guidelines were defined , the document was submitted for review to 117 independent reviewers , and to the medical committees of the 20 French Cancer Centers .
outcome	The main recommendations for the tumor markers in colorectal cancer are : 1 ) The carcinoembryonic antigen ( CEA ) is the reference serum marker ( standard ) .
outcome	2 ) All the analyses for a given patient must be performed in the same laboratory , using the same technique ( standard , expert agreement ) .
outcome	3 ) CEA or CA 19-9 should not be used for screening or diagnosis ( standard , level of evidence B2 ) .
other	4 )
outcome	High initial serum concentration of CEA is of bad predictive value ( standard , level of evidence C ) .
outcome	CEA is an independent prognostic factor of survival in colorectal cancers with lymph node metastases ( standard , level of evidence B2 ) .
outcome	5 ) CEA is the most sensitive biological parameter for the screening of hepatic metastases ( standard , level of evidence B2 ) .
outcome	6 ) CEA serum concentration before palliative chemotherapy is an independent prognostic factor of survival ( standard , level of evidence B2 ) .
outcome	The combination of CEA assay with imagery techniques and clinical examination can help monitor the response to palliative chemotherapy ( standard ) , in particular in non measurable disease ( standard , expert agreement ) .
outcome	7 ) In 65 % of the cases , CEA is the first indicator of relapse ( standard , level of evidence B2 ) .
outcome	CEA is the choice marker for monitoring patients with colorectal cancer ( standard , level of evidence B2 ) .
other	8 )
outcome	A sustained biological follow-up including CEA assay can be used to predict the operability of recurring tumors ( standard , level of evidence B2 ) .
outcome	Nevertheless , no survival advantage has been shown ( standard ) .

###10486193
background	This study was undertaken to determine if an AMPA ( LY215490 ) or an NMDA ( MK-801 ) glutamatergic receptor antagonist can reduce urinary tract dysfunctions related to detrusor hyperreflexia and detrusor-sphincter dyssynergia in awake , spinal cord-injured ( SC
population	Experiments were performed on female Sprague-Dawley rats in which the spinal cord was completely transected at T ( 8-10 ) level , 2-3 weeks prior to performing an intravesical continuous infusion cystometrogram ( CMG ) .
other	Bladder volume threshold ( VT ) for inducing voiding and voiding efficiency ( VE ) were determined by measuring voided volumes and residual volumes ( RV ) .
intervention	After control CMGs were performed , cumulative intravenous doses of LY215490 ( 0.1 , 1 , and 10 mg/kg ) or MK-801 ( 0.03 , 0.3 , and 3 mg/kg ) were administered at 120-min intervals .
outcome	03 and 0.3 mg/kg ) did not affect any parameters .
outcome	A large dose ( 10 mg/kg ) of LY215490 decreased maximal voiding pressure ( MVP ) by 27 % and increased RV by 119 % and VT by 58 % but did not decrease VE .
outcome	The highest cumulative dose ( 3 mg/kg ) of MK-801 significantly increased RV by 134 % and VT by 44 % and markedly decreased VE by 60 % and MVP by 18 % .
outcome	The effects of LY215490 to reduce MVP and increase VT without changing VE suggest that an AMPA receptor antagonist might be useful in treating detrusor-sphincter dyssynergia and bladder hypertrophy after SCI .
outcome	The effect of MK-801 to markedly reduce VE indicates that NMDA receptor antagonists may exacerbate neurogenic bladder dysfunction in SCI patients .

###8816635
background	To present a successful outcome of an IVF cycle complicated by failure to produce a sperm sample on the morning of oocyte retrieval .
study design	Case report .
other	Hospital-based IVF clinic .
population	A couple suffering secondary infertility undergoing their first IVF and intracytoplasmic sperm injection ( ICSI ) cycle .
intervention	Fine-needle testicular biopsy for sperm retrieval .
other	Sperm retrieval , fertilization , pregnancy .
outcome	Sufficient spermatozoa were obtained for ICSI .
outcome	Ten metaphase II oocytes were injected with two embryos being transferred fresh and four cryopreserved .
outcome	A single fetal heart was confirmed at 6-week sonar .
outcome	Testicular aspiration of sperm for ICSI is a simple , inexpensive , and effective means of rescuing an IVF cycle in which the male partner unexpectedly has been unable to produce a sperm sample on the morning of oocyte collection .

###17632393
study design	A retrospective review .
other	The purpose of this study is to document a series of cases of neurologic deficit following percutaneous vertebral stabilization , to identify patterns of neurologic injury , and to describe potential methods for avoiding these injuries .
background	Percutaneous vertebral stabilization procedures , including vertebroplasty and kyphoplasty , have become a widely used for the treatment of osteoporotic vertebral compression fractures , primary and metastatic vertebral tumors , and traumatic burst fractures .
background	Despite an increasing array of indications , there have been few reports of adverse events .
background	Neurologic complications associated with vertebroplasty and kyphoplasty have been described previously as case reports and have generally been considered as infrequent and minor in severity .
population	The clinical course of 14 patients with documented loss of neurologic function following percutaneous vertebral cement augmentation was retrospectively reviewed .
other	The average patient age was 74.9 years ( range , 46-88 years ) with 3 male and 11 female patients .
outcome	Four patients underwent a vertebroplasty procedure while 10 were treated with kyphoplasty .
outcome	Six patients developed neurologic deficits acutely ( < 24 hours of procedure ) .
outcome	The remaining 8 patients developed neurologic symptoms at an average of 37.1 days ( range , 3-112 days ) postprocedure .
outcome	Neurologic deficits were recorded as ASIA A in 4 patients , ASIA B in 2 patients , ASIA C in 1 patient , and ASIA D in 7 patients .
outcome	Twelve of 14 patients ( 85.7 % ) required revision open surgical intervention for treatment of their neurologic injury .
outcome	Percutaneous vertebroplasty and kyphoplasty have been reported to be safe options for the treatment of painful osteoporotic vertebral fractures .
outcome	Although complications are infrequent , there remains the potential for catastrophic neurologic injury .
outcome	Physicians performing these procedures need to be aware of these potential complications and be prepared to respond in an emergent manner ( surgically ) if a need arises .

###11575593
population	The contribution of the striatum to category learning was examined by having patients with Parkinson 's disease ( PD ) and matched controls solve categorization problems in which the optimal rule was linear or nonlinear using the perceptual categorization ta
other	Traditional accuracy-based analyses , as well as quantitative model-based analyses were performed .
background	Unlike accuracy-based analyses , the model-based analyses allow one to quantify and separate the effects of categorization rule learning from variability in the trial-by-trial application of the participant 's rule .
outcome	When the categorization rule was linear , PD patients showed no accuracy , categorization rule learning , or rule application variability deficits .
outcome	Categorization accuracy for the PD patients was associated with their performance on a test believed to be sensitive to frontal lobe functioning .
outcome	In contrast , when the categorization rule was nonlinear , the PD patients showed accuracy , categorization rule learning , and rule application variability deficits .
outcome	Furthermore , categorization accuracy was not associated with performance on the test of frontal lobe functioning .
outcome	Implications for neuropsychological theories of categorization learning are discussed .

###17335974
background	Neuropathic pain after spinal cord injury is not well understood and is difficult to treat .
background	One possible cause is mismatch between motor commands and sensory feedback .
population	This two-part study in five paraplegic patients investigated whether a visual illusion aimed to correct this mismatch reduces pain .
intervention	In study 1 , patients undertook three conditions : ( i ) virtual walking : with a mirror placed in front of a screen , patients aligned their own upper body with a film of a lower body walking .
intervention	Patients imagined walking and ` watched themselves ' walk ; ( ii ) guided imagery ; ( iii ) watching a film .
other	One patient withdrew from virtual walking because of distress .
outcome	For all patients , the mean ( 95 % CI ) decrease in pain ( 100 mm VAS ) was 42 mm ( approximately 65 % ) ( 11-73 mm ) for virtual walking , 18 mm ( 4-31 mm ) for guided imagery and 4mm ( -3 to 11 mm ) for watching the film .
outcome	Mean ( 95 % CI ) time to return to pre-task pain was 34.9 min ( 20.1-49 .8 min ) for virtual walking ; 13.9 min ( -0.9 to 28.8 min ) for the guided imagery and 16.3 min ( 1.5-31 .2 min ) for the film .
outcome	To investigate its clinical utility , four patients underwent virtual walking every weekday for 3 weeks .
outcome	Mean ( 95 % CI ) decrease in pain was 53 mm ( 45-61 mm ) at post training and 43 mm ( 27-58 mm ) at 3-month follow-up .
outcome	Virtual walking may be a viable treatment for pain after spinal cord injury .
outcome	A clinical trial seems warranted .

###17550722
background	To observe the effect and safety of one-stage single balloon multiple expansions percutaneous kyphoplasty ( PKP ) in treatment of osteoporotic vertebral compressive fracture ( OVCF ) and spinal tumor .
population	One-stage single balloon multiple expansions PKP was performed on 18 patients , 5 males and 13 females , aged 68.77 ( 44 - 80 ) , with 45 vertebrae , including 11 case of OVCF ( with 29 diseased vertebrae ) , 11 cases of multiple vertebral fracture ( with 19 diseas
other	Pain relief and functional recovery were evaluated with visual analogue pain scale ( VAS ) and Oswestry disability index ( ODI ) scaling , and restoration of vertebral height and Cobb angle were evaluated by X-ray examination .
other	Follow-up was conducted by telephone survey or clinic consults for 12.3 months ( 6 - 18 months ) .
outcome	Operation was successfully performed on all patients with an operative time of 29.3 min ( 55 - 127 min ) per vertebra .
outcome	The average pressure of the balloon expansion was 165 Psi ( 87 - 210 Psi ) , and the average balloon expanded volume was 3.25 ml ( 1.5 - 4 ml ) .
outcome	A balloon was expanded 2 approximately 5 times in one operation with the average of 2.94 expanded times .
outcome	The bone cement volume injected was 3.95 ml ( 2 - 8.5 ml ) per vertebra .
outcome	Epidural cement leakage was seen in 1 vertebra in 1 case and paraspinal leakage was seen in two vertebrae in 1 case .
outcome	The VAS and ODI scoring of these patients were both decreased significantly after operation .
outcome	Both the anterior height and midline height of vertebrae were significantly improved .
outcome	The pain relief and functional recovery were substantial and maintained to the last follow-up without any re-collapse or adjacent level fracture .
outcome	one-stage single balloon multiple expansions PKP is effective , economic and safe in treatment of multi-level OVCF and spinal tumor .

###15341593
background	Functional recovery after large excision of dorsal roots is absent because of both the limited regeneration capacity of the transected root , and the inability of regenerating sensory fibers to traverse the dorsal root entry zone .
population	In this study , bioresorbable guidance conduits were used to repair 6-mm dorsal root lesion gaps in rats , while neurotrophin-encoding adenoviruses were used to elicit regeneration into the spinal cord .
intervention	Polyester conduits with or without microfilament bundles were implanted between the transected ends of lumbar dorsal roots .
intervention	Four weeks later , adenoviruses encoding NGF or GFP were injected into the spinal cord along the entry zone of the damaged dorsal roots .
outcome	Eight weeks after injury , nerve regeneration was observed through both types of implants , but those containing microfilaments supported more robust regeneration of calcitonin gene-related peptide ( CGRP ) - positive nociceptive axons .
outcome	NGF overexpression induced extensive regeneration of CGRP ( + ) fibers into the spinal cord from implants showing nerve repair .
outcome	Animals that received conduits containing microfilaments combined with spinal NGF virus injections showed the greatest recovery in nociceptive function , approaching a normal level by 7-8 weeks .
outcome	This recovery was reversed by recutting the dorsal root through the centre of the conduit , demonstrating that regeneration through the implant , and not sprouting of intact spinal fibers , restored sensory function .
outcome	This study demonstrates that a combination of PNS guidance conduits and CNS neurotrophin therapy can promote regeneration and restoration of sensory function after severe dorsal root injury .

###10534603
population	In the present study , chronic constrictive injury ( CCI model ) of the sciatic nerve or tight ligation of L5 and L6 spinal nerves ( Chung model ) produced both dynamic and static components of mechanical allodynia in rats .
intervention	The two responses were detected , respectively , by lightly stroking the hind paw with cotton wool or application of pressure using von Frey hairs .
outcome	Animals with spinal nerve ligation developed both types of responses at a faster rate compared to animals with the CCI .
outcome	Morphine ( 1-3 mg/kg , s.c. ) dose-dependently blocked static but not dynamic allodynia .
outcome	In contrast , pregabalin ( previously S-isobutylgaba and CI-1008 ) dose-dependently ( 3-30 mg/kg , p.o. ) blocked both types of allodynia .
outcome	In CCI animals , two administrations of capsaicin ( 100 microg/50 microl ) into the plantar surface of the ipsilateral paw at 1-h intervals blocked the maintenance of thermal hyperalgesia without affecting either static or dynamic allodynia .
outcome	The similar administration of a further two doses of capsaicin into the same animals blocked the maintenance of static allodynia without affecting the dynamic response .
outcome	These data indicate that thermal hyperalgesia , static and dynamic allodynia are respectively signalled by C - , Adelta - and Abeta/capsaicin insensitive Adelta - primary sensory neurones .
outcome	It is suggested that pregabalin possesses a superior antiallodynic profile than morphine and may represent a novel class of therapeutic agents for the treatment of neuropathic pain .

###11478593
population	To examine the effects of altering the fatty acid ( FA ) composition of intravenous ( IV ) lipid emulsions on pulmonary vascular resistance ( PVR ) and thromboxane production , we studied three groups of newborn piglets after three days of either sow 's milk ( mil
outcome	At baseline , and during hypoxia at 20 min and 2 h , cardiac output ( Q ) was measured , PVR calculated and plasma levels of a prostacyclin metabolite ( 6-keto-PgF1alpha ) and thromboxane B2 ( TxB2 ) were measured .

outcome	There was an exaggerated increase in PVR and decrease in Q during prolonged hypoxia in the TPN-SBO group as compared with the other two groups .
outcome	There was no difference in PVR and Q between the milk and TPN-FO groups .
outcome	FA of lung phospholipids reflected the high dietary level of long chain n-3 FA in the TPN-FO group .
outcome	However , no differences in plasma levels of 6-keto-PgF1alpha or TxB2 were found .
outcome	Intravenous emulsions made from SBO reduced cardiac output and increased pulmonary vascular resistance in the hypoxic newborn piglet , whereas iv FO emulsions did not .
outcome	When subjects with pulmonary hypertension are receiving TPN iv SBO may be detrimental ; iv FO may be beneficial , giving similar responses as in a milk-fed subject .

###12025959
background	There are two bradykinin receptor subtypes , designated B1 and B2 .
background	Whilst both have been implicated in nociception , it is believed that there is a low level of constitutive expression of B1 receptors and that their expression is induced by inflammation or tissue damage .
