outcome	In control animals without paw inflammation , B9858 had no effect .
outcome	These findings are consistent with other evidence that peptide B1 receptor antagonists inhibit spinal nociceptive reflexes only after induction of B1 receptors by inflammation and support the potential therapeutic utility of B1 receptor antagonists as ana

###15024399
background	Epidemiological studies suggest that adiposity in children may be associated with a reduced level of physical activity .
background	Children with Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder ( ADHD ) are physically hyperactive as of early childhood and have been shown to exhibit higher levels of motor activity than normal .
population	The aim of our study was to assess if the prevalence of overweight and obesity is lower in a population of boys with ADHD in comparison with the German healthy male reference population of the same age .
other	Patients were investigated from 1999 until 2001 upon referral to the inpatient and outpatient unit of the Department of Child and Adolescent Psychiatry of the University of Aachen .
population	A total of 97 male patients ( mean age 10 + / -2 y ) with a diagnosis of ADHD according the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders ( DSM-IV ) , who were free of potentially orexigenic medication and who had no further comorbid diagnosis apart from
other	BMI standard deviation scores ( BMI-SDS ) were calculated and compared to age-adapted reference value of the German population .
outcome	Patients ' mean BMI-SDS was significantly higher than the age-adapted reference values of the German population ( P = 0.038 ) .
outcome	Our sample included significantly more subjects than expected with a BMI > or = 90th percentile ( 19.6 % , P < 0.001 ) and > or = 97th percentile ( 7.2 % , P = 0.007 ) .
outcome	Surprisingly , being ` hyperactive ' in the sense of the DSM-IV diagnosis of ADHD does not prevent the development or persistence of overweight and obesity in children .
outcome	The examination of these children might be a helpful approach in the investigation of the relationship between obesity and its contributing psychological and behavioural factors .

###11160435
background	Recovery of urinary tract function after spinal cord injury ( SCI ) is important in its own right and may also serve as a model for studying mechanisms of functional recovery after injury in the CNS .
background	Normal micturition requires coordinated activation of smooth muscle of the bladder ( detrusor ) and striated muscle of the external urethral sphincter ( EUS ) that is controlled by spinal and supraspinal circuitry .
population	We used a clinically relevant rat model of thoracic spinal cord contusion injury to examine the effect of varying the degree of residual supraspinal connections on chronic detrusor-EUS coordination .
outcome	Urodynamic evaluation at 8 weeks after SCI showed that detrusor contractions of the bladder recovered similarly in groups of rats injured with a 10 gm weight dropped 12.5 , 25 , or 50 mm onto the spinal cord .
outcome	In contrast , the degree of coordinated activation of the EUS varied with the severity of initial injury and the degree of preservation of white matter at the injury site .
outcome	The 12.5 mm SCI resulted in the sparing of 20 % of the white matter at the injury site and complete recovery of detrusor-EUS coordination .
outcome	In more severely injured rats , the chronic recovery of detrusor-EUS coordination was very incomplete and correlated to decreased innervation of lower motoneurons by descending control pathways and their increased levels of mRNA for glutamate receptor subu
outcome	These results show that the extent of recovery of detrusor-EUS coordination depends on injury severity and the degree of residual connections with brainstem control centers .

###19284667
background	The aim of the study was to evaluate factors influencing quality of life ( QOL ) in Moroccan postmenopausal women with osteoporotic vertebral fracture assessed by the Arabic version of ECOS 16 questionnaire .
population	357 postmenopausal women were included in this study .
other	The participants underwent bone mineral density ( BMD ) measurements by DXA of the lumbar spine and the total hip as well as X-ray examination of the thoraco-lumbar spine to identify subclinical vertebral fractures .
other	Patients were asked to complete a questionnaire on clinical and sociodemographic parameters , and osteoporosis risk factors .
other	The Arabic version of the ECOS16 ( Assessment of health related quality of life in osteoporosis questionnaire ) was used to assess quality of life .
other	The mean age was 58 + / - 7.8 years , and the mean BMI was 28.3 + / - 4.8 kg/m2 .
other	One hundred and eight women ( 30.1 % ) were osteoporotic and 46.7 % had vertebral fractures .
other	Most were categorized as Grade1 ( 75 % ) .
outcome	Three independent factors were associated with a poor quality of life : low educational level ( p = 0,01 ) , vertebral fracture ( p = 0,03 ) , and history of peripheral fracture ( p = 0,006 ) .
outcome	Worse QOL was observed in the group with vertebral fracture in all domains except `` pain '' : Physical functioning ( p = 0,002 ) ; Fear of illness ( p = 0,001 ) ; and Psychosocial functioning ( p = 0,007 ) .
outcome	The number of fractures was a determinant of a low QOL , as indicated by an increased score in physical functioning ( p = 0,01 ) , fear of illness ( p = 0,007 ) , and total score ( p = 0,01 ) after adjusting on age and educational level .
outcome	Patients with higher Genant score had low QOL in these two domains too ( p = 0,002 ; p = 0,001 respectively ) , and in the total score ( p = 0,01 ) after adjusting on age and educational level .
outcome	Our current data showed that the quality of life assessed by the Arabic version of the ECOS 16 questionnaire is decreased in post menopausal women with prevalent vertebral fractures , with the increasing number and the severity of vertebral fractures .

###15065383
background	At the beginning of 1995 Israel implemented a health reform .
background	A new National Health Insurance Law came into effect , mandating compulsory health insurance for all Israeli citizens .
background	However , while the individual 's right to health services is grounded in law , the basket of services provided under this law includes no components that can contribute to oral health of the population .
background	The country 's oral health system has always had minimal government involvement and relies largely on private funding .
background	As such , it can serve as an appropriate model for observing the impact of such policy on economically weak population groups , and on the extent of system equity .
background	The research goals were to examine gaps among various populations in service accessibility , knowledge and attitudes , preventive health behaviors , and perceived health within this unique oral healthcare system .
population	The study population consisted of residents of Israel aged 22 + and living in the community -- approximately 4.5 million persons .
outcome	The data were gathered through telephone interviews based on a random sampling of the computerized telephone directory of Israel 's domestic telephone company .
outcome	The response rate was 82 % , with 1,067 respondents representing the adult population of Israel .
outcome	The current study found significant gaps among income groups for knowledge , attitudes , preventive oral-health behaviors and perceived oral-health .
outcome	The findings can serve as a red flag for over-reliance on private funding in the health system , and may indicate the need for rethinking about the current oral healthcare policy in Israel .

###17211783
background	The aim of this study was to evaluate the evidence supporting the use of extracorporeal membrane oxygenation ( ECMO ) in infants with congenital diaphragmatic hernia ( CDH ) and severe respiratory failure .
other	Medline , Embase , ISI Current Contents and Biosis databases were searched using a defined strategy .
other	Case reports and opinion articles were excluded .
study design	We performed : 1 ) a systematic review of non randomised studies comparing mortality when ECMO was not available with a period when ECMO was available .
other	Mortality was classified as `` early '' ( before hospital discharge ) and `` late '' ( after discharge ) .
other	Patients were classified as `` ECMO '' and `` non-ECMO '' candidates according to criteria reported by the authors ; 2 ) a meta-analysis of randomised controlled trials ( RCTs ) comparing ECMO and conventional mechanical ventilation ( CMV ) .
other	Differences in mortality are reported as relative risk ( RR ) and 95 % confidence intervals .
outcome	A ) SYSTEMATIC REVIEW : 658 studies and 21 ( 2043 patients ) fulfilled the entry criteria .
outcome	Both early ( RR 0.60 [ 0.51-0 .70 ] ; p < 0.001 ) and late mortality ( RR 0.63 [ 0.53-0 .73 ] ; p < 0.001 ) were significantly lower when ECMO was available than when ECMO was unavailable .
outcome	This difference in mortality was observed in `` ECMO candidates '' ( RR 0.46 [ 0.32-0 .68 ] ; p < 0.001 ) but not in `` non-ECMO candidates '' ( RR 0.80 [ 0.58-1 .10 ] ; p = 0.17 ) .
outcome	B ) META-ANALYSIS : 3 trials comparing ECMO and conventional ventilation were identified which included 39 infants with CDH .
outcome	The early mortality was significantly lower with ECMO compared to CMV ( RR 0.73 [ 95 % CI 0.55-0 .99 ] ; p < 0.04 ) , however , late mortality was similar in the two groups ( RR 0.83 [ 0.66-1 .05 ] ; p = 0.12 ) .
outcome	Non randomised studies suggest a reduction in mortality with ECMO .
outcome	However , differences in the indications for ECMO and improvements in other treatment modalities may contribute to this reduction .
outcome	The meta-analysis of RCTs indicates a reduction in early mortality with ECMO but no long-term benefit .
outcome	A large RCT in infants with CDH and severe respiratory failure is warranted .

###12043753
background	Although there has been an increased interest in health care delivery for rural community populations , concerns remain regarding the lack of access to primary health care and specialty services ( such as palliative care ) , particularly in rural areas that a
other	This survey was conducted to examine the perceptions of palliative care services in rural communities and toward identifying perceived barriers that interfere with accessing palliative care services .
population	In conducting the study , personnel from various disciplines throughout the Community Cancer Care ( CCC ) network ( the largest private provider of oncology services in Indiana ) completed a survey that assessed their perceptions of the strengths and weaknesse
outcome	These responses , which indicate discrepancies in perceptions among staff within sites , suggest problems of integration of palliative care in given locations .
outcome	Results revealed three particularly problematic areas : accessing pain control , accessing psychological or psychiatric services or both , and overcoming barriers to hospice care .
outcome	Although no significant differences were found for any variables between MU and adequately medically served ( AMS ) areas , in general palliative care is limited and unintegrated into oncology care .
outcome	Confusion among staff at a particular oncology program likely contributes to the haphazard delivery and poor integration of palliative care .
outcome	Conclusions are tempered by important study limitations but the results suggest the need for programs that improve delivery of palliative care in rural Indiana .

outcome	Spinal cord stimulation provided effective therapy for refractory ischemic pain , even after failed sympathectomy .

background	There have been only a few investigational reports of sleep apnea syndrome ( SAS ) in patients with rheumatoid arthritis ( RA ) , although it may not be a rare condition and may be life-threatening occasionally .

other	The mean values of ramal height ( RH ) of the normal material ( we studied in Japanese ) are 46.0 mm in males and 38.3 mm in females .
outcome	There were 8 cases of SAS out of the 10 RA patients studied .
outcome	Their mean total apneic episode ( TAE ) was 289.9 mm with a range of 0-611 .
outcome	The mean ratio ( % ) of RH to mean value of the normal material ( % RH ) was 68.8 + / - 22.2 % for all .
outcome	( ABSTRACT TRUNCATED AT 250 WORDS )

###18070313
background	We present a 59-year-old man with a dilated cardiomyopathy ( ejection fraction = 20 % ) , congestive heart failure and atrio-ventricular ( AV ) block who underwent implantation of a biventricular defibrillator ( BiV ICD ) .
background	While undergoing cardiac transplant evaluation for drug-refractory ventricular fibrillation , his telemetry recorded findings resembling crosstalk inhibition .
outcome	Device interrogation was normal .
outcome	All episodes occurred at 1:00 a.m. suggesting a routine device operation .
outcome	Left ventricular capture management , a new feature that automatically measures left ventricular pacing thresholds at 1:00 a.m. , had been programmed to Monitor .
outcome	Understanding this sophisticated pacing algorithm might avoid confusion when operative in patients with AV block .

###8630199
background	Severe pain occurs in 5-30 % of the spinal cord-injured ( SCI ) population and is difficult to treat .
background	Subarachnoid lidocaine has been used in selected patients with some success .
background	Mexiletine , an analog of lidocaine that acts at Na + / K + channels in the peripheral nerve , has been found effective in persons with diabetic dysesthetic neuropathy .
background	The effect of mexiletine in the treatment of spinal cord dysesthetic pain was examined in this study .
population	Fifteen patients were enrolled , and 11 patients completed the prospective , randomized , placebo-controlled , double-blind , crossover design trial .
other	Inclusion/exclusion criteria were carefully defined .
intervention	A 1-wk washout period was followed by a 4-wk drug trial of either mexiletine ( 450 mg/day ) or placebo .
other	This was repeated for the second medication in the second arm of the study .
other	Patients were followed weekly with McGill and visual analog pain scales .
other	Baseline , midpoint , and endpoint Barthel function scores were recorded .
other	The Wilcoxon 's signed-rank test and paired t test were used for statistical analysis .
outcome	Results showed no significant effect of mexiletine on SCI dysesthetic pain scales or Barthel index .
outcome	In conclusion , in this trial , mexiletine did not appear to decrease spinal cord injury-related dysesthetic pain .

###9221411
background	Hormone replacement therapy ( HRT ) in post-menopausal or ovariectomized women reduces mortality due to cardiovascular diseases , lowers morbidity due to osteoporosis and improves vasovagal symptoms .
background	Long-term therapy , however , increase the risk of side-effects .
background	HRT may decrease mammographic sensitivity , markedly increasing glandular density .
background	Enlargement of pre-existing cysts and fibroadenomas has also been reported after HRT .
background	The correlation between HRT and breast cancer is highly controversial .
population	We examined 650 women : 550 of them ( 84.6 % ) received HRT ( 157 estrogens and 393 estrogens-progestins ) and 100 ( 15.4 % ) refused treatment and were thus considered as a control group .
other	All patients underwent mammography and DEXA before HRT and , during treatment , were followed-up yearly with mammography , often combined with US , and DEXA .
other	Fisher 's test was used for data analysis ( confidence interval 95 % ) .
outcome	The statistical analysis showed a significant difference between the HRT group and the control group only for the lumbar spine .
outcome	II ) were shown in 150 of 550 HRT patients .
outcome	Increased breast density was the most frequent finding .
outcome	Benign lesions arising de novo or increasing in size and/or number were observed in 41 of 150 patients ( 27.3 % ) in the HRT group , where 3 breast carcinomas were detected , versus 1 breast cancer only in the control group .
outcome	HRT had a marked positive effect on bone mineral content ( BMC ) at 2 years ' follow-up , but it remains debated if it reduces breast cancer risk .
outcome	In conclusion , our results indicate that a yearly mammography is mandatory in long-term HRT subjects and US may be also needed in particularly dense breasts .

###15028447
other	To determine the incidence and characteristics of prostate cancer in men with spinal cord injury ( SCI ) .
background	Little is known about the characteristics of prostate cancer in men with SCI , because prostate cancer screening is not aggressively performed in this population .
population	In one fiscal year , 648 men with SCI older than age 50 years were actively enrolled with the SCI service , 20,949 able-bodied men older than age 50 years were actively enrolled in the outpatient clinic database , and 945 patients with prostate cancer were i
other	These three databases were cross-referenced for prostate cancer diagnosis and stage and compared with the presence of SCI .
outcome	Of the 648 patients with SCI , 12 patients with a prostate cancer diagnosis that preceded their injury were excluded .
outcome	Of the remaining 636 patients , 11 ( 1.7 % ) had been diagnosed with prostate cancer since their injury .
outcome	In contrast , of the 20,949 able-bodied men older than age 50 years seen at our facility in fiscal year 1999 , 919 ( 4.4 % ) had prostate cancer .
outcome	Of the patients with SCI and prostate cancer , 7 ( 63.6 % ) had locally advanced ( Stage T3 ) or metastatic prostate cancer compared with 267 ( 29.1 % ) in the able-bodied population ( P = 0.012 ) .
outcome	Although the proportion of patients with a prostate cancer diagnosis was greater in the able-bodied patients , the prostate cancer detected in the patients with SCI tended to be of a more advanced stage and grade .
outcome	The difference was likely a result of the decreased use of prostate cancer screening in this population .

###17402851
background	Conventional clinical neuroimaging is insensitive to axonal injury in traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) .
background	Immunocytochemical staining reveals changes to axonal morphology within hours , suggesting potential for diffusion-weighted magnetic resonance ( MR ) in early diagnosis and management of TBI .
background	Diffusion tensor imaging ( DTI ) characterizes the three-dimensional ( 3D ) distribution of water diffusion , which is highly anisotropic in white matter fibers owing to axonal length .
background	Recently , DTI has been used to investigate traumatic axonal injury ( TAI ) , emphasizing regional analysis in more severe TBI .
background	In the current study , we hypothesized that a global white matter ( WM ) analysis of DTI data would be sensitive to TAI across a spectrum of TBI severity and injury to scan interval .
population	To investigate this , we compared WM-only histograms of a scalar , fractional anisotropy ( FA ) , between 20 heterogeneous TBI patients recruited from Detroit Medical Center , including six mild TBI ( GCS 13-15 ) , and 14 healthy age-matched controls .
other	FA histogram parameters were correlated with admission GCS and posttraumatic amnesia ( PTA ) .
outcome	In all cases , including mild TBI , patients ' FA histograms were globally decreased compared with control histograms .
outcome	The shape of the TBI histograms also differed from controls , being more peaked and skewed .
outcome	The mean FA , kurtosis and skewness were highly correlated suggesting a common mechanism .
outcome	FA histogram properties also correlated with injury severity indexed by GCS and PTA , with mean FA being the best predictor and duration of PTA ( r = 0.64 ) being superior to GCS ( r = 0.47 ) .
outcome	Therefore , in this heterogeneous sample , the FA mean accounted for 40 % of the variance in PTA .
outcome	Increased diffusion in the short axis dimension , likely reflecting dysmyelination and swelling of axons , accounted for most of the FA decrease .
outcome	FA is globally deceased in WM , including mild TBI , possibly reflecting widespread involvement .
outcome	FA changes appear to be correlated with injury severity suggesting a role in early diagnosis and prognosis of TBI .

###18640876
background	Percutaneous vertebroplasty has become a favored treatment option for reducing pain in osteoporotic patients with vertebral compression fractures ( VCFs ) .
background	Short-term results are promising , although longer-term complications may arise from accelerated failure of the adjacent vertebral body .
other	To provide a preliminary biomechanical assessment of prophylactic vertebral reinforcement adjacent to vertebroplasty using a three-vertebra cadaveric segment under dynamic loads that represent increasing activity demands .
other	In addition , the effects of reducing the elastic modulus of the cement used in the intact vertebrae were also assessed .
other	STUDY DESIGN/SETTING Three-vertebra cadaveric segments were used to evaluate vertebroplasty with adjacent vertebral reinforcement as an intervention for VCFs .
intervention	Nine human three-vertebra segments ( T12-L2 ) were prepared and a compression fracture was generated in the superior vertebrae .
intervention	Vertebroplasty was performed on the fractured T12 vertebra .
intervention	Subsequently , the adjacent intact L1 vertebra was prophylactically augmented with cement of differing elastic moduli ( 100-12 .5 % modulus of the base cement value ) .
other	After subfailure quasi-static compression tests before and after augmentation , these specimens were subjected to an incrementally increasing dynamic load profile in proportion to patient body weight ( BW ) to assess the fatigue properties of the construct .
other	Quantitative computed tomography assessments were conducted at several stages in the experimental process to evaluate the vertebral condition and quantify the gross dimensions of the segment .
outcome	No significant difference in construct stiffness was found pre - or postaugmentation ( t = 1.4 , p = .19 ) .
outcome	Displacement plots recorded during dynamic loading showed little evidence of fracture under normal physiological loads or moderate activity ( 1-2 .5 x BW ) .
outcome	A third of the specimens continued to endure increasing load demands and were confirmed to have no fracture after testing .
outcome	In six specimens , however , greater loads induced 11 fractures : 7 in the augmented vertebra ( 2xT12 , 5xL5 ) and 4 in the adjacent L2 vertebra .
outcome	A strong correlation was observed between the subsidence in the segmental unit and the incidence of fracture after testing ( r ( Spearman 's ) = -0.88 , p = .002 ) .
outcome	Altering the modulus of cement in the intact vertebra had no effect on level of segmental compromise .
outcome	These preliminary findings suggest that under normal physiological loads associated with moderate physical activity , prophylactic augmentation adjacent to vertebroplasty showed little evidence of inducing fractures , although loads representing more strenu
outcome	Reducing the elastic modulus of the cement in the adjacent intact vertebrae appeared to have no significant effect on the incidence or location of the induced fracture or the overall height loss of the vertebral segment .

###12745711
background	To report the ability of 12 tracheostomized acute rehabilitation hospital inpatients with severely disordered consciousness post-traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) to participate in an objective swallowing assessment .
other	Post hoc analysis of data from a larger , prospective blinded comparison study .
intervention	Methods and procedures : Subjects completed a modified barium swallow ( MBS ) study .
other	Food/drink and tracheostomy tube management recommendations were made .
outcome	All subjects participated successfully during an MBS .
outcome	Post-MBS , 10 subjects began receiving small amounts of food and/or drink .
outcome	Prior to hospital discharge , all subjects received some food and/or drink and were extubated .
outcome	Subjects were deemed representative of this patient population and , from a swallowing perspective , other tracheostomized patient populations at the same facility .
outcome	Clinicians should routinely consider tracheostomized , acute rehabilitation hospital inpatients with severely disordered consciousness post-TBI potential MBS candidates .
outcome	Implications and continued research needs are discussed .

###2449628
background	Traumatic sacral fractures are most often due to motor vehicle or industrial accidents and are commonly associated with pelvic , urogenital , and neurological injuries .
background	In recent years , a more subtle type of sacral fracture , not associated with major trauma , has been described .
background	It is an osteoporotic insufficiency fracture that presents as low back pain in elderly patients , especially postmenopausal Caucasian women .
background	It may escape detection unless radionuclide bone scans , tomograms , or computed tomograms are obtained .
background	The radiographic features have been detailed in various publications , but little has been reported about the clinical features , treatment , or ultimate outcome of patients with osteoporotic sacral fractures .
population	We have reviewed the charts and radiological studies of 13 women and 3 men who sustained this type of fracture between 1983 and 1986 .
population	All of these patients were Caucasian .
population	The average age was 71 years .
background	The most common presenting symptom complex was diffuse low back pain accompanied by hip , buttock , or thigh pain .
outcome	Pertinent physical findings were limited to tenderness on palpation of the sacrum and a decreased range of low back motion .
outcome	The osteoporotic fractures were seldom noted on plain roentgenograms of the sacrum , but were readily defined by sacral tomography or computed tomography .
outcome	Radionuclide bone scanning also proved helpful in making the diagnosis by localizing the process .
outcome	Treatment was medical and consisted of therapies designed to reduce pain and to combat the associated osteopenia .
outcome	( ABSTRACT TRUNCATED AT 250 WORDS )

###9596387
background	Assess modifications of sexual function in men treated with intrathecal baclofen for spinal spasticity .
study design	Prospective before-after trial .
other	A rehabilitation department of a university hospital ; follow-up was on an outpatient basis .
population	A convenience sample of nine consecutively recruited men with spinal cord injury or multiple sclerosis who were receiving intrathecal baclofen by an implantable pump ; average follow-up was 44.4 months .
other	A questionnaire focusing on libido ; ability to sustain reflexive and psychogenic erections ; rigidity , evaluated by a visual analog scale ; maximum duration of erection ; possibility of ejaculation .
outcome	Libido and the ability to obtain psychogenic or reflexogenic erections were not modified .
outcome	However , eight patients reported a decrease of erection rigidity and/or duration .
outcome	Ejaculation was possible in three cases before implantation .
outcome	It disappeared in two patients , and was more difficult to obtain in the last one .
outcome	It reappeared after treatment withdrawal .
outcome	No differences were found between multiple sclerosis and spinal cord injured patients .
outcome	Intrathecal baclofen may compromise erection and ejaculation .
outcome	This effect is reversible .
outcome	Patients should be informed of this effect .

###9091340
background	To determine the impact of hydrosalpinx on pregnancy rates in patients undergoing IVF for infertility caused by tubal disease .
other	Review of the records of all patients who had undergone IVF for tubal factor infertility at our institution between May 1988 and October 1994 .
other	A university-sponsored , hospital-based IVF facility .
population	Two hundred fifty patients were identified with infertility due to tubal disease ; 67 of these had at least one documented hydrosalpinx whereas the remaining 183 did not .
other	Numbers of oocytes retrieved and fertilized , the number of embryos transferred and implanting , and resulting pregnancy rates .
outcome	The groups were similar in age and cycle cancellation rates .
outcome	The patients with hydrosalpinx had greater numbers of oocytes retrieved per cycle ( 15.0 versus 11.6 ) and embryos transferred per cycle then those without hydrosalpinges ( 4.21 versus 3.98 ) .
outcome	The hydrosalpinx group also undertook more cycles per patient ( 2.31 versus 1.96 ) .
outcome	Fertilization rates between the two groups were similar , but implantation rates were decreased in those with hydrosalpinx ( 8.5 % versus 11.2 % ) .
outcome	Hydrosalpinx did not result in impaired ovarian stimulation or decreased oocyte fertilization .
outcome	It did , however , interfere with implantation and reduce to some degree the success of IVF in achieving an ongoing pregnancy .
outcome	The validity of routine salpingectomy for hydrosalpinx is debatable , but its use in selected individuals may well be appropriate .

background	Surgical opinions appear to be equally divided when considering the relative risks and benefits of these two procedures .

other	Normal continuous data were to have been summated using the weighted mean difference ( WMD ) .
outcome	The electronic database search yielded 2100 citations .
outcome	Of these , two articles were identified for possible inclusion , however both were excluded .
outcome	The hand search and personal communication were similarly unproductive .
outcome	No studies were included in the review and no data was synthesised .
outcome	Given that no qualifying studies were identified and because this is an important issue , both in terms of patient risk and benefit and health economics , the author feels it important to conduct a randomised controlled trial in this subject .

intervention	Subjects were randomized to either clean or sterile intermittent catheterization technique .
other	Protocols for both clean and sterile techniques were standardized and followed by nursing staff and caregivers .

outcome	A total of 189 urine specimens from 36 subjects were cultured .
outcome	Of the 36 subjects , 15 ( 43 % ) developed a symptomatic urinary tract infection : 6/16 ( 37 % ) from the clean group ; 9/20 ( 45 % ) from the sterile group ( P > 0.05 ) .
outcome	Mean time to onset for symptomatic urinary tract infection for the clean group was 3.0 ( standard deviation ( SD ) 2.4 ) weeks and for the sterile group , 3.6 ( SD 1.3 ) weeks ( P > 0.05 ) .
outcome	The most common urinary organisms at onset of symptomatic urinary tract infection were Enterococcus species followed by Klebsiella .
outcome	Clean intermittent catheterization in the rehabilitation setting does not appear to place the patient with spinal cord injury at increased risk for developing symptomatic urinary tract infection , and has significant cost and time saving benefits for the h

###17880726
background	There has been an ongoing discussion about the relationship between time spent watching television and childhood obesity .
background	This debate has special relevance in the Latin American region were the globalization process has increased the availability of screen-based entertainment at home .
background	The aim of this study is to examine the association between television viewing and weight status in Colombian children .
population	This cross sectional investigation included children aged 5 to12 yrs from the National Nutrition Survey in Colombia ( ENSIN 2005 ) .
other	Weight and height were measured in 11,137 children in order to calculate body mass index .
other	Overweight was defined by international standards .
intervention	Time spent viewing television was determined for these children through parental reports .
other	Multiple logistic regression analyses were conducted for different subgroups and adjusted for potential confounders in order to study the association between television viewing and weight status in this population .
outcome	Among the surveyed children , 41.5 % viewed television less than two hours/day ; 36.8 % between two and 3.9 hours/day and 21.7 % four or more hours/day .
outcome	The prevalence of overweight ( obesity inclusive ) in this population was 11.1 % .
outcome	Children who were classified as excessive television viewers ( between two and 3.9 hours/day or 4 or more hours/day ) were more likely to be overweight ( OR : 1.44 95 % CI : 1.41-1 .47 and OR : 1.32 95 % CI : 1.30-1 .34 , respectively ) than children who reported to w
outcome	Stratified analyses by age , gender and urbanization levels showed similar results .
outcome	Television viewing was positively associated with the presence of overweight in Colombian children .
outcome	A positive association between urbanization level and television viewing was detected .
outcome	Considering that the majority of Colombian children lives in densely populated cities and appear to engage in excessive television viewing these findings are of public health relevance for the prevention of childhood obesity .

###10422730
background	In the present brief overview we summarize results from several studies focusing on two neuropeptides , galanin and neuropeptide Y ( NPY ) in discrete neuronal systems , where they coexist with classic transmitters .
background	On the basis of studies in different animal models we propose that these peptides may be involved in regulation of certain CNS functions and that drugs acting on their receptors may be of use in new therapeutic strategies .
background	At the spinal level galanin and NPY are regulated in DRG neurons by nerve injury and in dorsal horn neurons by inflammation .
background	It is possible that this leads to attenuation of pain sensitivity .
background	Moreover , both peptides may exert trophic effects , for example to enhance regeneration .
background	In the hypothalamic arcuate nucleus NPY and its receptors are part of the feeding circuitry , and we suggest that derangement of these NPY neurons may at least in part underlay the lethal phenotype of anorectic mice , which die 22 days postnatally after sho
background	Expression of NPY and NPY receptors is changed in the hippocampus of mice comparatively early after prion inoculation , indicating that this peptide system is affected in this spongiform degenerative disease in a region of importance for learning and memor
background	Finally , galanin is co-localized with classic monoamine transmitters in two central systems , the dorsal raphe serotonin neurons and the locus coeruleus noradrenergic neurons .
background	In both cases galanin causes hyperpolarization ( at high concentrations ) and prolongs monoamine-induced outward currents ( at low concentrations ) , thus modulating activity in two systems of importance for many brain functions including mood regulation .
background	It may therefore be interesting to analyse to what extent drugs affecting galaninergic transmission also may be efficient in the treatment of , for example , depression .

###17149636

outcome	Further , tuberculous abscess as a cause of cauda equina syndrome is reported .
outcome	Patient had complete neurological recovery within weeks of drainage of abscess .
outcome	Transpedicular drainage of presacral abscess is a safer option for recently developed neurological deficit .
outcome	Late presentation may need anterior approach , which is associated with increased morbidity .

###11774957
background	Infection with Helicobacter pylori , particularly with strains positive for CagA protein , increases the risk of gastric adenocarcinoma .
background	Few studies have explored the possible association between H. pylori infection and colorectal cancer .
other	This study evaluated whether the seroprevalence of CagA in H. pylori-infected patients affected risk for colorectal cancer independently of H. pylori status .
population	In this study , we tested serum IgG antibodies against H. pylori ( ELISA ) and CagA protein ( Western blot assay ) in 67 patients with colorectal adenocarcinoma , 36 with gastric adenocarcinoma , 47 with other malignancies ( cancer controls ) , and 45 hospitalized
other	Colonic cancer and gastric cancer patients with H. pylori infection were compared to each control group and to the pooled controls using simple and adjusted analyses .
outcome	H. pylori infection was noted in 50 colon cancer patients , 31 gastric cancer patients , 31 cancer controls , and 32 TEE controls .
outcome	In all , 41 ( 82 % ) , 29 ( 94 % ) , 11 ( 35 % ) , and 13 ( 41 % ) , respectively , of these H. pylori-positive sera expressed CagA reactivity ( p < 0.001 for all pairwise comparisons between cases and controls ) .
outcome	In the adjusted analysis , infection with H. pylori CagA + compared to H. pylori CagA - was associated with increased risk for colorectal adenocarcinoma ( odds ratio = 10.6 ; 95 % CI = 2.7-41 .3 ; p = 0.001 ) and gastric adenocarcinoma ( odds ratio = 88.1 ; 95 % CI =
outcome	Among patients infected with H. pylori , CagA + seropositivity is associated with increased risk for both gastric and colonic cancer .
outcome	This finding should stimulate additional research into the role of cagA + H. pylori infection in the development of colorectal cancer .

###9777426
background	To compare the rates of mental health problems , disability and use of health and social services of older people living in sheltered accommodation with those of the rest of the community in the same age group .
other	Door-to-door survey in randomly selected enumeration districts .
other	The districts contained three sheltered accommodation complexes .
other	Residents from these addresses were compared with the others .
other	London Borough of Islington .
population	700 men and women aged 65 or over .
other	Short-CARE depression , dementia and activity scales ; the Guy 's / Age Concern anxiety scale ; individual items detailing problems with mobility , vision and hearing ; use of a number of health and social services .
outcome	The only difference in mental health variables on univariate analysis was a greater severity of cognitive impairment and dementia symptoms in sheltered accommodation .
outcome	When demographic differences were taken into account , the association with cognitive impairment became statistically insignificant .
outcome	There were significant associations between residence in sheltered accommodation and several of the disability variables .
outcome	Increased use of health and social services by sheltered residents remained significant after disability and living alone were taken into account .
outcome	The residents of sheltered accommodation were more disabled than the general elderly population but , in contrast to those in residential care , did not have a great excess of mental health problems .
outcome	Indeed , the possibility was raised that sheltered accommodation may protect against depression in people who live alone .

###8362892
background	Obesity can result in alterations in cardiac structure and function even in the absence of systemic hypertension and underlying organic heart disease .
background	Increased total blood volume creates a high cardiac output state that may cause ventricular dilatation and ultimately eccentric hypertrophy of the left ( and possibly the right ) ventricle .
background	Eccentric left ventricular ( LV ) hypertrophy produces diastolic dysfunction .
background	Systolic dysfunction may ensue due to excessive wall stress if wall thickening fails to keep pace with dilatation .
background	This disorder is referred to as obesity cardiomyopathy .
background	The presence of systemic hypertension in obese individuals facilitates development of LV dilatation and hypertrophy .
background	Congestive heart failure may occur in such individuals , and may be attributable to LV diastolic dysfunction or to combined LV diastolic and systolic dysfunction .
background	The sleep apnea/obesity hypoventilation syndrome occurs in 5 % of morbidly obese individuals and is potentially life-threatening .
background	Treatment of obesity cardiomyopathy consists of weight loss , salt restriction , and diuretics .
background	Digitalis and vasodilators may be useful in selected cases .
background	Central obesity is probably a risk factor for the development of coronary heart disease .
background	Alterations in lipid and insulin metabolism may facilitate development of coronary heart disease in obese patients .

###10135458
background	Health care reform in the United States is on a collision course with economic reality .
background	Most proposals focus on measures that will produce one-time cost savings by eliminating waste and inefficiency .
background	But the right question to ask is how to achieve dramatic and sustained cost reductions over time .
background	What will it take to foster entirely new approaches to disease prevention and treatment , whole new ways to deliver services , and more cost-effective facilities ?
background	The answer lies in the powerful lessons business has learned over the past two decades about the imperatives of competition .
background	In industry after industry , the underlying dynamic is the same : competition compels companies to deliver constantly increasing value to customers .
background	The fundamental driver of this continuous quality improvement and cost reduction is innovation .
background	Without incentives to sustain innovation in health care , short-term cost savings will soon be overwhelmed by the desire to widen access , the growing health needs of an aging population , and the unwillingness of Americans to settle for anything less than t
background	The misguided assumption underlying much of the debate about health care is that technology is the enemy .
background	By assuming that technology drives up costs , reformers neglect the central importance of innovation or , worse yet , attempt to slow its pace .
background	In fact , innovation , driven by rigorous competition , is the key to successful reform .

###16940162
background	Although clinical trials demonstrate the efficacy of quality improvement outreach in improving service delivery , evidence for broad community effectiveness has been lacking .
background	The objective of this study was to test the effectiveness of a statewide pediatric quality improvement outreach program in improving preventive services for children who are younger than 5 years .
population	All pediatric practices in Vermont ( n = 35 ) were invited to participate in a preventive services quality improvement initiative .
other	Ninety-one percent agreed .
other	Participating practices serve > 80 % of all Vermont children who are younger than 5 years .
other	The main outcome measured was change in 9 preventive services areas ( 1 ) immunizations up to date ; ( 2 ) anemia screening ; ( 3 ) tuberculosis risk assessment and indicated screening ; ( 4 ) lead screening ; ( 5 ) infant sleep position counseling ; ( 6 ) environmental tobacco smoke-exposure risk assessment ; ( 7 ) blood pressure screening ; ( 8 ) vision screening ; and ( 9 ) dental risk assessment .
outcome	All practices demonstrated improvement in 1 or more preventive services areas .
other	The mean number of areas chosen was 5 ( range 1-9 ) .
outcome	Practices that selected a specific preventive service area as a quality improvement goal were more likely to demonstrate improvement in that area than practices that did not choose to focus on that preventive services area .
outcome	The work in this project has provided the evidence for an effective statewide pediatric quality improvement outreach program to improve preventive services for children who are younger than 5 years .
outcome	Practices ' decision to focus on a specific preventive service area as a quality improvement goal seems necessary for improvement in that area .
outcome	This approach may be effective in other states or regions .

###18258231
background	To investigate the risks of chromosome mutation after ART for couples with comparable genetic backgrounds .
study design	Prospective clinical observational study .
other	In vitro fertilization center at a tertiary-care , university-affiliated teaching hospital .
population	Ninety-seven male children whose fathers have normal spermatogenesis were recruited , including 19 babies conceived through IVF , 18 babies conceived through intracytoplasmic sperm injection ( ICSI ) , and 60 naturally conceived babies , as well as the babies '
intervention	Collection of peripheral and umbilical cord blood samples .
other	The Yq genetic status of the babies and fathers according to 13 Y-specific markers covering four azoospermia factor ( AZF ) subregions , the karyotype , and the neonatal examination .
outcome	We found that all children had a normal 46 , XY karyotype , but de novo Y-chromosome microdeletions were identified in 1 ( 5.3 % ) of 19 IVF offspring and in 3 ( 16.7 % ) of 18 ICSI offspring .
outcome	The incidence of de novo Y-chromosome microdeletion in male children conceived through ICSI or IVF was statistically significantly higher than that in those conceived naturally ( 10.8 % vs. 0 ) .
outcome	In four babies with microdeletion , one was complicated , with hypospadias .
outcome	Our results , for the first time , indicate that risks of gene mutation may increase in the ART offspring , even though their fathers have normal spermatogenesis and genetic background .
outcome	Hence , intense attention should be placed on genetic safety in the ART children , and the benefits and risks of adopting ART should be balanced gingerly .

###9593951
background	Bradykinin has been strongly implicated as a mediator of cardiac nociception .
background	During coronary artery occlusion , the content of bradykinin in coronary sinus blood increases .
background	In non-cardiac tissues nociception to bradykinin exhibits tachyphylaxis , however , this phenomenon has not been rigorously studied in the heart .
background	This raises the question that repeated coronary occlusions may also result in tachyphylaxis , thereby reducing cardiac sensation on subsequent ischemic stimulation .
background	We therefore examined the hypothesis that repetitive episodes of myocardial ischemia and of epicardial application of bradykinin demonstrate tachyphylaxis .
population	Mongrel cats were anesthetized with alpha-chloralose and heart rate , arterial pressure , and thoracic spinal neuron firing rate were recorded during 60 s of anterior descending coronary occlusion or local epicardial application of bradykinin ( 10 microM ) .
outcome	Neurons were identified by cutaneous receptive fields in the left shoulder area .
outcome	Sixty-one of 93 neurons tested responded with an increase in firing rate to coronary artery occlusion only ( n = 24 ) , bradykinin only ( n = 19 ) or to both ( n = 18 ) .
outcome	On repetitive coronary occlusion , 14 of 25 neurons demonstrated tachyphylaxis compared to 12 of 15 tested with bradykinin ( p < 0.05 ) .
outcome	Similar responses were observed in thoracic spinal neurons that projected to the brain .
outcome	In neurons demonstrating tachyphylaxis , dorsal cervical cold block partially restored the neuronal activation to coronary occlusion but not to bradykinin .
outcome	We conclude , based on neuronal responses to repetitive stimuli , that afferent spinal responses to coronary occlusion and bradykinin are different .
outcome	These data suggest that bradykinin is not the sole mediator of myocardial ischemic pain .
outcome	The tachyphylaxis to repeated coronary artery occlusions may contribute to the clinical phenomenon of silent myocardial ischemia .

###19730763
other	Although the bladder neck is elevated during a pelvic floor muscle ( PFM ) contraction , it descends during straining .
background	This study aimed to investigate the relationship between bladder neck displacement , electromyography ( EMG ) activity of the pelvic floor and abdominal muscles and intra-abdominal pressure ( IAP ) during different pelvic floor and abdominal contractions .
population	Nine women without PFM dysfunction performed maximal , gentle and moderate PFM contractions , maximal and gentle transversus abdominis ( TrA ) contractions , bracing , Valsalva and head lift .
other	Bladder neck position was assessed with perineal ultrasound .
other	PFM and abdominal muscle activities were recorded with a vaginal probe and fine-wire electrodes , respectively .
other	IAP was recorded with a rectal balloon .
outcome	Bladder neck elevation only occurred during PFM and TrA contractions .
outcome	PFM EMG and IAP increased during all tasks from 0.5 ( gentle TrA ) to 45.7 cmH ( 2 ) O ( maximal Valsalva ) .
outcome	Bladder neck elevation was only observed when the activity of PFM EMG was high relative to the IAP increase .

###17364777
background	To compare the methodologies and results of research across five diagnostic groups in which there was expected to be a high prevalence of depression and occupational disability .
population	A review of research published since 1994 was carried out concerning depression and occupational disability in five diagnostic groups : Major depressive disorder ( MDD ) , spinal cord injuries ( SCI ) , traumatic brain injuries ( TBI ) , chronic back pain ( CP ) and
other	Prospective longitudinal designs were mostly undertaken in MDD studies .
other	Diagnostic interview schedules were utilized in most MDD studies whereas self-report inventories that tend to confound somatic and depressive symptoms were mostly used in CP , SCI , TBI and MI/CABG studies .
outcome	In longitudinal MDD studies both depression and occupational disability were related to access to enhanced primary care treatment .
outcome	On the other hand , CP research reported different results concerning the strength of depressive symptoms , cognitive and psychosocial factors in predicting occupational disability .
outcome	Different trends across diagnostic groups were evident in relation to depression , occupational disability , co-morbidity , socio-demographic factors and psychosocial resources .
outcome	Co-morbid , socio-demographic and psychosocial factors provide a framework from which to identify those at greater risk of depression and occupational disability .
outcome	However , more CP , SCI , TBI and MI/CABG studies with diagnostic schedules , prospective designs and longer follow-up are required .

###7638313
background	Sleep disorders are frequent and well documented in patients with Parkinson 's disease ( PD ) .
background	The effect of depression and anxiety on sleep in PD patients has not been carefully studied however , despite the fact that both depression and anxiety are common in PD and well known to affect sleep in patients without PD .
population	In this questionnaire study , sleep , anxiety , and depression were evaluated in 99 patients with PD and 47 control subjects .
outcome	PD patients had significantly higher scores on a variety of sleep variables as well as on measures of anxiety and depression .
outcome	While anxiety and depression were correlated with some sleep measures , neither contributed significantly to overall variance in sleep quality .
outcome	The effect on sleep variables was dominated by on-off symptom phenomena , levodopa dose , and age .

###15994574
background	Crisis resolution teams ( CRTs ) are being introduced throughout England , but their evidence base is limited .
intervention	To compare outcomes of crises before and after introduction of a CRT .
other	A new methodology was developed for identification and operational definition of crises .
other	A quasi-experimental design was used to compare cohorts presenting just before and just after a CRT was established .
outcome	Following introduction of the CRT , the admission rate in the 6 weeks after a crisis fell from 71 % to 49 % ( OR 0.38 , 95 % CI 0.21-0 .70 ) .
outcome	A difference of 5.6 points ( 95 % CI 2.0-8 .3 ) on mean Client Satisfaction Questionnaire ( CSQ-8 ) score favoured the CRT .
outcome	These findings remained significant after adjustment for baseline differences .
outcome	No clear difference emerged in involuntary hospitalisations , symptoms , social functioning or quality of life .
outcome	CRTs may prevent some admissions and patients prefer them , although other outcomes appear unchanged in the short term .

###15189000
background	Interorganizational health care delivery networks have potential for sustaining health services delivery in rural areas faced with economic and demographic challenges .

outcome	Greater dependence on vertical funding corresponds to greater external control ( r = .43 , p < .01 ) .
