###1927618
population	Seventy consecutive patients with injuries of the thoracic and lumbar spine accompanied by neurological deficit were prospectively studied and follow-up .
outcome	In 40 of these patients with a burst fracture , the degree of involvement of the cross-sectional area of the spinal canal , as revealed on first CT after admission , was not correlated with the type and degree of initial neurological deficit .
outcome	In patients with injuries of the lumbar spine , neurological deficit may be mild , although the sagittal diameter of the spinal canal may be reduced by as much as 90 % .
outcome	We can not establish a difference in neurological recovery between those cases who were managed conservatively and those in whom a surgical decompression and stabilization procedure was performed .
outcome	Surgical stabilizing procedures , however , result in immediate stabilization of the spine , they diminish pain , facilitate nursing care and allow more rapid mobilization and earlier active rehabilitation .
outcome	If major extraspinal injuries form a relative contra-indication to surgical decompression of the cord and stabilization of the spine injury , the patient can quite well be treated conservatively without endangering neurological recovery .

###15684794
background	Ventilator-associated pneumonia ( VAP ) is a common infection among patients in trauma intensive care units ( ICUs ) .
background	It has been suggested by different investigators that VAP is an indicator of injury severity and not necessarily associated with mortality .
background	Crude mortality rates approximating 20 % have been reported for trauma patients with VAP .
background	Most studies have involved the most severely injured patients , making it difficult to determine the relative contribution of either VAP or injury severity to death .
background	If VAP is independently associated with mortality , this relationship should be most evident in less severely injured patients .
other	We studied patients with less severe injuries ( Injury Severity Score , ISS < 25 ) to determine the impact of VAP on outcomes .
population	Patients admitted to the trauma ICU with ISS < 25 were identified from the trauma registry of a level I trauma center .
other	Patients with penetrating injuries and those who died within 48 h of injury were excluded .
other	Pneumonia was diagnosed using quantitative cultures of bronchoalveolar lavage effluent ( > / = 10 ( 5 ) colony forming units/mL ) .
other	Risk factors for VAP , including age , transfusions with 24 h of admission , brain injury , and chest injury severity were analyzed .
outcome	Logistic regression analysis was then performed to determine independent factors for death.Results : There were 15,492 blunt admissions over a 5.5 year study period who survived > 48 h.
outcome	Of these , 5,860 ( 38 % ) were admitted to the ICU , and 4,111 ( 70 % of ICU admissions ) had ISS < 25 .
outcome	The incidence of VAP in this group was 8 % .
outcome	Patients with VAP were older ( 47 vs 39 years ) , had more transfusions within 24 h ( 2.5 vs 0.9 units of red blood cell concentrates ) and had greater injury severity by ISS ( 16.7 vs 12.6 points ) , GCS ( Glasgow Coma Scale ) score ( 11.8 vs. 13.7 points ) and ches
outcome	Overall mortality was 4 % .
outcome	Mortality was 16 % in patients with VAP compared to 3 % in those without VAP ( p < 0.0001 ) .
outcome	Logistic regression analysis identified transfusions , age , and VAP as independent predictors of mortality .
outcome	Other descriptors of injury severity ( ISS , GCS , or chest AIS ) were not associated with death .
outcome	48 h.
outcome	Of these , 5,860 ( 38 % ) were admitted to the ICU , and 4,111 ( 70 % of ICU admissions ) had ISS , 25 .
outcome	The incidence of VAP in this group was 8 % .
outcome	Patients with VAP were older ( 47 vs 39 years ) , had more transfusions within 24 h ( 2.5 vs 0.9 units of red blood cell concentrates ) and had greater injury severity by ISS ( 16.7 vs 12.6 points ) , GCS ( Glasgow Coma Scale ) score ( 11.8 vs. 13.7 points ) and ches
outcome	Overall mortality was 4 % .
outcome	Mortality was 16 % in patients with VAP compared to 3 % in those without VAP ( p , 0.0001 ) .
outcome	Logistic regression analysis identified transfusions , age , and VAP as independent predictors of mortality .
outcome	Other descriptors of injury severity ( ISS , GCS , or chest AIS ) were not associated with death .
outcome	Ventilator-associated pneumonia is independently associated with death in less severely injured trauma patients .
outcome	This demonstrates the need for effective diagnostic techniques so that adequate therapy may be initiated .
outcome	Prevention of VAP in less severely injured trauma patients should increase survival .

###17943814
background	The frequency with which patients should attend for a dental check-up and the potential effects on oral health of altering recall intervals between check-ups have been the subject of ongoing international debate for almost 3 decades .
background	Although recommendations regarding optimal recall intervals vary between countries and dental healthcare systems , 6-monthly dental check-ups have traditionally been advocated by general dental practitioners in many developed countries .
other	To determine the beneficial and harmful effects of different fixed recall intervals ( for example 6 months versus 12 months ) for the following different types of dental check-up a ) clinical examination only ; b ) clinical examination plus scale and polish ; c ) clinical examination plus preventive advice ; d ) clinical examination plus preventive advice plus scale and polish .
other	To determine the relative beneficial and harmful effects between any of these different types of dental check-up at the same fixed recall interval .
other	To compare the beneficial and harmful effects of recall intervals based on clinicians ' assessment of patients ' disease risk with fixed recall intervals .
other	To compare the beneficial and harmful effects of no recall interval/patient driven attendance ( which may be symptomatic ) with fixed recall intervals .
other	We searched the Cochrane Oral Health Group Trials Register , the Cochrane Central Register of Controlled Trials ( CENTRAL ) , MEDLINE and EMBASE .
other	Reference lists from relevant articles were scanned and the authors of some papers were contacted to identify further trials and obtain additional information .
other	Date of most recent searches 5th March 2007 .
population	Trials were selected if they met the following criteria : design - random allocation of participants ; participants - all children and adults receiving dental check-ups in primary care settings , irrespective of their level of risk for oral disease ; interven
other	In addition the following outcomes were considered where reported patient-centred outcomes , economic cost outcomes , other outcomes such as improvements in oral health knowledge and attitudes , harms , changes in dietary habits and any other oral health-related behavioural change .
other	Information regarding methods , participants , interventions , outcome measures and results were independently extracted , in duplicate , by two review authors .
other	Authors were contacted , where deemed necessary and where possible , for further details regarding study design and for data clarification .
other	A quality assessment of the included trial was carried out .
other	The Cochrane Collaboration 's statistical guidelines were followed .
outcome	Only one study ( with 188 participants ) was included in this review and was assessed as having a high risk of bias .
outcome	This study provided limited data for dental caries outcomes ( dmfs/DMFS increment ) and economic cost outcomes ( reported time taken to provide examinations and treatment ) .
outcome	There is insufficient evidence from randomised controlled trials ( RCTs ) to draw any conclusions regarding the potential beneficial and harmful effects of altering the recall interval between dental check-ups .
outcome	There is insufficient evidence to support or refute the practice of encouraging patients to attend for dental check-ups at 6-monthly intervals .
outcome	It is important that high quality RCTs are conducted for the outcomes listed in this review in order to address the objectives of this review .

###15736515
background	The purpose of this health technology assessment ( HTA ) , commissioned by the German Federal Ministry of Health and Social Security , was to systematically review the evidence for the effectiveness and cost-effectiveness of antiviral treatment ( AVT ) with int
study design	We performed a systematic literature search on effectiveness and cost-effectiveness of AVT and summarized results using meta-analysis and evidence tables .
other	We applied the German Hepatitis C Model ( GEHMO ) , a decision-analytic Markov model , to determine long-term clinical effectiveness , costs , and incremental cost-effectiveness ratios ( ICER ) of the examined treatment strategies .
other	Model parameters were derived from German databases , published international randomized clinical trials ( RCT ) , and a Cochrane Review .
outcome	Overall , nine RCTs , two HTA reports , one Cochrane review , two meta-analyses , and seven economic evaluations met the inclusion criteria .
outcome	These studies indicate that PegIFN + RBV achieved the highest sustained virological response rates ( SVR ) ( 54-61 percent ) , followed by IFN + RBV ( 38-54 percent ) and IFN monotherapy ( 11-21 percent ) .
outcome	Based on our meta-analysis , PegIFN + RBV reduced cases without SVR by 17 percent compared with INF + RBV .
outcome	International cost-effectiveness studies indicate that INF + RBV is cost-effective when compared with INF monotherapy .
outcome	For PegIFN + RBV , our decision analysis yielded an ICER of 9,800 Euros per quality-adjusted life-year gained .
outcome	This HTA suggests that initial combination therapy prolongs life , improves quality of life , and is cost-effective in patients with CHC .
outcome	Peginterferon plus ribavirin is the most effective and efficient treatment among the examined options .
outcome	However , because not all chronic hepatitis C patients will develop progressive liver disease , a thorough assessment of the eligibility and appropriateness of treatment with combination therapy must be performed in each individual patient .

###16970230
background	The authors performed an analysis of retrospectively obtained data to compare the outcomes of pediatric patients admitted to their institution for traumatic injuries resulting from car , motorcycle , and all-terrain vehicle ( ATV ) accidents .
study design	The authors conducted a retrospective review of Columbus Children 's Hospital 's Trauma Registry data collected between January 1993 and December 2003 .
population	Data obtained in patients admitted with motor vehicle-related injuries were compiled for a total of 1608 patient records .
other	Data regarding sex , age , hospital length of stay ( LOS ) , Glasgow Coma Scale ( GCS ) score , revised trauma score , injury severity score ( ISS ) , and use of a protective device were analyzed .
other	Of 1608 patients , 1257 ( 78 % ) were injured in automobile accidents , 123 ( 7.6 % ) in motorcycle accidents , and 228 ( 14.2 % ) in ATV accidents .
outcome	Injuries sustained in all vehicle types peaked during the summer months .
outcome	Patients involved in automobile crashes presented with significantly lower GCS scores than those injured in motorcycle and ATV accidents ; however , there was no statistically significant difference in LOS among all three injury modalities .
outcome	Protective devices were underutilized in all three motor vehicle categories but , when used , were associated with significantly higher GCS scores , ISSs , and shorter LOSs among patients admitted after automobile accidents .
outcome	The correlation of seat belt use with better outcomes underscores the necessity to improve motor vehicle safety education for children , who are less likely to be restrained as they age .

###12497648
background	Generalized anxiety disorder ( GAD ) is a prevalent and disabling disorder characterized by persistent worrying , anxiety symptoms , and tension .
background	It is the most frequent anxiety disorder in primary care , being present in 22 % of primary care patients who complain of anxiety problems .
background	The high prevalence rate of GAD in primary care ( 8 % ) compared to that reported in the general population ( 12-month prevalence 1.9-5 .1 % ) suggests that GAD patients are high users of primary care resources .
background	GAD affects women more frequently than men and prevalence rates are high in midlife ( prevalence in females over age 35 : 10 % ) and older subjects but relatively low in adolescents .
background	The natural course of GAD can be characterized as chronic with few complete remissions , a waxing and waning course of GAD symptoms , and the occurrence of substantial comorbidity particularly with depression .
background	Patients with GAD demonstrate a considerable degree of impairment and disability , even in its pure form , uncomplicated by depression or other mental disorders .
background	The degree of impairment is similar to that of cases with major depression .
background	GAD comorbid with depression usually reveals considerably higher numbers of disability days in the past month than either condition in its pure form .
outcome	As a result , GAD is associated with a significant economic burden owing to decreased work productivity and increased use of health care services , particularly primary health care .
outcome	The appropriate use of psychological treatments and antidepressants may improve both anxiety and depression symptoms and may also play a role in preventing comorbid major depression in GAD thus reducing the burden on both the individual and society .

###3068145
background	Since the advent of fiberoptic endoscopy and the introduction of colonoscopic polypectomy , a simple and cost-effective procedure has been available to deal with an exceedingly common problem , the colonic polyp .
background	Although polyps in the gastrointestinal tract have a varied natural history , there is strong evidence that adenomatous colonic polyps have a potential for malignant degeneration and that virtually all colorectal cancers arise from adenomatous polyps .
background	This article will review some basic features of the endoscopic approaches and problems associated with polypectomy .

###16189339
background	Pronounced , unexplained preoperative tachycardia can be a formidable challenge for the anesthesiologist .
background	Whereas the relationship between persistent intraoperative tachycardia and perioperative morbidity is indisputable , there is a lack of available data on unexplained preoperative tachycardia .
background	The main objective of this case series is to stimulate research and discussion on this topic , so that guidelines can be developed to aid in management .
population	We present three patients with pronounced ( > or = 130 beats x min ( -1 ) ) unexplained preoperative tachycardia who suffered adverse perioperative events that were garnered from quality improvement records at two teaching hospitals .
other	In the first case , a 38-yr-old woman with a lumbar spinal tumour went into ventricular fibrillation after induction of anesthesia and was found on subsequent evaluation to have an abnormal cardiac re-entrant pathway .
other	In the second case , an otherwise healthy middle-aged man developed a wide complex tachycardia with hypotension during foot surgery , with the subsequent cardiac evaluation being negative .
other	In the third case , a young , healthy woman scheduled for a melanoma incision developed crushing , substernal chest pain accompanied by nausea and shortness of valve prolapse with regurgitation .
other	Before rescheduling the procedures , therapeutic interventions were undertaken that facilitated successful completion of the surgeries .
outcome	There are currently no data regarding the prevalence of unexplained preoperative tachycardia , and no guidelines to direct management .
outcome	More research is needed on this important topic , including epidemiological data and management algorithm ( s ) .

###18655202
background	The antihypersensitivity actions of gabapentin and pregabalin have been well characterized in a large number of studies , although the underlying mechanisms have yet to be defined .
background	We have been focusing on the supraspinal structure as a possible site for their action and have demonstrated that intracerebroventricular ( i.c.v. ) administration of gabapentin and pregabalin indeed decreases thermal and mechanical hypersensitivity in a mu
outcome	This novel supraspinally mediated analgesic effect was markedly suppressed by either depletion of central noradrenaline ( NA ) or blockade of spinal alpha ( 2 ) - adrenergic receptors .
outcome	Moreover , i.c.v. injection of gabapentin and pregabalin increased spinal NA turnover in mice only after peripheral nerve injury .
outcome	In locus coeruleus ( LC ) neurons in brainstem slices prepared from mice after peripheral nerve injury , gabapentin reduced the gamma-aminobutyric acid ( GABA ) type A receptor-mediated inhibitory postsynaptic currents ( IPSCs ) .
outcome	Glutamate-mediated excitatory synaptic transmission was hardly affected .
outcome	Moreover , gabapentin did not reduce IPSCs in slices taken from mice given a sham operation .
outcome	Although gabapentin altered neither the amplitude nor the frequency of miniature IPSCs , it reduced IPSCs together with an increase in the paired-pulse ratio , suggesting that gabapentin acts on the presynaptic GABAergic nerve terminals in the LC .
outcome	Together , the data suggest that gabapentin presynaptically reduces GABAergic synaptic transmission , thereby removing the inhibitory influence on LC neurons only in neuropathic pain states , leading to activation of the descending noradrenergic system .

###7854795
background	Neuropathic pain following spinal cord injury ( SCI ) can be difficult to manage using currently available pain management techniques .
background	We describe a case of chronic pain following SCI which failed to respond to a variety of approaches including intrathecal administration of morphine .
outcome	Use of clonidine in addition to the morphine resulted in a marked decrease in pain .
outcome	The use of intrathecal clonidine with or without opioids may present an effective alternative in the management of intractable SCI pain and other forms of neuropathic pain .

###690641
background	The excitability of a lower limb myotatic reflex arc is modulated by the antecedent activation of another myotatic arc in the same limb ; the changes can be represented by heteronymous excitability curves .
background	This work compares heteronymous excitability curves in spastic and normal subjects .
population	Eighteen patients who showed clear signs of pyramidal tract lesions at a chronic stage were studied .
other	Three myotatic arcs of the lower limb ( soleus , quadriceps , and short biceps ) were activated either by mechanical percussion ( T Sol-T Quad-TSBi ) or by electrical stimulation of the afferent nerve ( H Sol-H Quad ) .
other	They were used as conditioning and test responses in six different combinations , and the results compared to those obtained previously in normal volunteers .
outcome	In spastic patients , heteronymous excitability curves are more obviously modified than homonymous ones .
outcome	The changes are most prominent in the thigh muscles and less marked when the soleus reflex is conditioned by activation of quadriceps and biceps femoris myotatic reflex arcs .

###15909782
background	There is compelling evidence that residents training in primary care need education in palliative care .
background	Evidence for effective curricula is needed .
other	The objective of this study was to test whether a clinical elective improves measures of knowledge and skill .
population	Residents from three categorical training programs in internal medicine were recruited to an elective including clinical experiences in an acute hospital palliative care consultation service , on an acute hospice and palliative care unit , and in-home hospi
other	A 25-question pre - and post-test and a videotaped interview with a standardized patient were used to assess communication skills and measure outcomes .
outcome	Residents demonstrated a 10 percent improvement in knowledge after the four-week elective ( p < 0.05 ) .
outcome	All residents demonstrated basic competency in communication skills at the end of the rotation .
outcome	These results indicate that clinical rotation shows promise as an educational intervention to improve palliative care knowledge and skills in primary care residents .
outcome	An important limitation of the study is that it is an elective ; further studies with a required rotation and/or a control group are needed to confirm the findings .

###17341052
background	Electrical intracerebral stimulation ( also referred to as deep brain stimulation [ DBS ] ) is a tool for the treatment of chronic pain states that do not respond to less invasive or conservative treatment options .
background	Careful patient selection , accurate target localization , and identification with intraoperative neurophysiological techniques and blinded test evaluation are the key requirements for success and good long-term results .
other	The authors present their experience with DBS for the treatment of various chronic pain syndromes .
population	In this study 56 patients with different forms of neuropathic and mixed nociceptive/neuropathic pain syndromes were treated with DBS according to a rigorous protocol .
other	The postoperative follow-up duration ranged from 1 to 8 years , with a mean of 3.5 years .
intervention	Electrodes were implanted in the somatosensory thalamus and the periventricular gray region .
other	Before implantation of the stimulation device , a double-blinded evaluation was carefully performed to test the effect of each electrode on its own as well as combined stimulation with different parameter settings .
other	The best long-term results were attained in patients with chronic low-back and leg pain , for example , in so-called failed-back surgery syndrome .
outcome	Patients with neuropathic pain of peripheral origin ( such as complex regional pain syndrome Type II ) also responded well to DBS .
outcome	Disappointing results were documented in patients with central pain syndromes , such as pain due to spinal cord injury and poststroke pain .
outcome	Possible reasons for the therapeutic failures are discussed ; these include central reorganization and neuroplastic changes of the pain-transmitting pathways and pain modulation centers after brain and spinal cord lesions .
outcome	The authors found that , in carefully selected patients with chronic pain syndromes , DBS can be helpful and can add to the quality of life .

###10806719
background	To detect breast cancer susceptibility gene ( BRCA1 ) mutation in ovarian cancer and to look for correlations between BRCA1 mutation and hereditary ovarian cancer .
population	Mutation of BRCA1 gene in 4 patients with hereditary ovarian cancer and 31 patients with sporadic ovarian cancer were screened by polymerase chain reaction-single strand conformation polymorphism analysis with non-isotopic silver staining method .
outcome	2 mutations of BRCA1 gene were found in 2 of 3 patients belonged to hereditary breast-ovarian cancer syndrom ( HBOC ) which were located in exon 2 and 21 respectively .
outcome	No mutation was found in 31 cases of sporadic ovarian cancer and 1 case of hereditary site-specific ovarian cancer .
outcome	BRCA1 mutation was probably closely related to hereditary breast-ovarian cancer syndrome .
outcome	Detection of BRCA1 gene mutation was helpful to diagnose HBOC families .

###10084436
background	To compare the pressor response to static exercise in subjects with cervical spinal cord injury ( SCI ) at the C6 to C8 level with that in able-bodied control subjects .
background	In these SCI subjects , the descending supraspinal sympathetic neurons and afferent pathways from the contracting muscles to peripheral vessels via the medullary cardiovascular center are damaged .
population	Mean arterial blood pressure , heart rate , and plasma concentrations of norepinephrine , epinephrine , renin activity , vasopressin , aldosterone , and human atrial natriuretic peptide were measured during a 2-minute period of sustained contraction of elbow fle
outcome	74.7 + / -2.2 mm Hg ; static exercise , 81.9 + / -4.1 mm Hg ) and control subjects ( pre-exercise , 101.0 + / -4.2 mm Hg ; static exercise , 117.0 + / -4
outcome	In SCI subjects , there was no change in heart rate during exercise , whereas in control subjects heart rate increased during exercise ( p < .05 ) ( pre-exercise , 8.7 + / -3.8 beats/min : static exercise , 76.0 + / -3.1 beats/min ) .
outcome	There were no significant changes in the hormone levels in the SCI subjects throughout the experiment .
outcome	The significant increase in mean blood pressure observed in the present study indicates the presence of peripheral control from muscle receptors and evoked pressor response during static exercise in SCI subjects .

###16005822
background	This article explores the physiologic basis and symptoms of obstructive sleep apnea -- a general term encompassing central sleep apnea and obstructive sleep apnea .
background	The former is relatively uncommon while the latter is much more common .
background	Episodic collapse and blockage of the upper airway occur during sleep despite continuous respiratory effort .
background	Three types of sleep obstructive breathing -- apnea , hypopnea , and airway resistance -- are associated with respiratory-related arousals from sleep .

###16452337
other	PEDIATRICS ( ISSN Numbers Print , 0031-4005 ; Online , 1098-4275 ) .
background	Published in the public domain by the American Academy of Pediatrics.Speech and language development is a useful indicator of a child 's overall development and cognitive ability and is related to school success .
background	Identification of children at risk for developmental delay or related problems may lead to intervention services and family assistance at a young age , when the chances for improvement are best .
background	However , optimal methods for screening for speech and language delay have not been identified , and screening is practiced inconsistently in primary care .
other	We sought to evaluate the strengths and limits of evidence about the effectiveness of screening and interventions for speech and language delay in preschool-aged children to determine the balance of benefits and adverse effects of routine screening in primary care for the development of guidelines by the US Preventive Services Task Force .
population	The target population includes all children up to 5 years old without previously known conditions associated with speech and language delay , such as hearing and neurologic impairments .
other	Studies were identified from Medline , PsycINFO , and CINAHL databases ( 1966 to November 19 , 2004 ) , systematic reviews , reference lists , and experts .
other	The evidence review included only English-language , published articles that are available through libraries .
other	Only randomized , controlled trials were considered for examining the effectiveness of interventions .
other	Outcome measures were considered if they were obtained at any time or age after screening and/or intervention as long as the initial assessment occurred while the child was < or = 5 years old .
other	Outcomes included speech and language measures and other functional and health outcomes such as social behavior .
other	A total of 745 full-text articles met our eligibility criteria and were reviewed .
other	Data were extracted from each included study , summarized descriptively , and rated for quality by using criteria specific to different study designs developed by the US Preventive Services Task Force .
outcome	The use of risk factors for selective screening has not been evaluated , and a list of specific risk factors to guide primary care physicians has not been developed or tested .
outcome	Sixteen studies about potential risk factors for speech and language delay in children enrolled heterogeneous populations , had dissimilar inclusion and exclusion criteria , and measured different risk factors and outcomes .
outcome	The most consistently reported risk factors included a family history of speech and language delay , male gender , and perinatal factors .
outcome	Other risk factors reported less consistently included educational levels of the mother and father , childhood illnesses , birth order , and family size .
outcome	The performance characteristics of evaluation techniques that take < or = 10 minutes to administer were described in 24 studies relevant to screening .
other	Studies that were rated good to fair quality reported wide ranges of sensitivity and specificity when compared with reference standards ( sensitivity 17-100 % ; specificity 45-100 % ) .
other	Most of the evaluations , however , were not designed for screening purposes , the instruments measured different domains , and the study populations and settings were often outside of primary care .
other	No `` gold standard '' has been developed and tested for screening , reference standards varied across studies , few studies compared the performance of > or = 2 screening techniques in 1 population , and comparisons of a single screening technique across different populations are lacking .
other	Fourteen good - and fair-quality randomized , controlled trials of interventions reported significantly improved speech and language outcomes compared with control groups .
outcome	Improvement was demonstrated in several domains including articulation , phonology , expressive language , receptive language , lexical acquisition , and syntax among children in all age groups studied and across multiple therapeutic settings .
outcome	Improvement in other functional outcomes such as socialization skills , self-esteem , and improved play themes were demonstrated in some , but not all , of the 4 studies that measured them .
outcome	In general , studies of interventions were small and heterogeneous , may be subject to plateau effects , and reported short-term outcomes based on various instruments and measures .
outcome	As a result , long-term outcomes are not known , interventions could not be compared directly , and generalizability is questionable .
outcome	Use of risk factors to guide selective screening is not supported by studies .
outcome	Several aspects of screening have been inadequately studied to determine optimal methods , including which instrument to use , the age at which to screen , and which interval is most useful .
other	Trials of interventions demonstrate improvement in some outcome measures , but conclusions and generalizability are limited .
outcome	Data are not available addressing other key issues including the effectiveness of screening in primary care settings , role of enhanced surveillance by primary care physicians before referral for diagnostic evaluation , non-speech and language and long-term

###9694750
background	To evaluate the impact of the revised diagnostic criteria for diabetes mellitus adopted by the American Diabetes Association on prevalence of diabetes and on classification of patients .
background	For epidemiological purposes the American criteria use a fasting plasma glucose concentration > = 7.0 mmol/l in contrast with the current World Health Organisation criteria of 2 hour glucose concentration > = 11.1 mmol/l .
other	Data were collected from 13 populations and three occupational based studies from eight European countries .
other	All studies used a 75 g oral glucose tolerance test to measure fasting and 2 hour glucose concentrations .
population	17 881 men ; 8309 women ; age range 17-92 years .
other	Classification of diabetes according to both sets of criteria .
outcome	The application of the American criteria on European populations induced changes in prevalence of diabetes ranging from a reduction of 4.0 % to an increase of 13.2 % .
outcome	A total of 1517 previously undiagnosed individuals had diabetes according to either the WHO or the American criteria .
outcome	Among 1044 with diabetes according to American criteria , only 45 % had 2 hour values fulfilling the WHO criteria .
outcome	The risk of disagreement of classification decreased with increasing body mass index ( P < 0.00001 ) and increasing age ( P < 0.0001 ) ; the impact of sex was not significant ( P = 0.08 ) .
outcome	This shift in strategy from using 2 hour to fasting plasma glucose will cause an increase in the prevalence of diabetes in some European populations .
outcome	A high degree of disagreement in the classification was observed between the two recommendations .
outcome	Prospective data are needed to evaluate whether the WHO or the American criteria best identify individuals at risk of developing microvascular complications and cardiovascular disease .
outcome	Wider implementation of revised diagnostic criteria should await prospective data .

###2785879
population	Seven hundred ninety-three patients had coronary artery bypass graft ( CABG ) surgery within 30 days after acute myocardial infarction ( AMI ) between August 1982 and July 1987 .
outcome	Hospital mortality was 5.7 % .
outcome	Age , surgical priority , prior CABG surgery , congestive heart failure ( CHF ) , and type of AMI were associated with increased hospital mortality by logistic regression analysis of nine independent variables .
outcome	When the analysis was carried out separately for men and women , the same predictive variables were identified for men , but only surgical priority and age were predictive of operative mortality for women .
outcome	Elective CABG surgery can be carried out at low risk following AMI in stable patients regardless of the interval between AMI and surgery .
outcome	Patients who undergo urgent or emergency surgery and those who have CHF , Q wave infarction , or a history of prior AMI are at increased risk .

###9396468
background	Congestive heart failure ( CHF ) is associated with a decrease in renal perfusion .
background	Because endothelium-derived NO is important in the regulation of renal blood flow ( RBF ) , we tested the hypothesis that an impairment in the NO system may contribute to the decrease in RBF in rats with experimental CHF .
population	Studies were performed in rats with experimental high-output CHF induced by aortocaval ( AV ) fistula and sham-operated controls .
outcome	In controls , incremental doses of acetylcholine ( ACh , 1 to 100 microg x kg ( -1 ) x min ( -1 ) ) increased RBF and caused a dose-related decrease in renal vascular resistance ( RVR ) .
outcome	However , the increase in RBF and decrease in RVR were markedly attenuated in rats with CHF .
outcome	Likewise , the effects of ACh on urinary sodium and cGMP excretion were also diminished in CHF rats , as was the renal vasodilatory effect of the NO donor S-nitroso-N-acetylpenicillamine ( SNAP ) .
outcome	These attenuated responses to endothelium-dependent and - independent renal vasodilators in CHF rats occurred despite a normal baseline and stimulated NO2 + NO3 excretion and normal expression of renal endothelial NO synthase ( eNOS ) , as determined by eNOS mR
outcome	Infusion of the NO precursor L-arginine did not affect baseline RBF or the response to ACh in rats with CHF .
outcome	However , administration of the nonpeptide angiotensin II receptor antagonist A81988 before ACh completely restored the renal vasodilatory response to ACh in CHF rats .
outcome	This study demonstrates that despite a significant attenuation in the NO-related renal vasodilatory responses , the integrity of the renal NO system is preserved in rats with chronic AV fistula .
outcome	This impairment in NO-mediated renal vasodilation in experimental CHF appears to be related to increased activity of the renin-angiotensin system and may contribute further to the decrease in renal perfusion seen in CHF .

###11284548
background	Endothelial-derived prostacyclin is an important regulator of microvascular function , and its main actions are inhibition of platelet/leukocyte aggregation and adhesion , and vasodilation .
background	Disturbances in endothelial integrity following traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) may result in insufficient prostacyclin production and participate in the pathophysiological sequelae of brain injury .
other	The objective of this study was to evaluate the potential therapeutic effects of a low-dose prostacyclin infusion on cortical lesion volume , CA3 neuron survival and functional outcome following TBI in the rat .
population	Anesthetized animals ( sodium pentobarbital , 60 mg/kg , i.p. ) were subjected to a lateral fluid percussion brain injury ( 2.5 atm ) or sham injury .
intervention	Following TBI , animals were randomized to receive a constant infusion of either prostacyclin ( 1 ng/kg x min ( -1 ) i.v. ) or vehicle over 48 h.
intervention	All sham animals received vehicle ( n = 6 ) .
other	Evaluation of neuromotor function , lesion volume , and CA3 neuronal loss was performed blindly .
outcome	By 7 days postinjury , cortical lesion volume was significantly reduced by 43 % in the prostacyclin-treated group as compared to the vehicle treated group ( p < 0.01 ; n = 12 prostacyclin , n = 12 vehicle ) .
outcome	No differences were observed in neuromotor function ( 48 h and 7 days following TBI ) , or in hippocampal cell loss ( 7 days following TBI ) between the prostacyclin - and vehicle-treated groups .
outcome	We conclude that prostacyclin in a low dose reduces loss of neocortical neurons following TBI and may be a potential clinical therapeutic agent to reduce neuronal cell death associated with brain trauma .

###9806317
background	Obesity is characterised by growth hormone ( GH ) abnormalities , including a blunted response to stimulation and a ` paradoxical ' increase after meals .
background	The blunted GH release is reversed by a surgical intestinal bypass procedure .
background	However , this does not mean that normal GH dynamics have been restored .
background	The present study assessed whether post-surgical weight reduction in obese patients normalised the modulation of GH release produced by metabolic fuels .
population	Ten obese female subjects , aged 23-54 y , were studied before and after biliopancreatic diversion ( BPD ) .
outcome	All patients , after surgery , had experienced a significant reduction in body weight ( mean body mass index ( BMI ) 25.78 + / - 1.01 kg/m2 vs 44.68 + / - 1.73 kg/m2 ) .
population	Two groups were also studied as controls : Ten normal body weight female subjects and ten patients suffering from anorexia nervosa ( AN , mean BMI 17.46 + / - 1.12 kg/m2 ) .
other	We have studied the GH response to a GH releasing hormone ( GHRH ) bolus ( 1 microg/kg i.v. , at 13.00 h ) before and after a standard meal .
outcome	In post-BPD subjects , the GH response to GHRH in the fasting state , was clearly augmented in comparison with the pre-BPD values ( peak values 18.06 + / - 4.56 vs 3.24 + / - 0.68 microg/L ) .
outcome	In post-BPD subjects the postprandial GH response was further augmented in comparison with the fasting test ( peak 30.12 + / - 4.99 microg/L , P < 0.05 ) .
outcome	This pattern was similar to that observed in anorexic patients .
outcome	The surgical procedure restores a normal GH response to GHRH in the fasting state , but the ` paradoxical ' GH response after meals remains present , suggesting a persistent GH derangement in such patients , which is not related to body weight per se .
outcome	The surgical procedure makes obese patients similar to anorexics , in the relationships between metabolic fuels and GH secretion .
outcome	The persistence of the GH postprandial response to GHRH in post-BPD subjects suggests a role for metabolic fuels in the regulation of somatostatin ( SRIF ) secretion .

###11251396
background	This study was done to evaluate the effect of spinal cord stimulation ( SCS ) on critical limb ischemia and to report technical problems and complications .
population	One hundred and twenty patients with critical limb ischemia were eligible for randomization between medical treatment and medical treatment plus SCS .
intervention	Sixty received a spinal cord stimulator ( Itrel II ; Medtronic , Minneapolis , Minn. , USA ) .
other	Primary outcome measures were limb salvage and pain relief .
outcome	The mean pain reduction in both treatment groups was 50 % ( from 5 to 2.5 on the visual analog scale ) .
outcome	The 2-year limb survival was 52 % ( SCS ) versus 46 % ( standard treatment ; p = 0.47 ) .
outcome	The number of patients undergoing major amputations in the SCS group with intermediate TcpO2 values was half of that in the standard group ( 14 vs. 28 ; 24 vs. 48 % ; p = 0.17 ) .
outcome	Implantation was successful in 51 patients .
outcome	Technical problems such as loss of stimulation due to lead displacement occurred in 13 patients ( 22 % ) , local infection at the site of implantation occurred in 3 patients ( 5 % ) , resulting in a total complication rate of 27 % .
outcome	Premature depletion of the battery occurred within 2 years in 3 patients ( 5 % ) .
outcome	There were no lead fractures , epidural infections , hematoma or cerebrospinal fluid leakage .
outcome	Training of physicians and better reliability of the hardware should reduce the frequency of technical problems .
outcome	Lead displacement remains the major technical problem .
outcome	The search for prognostic factors of limb salvage is important .
outcome	One microcirculatory measurement ( TcpO2 ) seems to have a prognostic value , which remains to be described more precisely .

###16142502
background	Vertebral fractures are the most common osteoporotic fracture and may result in back pain with functional limitations and diminished quality of life .
background	Teriparatide [ rhPTH ( 1-34 ) ] has been shown to increase bone mass and reduce the risk of vertebral and other osteoporotic fractures .
population	The aim of this study was to evaluate the effects of teriparatide on the risk of back pain in patients with osteoporosis .
study design	A systematic review of the literature was performed , and five trials were identified and included in our analyses .
other	All trials were randomized , double-blinded , and parallel with either new vertebral fracture ( n = 1 ) or bone mineral density as the primary endpoint ( n = 4 ) .
other	Four studies were in postmenopausal women with osteoporosis , and one was in men with idiopathic or hypogonadal osteoporosis .
other	Two trials were placebo controlled , two trials were alendronate controlled , and one trial involved teriparatide plus hormone replacement therapy versus hormone replacement therapy alone .
other	Reports of back pain , defined as new or worsened back pain after initiating the study drug , were obtained from adverse event databases , and the risk of back pain was analyzed using a multivariate Cox proportional hazards model .
outcome	Results were not statistically heterogeneous ( P = 0.60 ) across trials , and there were no differences between groups administered teriparatide 20 or 40 mcg/day doses ( P = 0.64 ) .
outcome	The rates of back pain , moderate or severe back pain , and severe back pain per 100 patient-years were numerically lower in the teriparatide versus comparator groups in each study .
outcome	Compared with the pooled comparator , patients in the pooled teriparatide group had reduced risk for any back pain [ relative risk , 0.66 ( 95 % CI , 0.55-0 .80 ) ] , moderate or severe back pain [ relative risk , 0.60 ( 95 % CI , 0.48-0 .75 ) ] and severe back pain [ relat
outcome	Separate meta-analyses comparing teriparatide versus placebo or antiresorptive drugs gave similar results .
outcome	In conclusion , patients randomized to teriparatide had a reduced risk of new or worsening back pain compared to patients randomized to placebo , hormone replacement therapy or alendronate .

###7856687
background	We attempted to determine whether gynecologic histories differ in women who have and have not experienced an early menopause .
population	A group of 344 `` case '' women whose average age at menopause was 42.2 years and an age-matched group of 344 `` control '' women still menstruating or menopausal after age 46 were selected from a survey of 10,606 women aged 45 to 54 years for
outcome	Case women were more likely to have had menarche at or before age 11 , had shorter cycle lengths , had fewer pregnancies with live births , and had more frequent pelvic operations including unilateral oophorectomy and multiple cesarean sections .
outcome	Case women had a greater number of presumed ovulatory cycles , as estimated from age at menarche , average cycle length , and years of anovulation associated with pregnancies or oral contraceptive use .
outcome	In a multivariate model including smoking status and body mass index , ovulatory cycles were a significant predictor of early menopause , especially after an estimated 300 ovulations .
outcome	The reproductive histories of women who experienced an early menopause suggest a pattern of more rapid oocyte loss ( `` incessant '' ovulation ) .

###16643308
background	Magnetic resonance ( MR ) - based techniques are widely used for the assessment of patients with suspected and definite multiple sclerosis ( MS ) .
background	However , despite the publication of several position papers , which attempted to define the utility of MR techniques in the management of MS , their application in everyday clinical practice is still suboptimal .
background	This is probably related , not only , to the fact that the majority of published guidelines focused on the optimization of MR technology in clinical trials , but also to the continuing development of modern , quantitative MR-based techniques , that have not as
outcome	The present report summarizes the conclusions of the ` EFNS Expert Panel of Neuroimaging of MS ' on the application of conventional and non-conventional MR techniques to the clinical management of patients with MS.
outcome	These guidelines are intended to assist in the use of conventional MRI for the diagnosis and longitudinal monitoring of patients with MS.
outcome	In addition , they should provide a foundation for the development of more widespread but rational clinical applications of non-conventional MR-based techniques in studies of MS patients .

###11945138
background	The recent literature on the antinociceptive action of ionotropic glutamate receptor antagonists is reviewed with special emphasis on their clinical potential .
background	Actually the glutamatergic pathways descending from the brain stem into the spinal cord may generate analgesia .
background	However , physiologically more important is that glutamate and aspartate are apparently the main neurotransmitters along the ascending nociceptive pathways in the spinal cord .
background	Glutamate , aspartate and their receptors can be detected in particularly high concentrations in the dorsal root ganglia and the superficial laminae ( I , II ) of the spinal cord .
background	In low doses glutamate receptor antagonists only slightly elevate the threshold of the physiological pain sensation .
background	However , they suppress the process of pathological sensitisation i.e. lowering of the pain threshold seen upon excessive or lasting stimulation of C-fibre afferents , a process that takes place during inflammation or other kinds of tissue injury .
background	At electrophysiological level antagonists of both the NMDA - and AMPA/kainate receptors inhibit wind up i.e. lasting activation of the polymodal , second-order sensory neurones in the deeper layers of the dorsal horn .
background	During sensitisation the resting Mg ( + + ) blockade of transmembrane Ca ( + + ) channels is abolished , certain second messenger pathways are activated , the transcription of many genes is enhanced leading to overproduction of glutamate and other excitatory neurot
background	This cascade of events leads to increased excitability of the pain pathways .
background	NMDA antagonists are apparently more potent in experimental models of neuropathic pain , whereas AMPA antagonists are more effective in abolition of hyperalgesia seen during experimental inflammation .
background	Clinically , of the previously known NMDA antagonists amantadine , dextromethorphan and ketamine have been tested , the latter extensively .
background	Ketamine has been found quite active in certain cases of neuropathic pain and it reduced the opiate demand when used for postoperative analgesia .
background	However , in other types of clinical pain their efficacy is less convincing .
other	Not being registered there are no clinical data on the AMPA antagonists .
background	There are , however , some investigational new drugs and some novel compounds in the stage of preclinical development which antagonise the AMPA receptors in competitive fashion or allosterically .
background	Of the latter molecules 2,3-benzodiazepines are particularly promising .

###17299744
background	This review provides a comprehensive overview of the clinical uses of neuromuscular electrical stimulation ( NMES ) for functional and therapeutic applications in subjects with spinal cord injury or stroke .
intervention	Functional applications refer to the use of NMES to activate paralyzed muscles in precise sequence and magnitude to directly accomplish functional tasks .
outcome	In therapeutic applications , NMES may lead to a specific effect that enhances function , but does not directly provide function .
other	The specific neuroprosthetic or `` functional '' applications reviewed in this article include upper - and lower-limb motor movement for self-care tasks and mobility , respectively , bladder function , and respiratory control .
outcome	Specific therapeutic applications include motor relearning , reduction of hemiplegic shoulder pain , muscle strengthening , prevention of muscle atrophy , prophylaxis of deep venous thrombosis , improvement of tissue oxygenation and peripheral hemodynamic func
outcome	Perspectives on future developments and clinical applications of NMES are presented .

###16133744
background	Polyunsaturated fatty acids ( PUFAs ) modulate immune responses particularly by affecting T cell function and are applied clinically as adjuvant immunosuppressants in the treatment of various inflammatory diseases .
background	However , the molecular mechanisms of PUFA-induced immunosuppressive effects are not yet elucidated .

other	Lipid rafts were isolated by discontinuous sucrose density gradient ultracentrifugation .

###9300127
outcome	A cytotoxic factor ( CF ) appeared in murine serum after the intravenous injection of the dehydrogenation polymers ( DHPs ) of p-coumaric acid ( DHP-pCA ) , caffeic acid ( DHP-CA ) , and ferulic acid ( DHP-FA ) , which are categorized as a class of synthetic lignins .
outcome	The highest CF activity was observed 15 min after the i.v. injection of DHP-pCA .
background	CF is likely to be cytocidal through an apoptotic mechanism accompanied by nucleosome-sized DNA fragmentation .
background	CF is extractable with aqueous ethanol and highly stable against heat , proteases , and acid/alkali treatments .
outcome	The ethanol extract showed cytotoxicity toward various cultured cell lines and also ascites carcinoma cells in vivo .
outcome	The parent molecules DHPs did not show any appreciable cytotoxicity .
outcome	After the induction of CF activity , the activity quickly diminished and completely disappeared from the blood stream within an hour or so .
outcome	The cytotoxicity was observed only when the target cells were exposed to CF for longer than 10 h.

###16961082
background	Vertebral compression fractures ( VCFs ) result in severe and disabling pain , diminished quality of life , and substantial medical costs .
background	There exists no standard instrument with which to measure pain and functional status before and after treatment of VCFs .
population	A questionnaire was specifically developed to assess pain and disability in patients with VCFs before and after undergoing percutaneous polymethylmethacrylate-augmented vertebroplasty .
other	The first section of the baseline questionnaire ( before treatment ) contains 11 items that address the patient 's previous and current levels of back pain and distress .
other	The follow-up questionnaire ( after treatment ) is similar in format .
outcome	Among 72 vertebroplasty-treated patients , the internal consistency reliability of the 24 ADLs ranged from 0.87 to 0.98 , with similar results observed before and after treatment .
outcome	Correlations of 0.29 to 0.72 were observed among the 24 ADLs and the internal measures of pain and distress measured on both visual analog and adjectival scales .
outcome	Similar correlations ( range 0.35-0 .63 ) were observed between the questionnaire and 10 dimensions of the Oswestry Disability Index 's low-back pain questionnaire , an external instrument used to assess criterion-referenced validity .
outcome	Evidence in support of the validity of the questionnaire was present before and after treatment .
outcome	The Vertebral Compression Fracture Pain and Functional Disability Questionnaire appears to be a reliable and valid instrument for assessing back pain and functional ability in patients before and after treatment for VCFs .

###12433890
background	To determine tolerability and symptom changes associated with the introduction of bisoprolol treatment in older patients with heart failure .
study design	Prospective observational cohort study .
other	Geriatric medicine outpatient department of a university hospital .
population	51 patients ( mean age 78 years , range 70-89 years ) with stable symptomatic heart failure caused by left ventricular systolic dysfunction .
intervention	Bisoprolol tablets , 1.25-10 .0 mg .
other	Tolerability ; changes in symptoms and exercise tolerance .
outcome	69 % of patients tolerated bisoprolol .
outcome	Mean tolerated dose was 7.6 mg .
outcome	There was no change in symptoms or exercise capacity in those who tolerated bisoprolol .
outcome	Perceived health status and symptoms of anxiety and depression improved during the titration period .
outcome	The rate of withdrawal from bisoprolol treatment in older patients with congestive heart failure was twice that previously reported in younger patients .
outcome	The mean tolerated dose was similar to that found in trials reporting clinical efficacy .
outcome	There was no evidence of a negative impact on symptoms or exercise capacity in patients who tolerated bisoprolol .

###15278749
background	The purpose of this study was to investigate the effect of alendronate on metacarpal and lumbar bone mineral density ( BMD ) , bone resorption , and chronic back pain in postmenopausal women with osteoporosis .
population	Eighty postmenopausal women with osteoporosis , 59-88 years of age , were divided into two groups of 40 each according to the site of BMD measurement : the metacarpus ( M ) and the lumbar spine ( L ) .
intervention	All of them were treated with alendronate ( 5 mg/day ) for 12 months .
other	Metacarpal or lumbar BMD was measured by computed X-ray densitometry or dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry in the M or the L group , respectively , at baseline and every 6 months .
other	Urinary cross-linked N-terminal telopeptides of type I collagen ( NTX ) were measured by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay , and chronic back pain was evaluated by face scale score at baseline and every 6 months in both groups .
outcome	There were no significant differences in baseline characteristics , including age , body mass index , years since menopause , urinary NTX level , face scale score , or number of prevalent vertebral fractures per patient between the two groups .
outcome	Urinary NTX level was reduced and chronic back pain was improved similarly in both groups .
outcome	Whereas metacarpal BMD did not significantly change in the M group ( 0.20 % increase ) , lumbar BMD increased by 8.15 % in the L group .
outcome	These results suggest that although alendronate increases BMD of the lumbar spine , which is rich in cancellous bone , and improves chronic back pain , with suppression of bone resorption in postmenopausal women with osteoporosis , it may fail to increase cor

###1444769
background	Hip flexor spasticity , which is often associated with central nervous system ( CNS ) diseases , is a major impediment in rehabilitation .
background	In order to cope with this problem , lumbar nerve blocking techniques developed by Meelhuysen and major and minor psoas muscle blocking techniques developed by Awad have been used in combination with physical therapies .
background	Based on these techniques , we conducted major and minor psoas muscle phenol block ( motor point block or intramuscular nerve block ) under ultrasonic monitoring .
population	Phenol block was conducted in nine patients with cerebral infarction ( 13 blocking procedures ) and three with spinal cord injuries ( six blocking procedures ) while keeping them in a lateral position with the operation side upside .
other	The beginning of the femoral nerves and part of the lumbar artery were visualized by ultrasound in some patients .
outcome	As a result of the improvement of hip flexor spasticity , the range of hip joint motion ( determined by the Mundale technique , prone hip extension and Thomas test ) improved shortly after blocking .
outcome	When physical therapy was conducted after blocking , improvement of skin care management was observed in eight cases , ability to keep in a stable sitting position in nine , improvement of a standing posture in three , increases in the ability to walk in two
outcome	Although nerve block is reported to result in hematoma , decreases in muscle force , pain , cystic/rectal disorders and hypogonadism , we have observed no such complication in our patients .

###1829622
background	During the past year , investigations involving the etiology , diagnostic evaluation , and therapy of low back pain have reported interesting new data .
background	The natural history of degenerative intervertebral disk disease may be explained by peripheral annular fiber injury that results in damage to the nucleus pulposus .
background	Diurnal changes in patient clinical symptoms and signs may have a correlate in alteration of spinal mechanics that occurs during the course of a day .
background	The diagnostic evaluation of low back pain continues to be revolutionized by magnetic resonance imaging .
background	Although magnetic resonance imaging is able to detect specific lesions with greater sensitivity than other radiographic techniques , correlation between clinical symptoms and signs and anatomic abnormalities is essential for correct diagnosis .
background	Therapeutic controversies continue concerning the efficacy of chiropractic intervention and transcutaneous electric nerve stimulation for low back pain patients .
background	Microsurgical techniques for disk removal may prove to be associated with less morbidity than diskectomy with laminectomy , but require additional study .

###11926327
background	An interactive data management ( IDM ) system for the Spinal Cord Injury ( SCI ) Service was developed to collect self-reported patient data related to secondary medical complications and to provide feedback to the SCI rehabilitation team .
background	The long-term objective is to improve clinical care through a process of staff review of current rehabilitation programs in the areas of prevalence , prevention , and management .
population	Based on data from the first 99 SCI patients visiting the clinic and hospital after the installation of the IDM system , SCI patients reported high rates of current problems with spasticity ( 53 percent ) , pain ( 44 percent ) , and pressure ulcers ( 38 percent ) .
other	Respiratory ( 12 percent ) and bowel ( 14 percent ) problems were less common current problems .
other	The SCI staff questioned the reportedly high spasticity rates .
outcome	They thought that the patients ' answers might have indicated simply the occurrence of spasticity , rather than the more important issue of severe spasticity that interferes with daily activities .
outcome	The staff suggested several additional spasticity questions to add to the study .
outcome	In other areas , only a small percentage of patients wanted to talk with a therapist about prevention of pressure ulcers .
outcome	Patients who had urinary problems consistently reported five urinary signs ( e.g. , cloudy urine ) .
outcome	The clinical staff found these data informative and stated that they should continue to be collected .

###10325286
background	Here we report the first case of prenatally diagnosed fetal renal mesoblastic nephroma occurring after transfer of a cryopreserved embryo .
background	A 37 year old woman , having immunological infertility , was treated by in-vitro fertilization ( IVF ) and embryo transfer .
other	Following unsuccessful IVF using fresh embryos , the patient conceived after transfer of cryopreserved-thawed embryos .
background	The chromosomal analysis identified a normal karyotype at 16 weeks ' gestation when amniocentesis was performed .
background	The pregnancy course was uneventful until 28 weeks ' gestation when polyhydramnios associated with fetal renal tumour was detected using ultrasonography .
outcome	A male infant weighing 2564 g was born via Caesarean section at 34 weeks ' gestation .
outcome	A left nephrectomy was performed 5 days after delivery and the tumour was identified histologically as a mesoblastic nephroma .
outcome	The postoperative course was uncomplicated to this point .

###18849799
background	With the advent of holo-body computed tomography scanning of trauma patients , the radiologic diagnosis of transverse process fractures ( TPF ) has increased .
other	The significance of this fracture has not been elucidated .
background	Spine service ( neurosurgical or orthopedic ) consultation is frequently requested for patients with these fractures , stressing constraints on these practices .
other	We hypothesize that isolated transverse process fractures ( iTPF ) are structurally and neurologically stable injuries , which do not require spine service intervention .
study design	Patients for this retrospective , institutional review board-approved study were identified by reviewing the daily neurosurgical census from July 2004 to February 2007 .
population	Data were collected by chart review on all patients with TPF-grouped into isolated fractures ( iTPF ) and fractures with other associated spinal injuries ( aTPF ) .
other	Other parameters evaluated included fracture location , other spinal injuries , nonspinal injuries , mechanical stability , neurologic findings , pain , and treatment ( surgical stabilization or decompression or bracing or both ) .
other	Eighty-four patients with one or more TPF were identified-47 with iTPF and 37 with aTPF .
outcome	All iTPF and aTPF patients were found to be neurologically intact .
outcome	No patients with iTPF required surgery or bracing for spinal stability , but 4 aTPF needed surgery and 18 aTPF required bracing with a total of 22 requiring neurosurgical intervention ( p < 0.0001 ) .
outcome	However , none of these patients received treatment for the TPF .
outcome	Twenty-five patients had associated abdominal injuries ( 16 of 46 iTPF , 9 of 37 aTPF , p = 0.3335 ) .
outcome	iTPF are not associated with neurologic deficit or structural instability requiring spine service intervention .
outcome	Therefore , conservative management without neurosurgical or orthopedic consultation is appropriate .
outcome	When TPF are identified , diligence in searching for other spinal injuries or abdominal injuries should be exercised , as these associated injuries occur frequently .

###16050925
background	To examine the performance of two widely used outcome measures in public adult mental health services .
population	As part of a larger study , clinical staff in eight New Zealand District Health Board areas collected consumer outcomes data for a period of 6 months .
other	Among other measures , the Health of the Nation Outcome Scales ( HoNOS ) and Life Skills Profile ( LSP-16 ) were completed at the start and end of episodes of care , as well as at 90-day reviews .
outcome	The performance of these two measures was examined in relation to compliance with the data collection protocol , item completion rates , certain psychometric properties , the relationship between them and the relationship of each instrument to the age , sex ,
outcome	Compliance with the HoNOS was superior to the LSP-16 , but the reverse was true for completion .
outcome	The two instruments were strongly correlated , but not enough to suggest that one may substitute for the other .
outcome	A five-subscale structure for the HoNOS was supported .
outcome	Certain HoNOS subscales were associated with age , but the total score was not , and differences between the sexes were small .
outcome	Some large diagnostic differences were observed on both instruments .
outcome	All LSP-16 summary scores and all HoNOS summary scores apart from Depression were higher ( worse ) in involuntary episodes .
outcome	Only one LSP-16 item , relating to work potential , was related to age and men generally scored higher ( worse ) than women .
outcome	From a technical perspective , the HoNOS and LSP-16 appear suitable for routine collection .
outcome	New Zealand has adopted the HoNOS for routine use but not the LSP-16 because of local concerns about its appropriateness and acceptability .
outcome	The clinician-rated measures reported here need to be complemented by both consumer-rated and family/carer measures .

###1627411
background	Vertebral compression fractures ( VCFs ) may be defined radiographically or as a clinical event .
background	The prevalence of these fractures in women aged 50 and over has been estimated at 26 % when defined as a reduction in vertebral height greater than 15 % .
background	Retrospective reviews of case records have shown a clinical detection rate of VCF in white women of 153/100 ,000 person years .
background	Of these clinically detected VCFs , 84 % were associated with pain .
background	VCF may be defined as a clinical event characterised by loss of height and acute pain .
background	The pain of acute fracture usually lasts 4 to 6 weeks with intense pain at the site of fracture .
background	Chronic pain may also occur in patients with multiple compression fractures , height loss and low bone density but is probably due to structural changes or osteoarthritis .
background	Radiographic VCF may not be symptomatic .
background	The greater the deformity , the greater the likelihood of pain and disability .
background	As height is lost , patients experience discomfort from the rib cage pressing downward on the pelvis .
background	Patients develop a thoracic kyphosis , a lumbar lordosis , and a protuberant abdomen with prominent horizontal skinfold creases .
background	The reduced thoracic space may result in decreased exercise tolerance and reduced abdominal space may give rise to early satiety and weight loss .
background	Sleep disorders may also occur .
background	Patients lose self esteem .
background	Self care may become difficult .
background	They are often depressed .
background	They become fearful of further fracture .
background	They have distorted body image and poor health perception .
background	Patients with one vertebral fracture are at increased risk of peripheral fracture and further vertebral fracture .
background	( ABSTRACT TRUNCATED AT 250 WORDS )

###12611838
background	Antenatal depression is a significant risk factor for postpartum depression , with a 10 % -12 % prevalence in all pregnancies .
background	Rates of depression are higher for pregnant women with chronic stressors , financial and housing problems , and inadequate social support .
background	Despite the prevalence and associated family and infant morbidity , there are no controlled clinical treatment trials regarding this topic , to the authors ' knowledge .
background	APA has identified treatment of depression during pregnancy as a priority for clinical guidelines .
study design	A 16-week bilingual controlled clinical trial compared a group receiving interpersonal psychotherapy for antepartum depression to a parenting education control program .
population	Fifty outpatient antepartum women who met DSM-IV criteria for major depressive disorder were randomly assigned to interpersonal psychotherapy or a didactic parenting education program .
other	Thirty-eight women remained in the study and were included in the data analysis .
other	Depressed mood was measured with the Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale , the Beck Depression Inventory , and the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale .
other	The Clinical Global Impression ( CGI ) and the Hamilton depression scale measured recovery .
outcome	The interpersonal psychotherapy treatment group showed significant improvement compared to the parenting education control program on all three measures of mood at termination .
outcome	Recovery criteria were met in 60 % of the women treated with interpersonal psychotherapy , according to a CGI score of < or = 2 .
outcome	In addition , there was a significant correlation between maternal mood and mother-infant interaction .
outcome	Interpersonal psychotherapy is an effective method of antidepressant treatment during pregnancy and should be a first-line treatment in the hierarchy of treatment for antepartum depression .

###12465733
background	Acute pancreatitis can result in pancreatic ischaemia and necrosis .
background	Pancreatic duct ( PD ) obstruction may be the first step causing ischaemia in acute pancreatitis .
background	Nitric oxide donors can attenuate acute pancreatitis through improvement in compromised pancreatic perfusion ( PP ) .
other	In this study , we determined if ( 1 ) PD obstruction altered PP and ( 2 ) PD decompression or L-arginine administration reversed this change .
population	Fifteen Australian possums were randomly assigned to two groups :
intervention	Animals in group A ( n = 6 ) were subjected to 30 min of PD obstruction and 60 min of PD decompression .
intervention	Animals in group B ( n = 9 ) were subjected to 120 min PD ligation and 60 min PD decompression .
intervention	A subset group B ( n = 6 ) were subjected to intravenous L-arginine ( 100 microg/kg ) at the end of 120 min of ligation and at the end of PD decompression .
other	The PP ( Laser Doppler fluxmetry ) , PD pressure and blood pressure were continuously monitored .
outcome	PD pressure increased from 2.9 + / - 2.5 to 18.1 + / - 4.9 mmHg following PD ligation .
outcome	PP was reduced to 67.1 % + / - 4.5 % ( P < 0.01 ) and 46.2 % + / - 7.5 % ( P < 0.001 ) of baseline following 30 and 120 min of PD ligation , respectively .
outcome	Following 60 min of PD decompression , PP was restored to 89.1 % + / - 13.4 % ( P < 0.02 ) of the baseline in the 30-min group .
outcome	However , following 120 min PD ligation , PP remained depressed .
outcome	L-arginine administration after 120 min of PD ligation transiently increased PP from 46.2 % + / - 7.5 % to 81.1 % + / - 8.6 % ( P < 0.03 ) of baseline .
outcome	This effect was reproduced if L-arginine was administered at the end of decompression ( P < 0.05 ) .
outcome	In patients with acute pancreatitis due to obstructive causes , early decompression of the PD may prevent early pancreatic ischaemia .

###1493344
background	To assess the efficacy of acute intrathecal ( i.t. ) baclofen on chronic , dysesthetic , and spasm-related pain ( SRP ) among patients with spinal spasticity [ i.e. , multiple sclerosis ( MS ) , spinal cord injury ( SCI ) , transverse myelitis ( TMy ) ] .
study design	Double-blind , randomized , and placebo ( vehicle ) controlled trials ( n = 7 ) , and nonrandomized , nonblinded trials ( n = 2 ) .
other	In-patient program at Samaritan Rehabilitation Institute , Phoenix , Arizona , U.S.A.
population	INT
other	Electromyographic ( EMG ) activity ; intravesical and intraurethral pressures ; Ashworth Scale and tendon response values ; visual analog scales for describing dysesthetic pain intensity ; and threshold/EMG relationships after controlled pinch as an indication of nociceptive pain .
outcome	i.t. baclofen ( a ) caused marked reduction of segmental reflexes before suppression of intersegmental reflexes ; ( b ) significantly suppressed dysesthetic pain and SRP with temporal dissociation ; and ( 3 ) did not influence pinch-induced and musculoskeletal ( l
outcome	The suppressive action of i.t. baclofen on spontaneous and evoked ( allodynia ) dysesthetic pain suggests that a dysfunctional spinal gamma-aminobutyric acidB receptor system , including functional supersensitivity , is associated with the phenomenon of centr
outcome	Temporal dissociation regarding the action on dysesthetic pain and SRP suggests that disparate central mechanisms subserve the two clinical states .

###7575212
population	A prospective study was designed to follow patients with syndromes of brain stem during 12 months ( in 1991-1992 ) .
background	The aim was to correlate clinical and radiologic findings and comparing them with the classical descriptions of brain stem syndromes .
other	Twenty one consecutive patients were admitted at the Hospital de Base do Distrito Federal .
other	The diagnosis and the follow up were carried out by neurological examination and neuroradiologic images CT ( 100 % ) , angiography ( 24 % , 5 ) and MRI ( 5 % , 1 ) .
outcome	Hypertension and old age were the most important risk factors and hemorrhage at pons with extension to midbrain was the most frequent finding .
outcome	Coma at admission was associated to a poor outcome .
outcome	The outcome was defined by the Glasgow Outcome Scale : 28 % rated 5 , 24 % rated 4 , 5 % rated 3 , 28 % rated 2 and 14 % rated 1 .
outcome	Our results show that the clinical presentation of ischemic strokes and hemorrhages of the brain stem very frequently follow a mixed pattern , which do not conciliate with the classical of these syndromes .

###16940876

background	The predominant reason for total proctocolectomy is for symptoms refractory to currently available medical therapy .
background	Less common reasons are dysplasia or cancer .
background	The goal of colectomy is to prevent recurrence of systemic inflammatory disease .
intervention	Consequently , surgery with total proctocolectomy and creation of an ileal J-pouch-anal anastomosis has become the procedure of choice for many patients without other therapeutic options .
outcome	Health-related quality of life ( QOL ) in patients with severe ulcerative colitis is so poor that , after ileal J-pouch-anal anastomosis , QOL is considered to improve in most clinical studies ( 8 studies , improved QOL ; 1 study , no change ; 1 study , QOL worse t
