outcome	Thus , despite the availability of ileal J-pouch-anal anastomosis , surgery does not always restore all aspects of QOL to normal .

###12109610
background	Mechanical bowel preparation before colonic surgery is widely advocated but remains controversial .
background	Recent guidelines published by the Clinical Standards Board for Scotland recommend mechanical bowel preparation prior to surgery for all colorectal cancers but this may be inappropriate .
intervention	This study examines the outcome of a policy of no mechanical preparation before elective right hemicolectomy .
population	Data on 102 consecutive patients undergoing elective right or extended right hemicolectomy for colonic adenocarcinoma were extracted from a prospective database .
outcome	No clinical anastomotic leaks were observed .
outcome	Two patients developed wound infections and one patient died with no autopsy evidence of anastomotic leak .
outcome	Mechanical bowel preparation can safely be omitted prior to right hemicolectomy in patients with colonic cancer .

###6690756
population	A total of 27 men with multiple sclerosis underwent urodynamic evaluation as part of a prospective study of voiding dysfunction .
other	Of 18 patients with detrusor-external sphincter dyssynergia 9 suffered serious urologic complications , including repeated episodes of urosepsis , vesicoureteral reflux and urolithiasis .
outcome	None of the 9 patients without dyssynergia suffered any urologic complications .
outcome	Urologic complications were correlated highly to the presence of detrusor-external sphincter dyssynergia and the severity of multiple sclerosis but not to duration of multiple sclerosis , age of the patient or type of dyssynergia .
outcome	Although no treatment was without complications it appears that either anticholinergics plus intermittent self-catheterization or condom catheter drainage is superior to an indwelling catheter for initial conservative treatment .
outcome	External sphincterotomy or urinary diversion may be necessary if conservative therapy fails .

###16185161
background	The potential use of nicotinic acetylcholine receptor agonists has been the subject of a number of recent reviews .
background	Despite the promises of better things to come , few new compounds have been identified that circumvent the issues hindering the widespread use of the previously described nicotinic analgesics , mainly a narrow therapeutic window between analgesic efficacy a
background	However , several recent developments have potentially opened new windows of opportunity in the use of nicotinic agents for analgesia .
outcome	A small number of laboratories have reported that peripheral nerve injury alters the pharmacology of nicotinic receptors , resulting in a leftward shift of analgesic potency but not of toxicity .
outcome	Another important development in the pathophysiology of neuropathic pain is the reliance of nerve injury-induced behavioural hypersensitivity on both peripheral and central neural immune interactions .
outcome	Finally , the reported neuroprotective effects of nicotine following spinal cord injury may provide an opportunity for the development of selective nicotinic agonists that are capable of attenuating chronic pain .
outcome	The current review will attempt to highlight these recent developments and outline key findings that demonstrate further opportunity for the development of nicotinic agonists as novel analgesics .

###7782272
background	Generalized and specific social phobias are common , chronic , and potentially debilitating conditions .
background	In recent years , there have been major advances in the pharmacotherapy of social phobia ; efficacy has become better established for a diverse group of medications .
background	Controlled studies have shown substantial benefit from monamine oxidase inhibitors , both irreversible ( phenelzine ) and reversible ( brofaromine and moclobemide ) .
background	The serotonin selective reuptake inhibitor antidepressants have shown promise in case reports , uncontrolled studies , and double-blind trials ( fluvoxamine and sertraline ) .
background	The benzodiazepines have been extensively used to treat social phobia , although only recently has a controlled , double-blind study confirmed efficacy ( clonazepam ) .
background	The beta-adrenergic receptor blockers have been widely used on an as needed basis to treat specific social phobia ( i.e. , performance anxiety ) , although their value in generalized social phobia has not been convincing .
background	Finally , pharmacologic approaches to social phobia must take into consideration the common coexistence of other psychiatric conditions .

###10468325
background	For the past decade , the role of noradrenaline in depression has been somewhat neglected in favour of serotonin .
background	This is largely because of the advent of the selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors , which have facilitated clinical and experimental observation of the roles of serotonin .
background	Until now , no such tools have been available to study the noradrenergic system .
background	However , the recent development of reboxetine , the first selective noradrenaline reuptake inhibitor , has allowed clinical investigation of the role of the noradrenergic system in different aspects of depressive disorders .
outcome	In clinical trials , the use of reboxetine has shown that selective noradrenaline reuptake inhibition is an effective approach to alleviating depression .
outcome	It is more effective than placebo and at least as effective as desipramine , imipramine and fluoxetine in the short term .
outcome	In addition , its efficacy is maintained in patients with severe depression and in those receiving long-term maintenance treatment .
outcome	Reboxetine is very well tolerated , as predicted from its pharmacological profile , having fewer anticholinergic side-effects than imipramine or desipramine .
outcome	Compared with fluoxetine , patients treated with reboxetine experienced less nausea and sexual dysfunction , adverse events that are common among those taking selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors .
outcome	Adverse events predicted by the neuroanatomy of the noradrenergic system , such as tremor and cardiovascular effects , occurred less frequently than expected .
outcome	Clinical experience with reboxetine challenges our current knowledge of the role of noradrenaline in depression and questions existing evidence based on studies with noradrenergic tricyclic antidepressants .
outcome	Selective noradrenaline reuptake inhibition , as exemplified by reboxetine , therefore offers a significant improvement in antidepressant pharmacotherapy , and an opportunity to increase our understanding of the role of noradrenaline in depression .

###17297315
background	Osmotic agents are widely used to lower elevated intracranial pressure ( ICP ) .
background	However , little data are available regarding cerebral oxygenation and metabolism in the traumatized brains studied under clinical conditions .
population	The present prospective , open-labeled clinical study was designed to investigate whether administration of mannitol , with the aim of reducing moderate intracranial hypertension , improves cerebral metabolism and oxygenation in patients after severe traumat
population	Multimodal cerebral monitoring ( MCM ) , consisting of intraparenchymal ICP , tissue oxygenation ( ptiO2 ) , and micro dialysis measurements was initiated in six male TBI patients ( mean age 45 years ; Glasgow Coma Scale score < 9 ) .
intervention	A total of 14 mannitol boli ( 20 % , 0.5 g/kg , 20 minutes infusion time ) were administered to treat ICP exceeding 20 mm Hg ( 2.7 kPa ) .
other	Temporal alterations determined by MCM after mannitol infusions were recorded for 120 minutes .
other	Microdialysates were assayed immediately for extracellular glucose , lactate , pyruvate , and glutamate concentrations .
outcome	Elevated ICP was successfully treated in all cases .
outcome	This effect was maximal 40 minutes after start of infusion ( 25 + / - 6 mm Hg [ 3.3 + / - 0.8 kPa ] to 17 + / - 3 mm Hg [ 2.3 + / - 0.4 kPa ] , p < 0.05 ) and lasted up to 100 minutes .
outcome	Cerebral ptiO2 remained unaffected ( 21 + / - 5 mm Hg [ 2.8 + / - 0.7 kPa ] to 23 + / - 6 mm Hg [ 3.1 + / - 0.8 kPa ] , n.s. ) .
outcome	Microdialysate concentrations of all analytes rose unspecifically by 10 % to 40 % from baseline , reaching maximum concentrations 40 to 60 minutes after start of the infusion .
outcome	Mannitol efficiently reduces increased ICP .
outcome	At an ICP of up to 30 mm Hg [ 4 kPa ] it does not affect cerebral oxygenation .
outcome	Unspecific increases of extracellular fluid metabolites can be explained by transient osmotic dehydration .
outcome	Additional mechanisms , such as increased cerebral perfusion and blood volume , might explain an accelerated return to baseline .

study design	The objective of this review was to assess the effects of nutrient administration for suspected fetal growth impairment on fetal growth and perinatal outcome .

###15763777
background	Postmenopausal bleeding ( PMB ) accounts for about 5 % of all office gynaecology visits .
background	The causes of PMB are varied .
background	Many women with endometrial cancer present with this symptom .
background	Although many investigations are described , the most appropriate approach is often unclear .
background	In a patient with no obvious local cause , the emphasis should be on uterine and adnexal evaluation .
background	Based on a literature review , the evidence favours a conservative approach if the endometrial thickness ( ET ) is < 4mm , unless there are risk factors .
outcome	All patients with ET 4 mm should have outpatient endometrial sampling .
outcome	If this is unsuccessful , then outpatient hysteroscopy with directed biopsy or inpatient hysteroscopy is favoured .
outcome	The role of ancillary investigations are described .

###17968166
other	To evaluate comparative outcome between adjuvant postoperative chemoradiotherapy ( postoperative CRT ) and lateral pelvic lymph node dissection ( LPLD ) following total mesorectal excision ( TME ) in rectal cancer patients .
background	Although TME results in lower rate of locoregional recurrence compared with conventional surgery , these 2 treatment modalities following TME have not adequately been appraised until the present trend of preoperative chemoradiotherapy .
population	Between 1995 and 2000 , patients with stage II and III rectal cancer underwent TME plus postoperative CRT ( n = 309 ) or LPLD ( n = 176 ) .
intervention	Patients in the postoperative CRT group received 8 cycles of 5-fluorouracil plus leucovorin and 45 Gy pelvic radiotherapy .
intervention	Patients in the LPLD group underwent lateral lymph node dissection outside the pelvic plexus .
outcome	The 5-year overall and disease-free survival rates were 78.3 % and 67.3 % in the postoperative CRT group , respectively , and 73.9 % and 68.6 % in the LPLD group , respectively , without significant differences between these groups .
outcome	Patients in the LPLD group with stage III lower rectal cancer had a locoregional recurrence rate 2.2-fold greater than those in the postoperative CRT group ( 16.7 % vs. 7.5 % , P = 0.044 ) .
outcome	Multivariate analysis showed that APR and advanced T-category ( T4 ) were significantly associated with locoregional recurrence , whereas lymph node metastases , high preoperative serum carcinoembryonic antigen , and APR were significantly associated with shor
outcome	Postoperative-CRT and LPLD following TME resulted in comparable survival rates , but the locoregional recurrence rate was higher in the LPLD group .
outcome	These findings suggest that initial surgery is appropriate for rectal cancer patients who are candidates for low anterior resection without extensive local disease ( T1-T3 ) , regardless of lymph node status .

###16643969
background	A number of studies have now documented that traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) is associated with deficits in the recognition of basic emotions , the capacity to infer mental states of others ( theory of mind ) , as well as executive functioning .
background	However , no study to date has investigated the relationship between these three constructs in the context of TBI .
population	In the current study TBI participants ( N = 16 ) were compared with demographically matched healthy controls ( N = 17 ) .
outcome	It was found that TBI participants ' recognition of basic emotions , as well as their capacity for mental state attribution , was significantly reduced relative to controls .
outcome	Performance on both of these measures was strongly correlated in the healthy control , but not in the TBI sample .
outcome	In contrast , in the TBI ( but not the control ) sample , theory of mind was substantially correlated with performance on phonemic fluency , a measure of executive functioning considered to impose particular demands upon cognitive flexibility and self-regulati
outcome	These results are consistent with other evidence indicating that deficits in some aspects of executive functioning may at least partially underlie deficits in social cognition following TBI , and thus help explain the prevalence of social dysfunction in TB

###15307975
background	Endometriosis is a common clinical disorder in women and usually presents with pelvic pain , infertility , or adnexal masses secondary to intracystic hemorrhage with the formation of an endometrioma .
background	Endometriosis shares certain characteristics with malignant neoplasms , and malignant ovarian tumours have been documented in women with endometriosis .
background	Endometriosis-associated ovarian cancer ( EAOC ) usually occurs in younger women , has favourable outcomes , and appears as either a low-grade tumour of endometrioid cell type or as a clear cell tumour .
background	As it has been suggested that the pathologic features of `` atypical endometriosis '' may constitute a precancerous state , women with atypical endometriosis may be at an increased risk of developing EAOC .
background	There are no prospective randomized trials assessing treatment regimens for EAOC .
background	Most women receive treatment similar to other epithelial ovarian cancers .
background	However , women with EAOC represent a subgroup of patients that may require different therapeutic options .

###10796521
background	Audit and feedback has been identified as having the potential to change the practice of health care professionals .
other	To assess the effects of audit and feedback compared with other interventions in changing health professional practice and to assess whether the effectiveness of audit and feedback can be improved by modifying how it is done .
other	We searched MEDLINE up to June 1997 , the Research and Development Resource Base in Continuing Medical Education , and reference lists of related systematic reviews and articles .
intervention	Randomised trials of audit and feedback ( defined as any summary of clinical performance of health care over a specified period of time ) compared with other interventions .
population	The participants were health care providers responsible for patient care .
other	Two reviewers independently extracted data and assessed study quality .
other	Twelve studies were included involving more than 2194 physicians .
outcome	Seven trials with direct comparisons were included .
outcome	The targeted behaviours were the management of low haemoglobin , the delivery of preventive care services ( two studies ) , the management of high cholesterol , the performance of cervical smears , and the ordering of diagnostic tests ( two studies ) .
outcome	From the results of four trials , there is little evidence of a measurable effect of adding a complementary intervention such as a local consensus process to audit and feedback compared to audit and feedback alone .
outcome	Two of three trials that compared audit and feedback to reminders reported that reminders were more effective in improving the delivery of some preventive services .
outcome	It is not possible to recommend a complementary intervention to enhance the effectiveness of audit and feedback .
outcome	Reminders might be more effective than audit and feedback to improve the delivery of some preventive services but the results are not striking .
outcome	Few trials have investigated the effect of varying different characteristics of the audit and feedback process .
outcome	Consideration should be given to testing the effects of modifying important characteristics such as the content , source , timing , recipient and format .

###12971714
background	To describe pain and associated variables in a prevalence group of persons with a sustained spinal cord injury ( SCI ) in the Swedish capital and its surroundings .
other	Spinalis SCI Unit ( outpatient clinic ) , Stockholm , Sweden .
other	Assessment over a 12-month period in a yearly health control .
population	Four hundred and fifty-six SCI patients .
outcome	Two hundred and ninety-one out of 456 SCI patients ( 63.7 % ) suffered from pain , and in 45.7 % of these it was classified as being neurogenic .
outcome	Aching pain was the most used descriptor ( 38.5 % ) .
outcome	The onset of pain was commonly within three months ( 73.5 % ) .
outcome	In 70.4 % of patients pain occurred below the level of the lesion .
outcome	Most patients identified pain as coming from one ( 55.0 % ) or two ( 28.2 % ) body regions .
outcome	Rating of the general pain intensity on a visual analogue scale ( VAS ) was 46 out of 100 and rating of the worst pain intensity was 78 out of 100 .
outcome	Ninety-four out of 276 patients ( 32.3 % ) considered that their quality of life was significantly affected by pain .
outcome	Pain was most common in patients with incomplete lesions ( ASIA impairment grade D ) and there was a correlation between pain and higher mean age at injury and between pain and female gender .

###8170754
background	Substantial research shows less favorable body-image experiences among overweight and obese persons relative to persons of average weight .
population	The purpose of this investigation of body image was to compare 102 enrollees in a commercial , very-low-calorie diet program to 258 age - and weight-matched control subjects .
outcome	Whereas enrollees were more strongly invested in their physical appearance , they held a more disparaging view of their looks .
outcome	Relative to the control group , enrollees also felt less healthy , yet their evaluation of and investment in their physical fitness were more positive .
outcome	Obese persons constitute a heterogeneous population , and those who seek rapid and extensive weight loss in commercial programs may have special body-image concerns and needs .

###11148409
background	A 47-year-old woman presented with a rare case of epidural hematoma of the clivus .
background	The patient had bilateral occipital condyle fractures ( a comminuted fracture on the right side , an avulsion fracture on left side and a lower clivus fracture ) .
background	On admission the patient was tetraparetic with left abducens palsy .
background	Preoperative imaging showed no atlanto-axial or occipito-atlantal dislocation .
other	The patient was operated with a posterior approach .
intervention	An occipital craniectomy with C1 laminectomy was achieved without atlanto-occipital fusion .
outcome	Two years after the trauma , the patient had mild left hemiparesis but was able to walk normally .
outcome	Head motion was normal , but just mildly decreased by pain in flexion and extension .
outcome	Imaging control did not show any occipito-atlantal instability .
outcome	We describe the imaging features allowing precise diagnosis and discuss the management of a rare entity : bilateral occipital condyle fractures and epidural hematoma of the clivus .

###2380621
population	Twenty-three consecutive patients presenting for in vitro fertilization were evaluated with transvaginal sonography on cycle day 3 , prior to initiating ovarian hyperstimulation .
population	Three of these patients were noted to have large ovarian cysts .
intervention	All three underwent transvaginal aspiration of the cysts , followed immediately by initiation of ovarian hyperstimulation .
outcome	Following oocyte retrieval , in vitro fertilization , and embryo transfer , all three women achieved pregnancy .
outcome	We conclude that cyst aspiration is not contraindicated when an ovarian cyst is encountered in the follicular phase of an in vitro fertilization cycle .

###8678767
background	To compare the accuracy of whole-body position emission tomography ( PET ) using [ 18F ] fluorodeoxyglucose ( FDG ) with conventional radiological imaging techniques in identifying operable colorectal cancer metastases to the liver .
study design	A double-blind comparative study of FDG-PET as the criterion standard vs conventional radiological imaging methods as the criterion standard , in staging of recurrent colorectal cancer .
other	Institutional practice in a tertiary referral center .
population	Thirty-four consecutive patients with suspected colorectal cancer metastases recruited for the study between May 1993 and October 1994 .
intervention	Conventional radiological methods of cancer staging included abdominal computed tomography ( CT ) ( n = 34 ) , chest x-rays ( n = 15 ) , and chest CT ( n = 19 ) to evaluate extrahepatic disease .
other	Twenty-seven patients were subsequently considered to have apparently isolated cancer metastases to the liver .
intervention	Anatomical resectability was assessed by magnetic resonance imaging ( n = 24 ) or CT angiography ( n = 3 ) in all study patients .
intervention	The FDG-PET studies ( n = 34 ) were performed within 8 weeks of conventional radiological imaging .
other	Malignancy of suspected lesions detected by means of FDG-PET and conventional radiological imaging was confirmed by histopathologic examination of resected specimens and percutaneous biopsy specimens and by serial CT scans demonstrating progression of disease .
outcome	Unsuspected extrahepatic malignant disease that was missed by conventional radiological imaging was detected by FDG-PET in 11 patients ( 32 % ) .
outcome	The PET-detected extrahepatic malignant disease included retroperitoneal nodal metastases ( n = 6 ) , pulmonary metastases ( n = 3 ) , and locoregional cancer recurrences ( n = 2 ) .
outcome	The additional information afforded by PET consequently had an influence on the clinical management in 10 patients ( 29 % ) .
outcome	The FDG-PET method enabled selection of patients with apparently curable colorectal cancer metastases to the liver for hepatic resection .

###15997638
background	BioMarine 570 is well tolerated agent supporting the innate immunity .
background	It was isolated from Greenland shark liver .
other	To evaluate the effect of BioMarine .
population	The 10 healthy , randomly chosen volunteers are included to the protocol .
intervention	Volunteers are given 9 capsules of BioMarine a day for 30 days .
other	The clinical and laboratory parameters were analyzed before and after the treatment .
other	The following innate immunity parameters were analyzed C1q , C3 C4 and CH50 of complement level , CD4/CD8 ratio , Th1/Th2 cytokine polarization , reactive oxygen intermediates production ( ROI ) .
outcome	Clinically no side effects were noted .
outcome	BioMarine intake has increased the C1q level , increase CD4/CD8 ratio from 1.3 to 1.8 and polarized Th1/Th2 lymphocyte cytokine secretion towards Th1 .
outcome	The modulation of ROI production by neutrophils was also noted .
outcome	BioMarine has no affect on CD4 + CD25 + regulatory lymphocytes .
outcome	Concluding BioMarine is save , effective and innate immunity supporting agent , can be effectively applied in people with disturbed immune system as harmless and effective agent normalizing the immune imbalance .

###15944171
background	To report preliminary efficacy data from a Web-based family problem-solving intervention to improve parent and child adaptation .
population	Eight parents and six children with moderate to severe traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) who were injured more than 15 months earlier ( M = 16 months ) participated in the intervention .
intervention	Families were given computers , Web cameras , and high-speed Internet access .
intervention	Weekly videoconferences with the therapist were conducted after they completed self-guided Web exercises on problem-solving , communication , and antecedent behavior management strategies .
outcome	Paired t tests comparing pre - and post-intervention scores revealed significant improvements in injury-related burden , parental psychiatric symptoms , depression , and parenting stress .
outcome	There were also significant reductions in antisocial behaviors in the injured child , but not in self-reported depressive symptoms .
outcome	These findings suggest that a computer-based intervention may successfully be used to improve both parent and child outcomes following TBI in children .

###2151984
population	Conservative management of 54 patients with thoracolumbar ( T12 and/or L1 ) burst fractures was investigated .
other	The fractures were subdivided according to the Denis classification and a modification was suggested .
outcome	Most type A and B fractures showed good results regarding reduction and neurological improvement .
outcome	However , severe type B ( with anterior column compression and spinal canal narrowing exceeding 50 % ) , D , and E fractures were to a large extent complicated by intractable low back pain , neurological involvement , and signs of instability .
outcome	This study suggests predictors for complications in patients with burst fractures in the thoracolumbar junction .
outcome	These are ( a ) compression rate of the anterior column exceeding 50 % , ( b ) narrowing of the spinal canal exceeding 50 % , ( c ) signs of rotational malalignment in fracture level , and ( d ) level of the injury ( L1 fractures ) .

###9392045
population	The outcome in terms of health-related quality of life ( HRQL ) in pediatric spinal cord injury ( SCI ) was studied in 36 adults who had sustained an SCI in childhood .
other	The patients were interviewed and clinically examined .
intervention	HRQL was assessed with the 15D , a generic fifteen-dimensional self-administered HRQL instrument .
background	The 15 multiple-level dimensions are moving , seeing , hearing , breathing , sleeping , eating , communicating , urinary continence , working , social participation , mental functioning , pain , depression , distress and perceived health .
background	The respondents choose , for each dimension , the level that best describe their health status .
background	In the 15D valuation system the respondents first assign a relative importance weight to each dimension and then a relative value to the levels on each dimension .
background	To derive the 15D HRQL score on a 0-1 scale the level values and importance weights are multiplied and combined with the levels chosen .
outcome	The average HRQL score of this SCI group was significantly lower than that measured in the population sample .
outcome	The average importance weights assigned by the SCI group differed significantly ( P < 0.05 ) from those assigned by the general population on several dimensions .
outcome	The weights assigned by the SCI group were higher for the dimensions of mental functioning , communicating , social participation and seeing and lower for moving , working , sleeping and eating .
outcome	These differences in valuing the dimensions of HRQL can influence behaviour and should therefore be taken into consideration in rehabilitation .

###15093636
background	To compare the safety and efficacy of the Surodex dexamethasone anterior segment drug delivery system ( Oculex Pharmaceuticals , Inc. ) and dexamethasone 0.1 % eyedrops ( Maxidex ) in patients with inflammation after cataract surgery .
other	Cataract Service , Department of Ophthalmology , Lothian University Hospitals , Edinburgh , United Kingdom .
population	This comparative single-masked parallel-group study comprised 1 eye of 19 patients having phacoemulsification cataract extraction and posterior chamber intraocular lens implantation .
intervention	The Surodex group had the dexamethasone drug delivery system inserted into the anterior chamber ( AC ) angle during surgery and was treated with saline eyedrops ( Isopto Plain ) for 4 weeks .
other	The control group had no drug delivery system or a placebo inserted at surgery and were treated with dexamethasone 0.1 % eyedrops for 4 weeks .
other	A Kowa FM-500 laser flare meter was used to objectively measure AC flare , the main outcome measure .
other	Slitlamp biomicroscopy to grade AC flare and cells , intraocular pressure measurement , and corneal endothelial specular microscopy , performed up to 60 days after surgery , were the secondary outcome measures .
other	The Surodex group had safety follow-ups after completion of the initial study period .
outcome	Both groups had a steady increase in laser flare meter readings postoperatively .
outcome	The readings peaked at 3 days in the control group and at 7 days in the Surodex group .
outcome	This was followed by a gradual decline toward baseline values up to 28 days , after which the values remained at a similar level to 60 days in both groups .
outcome	There were no significant differences in flare meter readings between the groups throughout the study .
outcome	There were also no significant between-group differences in subjective assessment of intraocular inflammation and in impact on corneal endothelial cell count ( P = .67 ) .
outcome	Surodex remnants persisted up to a mean of 22.0 months + / - 2.5 ( SD ) postoperatively in 6 eyes ( 54 % ) .
outcome	Neither group had a severe adverse event .
outcome	Surodex appeared to be as effective as dexamethasone 0.1 % eyedrops in controlling intraocular inflammation after cataract surgery by phacoemulsification , and both methods had a similar safety profile .

###18243784
background	Breastfeeding has a major impact on HCMV epidemiology .
background	The incidence of postnatal HCMV reactivation during lactation equals the maternal seroprevalence .
background	Infectious virus , viral DNA and RNA can be isolated easily from cell and fat-free milk whey .
background	Early onset of viral DNAlactia and virolactia as well as high viral load in milk whey are maternal risk factors for virus transmission .
background	The dynamics of HCMV reactivation can be described by unimodal kinetics with interindividual variation .
background	Virus reactivation during lactation is a self-limiting local process in the absence of systemic HCMV infection .
background	Preterm infants below 1000g birthweight and a gestational age below 30 weeks may be at high risk of acquiring a symptomatic HCMV infection .
background	Several recent studies described low transmission rates and mostly asymptomatically infected neonates using frozen milk .
outcome	Despite different freeze-storing procedures , HCMV transmissions occurred , and severe HCMV infections were observed .
outcome	Few data exist on the long-term outcome of postnatally acquired HCMV infection via breast milk .
outcome	To substantiate the international debate on the use of native or inactivated milk for feeding of preterm infants , additional data are necessary for better identification of mother-infant-pairs at risk for viral transmission and symptomatic infection early

###19556132
background	We aimed to evaluate the safety and therapeutic efficacy of percutaneous transpedicular vertebroplasty ( PVP ) using polymethyl methacrylate ( PMMA ) in patients with symptomatic metastatic spine lesions .
population	We included 31 patients in this retrospective study who were treated with PMMA from 2003 to 2005 for intractable pain due to metastatic spine lesions .
other	The types of cancer ( and numbers of patients ) included lung cancer ( 9 ) , breast cancer ( 7 ) , gastrointestinal ( GI ) tract cancers ( 5 ) , hepatobiliary malignancies ( 3 ) , and other types of cancer ( 7 ) .
intervention	All patients received vertebroplasty , resulting in 41 treatments ( 16 in thoracic , 25 in lumbar spine ) .
other	Preoperative and postoperative visual analog scale ( VAS ) scores for pain were measured in all patients .
intervention	Image studies including contrast-enhanced MRI were performed in all patients .
outcome	Results showed characteristic metastatic lesions .
other	Suspicious lesions were further confirmed as malignant by a bone scan , a positron emission tomography ( PET ) scan , and pathological exam .
outcome	Vertebroplasty resulted in complete or partial pain relief in 29 patients ( 95 % ) , and provided no pain relief in 2 patients ( 5 % ) .
outcome	The mean preoperative VAS score of 8.9 ( + / -0.93 ) was higher than the mean postoperative VAS score ( 2.6 + / -1.71 ) .
other	Metastatic spine lesions were most common in lung and breast cancer patients and these lesions were located more often on segments T12 to L2 ( 53.6 % ) .
outcome	Patients with malignancy of hepatobiliary origin did not show improvement in pain scores as dramatically as patients with other types of malignancies , although only a few cases were included in this study .
outcome	No patients experienced worsening of symptoms or suffered from vertebroplasty complications .
outcome	We conclude that vertebroplasty is a safe , effective , and simple treatment for the management of intractable spinal pain due to metastases .

###12688385
background	It is well established that cholecystokinin ( CCK ) reduces the antinociceptive effect of opioids .
background	The level of CCK and CCK receptors , as well as CKK release , exhibits considerable plasticity after nerve injury and inflammation , conditions known to be associated with chronic pain .
background	Such altered CCK release coupled in some situation with changes in CCK receptor levels may underlie the clinical phenomenon of varying opioid sensitivity in different clinical pain conditions .
background	In particular , neuropathic pain after injury to the peripheral and central nervous system does not respond well to opioids , which is likely to be caused by increased activity in the endogenous CCK system .
background	CCK receptor antagonists may thus be useful as analgesics in combination with opioids to treat neuropathic pain .

###15574127
background	ACE ( angiotensin-converting enzyme ) inhibitors and PDE5 ( phosphodiesterase type 5 ) inhibitors have each been reported to improve endothelial function in cardiovascular disease patients , but the comparative and combined effects of these two classes have no
other	We sought to characterize the acute effects of ramipril alone , sildenafil alone , or their combination on endothelial function in patients with CHF ( chronic heart failure ) .
population	CHF subjects ( n = 64 ) were randomized to receive placebo , 10 mg of ramipril alone , 50 mg of sildenafil alone or a combination of ramipril and sildenafil in a double-blind manner .
other	FMD ( flow-mediated dilation ) of the brachial artery was determined by high-resolution ultrasound imaging before and at 1 , 2 and 4 h after administration of the study drug .
outcome	Ramipril alone increased FMD at 4 h compared with placebo ( +2.3 + / -1.3 % , P = 0.02 ) .
outcome	Sildenafil alone increased FMD at 1 , 2 and 4 h compared with placebo ( +3.9 + / -1.4 , +4.6 + / -1.8 and +3.7 + / -1.3 % respectively , all P < 0.02 ) .
outcome	Sildenafil in combination with ramipril increased FMD at 1 , 2 and 4 h when compared with placebo ( +3.5 + / -1.5 , +4.5 + / -1.8 and +4.8 + / -1.3 % respectively , all P < 0.03 ) .
outcome	Ramipril and sildenafil both acutely improved FMD in patients with CHF , with additive effects evident at 4 h during combination therapy .
outcome	Therefore further work to characterize chronic effects of combined ACE and PDE5 inhibition on endothelial function are warranted .

###15953751
study design	This preliminary cross-sectional study was undertaken to determine if there were measurable relationships between posture , back muscle endurance and low back pain ( LBP ) in industrial workers with a reported history of flexion strain injury and flexion pai
background	Clinical reports state that subjects with flexion pain disorders of the lumbar spine commonly adopt passive flexed postures such as slump sitting and present with associated dysfunction of the spinal postural stabilising musculature .
other	However , to date there is little empirical evidence to support that patients with back pain , posture their spines differently than pain-free subjects .
population	Subjects included 21 healthy industrial workers and 24 industrial workers with flexion-provoked LBP .
other	Lifestyle information , lumbo-pelvic posture in sitting , standing and lifting , and back muscle endurance were measured .
outcome	LBP subjects had significantly reduced back muscle endurance ( P < 0.01 ) .
outcome	LBP subjects sat with less hip flexion , ( P = 0.05 ) , suggesting increased posterior pelvic tilt in sitting .
outcome	LBP subjects postured their spines significantly closer to their end of range lumbar flexion in ` usual ' sitting than the healthy controls ( P < 0.05 ) .
outcome	Correlations between increased time spent sitting , physical inactivity and poorer back muscle endurance were also identified .
outcome	There were no significant differences found between the groups for the standing and lifting posture measures .
outcome	These preliminary results support that a relationship may exist between flexed spinal postures , reduced back muscle endurance , physical inactivity and LBP in subjects with a history of flexion injury and pain .

###1991293
population	One hundred thirty consecutive patients with metastatic spinal cord compression ( MSCC ) were entered in a therapeutic protocol in which radiation therapy ( RT ) played the main role .
background	When MSCC is diagnosed by clinical-radiologic methods such as myelography with or without computed tomography ( CT ) or magnetic resonance imaging ( MRI ) , steroids are given and RT treatment started within 24 hours .
background	When diagnostic doubts exist or stabilization is necessary , surgery precedes RT. .
background	Chemohormonal potentially responsive tumors are also treated with chemotherapy or hormonal therapy .
intervention	Twelve patients ( 9.2 % ) underwent surgery plus RT , and 118 ( 90.8 % ) received RT alone .
outcome	Thirteen ( 11 % ) early death patients were not evaluable .
other	The 105 evaluable cases that received RT alone were analyzed .
other	Median follow-up was 15 months ( range , 4 to 38 months ) .
outcome	Response among patients with back pain was 80 % .
outcome	In cases with motor dysfunction , 48.6 % improved , and in 33 of 105 patients ( 31.4 % ) without motor disability there was no deterioration .
outcome	Forty percent of patients with autonomic dysfunction responded to RT. .
outcome	Median survival time was 7 months with a 36 % probability of survival for 1 year .
outcome	The median duration of improvement was 8 months .
outcome	The most important prognostic factor was early diagnosis .
outcome	Radiosensitivity of tumor was only important in paraparetic patients in predicting response to RT. .
outcome	Complete myelographic block significantly diminished response to RT. .
outcome	Vertebral collapse did not influence response or survival .

###12384737
background	Microdiscectomy represents the gold standard in disc surgery on the lumbar spine .
background	The remaining defect in the intervertebral disc space can be filled with a newly developed nucleus prosthesis presented in this paper .
background	This prosthesis consists of polycarbonate urethane ( Sulene PCU ) , and takes the form of a memory coiling spiral .

population	Five patients have been supplied with the implant to date .

###17326599
background	Fentanyl is commonly used systemically or neuraxially for the management of chronic pain .
background	It can be administered intrathecally via implanted pump , but it is generally considered only after trials of intrathecal ( IT ) morphine and hydromorphone have proven ineffective .
other	Published experience with IT fentanyl is limited , and long-term therapy at relatively high doses has not been described previously .
population	We describe four patients who were treated with IT fentanyl after other analgesic approaches had failed and who gradually underwent dose escalation to levels as high as 20 times those previously reported .
outcome	Safety and tolerability were maintained during dose titration .
outcome	Our experience highlights an expanding scope of practice in the use of IT opioids in general and fentanyl specifically and suggests that high-dose fentanyl can be used safely in highly selected patients .

###16770167
background	Resection of the small bowel can lead to malabsorption of fluid , electrolytes , minerals , and other essential nutrients , resulting in malnutrition and dehydration .
background	Individualized and tailored nutritional management for patients with short bowel syndrome ( SBS ) helps to optimize intestinal absorption , leading to nutritional independence such that a patient can resume as normal a lifestyle as possible .
background	Parenteral nutrition ( PN ) , used to supply the required nutrients following resection , is associated with a number of complications affecting patient morbidity and mortality .
other	Attempts should be made to wean patients from PN to an oral diet as soon as possible .
outcome	Dietary management is complex and needs to be individualized for each patient on the basis of his or her specific gastrointestinal anatomy , underlying disease , and lifestyle .
outcome	In addition to nutrient intake , management of SBS also requires appropriate oral rehydration , vitamin and mineral supplementation , and pharmacotherapy .
outcome	Several medications provide a useful adjunctive function to dietary intervention , including antidiarrheal agents , H2 antagonists and proton pump inhibitors , pancreatic enzymes , somatostatin analogs , antimicrobials , and trophic factors .

###15597029
other	To examine the relation between sleep disturbance and neurocognitive ability among persons with traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) .
background	Correlational research evaluating demographic and neuropsychological predictors of sleep disturbance using multiple regression analysis and analysis of variance .
population	Eighty-seven patients with mild to severe TBI admitted to a comprehensive outpatient neurorehabilitation program .
other	Sleep disturbance assessed using the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index .
outcome	Hierarchical regression analysis revealed that performance on selected measures of cognitive functioning significantly improved prediction of sleep disturbance , accounting for 14 % of variance beyond that accounted for by injury severity and gender .
outcome	The total model accounted for 31 % of the variance in Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index scores .
outcome	Patients with mild TBI reported more sleep disturbance ( P < .01 ) than did patients with severe TBI .
outcome	Sleep disturbance among patients with TBI may be associated with a particular constellation of neuropsychological abilities .
outcome	These issues are discussed in relation to prior findings that indicate the involvement of additional neuropsychiatric factors associated with sleep disturbance in mild TBI .

###15922830
background	Is sense-antisense ( SA ) pairing of transcripts a common mode of gene regulation in the human genome ?
background	Although > 20 % of human genes might form SA pairs , the extent to which they are involved in antisense regulation is unknown .
background	Simultaneous expression of paired sense and antisense genes is an essential step and an important indicator of antisense regulation .
outcome	In this article , we demonstrate that human SA pairs tend to be co-expressed and/or inversely expressed more frequently than expected by chance .
outcome	Moreover , co-expressed and inversely expressed SA pairs exhibit a striking pattern of evolutionary conservation .
outcome	These findings suggest that antisense regulation is a common and important mechanism of gene regulation in the human genome .

###3394706
background	Animal laboratory studies have demonstrated that 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin ( TCDD ) has fetotoxic and teratogenic effects at low doses .
background	TCDD contamination of soil in nine residential areas of eastern Missouri began in 1971 when several horse arenas and dirt roads were sprayed for dust control with a mixture that contained waste oil and dioxin .
background	The authors conducted an epidemiologic investigation to determine if adverse human reproductive outcomes are associated with exposure to soil contaminated with dioxin .
population	The authors attempted to identify all births during the period of January 1 , 1972 through December 31 , 1982 that had potential exposure to dioxin , based on proximity of the maternal address to a location of known TCDD contamination .
other	This group totaled 410 births .
population	A matched set of 820 unexposed births was selected as a comparison group after being matched for maternal age and race , year of birth , hospital of birth , and plurality .
outcome	The exposed group had increased risk ratios for infant , fetal , and perinatal death ; low birth weight ; and several subcategories of birth defects .
outcome	None of these increased risk ratios for the exposed group were statistically significant .
outcome	These results do not provide evidence that TCDD exposure has a substantial impact on the reproductive outcomes investigated .
outcome	If TCDD does produce effects on reproductive health , a larger study and/or better measures of exposure may be needed to discover them .

###8006372
background	To advance our understanding of attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder and medication effects we draw upon the evidence for ( 1 ) a neurotransmitter imbalance between norepinephrine and dopamine in attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder and ( 2 ) an asymm
outcome	It appears that attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder may involve a bihemispheric dysfunction characterized by reduced dopaminergic and excessive noradrenergic functioning .
outcome	In turn , favorable medication effects may be mediated by a restoration in neurotransmitter balance and by increased control over the allocation of attentional resources between hemispheres .

###17582499
background	Fish contain essential long chain polyunsaturated fatty acids ( PUFAs ) , particularly docosahexaenoic acid ( DHA ) , an omega-3 ( or n-3 ) PUFA , but are also the main source of exposure to methylmercury ( MeHg ) , a potent developmental neurotoxicant .
background	Since n-3 PUFAs support neural development and function , benefits deriving from a diet rich in n-3s have been hypothesized to protect against deleterious effects of gestational MeHg exposure .
population	To determine whether protection occurs at the behavioral level , female Long-Evans rats were exposed , in utero , to 0 , 0.5 , or 5ppm of Hg as MeHg via drinking water , approximating exposures of 0 , 40 , and 400 microgHg/kg/day and producing 0 , 0.29 , and 5.50 pp
intervention	They also received pre - and postnatal exposure to one of two diets , both based on the AIN-93 semipurified formulation .
other	A `` fish-oil '' diet was high in , and a `` coconut-oil '' diet was devoid of , DHA .
other	Diets were approximately equal in alpha-linolenic acid and n-6 PUFAs .
other	As adults , the rats were first assessed with a spatial discrimination reversal ( SDR ) procedure and later with a visual ( nonspatial ) discrimination reversal ( VDR ) procedure .
outcome	MeHg increased the number of errors to criterion for both SDR and VDR during the first reversal , but effects were smaller or non-existent on the original discrimination and on later reversals .
outcome	No such MeHg-related deficits were seen when the rats were retested on SDR after 2 years of age .
outcome	These results are consistent with previous reports and hypotheses that gestational MeHg exposure produces perseverative responding .
outcome	No interactions between diet and MeHg were found , suggesting that n-3 PUFAs do not guard against these behavioral effects .
outcome	Brain Hg concentrations did not differ between the diets , either .
outcome	In geriatric rats , failures to respond were less common and response latencies were shorter for rats fed the fish-oil diet , suggesting that exposure to a diet rich in n-3s may lessen the impact of age-related declines in response initiation .

###16421065
background	Age is assumed to be a negative prognostic factor in recovery from moderate-to-severe traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) .
background	Little is known on cognitive performance after mild TBI in relation to age in the sub-acute stage after injury .
population	Ninety-nine mild TBI subjects ( age 15-75 ) were compared with 91 healthy control subjects ( age 14-74 ) in a case-control design .
other	Patients were matched on age , sex and level of education , with control subjects .
other	Mean interval between injury and cognitive assessment was 13 days .
other	Neurocognitive test battery contained tests of verbal memory , selective attention , general speed of information processing and verbal fluency .
outcome	An overall effect was found of a single mild TBI on neurocognitive performance in the sub-acute stage after injury .
outcome	Age did not add significantly to the effect of mild TBI on cognitive functioning .
outcome	Patients suffering from mild TBI are characterized by subtle neurocognitive deficits in the weeks directly following the trauma .
outcome	The notion that elderly subjects have a worse outcome in the sub-acute period after mild TBI is at least not in line with the results of this study .

###14505102
background	Intracranial pressure monitoring is recommended for the management of severe head injury and is increasingly used during intensive care for other pathologies , such as subarachnoid hemorrhage .
background	However , it is still not uniformly applied in different centers .
background	The objectives of this paper are to summarize the frequency and the modalities of intracranial pressure ( ICP ) monitoring in different centers in Italy ; to describe its use in traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) and in subarachnoid hemorrhage ( SAH ) ; and to identi
other	The medical directors of either the neurosurgical department or the intensive care unit , or both , of every Italian neurosurgical center were personally interviewed .
other	They answered specific questions about TBI and SAH patients admitted , and ICP monitoring used , in their units .
other	Data were cleared of any obvious inconsistencies and entered in a database for analysis .
other	All analyses were based simply on the data declared .
population	The clinical information was obtained from 9137 TBI cases , of whom 4240 severe , and 3151 SAH patients .
outcome	Among the 106 participating centers , 15 did not use ICP monitoring at all .
outcome	The remaining 91 had used 3293 ICP devices during the year 2001 ; 146 were used in tumor cases , 2009 in TBI , and 1138 in SAH .
outcome	Twenty-two percent of TBI cases admitted to centers with ICP equipment were monitored .
outcome	Restricting this analysis to severe cases , 47 % of TBI with a GCS < 8 had ICP .
outcome	On average , 36 % of SAH underwent ICP monitoring .
outcome	The proportions of head injury and SAH cases who underwent ICP monitoring varied widely in the different centers .
outcome	Dividing the country into three main areas ( north , center and south ) , there were considerable differences both in the rate of admissions per million inhabitants and in the frequency of ICP monitoring .
outcome	ICP monitoring in Italy is used in most , but not all , centers .
outcome	ICP is measured fairly extensively in head injury cases , but a significant proportion of SAH patients is monitored as well .
outcome	There are substantial differences in the frequency of ICP monitoring in different parts of the country .
outcome	The use of ICP for both these indications , and the rates of admission to specialized centers , could be improved .

population	By use of pentobarbital sodium to produce experimental congestive heart failure ( CHF ) in 40 rabbits , they were treated with xin-fu-ning IV ( XFN IV ) , the plasma atrial natriuretic factor ( ANF ) levels and atrial tissue ANF levels of rabbits were measured .
outcome	The results showed that XFN IV had elevated ANF levels of the rabbits with CHF .
outcome	It showed that XFN IV could improve endocrine function of heart , and it also showed good curative effect on CHF .

background	A majority of psychiatric medications are known to generate weight gain and ultimately obesity in some patients .

###10879772
background	Spinal hydatid disease is a rare entity that frequently yields to severe , acute-onset neurological deficits .
background	Although the gold standard treatment is total surgical removal of the cysts without inducing any spillage , it may not be possible to perform this in patients with multiple and fragile cysts .
background	In such cases , the neural structures should be adequately decompressed and albendazole should be administered promptly .
population	The authors describe the case of a 13-year-old girl who was admitted with a history of back pain and acute-onset lower-extremity weakness .
other	Magnetic resonance imaging scans demonstrated severe spinal cord compression caused by multiple cysts involving T-4 and the mediastinum .
intervention	The patient underwent surgery , and the cysts were removed , except for one cyst that was hardly exposed .
intervention	Following histopathological confirmation of spinal hydatid disease , she was treated with albendazole for 1 year .
outcome	One year postoperatively , the residual cyst had gradually shrunk and had almost disappeared .
outcome	Although a single case is not sufficiently promising , we believe that administration of albendazole is efficient to prevent recurrences in cases in which it is not possible to obtain total removal of the cysts without inducing spillage .

###12853899
background	Injury to the anterior cruciate ligament ( ACL ) has been suggested to alter the neuromuscular mechanism in the lower extremity .
background	However , conclusive evidence regarding this occurrence has yet to be established during closed kinetic chain exercise .
other	The purpose of this study was to assess differences in muscle activation during slideboard exercise between non-injured , ACL deficient , and ACL reconstructed individuals .
study design	Experimental design : comparative study .
other	Setting research laboratory .
population	Participants : subjects for this study included 10 healthy , non-injured ( NI ) individuals , 7 uni-lateral ACL deficient ( ACLD ) individuals , and 6 uni-lateral ACL reconstructed ( ACLR ) individuals .
other	Interventions
intervention	EMG activity was measured from the vastus medialis ( VM ) , vastus lateralis ( VL ) , medial hamstring ( MH ) , lateral hamstring ( LH ) , tibialis anterior ( TA ) , and medial gastrocnemius ( MG ) muscles during slideboard performance .
other	Measures
other	EMG for each muscle during each of 6 phases of 1 average slideboard cycle was expressed as a percentage of EMG during a maximal voluntary contraction .
outcome	The results demonstrated that during slideboard phase I the VM , VL , and TA muscles generated the greatest amount of activity as compared to the other muscles .
outcome	Vastus medialis muscle activation was found to be significantly higher than the other muscles in the involved/dominant limb , as compared to the non-involved/non-dominant limb during slideboard phase II .
outcome	During slideboard phases III-VI , tibialis anterior muscle activation was found to be consistently higher than the other muscles , while hamstring muscle activity was consistently the lowest .
outcome	It is concluded that adaptive changes following ACL injury during a dynamic , closed kinetic chain activity such as the slideboard exercise , may be a restoration of a bi-lateral balance in muscle activation .

###16540878
study design	A prospective and comparative analysis of tissue injury after mini-open lumbar fusion and conventional technique .
other	To evaluate the tissue injury quantitatively after mini-open lumbar fusion .
background	The advantages of minimally invasive techniques demonstrated by clinical reports have been a smaller scar , lesser pain , and rapid rehabilitation .
background	It has not been established , however , that the minimally invasive technique has less tissue injury and less systemic response than the conventional spine surgery .
population	Twenty patients who had undergone posterior decompression and the fusion of the L4-L5 segment for spinal stenosis were studied prospectively .
population	Ten patients that had the conventional posterior decompression and posterior lumbar interbody fusion ( PLIF ) at L4-L5 were enrolled in a control group .
population	The remaining 10 patients who underwent MISS techniques ( paramedian mini-open approach using a tubular retractor ) were enrolled in a study group .
other	The serum enzymes representing skeletal muscle injury ( creatinine kinase and aldolase ) , pro-inflammatory cytokines ( IL-6 , IL-8 ) , and anti-inflammatory cytokines ( IL-10 , IL-1 receptor antagonist ) were analyzed with ELISA techniques .
other	They were checked on the day before operation and 1 , 3 , 7 , and 14 days after operation .
outcome	Serum creatinine kinase and most of the inflammatory cytokines were significantly high in the control group on postoperative days 1 and 3 and returned to the normal level on postoperative day 7 .
outcome	Serum aldolase was significantly high on postoperative day 1 , and IL-8 remained elevated until postoperative day 7 in the control group .
outcome	Mini-open lumbar fusion may significantly contribute to the reduction of muscle injury and systemic inflammatory reactions during the acute postoperative period .
outcome	This study suggests that mini-open lumbar fusion may also play an important role in preventing medical morbidity after spinal surgery .

###10682182
background	Up to 35 % of the world population suffer from functional gastrointestinal disorders ( FGD ) , accounting for about 40 % of gastroenterologic and 12 % of primary care practice .
background	Society incurs high costs from FGD morbidity in terms of medical workups and absenteeism from work .
background	FGD are characterized by chronic and recurrent symptoms of the gastrointestinal ( GI ) tract without detectable structural or biochemical abnormalities .
background	In the absence of universal biologic markers , the diagnosis is based on consensus symptom criteria ( 1 ) .
background	This chapter reviews current knowledge of the pathophysiology and provides a practical approach to patients with functional dyspepsia and irritable bowel syndrome , 2 of the most common functional GI syndromes .

###11490372
background	Chemoresistance may involve the anti-apoptotic transcriptional regulator , nuclear factor-kappa B ( NF-kappa B ) .
other	The purpose of this study was to determine whether chemotherapy induces NF-kappa B activation in a human colon cancer cell line ( SW48 ) and whether NF-kappa B is constitutively activated in colorectal cancer .
population	SW48 cells were incubated with gemcitabine hydrochloride ( Gemzar ) in the presence and absence of the 26s proteasome inhibitor , MG132 , and NF-kappa B binding ( electrophoretic mobility shift assay ) , DNA synthesis ( tritiated thymidine uptake ) , cell viability
intervention	NF-kappa B binding ( electrophoretic mobility shift assay ) was also assayed in 10 colorectal cancer tumors .
outcome	SW48 cells demonstrated constitutive NF-kappa B binding that was enhanced by gemcitabine hydrochloride in a dose-dependent manner .
outcome	MG132 inhibited NF-kappa B binding and enhanced gemcitabine hydrochloride 's inhibition of DNA synthesis ( gemcitabine hydrochloride = 73 % + / - 1.4 % vs gemcitabine hydrochloride + MG132 = 6 % + / - 0.4 % , P < .05 ) , cell killing ( gemcitabine hydrochloride = 87 %
outcome	NF-kappa B binding was increased in 8 of 10 colorectal cancer tumors compared with adjacent normal mucosa .
outcome	Gemcitabine hydrochloride enhances NF-kappa B binding in a colorectal cancer cell line , whereas inhibition of NF-kappa B enhances gemcitabine hydrochloride 's antitumor activity .
outcome	NF-kappa B is also activated in human colorectal cancer .
outcome	NF-kappa B may identify chemoresistant tumors , whereas inhibition of NF-kappa B may be a novel , biologically based therapy .

###12898578
background	Although a number of studies have shown that human impulsive traits are associated with indices of central serotonin function , few researchers have investigated the relationship between a polymorphism in the serotonin transporter gene-linked region ( 5-HTT
population	We determined the 5-HTTLPR polymorphism in 123 employed Japanese male adults using the polymerase chain reaction .
other	The distribution of allelic frequency was determined and also investigated the relationship of the 5-HTTLPR polymorphism to a impulsive trait as measured by the Barratt Impulsiveness Scale , 11th version ( BIS-11 ) .
outcome	The distribution of allelic frequency was found to be almost identical to that previously reported in Japanese ( the frequency for the long ( L ) / L , L/short ( S ) , and S/S genotypes was : 3 , 28 , and 68 % , respectively ) .
outcome	In a comparison between the genotype groups , the S/S genotype group significantly higher scored for the total BIS-11 and the subscale attentional impulsiveness than the L/S + L/L genotype group .
outcome	These findings suggest that individuals with a homozygous S-allele may be more impulsive than those with the other genotype .

###10362442
background	The significant morbidity and mortality associated with severe depression and its psychotic or melancholic subtypes necessitate effective and well-tolerated therapy .
background	This review evaluates antidepressant treatments for patients with severe depression .
population	Comparative clinical trials conducted on patients with severe depression were found by an English-language MEDLINE search ( 1985 to present ) .
other	Additional studies were identified in article bibliographies .
other	Search terms included depressive disorders , depression and severe , hospitalized , melancholic or melancholia , psychotic , and endogenous .
outcome	Evidence for efficacy of SSRIs in severe or melancholic depression comes from a small but growing number of controlled studies with adequate samples , as well as meta-analyses and retrospective subgroup analysis of premarketing trials .
outcome	In studies that defined response as a 50 % or greater reduction in Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression ( HAM-D ) scores , response rates ranged from 53 % to 64 % for SSRIs and 43 % to 70 % for TCAs .
outcome	In separate trials on severe depression , venlafaxine and mirtazapine were both more effective than placebo and an active comparator .
outcome	Nefazodone and bupropion were each found to be more effective than placebo in studies of severe depression .
outcome	Venlafaxine and mirtazapine have been found to be more effective than fluoxetine .
outcome	SSRIs and TCAs are comparably effective for the treatment of severe or melancholic depression .
outcome	SSRIs and other newer agents appear to be better tolerated than TCAs , specifically lacking adverse anticholinergic and cardiovascular effects that may limit the use of TCAs .
outcome	Emerging data with venlafaxine and mirtazapine in severely depressed patients with or without melancholia support the efficacy of these treatments .
outcome	Nefazodone and bupropion were found to be effective in hospitalized depressed patients .
outcome	Electroconvulsive therapy ( ECT ) or combined antidepressant therapy may be useful in some patients with severe depression .
outcome	Patients with severe psychotic depression may respond better to an antipsychotic-antidepressant combination .

###15204365
background	The study examined whether associations between bone , body composition and strength are age dependent .
population	Two age levels ( premenarcheal girls and postmenopausal women on HRT ) were studied in a 10-month follow-up .
other	Bone , lean and fat mass were measured by dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry ( DXA ) , and strength was measured using an isokinetic dynamometer .
outcome	In girls , significant correlations were found between mass ( lean , fat and body mass ) , strength and most bone characteristics ( r = 0.15-0 .93 ) .
outcome	At the proximal femur changes in bone mineral density ( BMD ) were moderately related to changes in body composition .
outcome	In the women , body mass and lean mass were significantly correlated with most bone characteristics ( r = 0.34-0 .82 ) .
outcome	Low to moderate correlations were observed between changes in bone and changes in body composition .
outcome	After controlling for lean mass the relation between strength and bone was no longer significant .
outcome	In premenarcheal girls , bone is partly determined by mass , with lean mass the most important predictor at the femoral sites .
outcome	In postmenopausal women , lean mass is an important determinant of bone mineral content ( BMC ) and BMD , but changes in BMD are related to changes in fat .
outcome	The relation between strength and BMD is mainly attributable to the relation between lean mass and BMD .
outcome	The contributory effects of soft tissue to bone change over different life periods .

###17977769
background	A 68-year-old woman with a fragility fracture of the fourth lumbar vertebra was treated with a first vertebroplasty using methylmetacrylate with an initial good pain relief .
outcome	Early painful recurrent vertebral fractures led to iterative vertebroplasties .
outcome	Furthermore prophylactic treatment with methylmetacrylate of a non-fractured vertebra located between two previously injected ones did not prevent its collapse .
outcome	This case report underlines the lack of a clear evaluation benefit/risk ratio of these procedures in patients with non-malignant bone fragility .

###2150530
background	The influence of fish oil and safflower oil contained in the common Japanese diet as the main dietary polyunsaturated fatty acid source on plasma fatty acids in ten female student volunteers ( 21-22 years old ) was investigated .
intervention	The subjects were divided into two groups and fed the experimental diets for five days .
intervention	The total daily fat intake in the fish diet and safflower oil diet was 54.4 g and 56.2 g , respectively , and the fat derived from fish and safflower oil was 16 g and 23 g , respectively .
outcome	The proportion of linoleic acid was reduced in the plasma of subjects fed the fish diet and increased in the plasma of subjects fed the safflower oil diet .
outcome	The plasma levels of eicosapentaenoic acid ( EPA ) and docosahexaenoic acid ( DHA ) were significantly elevated in the fish diet group .
outcome	The ratio of EPA/arachidonic acid ( AA ) was higher , and those of n-6 / n-3 and n-9 / n-3 were lower in the plasma of subjects fed the fish diet when compared to the results obtained from plasma of subjects fed the safflower oil diet .
outcome	From these results , it seems likely that fish oil in the common Japanese diet is a favorable source of plasma EPA and DHA even in such short term supplementation and with such a small amount of daily consumption .

###16647594
background	Patients suffering from inoperable critical leg ischemia ( CLI ) ultimately face a major amputation .
background	Spinal cord stimulation ( SCS ) has been introduced as a possible treatment option .
intervention	This paper presents the best available evidence from a systematic review on the effectiveness of SCS in these patients and discusses the indications for SCS therapy .
outcome	A meta-analysis of six controlled trials , including 444 patients , showed 11 % ( 95 % confidence interval : -0.02 to -0.20 ) lower amputation rate after 12 months compared to those treated with optimum medical treatment .
outcome	In addition , SCS patients required significantly fewer analgesics and showed a significant clinical improvement .
outcome	These positive effects have to be weighed against the higher costs and ( generally minor ) complications of SCS .
outcome	TcpO ( 2 ) measurements were found to be useful in selecting the most respondent patients , yielding a 12-month limb salvage up to 83 % .
outcome	Hence , SCS should be considered as a possible treatment option in patients with CLI , particularly if their foot TcpO ( 2 ) is between 10 and 30 mmHg .

###12183674
background	Opioids are commonly used for pain relief clinically and reduce hyperalgesia in most animal models .
background	Two injections of acidic saline into one gastrocnemius muscle 5 days apart produce a long-lasting bilateral hyperalgesia without associated tissue damage .
other	The current study was undertaken to assess the effects of opioid agonists on mechanical hyperalgesia induced by repeated intramuscular injections of acid .
intervention	Morphine ( mu-agonist ) , [ D-Ala ( 2 ) , N-Me-Phe ( 4 ) , Gly-ol ( 5 ) ] - enkephalin ( mu-agonist ; DAMGO ) , 4 - [ ( ( alpha ) R ) - alpha - ( ( 2S ,5 R ) -4 - allyl-2 ,5 - dimethyl-1-piperazinyl ) -3 - methoxybenzyl ] - N,N-diethylbenzamide ( delta-agonist ; SNC80 ) , or ( 1S-trans ) -3,4 - dichloro-N-methyl-N - [ 2
other	Mechanical hyperalgesia was assessed by measuring the withdrawal thresholds to mechanical stimuli ( von Frey filaments ) before the first and second intramuscular injection , 24 h after the second intramuscular injection , and for 1 h after administration of the opioid agonist or vehicle .
outcome	Morphine , DAMGO , and SNC80 dose dependently increased the mechanical withdrawal threshold back toward baseline responses .
outcome	The reduction in hyperalgesia produced by morphine and DAMGO was prevented by H-D-Phe-Cys-Tyr-D-Trp-Arg-Thr-Pen-Thr-NH ( 2 ) ( CTAP ) and that of SNC80 was prevented by naltrindole .
outcome	U50 ,488 had no effect on the decreased mechanical withdrawal thresholds .
outcome	Thus , activation of mu - and delta - , but not kappa - , opioid receptors in the spinal cord reduces mechanical hyperalgesia following repeated intramuscular injection of acid , thus validating the use of this new model of chronic muscle pain .

###15882372
intervention	This paper reports a systematic review of seven studies evaluating the efficacy of cognitive behavioural therapy ( CBT ) for persistent primary insomnia .
background	Insomnia is one of the most common health complaints reported in the primary care setting .
background	Although non-pharmacological treatments such as the CBT have been suggested to be useful in combating the persistent insomnia , the efficacy and clinical utility of CBT for primary insomnia have yet to be determined .
other	A systematic search of Ovid , MEDLINE , psychINFO , PsycARTICLES , CINAHL , and EMBASE databases of papers published between 1993 and 2004 was conducted , using the following medical subject headings or key words insomnia , primary insomnia , psychophysiological insomnia , sleep maintenance disorders , sleep initiation disorders , non-pharmacological treatment , and cognitive behavioural therapy .
other	A total of seven papers was included in the review .
outcome	Stimulus control , sleep restriction , sleep hygiene education and cognitive restructuring were the main treatment components .
outcome	Interventions were provided by psychiatrists except for one study , in which the CBT was delivered by nurses .
outcome	Among beneficial outcomes , improvement of sleep efficacy , sleep onset latency and wake after sleep onset were the most frequently reported .
outcome	In addition , participants significantly reduced sleep medication use .
outcome	Some studies gave follow-up data which indicated that the CBT produced durable clinical changes in total sleep time and night-time wakefulness .
outcome	These randomized controlled trial studies demonstrated that CBT was superior to any single-component treatment such as stimulus control , relaxation training , educational programmes , or other control conditions .
outcome	However , heterogeneity in patient assessment , CBT protocols , and outcome indicators made determination of the relative efficacy and clinical utility of the therapy difficult .
outcome	Therefore , the standard components of CBT need to be clearly defined .
outcome	In addition , a comprehensive assessment of patients is essential for future studies .

###17936809
background	Transurethral bladder tumor resection is associated with imperfect clinical staging and incomplete tumor removal .
background	Transurethral prostate resection may be complicated by inadvertent damage to the urinary sphincter , bladder neck and trigone .
background	We performed a multicenter pilot and feasibility study of a novel working element for resectoscopes designed to improve the efficacy and safety of transurethral endoscopic surgery .
other	An innovative working element for resectoscopes was developed to convert the standard in/out linear/axial movement at the handgrip into a side-to-side , bidirectional , lateral rotating motion .
other	The device is compatible with current optical technology and conventional electrocautery generators , and it has been granted marketing approval .
other	It consists of variably sized cutting loops designed for transurethral resection of bladder tumors and the prostate .
population	To date 80 patients with bladder cancer ( 38 ) or benign prostatic hyperplasia ( 42 ) have undergone surgery with this instrument at our 3 clinical sites .
outcome	No safety concerns were evident .
outcome	When used during transurethral bladder tumor resection , lateral resection at the base of the tumor enabled accurate depth of penetration into the bladder wall , which may decrease the risk of bladder perforation and improve pathological assessment of tumor
outcome	During transurethral prostate resection this novel tool facilitated dissection of adenoma adjacent to the verumontanum and prostatovesical junction , which may decrease the risk of sphincteric damage and bladder neck injury .
outcome	A novel resectoscope is currently under prospective clinical investigation to establish its surgical and pathological efficacy , ease of use and side effect profile .
outcome	Current data suggest that the learning curve is mild , its use is safe and it provides distinct advantages when used for transurethral resection of bladder tumors and the prostate .

###2505606
background	Congestive heart failure ( CHF ) is often associated with undernutrition .
background	Although loss of lean tissue may be detrimental to the host , a protective effect is conveyed as cardiac demands are reduced by lower whole-body oxygen consumption ( VO2 ) and circulating fluid volume .
population	The aim of this study was to determine if continuous nasoenteric feeding could promote an anabolic state with increments in lean tissue in moderate-severe CHF patients without adversely effecting cardiac performance .
intervention	Undernourished CHF patients on a metabolic ward were fed a formula diet infused intragastrically for 2 wk .
other	The energy infusion rate was maintained at 1.4-1 .8 X measured resting metabolic rate .
other	During the infusion period , body weight , elemental balances , VO2 , and cardiac function ( echocardiography ) were monitored .
outcome	Results showed a loss in weight and extracellular fluid , gain in lean body mass ( eg , + delta N and delta K ) , unaltered VO2 , and unchanged cardiac function .
outcome	Cardiac cachexia is therefore safely and effectively manageable by maintenance or repletional levels of nasoenteric feeding .

###16456449
background	Using a model of traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) in the rat , this study was undertaken to characterize the short-term biochemical changes of IL-1beta , IL-10 , and tumor necrosis factor TNF-alpha to determine whether injury in the brain elicits a systemic cyto
population	Sprague-Dawley rats were subjected to a TBI using a weight-drop model and then killed at various time points after injury .
other	Samples of blood , brain , and liver were recovered and analyzed for concentrations of IL-1beta , IL-10 , and TNF-alpha as well as IL-1beta and IL-10 mRNA expression in liver and brain .
outcome	In brain , IL-1beta increased in the first hour after injury , peaked at 8 hours , and declined during the final 16 hours .
outcome	IL-10 quickly increased during the first 4 hours and then gradually rose over the last 20 hours .
outcome	Analysis of liver showed no upregulation of these markers and plasma IL-1beta and IL-10 were unchanged compared with controls .
outcome	Although not upregulated in brain , TNF-alpha showed a statistically significant ( p < 0.05 ) rise in plasma from 14 + / - 16 pg/mL at 20 minutes to 91 + / - 28 pg/mL at 24 hours .
outcome	Using a model of TBI , we have demonstrated that there is a rise in both IL-1beta and IL-10 in the injured rat brain within the first 24 hours after injury without a corresponding rise in either plasma or liver .
outcome	Therefore , it appears as if two strong indicators of brain injury severity are expressed and possibly carry out their actions solely in the brain .

###16327580
background	To compare the pattern of familial aggregation of psychopathology in children who are good responders ( GR ) to methylphenidate ( MPH ) versus those who are poor responders ( PR ) .
