intervention	A low dose of 0.5 mg/kg of body weight of MPH divided in two equal doses was used .
other	Family history was obtained by interviewing at least one key historian relative of each subject using Family Interview for Genetic Studies .
other	Information was collected on 342 first-degree and 1,151 second-degree relatives of children with attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder .
outcome	Forty-four subjects showed mild or no improvement ( PR ) and 74 showed moderate or very much improvement ( GR ) on MPH over placebo .
outcome	First-degree relatives of GR subjects were at significantly higher risk of attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder than the relatives of PR subjects ( p < .05 ) .
outcome	Second-degree relatives of the GR were at significantly higher risk of antisocial personality disorder compared to the relatives of PR subjects ( p < .05 ) .
outcome	The significantly higher presence of attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder in the first-degree relatives and of antisocial personality disorder in the second-degree relatives of GR children suggests that this group may , at least partially , be distinct

###14533099
background	Infection with human immunodeficiency virus ( HIV ) is often accompanied by neurological complications .
background	One of these includes disorders affecting the peripheral and visual nervous system , especially during the acquired immunodeficiency syndrome ( AIDS ) stage .
background	The peripheral neuropathies associated with infection by HIV are an assorted group of disorders , which include acute or chronic inflammatory demyelinating polyneuropathy , multiple mononeuropathy and neuropathies related to the herpes zoster virus or cytom
background	The most common and clinically important of the neuropathies is painful distal sensory polyneuropathy ( DSP ) .
background	The most severely affected cranial nerves are V and VII .
background	The isolation of HIV from the affected nerves suggests a direct role , but an immune mechanism is also possible .
background	Although cytomegalovirus may be associated with a variety of peripheral nerve syndromes , its clinical presentation as a primary demyelinating polyneuropathy is unusual .
outcome	DSP and antiretroviral toxic neuropathy are the most common HIV-associated neuropathies .
outcome	Both HIV infection , by itself , and the neurotoxicity of certain drugs in tritherapy contribute to the development of painful peripheral sensory neuropathy .
outcome	In researching into the cause of HIV-associated neuropathy further studies are needed to determine the relative roles played by the viral infection and the activation of the immunological factors that contribute to the pathogenesis of the damage done in a

###11758872
background	Neuropathic pain may be defined as pain related to abnormal somatosensory processing in either the peripheral or central nervous system .
background	This pathophysiologic label is typically applied when the painful symptom is associated with an overt injury to neural structures , is part of a recognized syndrome , or has a dysesthetic quality ( usually burning , shooting , or electrical ) .
background	Most neural injury does not lead to clinically important neuropathic pain , but sometimes even a small degree of tissue injury can precipitate severe pain .
background	In the cancer population , neuropathic pain is often related to compression , direct neoplastic invasion of the peripheral nerves or spinal cord , or to a neuropathy caused by chemotherapy .
background	To manage neuropathic pain in this population , nonopioid adjuvant drugs that are neuroactive or neuromodulatory are often needed to complement opioid therapy .
background	The primary adjuvant analgesics are anticonvulsant and antidepressant medications , but a wide variety of other drugs are also used .
background	To optimize analgesic therapy in patients with neuropathic pain , both opioid and adjuvant analgesics must be used effectively .

###19169179
background	An adolescent 15-yr-old male competitive gymnast presented to a university-based multidisciplinary spine institute with a persistent low-back pain for 18 mos .
background	Although the results of x-rays were negative , his pain rendered him unable to compete in his sport any longer .
background	A computed tomography scan was performed , which showed a bilateral pars fracture at L5 , without spondylolisthesis .
background	A nuclear medicine bone scan revealed negative findings , confirming chronic nonunion .
background	The patient completed a 4-wk course of physical therapy 6 mos before our intervention , without any relief of pain or radiologic evidence of healing .
intervention	The patient was treated with a bone stimulator for 4 hrs/day and was recommended to wear a warm-and-form-type brace .
other	Isometric core trunk exercises were also initiated .
outcome	Only after 6 wks of treatment , the subject showed clinical improvement at the follow-up visit .
outcome	Computed tomography scan performed 12 wks after the initial scan showed complete union of the fracture correlating with clinical improvement .
outcome	Two years later , the athlete remains completely pain-free , is training regularly , and is able to compete on a national and , possibly , international level .

###10421001
background	This study investigated the effect of traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) on time - , event - , and activity-based prospective memory using a laboratory paradigm developed in the literature on ageing ( Einstein , McDaniel , Richardson , Guynn , & Cunfer , 1995 ) .
population	The participants were 12 individuals with severe long-term TBI and 12 community controls .
other	Participants were asked to answer general-knowledge questions on a computer for two sessions .
other	The time - and event-based tasks were embedded in this filler activity .
intervention	Participants were also required to carry out activity-based actions at the end of the two sessions .
outcome	Participants with TBI performed significantly worse than did controls on all three prospective-memory tasks , indicating that TBI affects not only retrospective but also prospective memory .

###17943778
background	There is great interest in chronic obstructive pulmonary disease ( COPD ) and the associated large burden of disease .
background	COPD is characterised by frequent day by day fluctuations , and repetitive clinical exacerbations are typical .
background	Self-management is a term applied to educational programmes aimed at teaching skills needed to carry out medical regimens specific to the disease , guide health behaviour change , and provide emotional support for patients to control their disease and live
background	In COPD , the value of self-management education is not yet clear .
background	The first Cochrane review about self-management was published in 2003 .
background	It was intended to shed light on the effectiveness of self-management programmes in COPD and the relative efficacy of their constitutive elements .
background	No conclusions about the effectiveness of self-management could be drawn because of the large variation in outcome measures used in the limited number of included studies .
other	This article describes the first update of this review .
other	The objective of this review was to assess the settings , methods and efficacy of COPD self-management education programmes on health outcomes and use of health care services .
other	We searched the Cochrane Airways Group trial register , MEDLINE ( January 1985 to January 2006 ) , reference lists , and abstracts of medical conferences .
population	Controlled trials ( randomised and non-randomised ) of self-management education in patients with COPD .
other	Studies focusing mainly on pulmonary rehabilitation and studies without usual care as a control group were excluded .
other	Two reviewers independently assessed study quality and extracted data .
other	Investigators were contacted for additional information .
outcome	The reviewers included 15 group comparisons drawn from 14 trials .
outcome	They assessed a broad-spectrum of interventions and health outcomes with different follow-up times .
outcome	Meta-analyses could often not appropriately be performed because of heterogeneity among studies .
outcome	The studies showed a significant reduction in the probability of at least one hospital admission among patients receiving self-management education compared to those receiving usual care ( OR 0.64 ; 95 % CI ( 0.47 to 0.89 ) ) .
outcome	This translates into a one year NNT ranging from 10 ( 6 to 35 ) for patients with a 51 % risk of exacerbation , to an NNT of 24 ( 16 to 80 ) for patients with a 13 % risk of exacerbation .
outcome	On the disease specific SGRQ , differences reached statistical significance at the 5 % level on the total score ( WMD -2.58 ; 95 % CI ( -5.14 to -0.02 ) ) and impact domain ( WMD -2.83 ; 95 % CI ( -5.65 to -0.02 ) ) , but these difference did not reach the clinically re
outcome	A small but significant reduction was detected in dyspnoea measured with the BORG-scale ( WMD -0.53 ; 95 % CI ( -0.96 to -0.10 ) ) .
outcome	No significant effects were found either in number of exacerbations , emergency department visits , lung function , exercise capacity , and days lost from work .
outcome	Inconclusive results were observed in doctor and nurse visits , on symptoms other than dyspnoea , the use of courses of oral corticosteroids and antibiotics , and the use of rescue medication .
outcome	It is likely that self-management education is associated with a reduction in hospital admissions with no indications for detrimental effects in other outcome parameters .
outcome	This would in itself already be enough reason for recommending self-management education in COPD .
outcome	However , because of heterogeneity in interventions , study populations , follow-up time , and outcome measures , data are still insufficient to formulate clear recommendations regarding the form and contents of self-management education programmes in COPD .
outcome	There is an evident need for more large RCTs with a long-term follow-up , before more conclusions can be drawn .

###16207647
background	Clinical and experimental evidence has supported a benefit for the inclusion of fish oils ( a primary source of omega-3 fatty acids ) as a component of a normal healthy diet .
background	Polyunsaturated omega-3 fatty acids have been demonstrated to be of benefit in a number of inflammation-associated disease states , including atherosclerosis , autoimmune disorders , malignancy , and sepsis .
background	The beneficial effects of omega-3 fatty acids are thought to occur through the postulated antiinflammatory actions of omega-3 fats ; however , the specific mechanism ( s ) of action has not been completely defined .
background	In this review , we discuss the recent progress made in our laboratory on defining the mechanisms of omega-3 fatty acids activity .

###15899921
background	To test the effectiveness of a home based developmental education intervention in improving outcome at 5 years for very preterm infants .
population	The Avon Premature Infant Project ( APIP ) is a randomised controlled trial in which the parents of 284 babies born < 33 weeks gestational age received a developmental education programme , a social support intervention , or standard care .
other	A term reference population was also recruited .
other	This study reports outcomes at 5 years ( mean age 58 months 15 days ) for 187 ( 66 % ) of these children without disability .
other	Outcomes were assessed using the British Ability Scales II for cognitive development , the Movement ABC for motor impairment , and the Child Behavior Checklist for behavioural problems .
outcome	Preterm infants showed poorer cognitive performance than their term peers .
outcome	Mean ( SD ) general conceptual ability ( GCA ) scores were : Portage 99.2 ( 15.7 ) ; parent adviser 100.3 ( 14.8 ) ; preterm control 101.1 ( 15.0 ) ; term reference 107.2 ( 13.4 ) .
outcome	There were no significant differences between preterm groups in GCA scores indicating no effect of either intervention .
outcome	Similarly , there was no significant effect of intervention on behavioural or motor outcomes .
outcome	Further analyses , in which outcome data were adjusted for social factors , did not reveal any differences between the three preterm groups or by subgroups classified by a range of perinatal variables .
outcome	The small advantage shown at 2 years of age is no longer detectable at 5 years .
outcome	These results question the effectiveness of early intervention in enhancing cognitive , behavioural , and motor function at 5 years .

###17673692
background	Obstructive sleep apnea ( OSA ) is linked to increased cardiovascular risk , but the impact of mild forms of OSA and their treatment on cardiovascular outcomes remains controversial .
other	To prospectively investigate cardiovascular outcomes in treated versus untreated patients with OSA .
population	Consecutive sleep laboratory patients with all degrees of OSA were included .
other	Endpoints were nonfatal ( myocardial infarction , stroke , and acute coronary syndrome requiring revascularization procedures ) and fatal ( death from myocardial infarction or stroke ) cardiovascular events .
other	Comparison of event-free survival rates in treated versus untreated patients ( Kaplan-Meier estimates , log-rank test ) .
intervention	Of 449 patients enrolled ( age , 56.0 + / - 10.5 years ; body mass index , 30.8 + / - 5.4 kg/m ( 2 ) ) , 364 patients received OSA treatment , and 85 patients remained untreated .
other	Median follow-up was 72.0 months ( range , 1-156 ) .
outcome	Mean apnea-hypopnea index before treatment was 30.9 + / - 21.8 / hour in treated and 15.3 + / - 13.0 / hour in untreated patients , but there were no differences in cardiovascular comorbidities or risk factors .
outcome	In patients with mild-moderate OSA ( n = 288 ) , events were more frequent in untreated patients ( estimated event-free survival at 10 yr , 51.8 vs. 80.3 % [ P < 0.001 ] ; absolute risk reduction , 28.5 % ; number needed to treat to prevent one event/10 yr , 3.5 ) .
outcome	After adjustment for age , gender , cardiovascular risk factors , and comorbidities at baseline , OSA treatment was an independent predictor for events ( hazard ratio , 0.36 ; 95 % confidence interval , 0.21-0 .62 ; P < 0.001 ) .
outcome	OSA treatment was associated with a cardiovascular risk reduction of 64 % independent from age and preexisting cardiovascular comorbidities .
outcome	OSA treatment should be considered for primary and secondary cardiovascular prevention , even in milder OSA .

###17646104
background	In 1991 , a population-based epidemiologic traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) study was done in urban and rural areas of Taiwan ; this was 5 years before the helmet use law was passed and 8 years before the drink driving law was passed .
intervention	In order to evaluate the impact of three major determinants ( time , geography , and legislation ) on the epidemiology of TBI , we conducted a prospective study in 2001 and used the 1991 data to examine the differences in TBI distribution in urban and rural Ta
population	In 2001 , 5754 TBI cases were collected from the urban area of Taipei City , and 1474 TBI cases were collected from the rural area of Hualien County .
outcome	The TBI incidence rate in Taipei City in 2001 was estimated to be 218/100 ,000 population ( 285/100 ,000 for males and 152/100 ,000 for females ) .
outcome	When compared to the 1991 data , the incidence rate in 2001 had increased by 20 % .
outcome	The TBI incidence rate in Hualien County in 2001 was estimated to be 417/100 ,000 population ( 516/100 ,000 for males and 306/100 ,000 for females ) ; this was a 37 % increase over the 1991 data .
outcome	Our study found that the distribution of causes and age distribution had shifted significantly over the 10-year period .
outcome	In 2001 , the age group with the highest incidence was 20-29 years , while in 1991 it had been the over 70 years age group .
outcome	While traffic-related TBI had decreased , falls and assaults had increased in 2001 .
outcome	We also found that legislation , such as the helmet law , affects TBI distribution by decreasing the traffic-related TBI rate , decreasing the admission severity of TBI , and reducing TBI-related mortality .
outcome	Finally , geography plays a crucial role in the outcome of TBI ; over the 10 year period , Taipei had an increase in moderately severe outcomes , while Hualien had an increase in more severe outcomes .
outcome	Comparative studies of TBI in urban and rural areas have shown that time , legislation , and geography are crucial determinants of TBI epidemiology .
outcome	Although time and legal interventions seem to have more of an impact , geography does affect TBI outcomes .

###8527226
background	Adrenoleukodystrophy ( ALD ) is an X-linked disorder that involves mainly the nervous system white matter and adrenal cortex .
background	It is associated with the accumulation of saturated very-long-chain fatty acids ( VLCFAs ) , such as hexacosanoic acid ( C26 :0 ) , that occurs as a result of the impaired capacity to degrade these substances , a reaction that normally takes place in the peroxiso
background	The VLCFAs originate from the diet and are also synthesized endogenously .
background	Interest in dietary therapy arose from the observation that the administration of oils containing erucic and oleic acid ( Lorenzo 's oil ) , when combined with restriction of dietary intake of VLCFAs , can normalize plasma VLCFA levels in ALD patients .
background	Clinical results in patients who are already symptomatic have been disappointing .
background	However , preliminary data , still in need of confirmation , suggest that dietary therapy begun in asymptomatic patients can reduce the frequency and severity of later neurological disability .

###11687191
background	Many treatments are available for whiplash-patients , but to date , no evidence exists for their effectiveness .
population	The objective of this systematic review was to assess the efficacy of conservative treatment in patients with whiplash-injuries ( rated as Whiplash-Associated Disorders [ WAD ] I or II ) .
other	A computerized literature search of Medline , Embase , Cinahl , Psychlit and the Cochrane Controlled Trial Register through June 1998 was carried out .
other	We also screened reference lists of publications of identified randomized trials and relevant systematic reviews .
other	Studies were selected for inclusion if they fit the following criteria design was a ( randomized ) clinical trial ( RCT ) ; all patients had suffered a whiplash-injury ; the type of intervention was a conservative one ; pain , global perceived effect , or participation in daily activities was used as one of the outcome measures ; and the publication was written in English , French , German or Dutch .
other	The methodological quality of the studies was independently assessed by two reviewers using the Maastricht-Amsterdam list .
other	Three quality scores were calculated using this criteria list the Overall methodological Quality Score , the Internal Validity Score and the Delphi Quality Score .
other	The conclusion of the review was based on articles that scored a quality score of at least 50 percent of the maximum available score on two out of three quality scores .
other	Eleven studies met the inclusion criteria .
outcome	A broad variety of conservative interventions were evaluated , and only one study was performed in chronic whiplash patients .
outcome	Only three studies satisfied at least 50 percent on two out of three quality scores indicating poor overall methodological quality .
outcome	A high rank correlation was observed among the three methods of quality .
outcome	Because of the heterogeneity of patient selection , interventions and outcome measures , no statistical pooling was performed .
outcome	This review indicates that active treatments show a beneficial effect on at least one of the primary outcome measures , preferably pain .
outcome	In other words , rest and immobilization using collars are not recommended for the treatment of whiplash , while active interventions , such as advice to ` maintain usual activities ' might be effective in whiplash
outcome	Nevertheless , caution is needed when attempting to draw conclusions regarding the efficacy of conservative treatments in whiplash-patients , because of the paucity of high-quality studies .
outcome	No conclusions can be drawn about the most effective therapy for chronic whiplash-patients because only one low quality trial was identified .

###16437491
background	Women with endometriosis who are treated with in vitro fertilization ( IVF ) or intracytoplasmic sperm injection ( ICSI ) have a lower pregnancy rate compared to women with tubal factor infertility .
background	It has been suggested that the administration of gonadotrophin releasing hormone ( GnRH ) agonists for a few months prior to IVF or ICSI increases the pregnancy rate .
population	To determine the effectiveness of administering GnRH agonists for three to six months prior to IVF or ICSI in women with endometriosis .
other	We used computer searches of the Cochrane Central Register of Controlled Trials ( CENTRAL ) , MEDLINE , EMBASE , the National Research Register ( NRR ) and the MDSG Specialised Register of controlled trials .
other	We handsearched proceedings of annual meetings of the American Society for Reproductive Medicine ( ASRM ) and the European Society for Human Reproduction and Embryology ( ESHRE ) .
other	We reviewed lists of references in original research and review articles .
other	We contacted experts in various countries to identify unpublished trials .
other	We included randomised controlled trials using any GnRH agonist prior to IVF or ICSI to treat women with any degree of endometriosis diagnosed by laparoscopy or laparotomy DATA COLLECTION AND ANALYSIS
other	Two independent review authors abstracted data ( HNS and JGV ) .
other	We sent e-mails to investigators to seek additional information .
other	We assessed the validity of each study using the methods suggested in the Cochrane Handbook .
other	The data were checked by the third review author ( SD ) and any disagreement was resolved by arbitration with the fourth review author ( AA ) .
other	We generated 2 x 2 tables for principal outcome measures .
other	The Peto-modified Mantel-Haenszel technique was used to calculate odds ratios ( OR ) and assess statistical heterogeneity between studies .
other	Three randomised controlled trials ( with 165 women ) were included .
outcome	The live birth rate per woman was significantly higher in women receiving the GnRH agonist compared to the control group ( OR 9.19 , 95 % CI 1.08 to 78.22 ) .
outcome	However , this was based on one trial reporting `` viable pregnancy '' only .
outcome	The clinical pregnancy rate per woman was also significantly higher ( three studies : OR 4.28 , 95 % CI 2.00 to 9.15 ) .
outcome	The information on miscarriage rates came from two trials with high heterogeneity and , therefore , results of the meta-analysis were doubtful .
outcome	The included studies provided insufficient data to investigate the effects of administration of GnRH agonists on multiple or ectopic pregnancies , fetal abnormalities or other complications .
outcome	The administration of GnRH agonists for a period of three to six months prior to IVF or ICSI in women with endometriosis increases the odds of clinical pregnancy by fourfold .
outcome	Data regarding adverse effects of this therapy on the mother or fetus are not available at present .

###15846666
background	People with severe hemophilia A or B , X-linked bleeding disorders due to decreased blood levels of coagulants , suffer recurrent bleeding into joints and soft tissues .
background	Before clotting factor concentrates were available , most people with severe hemophilia developed crippling musculoskeletal deformities .
background	Clotting factor concentrate prophylaxis aims to preserve joint function by converting severe hemophilia ( factor VIII or IX less than 1 % ) into a clinically milder form of the disease .
background	Prophylaxis has long been used in Sweden , but not universally adopted because of medical , psychosocial , and cost controversies .
background	Use of clotting factor concentrates is the single largest predictor of cost in treating hemophilia .
population	To determine the effectiveness of clotting factor concentrate prophylaxis in the management of people with hemophilia A or B.
other	We searched the Cystic Fibrosis and Genetic Disorders Group 's Trials Register comprising references from comprehensive electronic database searches and handsearches of journals and abstract books .
other	Reference lists of relevant articles were reviewed.Most recent search January 2002 .
other	Randomized controlled trials ( RCTs ) evaluating people with severe hemophilia A or B , receiving prophylactic clotting factor concentrates .
other	Two reviewers independently reviewed studies for eligibility , assessed methodological quality and extracted data .
outcome	Twenty-nine studies were identified , of which four ( including 37 participants ) were eligible for inclusion .
outcome	Three studies evaluated hemophilia A ; one showed a decrease in frequency of joint bleeds with prophylaxis compared to placebo ( non-physiological dose ) , with a rate difference ( RD ) -10.80 ( 95 % confidence interval ( CI ) -16.33 to -5.27 ) bleeds per year .
outcome	The remaining two studies evaluating hemophilia A compared two prophylaxis regimens , one study showed no difference in joint bleed frequency , RD -5.04 ( 95 % CI -17.02 to 6.94 ) bleeds per year and another failed to demonstrate an advantage of factor VIII dos
outcome	The fourth study evaluated hemophilia B and showed fewer joint bleeds with weekly ( 15 IU/kg ) versus bi-weekly ( 7.5 IU/kg ) prophylaxis , RD -3.30 ( 95 % CI -5.50 to - 1.10 ) bleeds per year .
outcome	There is insufficient evidence to determine whether prophylactic clotting factor concentrates decrease bleeding and bleeding-related complications in hemophilia A or B , compared to placebo , on-demand treatment , or prophylaxis based on pharmacokinetic data
outcome	Well-designed RCTs are needed to assess the effectiveness of prophylactic clotting factor concentrates .
outcome	Two clinical trials are ongoing .

###16364690
background	Screening for ovarian cancer in the general population presents several unique challenges .
background	Without a clearly identified premalignant state , efforts have focused on detection of early stage disease .
background	Towards this end , investigators have focused on the use of serum markers and transvaginal ultrasound .
other	CA125 determination is the most reliable serum marker in use , and utilization of serial measurements to calculate risk of cancer appears to have greater utility than evaluation of a single value .
background	Multimodality screening focuses on combining serial CA125 measurement with transvaginal ultrasound follow-up for those with abnormal values .
background	Large prospective trials , such as the United Kingdom Collaborative Trial of Ovarian Cancer Screening ( UKCTOCS ) , are currently underway to assess the impact of various screening strategies on mortality , and to evaluate feasibility , acceptability , and morbi
background	Future research efforts will undoubtedly focus on promising techniques to examine the serum proteosome for patterns to identify early ovarian cancer .

###12071542
background	In the two decades after obstructive sleep apnea syndrome ( OSAS ) was described , it was considered a disease primarily of males .
background	As a result , for many years , epidemiologic studies of the general population examining the prevalence of OSAS included only males and investigators examined almost exclusively males in their pathophysiologic studies .
background	It has been widely recognized that OSAS in women is not as rare as it was originally believed .
background	Whereas early studies of clinic populations suggested that females made up about 10 % or less of OSAS cases , later studies of the general population suggest that about a third of all cases are females .
background	This suggests that there may be clinical under-recognition of OSAS in females .

background	These deleterious effects of increased core temperature on the neurological symptoms have been documented for a half century .
background	Elevation of the patient 's core temperature may lead to either transient or permanent neurologic symptoms and signs that predispose to considerable morbidity and mortality .

###8670001
background	To determine the relation between various components of spasticity evaluated clinically in persons with spinal cord injury ( SCI ) .
study design	Case series evaluating spasticity using clinical scales commonly referenced in contemporary literature , including the Penn Spasm Frequency Scale , the Ashworth Scale , and standard scales of tendon taps , clonus , and plantar stimulation .
other	A Veterans Affairs Medical Center Spinal Cord Injury Center .
population	Eighty-five spinal cord injured individuals with varying degrees of spasticity .
outcome	Correlations demonstrated weak relationships between Spasm Frequency Scale and self-report scales of interference with function ( .407 ) and painful spasms ( .312 ) .
outcome	No clinical examination score correlated with self-report scores greater than 0.4 .
outcome	Three clinical examination scores correlated modestly ( > 0.5 ) - Ashworth score with patellar tendon taps ( .553 ) , ankle clonus with Achilles tendon tap ( .663 ) , and patellar tendon tap with adductor tendon tap ( .512 ) .
outcome	Two other clinical scales correlated weakly ( > 0.4 ) - Achilles tendon tap with patellar tendon tap ( .417 ) and plantar reflex with adductor tendon taps ( .423 ) .
outcome	Clinical scales currently used to evaluate spasticity in SCI correlate poorly with each other , suggesting that they each assess different aspects of spasticity .
outcome	The use of any single scale is likely to underrepresent the magnitude and severity of spasticity in the SCI population .
outcome	In the absence of agreement among these various scales and with the absence of an appropriate criterion standard for evaluation of spasticity , assessments of spasticity , whether clinical or neurophysiological in nature , should be comprehensive in scope .

###14984725
background	The decrease in heart rate variability ( HRV ) might be related to the hemodynamic status in heart failure .
background	However , HRV in patients with severe isolated right heart failure has not been extensively studied .
population	This study compared HRV in patients with congestive heart failure ( CHF ) and in patients with isolated right heart failure .
other	Time and frequency domain analysis of HRV on 24-h ECG recording was assessed in 15 healthy subjects and in two groups of patients with severe heart failure awaiting heart or heart/lung transplantation .
other	These were 15 patients with CHF due to idiopathic dilated cardiomyopathy ( IDC ) and 10 patients with isolated right heart failure due to primary pulmonary hypertension ( PPH ) .
outcome	Measurement of HRV were significantly decreased in both groups of patients compared with the control group .
outcome	Patients with IDC had higher pulmonary capillary wedge pressure than patients with PPH ( P = 0.04 ) but lower pulmonary artery pressure and lower pulmonary vascular resistance ( PVR ) ( P < 0.0001 ) .
outcome	However , all the measurements of HRV were significantly lower in patients with IDC than in patients with PPH ( range 22-77 % , P < 0.05 to P < 0.01 ) .
outcome	None of the HRV measurements correlated with filling pressure measurements .
outcome	The increase in pulmonary vascular resistance in heart failure is not the main causal factor behind a decrease in HRV .

###16437495
background	Heat and cold are commonly utilised in the treatment of low-back pain by both health care professionals and people with low-back pain .
other	To assess the effects of superficial heat and cold therapy for low-back pain in adults .
other	We searched the Cochrane Back Review Group Specialised register , the Cochrane Central Register of Controlled Trials ( The Cochrane Library Issue 3 , 2005 ) , MEDLINE ( 1966 to October 2005 ) , EMBASE ( 1980 to October 2005 ) and other relevant databases .
population	We included randomised controlled trials and non-randomised controlled trials that examined superficial heat or cold therapies in people with low-back pain .
other	Two authors independently assessed methodological quality and extracted data , using the criteria recommended by the Cochrane Back Review Group .
other	Nine trials involving 1117 participants were included .
outcome	In two trials of 258 participants with a mix of acute and sub-acute low-back pain , heat wrap therapy significantly reduced pain after five days ( weighted mean difference ( WMD ) 1.06 , 95 % confidence interval ( CI ) 0.68 to 1.45 , scale range 0 to 5 ) compared t
outcome	One trial of 90 participants with acute low-back pain found that a heated blanket significantly decreased acute low-back pain immediately after application ( WMD -32.20 , 95 % CI -38.69 to -25.71 , scale range 0 to 100 ) .
outcome	One trial of 100 participants with a mix of acute and sub-acute low-back pain examined the additional effects of adding exercise to heat wrap , and found that it reduced pain after seven days .
outcome	There is insufficient evidence to evaluate the effects of cold for low-back pain , and conflicting evidence for any differences between heat and cold for low-back pain .
outcome	The evidence base to support the common practice of superficial heat and cold for low back pain is limited and there is a need for future higher-quality randomised controlled trials .
outcome	There is moderate evidence in a small number of trials that heat wrap therapy provides a small short-term reduction in pain and disability in a population with a mix of acute and sub-acute low-back pain , and that the addition of exercise further reduces p
outcome	The evidence for the application of cold treatment to low-back pain is even more limited , with only three poor quality studies located .
outcome	No conclusions can be drawn about the use of cold for low-back pain .
outcome	There is conflicting evidence to determine the differences between heat and cold for low-back pain .

###17636722
background	Subclinical hypothyroidism is defined as an elevated serum thyroid-stimulating hormone ( TSH ) level with normal free thyroid hormones values .
background	The prevalence of subclinical hypothyroidism is 4 % to 8 % in the general population , and up to 15 % to 18 % in women who are over 60 years of age .
background	There is considerable controversy regarding the morbidity , the clinical significance of subclinical hypothyroidism and if these patients should be treated .
other	To assess the effects of thyroid hormone replacement for subclinical hypothyroidism .
other	We searched The Cochrane Library , MEDLINE , EMBASE and LILACS .
other	Ongoing trials databases , reference lists and abstracts of congresses were scrutinized as well .
population	All studies had to be randomised controlled trials comparing thyroid hormone replacement with placebo or no treatment in adults with subclinical hypothyroidism .
other	Minimum duration of follow-up was one month .
other	Two authors independently assessed trial quality and extracted data .
other	We contacted study authors for missing or additional information .
other	Twelve trials of six to 14 months duration involving 350 people were included .
outcome	Eleven trials investigated levothyroxine replacement with placebo , one study compared levothyroxine replacement with no treatment .
other	We did not identify any trial that assessed ( cardiovascular ) mortality or morbidity .
outcome	Seven studies evaluated symptoms , mood and quality of life with no statistically significant improvement .
outcome	One study showed a statistically significant improvement in cognitive function .
outcome	Six studies assessed serum lipids , there was a trend for reduction in some parameters following levothyroxine replacement .
outcome	Some echocardiographic parameters improved after levothyroxine replacement therapy , like myocardial relaxation , as indicated by a significant prolongation of the isovolumic relaxation time as well as diastolic dysfunction .
outcome	Only four studies reported adverse events with no statistically significant differences between groups .
outcome	In current RCTs , levothyroxine replacement therapy for subclinical hypothyroidism did not result in improved survival or decreased cardiovascular morbidity .
outcome	Data on health-related quality of life and symptoms did not demonstrate significant differences between intervention groups .
outcome	Some evidence indicates that levothyroxine replacement improves some parameters of lipid profiles and left ventricular function .

###16734999
background	Low back pain ( LBP ) is a widespread health problem and a major contributor to increasing health costs and lost work days .
background	Different pathologies cause LBP and one of these is lumbar degenerative spondylolisthesis ( SPL ) .
background	There are no generally accepted and standardized methods for assessing the outcome of patients treated for degenerative lumbar SPL .
other	This study aims to assess quality of life after surgery for lumbar degenerative SPL through the adoption of outcome measures .
population	We studied 76 patients treated , for degenerative lumbar SPL , with spinal stabilization , decompression and bilateral dorsolateral fusion , followed up for at least two years .
other	We used the Roland-Morris ( RM ) scale and the Oswestry Disability Index ( ODI ) to assess the quality of life of the patients before surgery and at follow up .
other	Each patient was pre-operatively studied through standard and dynamic x-rays , CT scan and MRI of lumbar column .
other	Relationships between clinical , radiological and disability scores , grouped by categories , were tested .
other	The sample comprised 25 males and 51 females .
other	Mean age was 59.6 years ( SD 12.2 ) .
outcome	The mean duration of symptoms ( from clinical onset to surgery ) was 23.42 months ( median 13 , range 4-100 months ) .
outcome	In about half of the cases , duration of symptoms before surgery was > 12 months .
outcome	At follow up , the fusion rate was 85.5 % , and the ODI score was significantly reduced : an improvement of < 20 points in 35.7 % of patients , and of > 20 points in 55.7 % .
outcome	On the RM scale , 59.4 % of patients had a reduction > 5 points , 13.1 % a reduction of 2-4 points , and 27.5 % an unchanged or worse score .
outcome	There was no significant reduction in RM scale and ODI scores in patients with fusion versus pseudoarthrosis .
outcome	Instrumental pedicle screw fixation and arthorodesis seem to be very effective in improving quality of life , as shown by the reduced disability scores at follow up .

###11965332
background	In 1998 , a research study was conducted to compare existing programs in the European Union providing both care to people with senile dementia of the Alzheimer type , and support to their informal caregiver .
other	Five programs were selected in seven centres .
other	Home social services ( Denmark ) , Day centres ( Germany ) , Expert Centres ( Belgium , Spain ) , Group Living/Cantou ( Sweden , France ) , Respite hospitalization ( France ) .
population	In each centre , 50 patients were randomly selected .
other	The questionnaire addressed informal caregivers ( or referents ) .
other	It included the Nottingham Health Profile ( NHP ) , the Zarit Scale , and it collected data on age , sex and position ( spouse or child ) of the informal caregiver , as well as age , level of mental deterioration and disabilities of the patient .
outcome	( n = 322 subjects ) Comparatively with caregivers of Respite hospitalization patients chosen as the reference , caregivers of patients cared by Group living/Cantou and Home social services experienced a significantly lower burden .
outcome	The benefit from the Expert centre program concerned emotional reactions ( depression ) ( odds ratio = 0.32 ; P = 0.02 ) and work burden ( Zarit ) ( OR = 0.32 ; P = 0.04 ) .
outcome	The main benefit for caregivers who received Day centre help was the important reduction of feelings of social isolation ( OR = 0.13 ; P = 0.0003 ) .
outcome	The Group Living/Cantou program appeared as the most efficient way to reduce informal caregiver burden , independently from the country considered .

###16089255
background	In response to increasing demand for more accountability and improved outcomes in the provision of behavioural services , Specialist Education Services ( SES ) in New Zealand employed the trainer of trainers programme developed by the Institute for Applied B
background	The goal was to develop a national training team capable of training SES staff to carry out assessments and develop support plans that could meet defined standards .
other	The purpose of this study was to evaluate the outcomes of this trainer of trainers project .
population	The primary methods of evaluation included the pre-post training comparisons of trainees ' functional assessments and positive behaviour support plans , against 140 defined criteria .
outcome	The results of this project indicated that the SES national training team was able to train SES staff to meet the same standards of service delivery as the external IABA trainers .
outcome	Further , a Periodic Service Review ( PSR ) system was implemented to insure that service standards could be maintained at a high level .
outcome	A major conclusion reached in this study was that a trainer of trainer approach appears to be effective in preparing large numbers of educational personnel to meet the increasing demands by schools for professionals to meet a high standard of service deli

###6092532
study design	The authors have completed a large descriptive study of the system of psychiatric aftercare in Metropolitan Toronto .
population	This article describes the relevant 6-month and 2-year postdischarge outcome in each of five aftercare components for 505 subjects in a traditional system of service delivery .
other	Provincial hospital , research institute , and general hospital subgroups are compared .
outcome	For the total group , recidivism and employment rates are similar to those found in previous studies .
outcome	Symptoms and distress levels are high .
outcome	Considerable numbers of subjects live in inadequate and unsatisfactory housing .
outcome	Social isolation , inadequate income , and difficulties with instrumental role functioning are persistent problems with little improvement between 6 months and 2 years postdischarge .
outcome	Differences among the subgroups vary according to type of outcome and , for the most part , can be explained by differences in the characteristics of the patients served by the three types of inpatient treatment settings .
outcome	These findings provide additional information about serious deficiencies in discharge planning and aftercare service delivery that is focused primarily upon the treatment of illness .
outcome	The authors conclude that a more balanced system of aftercare requires a shift in resources to rehabilitation programs in the community .

###14581409
background	In ventricular myocardium , the T-type Ca2 + current ( ICa , T ) , which is temporarily observed during fetal and neonatal periods , has been shown to reappear in failing/remodeling hearts .
background	However , its pathophysiological regulation has not been elucidated .
population	We utilized Dahl salt-sensitive ( DS ) rats with hypertension at the stage of concentric left ventricular ( LV ) hypertrophy ( 11 weeks old , LVH ) and at the heart failure stage ( 16 to 18 weeks old , CHF ) .
intervention	Some were treated with bosentan ( 100 mg/kg per day ) during the period from LVH to CHF .
outcome	In LVH , neither the presence of ICa , T ( measured in the freshly isolated LV myocytes ) nor an increase in alpha-1G mRNA expression were detected .
outcome	This condition was associated with increases in tissue angiotensin II ( AII ) but not with endothelin ( ET ) -1 peptides .
outcome	In contrast , in CHF , when the tissue AII remained elevated and ET-1 de novo increased , ICa , T was recorded in most of the cells ( -0.87 + / -0.18 pA/pF at -30 mV , P < 0.01 versus LVH ) .
outcome	This was associated with a significant increase in the alpha-1G mRNA level .
outcome	The chronic bosentan treatment eliminated both the elevation of alpha-1G mRNA level and ICa , T from the cells , whereas it did not affect the cell size and membrane capacitance .
outcome	In addition , 48-hour exposure to ET-1 but not AII induced ICa , T in normal adult myocytes in culture from Sprague-Dawley rats .
outcome	ICa , T channels reappear in failing but not in hypertrophied LV cardiomyocytes in a manner depending on the tissue ET-1 activation .

###12719182
background	Economic restructuring in the health services industry in the USA exemplifies general patterns of economic change propelled by neoliberalism , especially industry privatization , diminished social services , and dependence on `` flexible '' labor and m
background	Combined with the widespread entry of women into the labor force , an aging population , and minimal assistance for high quality long-term care at the end of life , these economic and social conditions raise a set of difficult policy questions for health ser
background	Set in these broad contexts , this paper situates access to and experience of health services in the home , the hospital , and nursing facility , to demonstrate how economic changes have relocated and redefined health services in ways that distinctively impac
background	This place switching of health services externalizes costs of subacute and `` daily life care '' ( the so-called custodial care ) to the sphere of the individual , their family , and communities .
background	The theoretical analysis uses current geographical and philosophical approaches to place and space , and considers the tensions between institutionally managed health care space , and the patient 's experience of receiving health services in place .
background	The place/space dilemma of health services provision is examined through several interrelated subjects : long-term care at the end of life , gendered characteristics of care giving , the limitations of Medicare and Medicaid , historical changes in hospital le
background	The analysis is based on examples of stroke and incontinence care to demonstrate the importance of considering place and space issues in health care planning .

###12231567
background	Obesity is associated with increased morbidity and mortality from atherosclerotic disease .
background	Lipid abnormalities contribute to the increased relative risk in obese subjects .
background	Cholesteryl ester transfer protein ( CETP ) mass is increased in these patients and might mediate the atherogenic lipoprotein pattern observed in obesity .
population	Twenty-one morbidly obese , middle-aged , female subjects participated in this prospective study .
intervention	Subjects were examined before and 1 year after surgical treatment .
other	Fat mass was determined by body impedance analysis ; CETP mass , by ELISA ; CETP activity , by exogenous substrate assay ; and LDL particle diameter , by gradient gel electrophoresis .
outcome	Mean weight loss after 1 year was 28.7 kg ; mean fat mass loss was 22.6 kg .
outcome	Mean CETP mass decreased from 1.81 to 1.32 microg/mL ( P = 0.008 ) ; mean CETP activity decreased from 244 to 184 nmol x mL ( -1 ) x h ( -1 ) ( P = 0.004 ) ; and in parallel , the mean diameter of LDL particles increased ( 256.8 to 258.4 A , P = 0.04 ) .
outcome	We conclude that weight loss is associated with a pronounced decrease in CETP mass and activity and a consistent increase in LDL particle diameter .
outcome	After 1 year of this prospective study in morbidly obese subjects undergoing weight loss by surgical treatment , it has been determined that some features of the atherogenic lipoprotein profile can be reversed .

###16765483
background	This article describes the effect of introducing a cohort area into a vascular surgery ward where a sustained increase in new cases of meticillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus ( MRSA ) made the implementation of standard MRSA infection control precautions
background	A recent review of published reports concluded , ` that little evidence could be found to suggest that isolation measures recommended in the UK are effective ' .
background	The authors recommended a reporting format to enable the evidence for isolation to be gathered more systematically .
other	This paper follows the recommended reporting format .
outcome	The setting was a 30-bedded acute and subacute vascular surgery ward within a tertiary care hospital in Glasgow , UK .
outcome	The data were analysed as an interrupted time series of 19 months pre-cohort , eight months with cohort and eight months post cohort .
outcome	Following the instigation of the cohort area , there was a significant reduction in the number of nosocomial MRSA isolates from patients ( P = 0.0005 ) .
outcome	This reduction was sustained after the cohort area was discontinued .
outcome	In conclusion , effective separation of MRSA-colonized / - infected patients from patients who are not colonized/infected with MRSA , using a cohort area , resulted in a significant reduction in MRSA cross-colonization and cross-infection .
outcome	The resulting reduction in MRSA prevalence within the unit facilitated effective screening and isolation of subsequent patients once the cohort area had been discontinued .

###16091504
background	Previous studies have retrospectively reported the positive effects of percutaneous vertebroplasty .
background	The purpose of our study was to evaluate prospectively the effects of vertebroplasty on mobility , analgesic use , pain , and SF-36 ( short-form 36-item ) scales for patients with painful vertebral compression fractures that are refractory to medical therapy .
population	We prospectively followed 167 patients who received 207 vertebroplasty treatment sessions for stabilization of 264 symptomatic vertebral compression fractures between August 1999 and January 2003 .
other	The average age of patients was 74.6 years ( SD = 12.2 years ) , and 76 % were women .
other	Pre - and postprocedural measurements of pain , mobility , analgesic use , and SF-36 scales were compared at 1 month after the procedure and between 6 months and 3 years after the procedure with the SF-36 scales .
outcome	Respective pre - and post-treatment pain scores were 8.71 ( SE = 0.1 ) and 2.77 ( SE = 0.18 ; P < .00001 ) .
outcome	Respective pre - and post-treatment analgesic use scores were 2.93 ( SE = 0.9 ) and 1.64 ( SE = 0.09 ; P < .00001 ) .
outcome	Respective pre - and post-treatment activity levels were 2.66 ( SE = 0.1 ) and 1.64 ( SE = 0.11 ; P < .00001 ) .
outcome	There was a statistically significant improvement on nine of 10 SF-36 scales ( P < .001 ) after 1 month and on eight of 10 SF-36 scales ( P < .02 ) at long-term follow-up .
outcome	Percutaneous vertebroplasty offers statistically significant benefits in decreasing pain , decreasing use of analgesics , and increasing mobility in appropriately selected patients .
outcome	Percutaneous vertebroplasty also offers a statistically significant benefit in most SF-36 scales at both short - and long-term follow-up .

###12601656
background	To identify factors associated with specific categories of charges during acute inpatient rehabilitation treatment after traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) .
study design	Prospective observational study .
other	A single Traumatic Brain Injury Model Systems ( TBIMS ) center .
population	Eighty-four consecutive TBIMS patients .
other	One exploratory analysis also included all 350 patients with TBI admitted during 1999 .
other	Not applicable .
other	Average daily charges for specific categories of resource use ( eg , room and board , rehabilitation therapies , functional labs ) .
outcome	Room and board and rehabilitation therapy accounted for almost 90 % of average daily charges .
outcome	There was no linear component of change in average daily charges , but certain categories of charges were significantly higher during the first week than thereafter .
outcome	Functional status at rehabilitation admission correlated with charges for respiratory , medical , and surgical supplies and with pharmacy and radiology , but not the other categories .
outcome	Specific medical variables also correlated with specific charge categories .
outcome	Focused chart reviews of patients with low and high charges in specific categories led to the formulation of additional predictive hypotheses .
outcome	Certain categories of charges correlated with functional scores and acute medical variables that are known before admission to acute inpatient rehabilitation , allowing for better inpatient admission planning under prospective payment .
outcome	Further research is needed to identify and correlate resource use that is bundled within the room and board category .

###18231079
background	To document the absenteeism costs associated with obesity and morbid obesity by occupation .
other	Data from the Medical Expenditure Panel Survey for 2000-2004 are examined .
other	The outcomes are probability of missing any work in the previous year and number of days of work missed in the previous year .
other	Predictors include clinical weight classification , age , education , and race .
other	Models are estimated separately by gender and occupation category .
outcome	The probability of missing work in the past year , number of days missed , and costs of absenteeism rise with clinical weight classification for both women and men , and vary across occupation .
outcome	Absenteeism costs associated with obesity total $ 4.3 billion annually in the United States .
outcome	Substantial absenteeism costs are associated with obesity and morbid obesity .
outcome	Employers should explore workplace interventions and health insurance expansions to reduce these costs .

###16021360
background	Whereas the effect of interferons ( IFNs ) on magnetic resonance imaging ( MRI ) outcome measures in patients with multiple sclerosis ( MS ) has been convincingly shown , little work has been done to define the between-patient heterogeneity of treatment response
population	Our aim was to assess the distribution of the effect of IFNbeta-1b in terms of reduction of active T2 lesions in patients with MS.
intervention	Using a fixed and a random effects model , we investigated the distribution of active T2 lesions reduction over a three-year follow up in response to treatment with 250 mcg IFNbeta-1b every other day in 695 patients with a complete MRI data-set of the 718
outcome	The two statistical models consistently showed that the between-patient response to IFNbeta-1b , in terms of reduction of active T2 lesions , is highly heterogeneous .
outcome	Whereas treated patients have a high probability ( more than 65 % ) of showing an active T2 lesion reduction equal to or greater than 60 % , there is also a 7 % probability for treated patients not to show any reduction of MRI-detected disease activity during t
outcome	This study might be regarded as a first step toward the definition of markers potentially useful to identify IFNbeta treatment responders and non-responders with regard to T2 lesion activity .

###12356708
background	Community pharmacists have increasing involvement in the self-management of minor illness as a result of the availability of a wider range of over-the-counter ( OTC ) medicines .
other	We undertook a randomized controlled trial ( RCT ) to assess the effectiveness and efficiency of educational strategies to implement evidence-based guidelines for the sale of OTC anti-fungals in the community pharmacy setting .
other	The aim of the study was to compare the effectiveness and efficiency of two guideline dissemination strategies in community pharmacy settings .
population	A 2 x 2 factorial , cluster RCT was conducted with 60 community pharmacies in the Grampian region of Scotland .
intervention	The interventions included dissemination of an evidence-based guideline for OTC management of vulvovaginal candidiasis ( thrush ) by postal dissemination ( control ) , educational outreach visit or attendance at a continuing professional education session .
other	Pre - and post-intervention simulated patient visits were made to participating pharmacies .
other	The simulated patients completed assessment forms following each visit .
other	The primary outcome was the appropriateness ( based upon the guidelines ) of sale or no sale of OTC anti-fungals .
outcome	There were no significant differences in the proportion of appropriate outcomes following educational outreach [ odds ratio ( OR ) = 1.1 ; 95 % confidence interval ( CI ) 0.52 to 2.45 ] or continuing professional education ( OR = 0.88 ; 95 % CI 0.41 to 1.91 ) .
outcome	Neither strategy was effective in improving the appropriateness of OTC management of vulvovaginal candidiasis by community pharmacy staff .
outcome	Further research is needed to identify barriers to guideline implementation and evidence-based practice in this setting .

###11208947
background	The importance of maternal dietary fatty acids on arachidonic acid [ AA ; 20:4 ( n-6 ) ] and docosahexaenoic acid [ DHA ; 22:6 ( n-3 ) ] in fetal brain nerve growth cone membranes and monoaminergic neurotransmitters was investigated .
population	Rats were fed purified diets containing 20 g/100 g safflower oil with 74.3 % 18:2 ( n-6 ) , 0.2 % 18:3 ( n-3 ) , soybean oil with 55.4 % 18:2 ( n-6 ) , 7.7 % 18:3 ( n-3 ) or high fish oil with 24.6 % 22:6 ( n-3 ) through gestation .
other	Tissue for rats within a litter were pooled at birth , brain growth cone membranes prepared and phosphatidylcholine ( PC ) , phosphatidylserine ( PS ) , phosphatidylethanolamine ( PE ) and phosphatidylinositol ( PI ) fatty acids quantified by gas-liquid chromatography .
other	Dopamine , serotonin , and the metabolites 3,4-dihydroxyphenylacetic acid and homovanillic acid , and 5-hydroxyindolacetic acid were quantified by HPLC .
outcome	Growth cone membranes from offspring of rats fed safflower oil had significantly lower , and offspring of rats fed high 22:6 ( n-3 ) fish oil had significantly higher 22:6 ( n-3 ) in PE , PS and PI than the soybean oil group .
outcome	The growth cone membrane PC , PE and PS 20:4 ( n-6 ) was significantly lower in the fish oil than in the soybean or safflower oil groups .
outcome	Serotonin concentration was significantly higher in brain of offspring in the safflower oil compared with the soybean oil group .
outcome	The newborn brain dopamine was inversely related to PE DHA and PS DHA ( P < 0.001 ) , but positively related to PC AA ( P < 0.05 ) .
outcome	These studies show that maternal dietary fatty acids may alter fetal brain growth cone ( n-6 ) and ( n-3 ) fatty acids , and neurotransmitters involved in neurite extension , target finding and synaptogenesis .
outcome	The functional importance , however , is not known at this time .

###17303529
background	Adjunctive dexamethasone increases survival from tuberculous meningitis , but the underlying mechanism is unclear .
background	We aimed to determine the effect of dexamethasone on cerebral MRI changes and their association with intracerebral inflammatory responses and clinical outcome in adults treated for tuberculous meningitis .
population	Cerebral MRI was undertaken , when possible , at diagnosis and after 60 days and 270 days of treatment in adults with tuberculous meningitis admitted to two hospitals in Vietnam .
intervention	Patients were randomly assigned either dexamethasone ( n = 24 ) or placebo ( n = 19 ) and received 9 months of treatment with standard first-line antituberculosis drugs .
other	We assessed associations between MRI findings , treatment allocation , and resolution of fever , coma , cerebrospinal fluid inflammation , and neurological outcome .
outcome	83 scans were done for 43 patients : 19 given placebo , 24 given dexamethasone .
outcome	Basal meningeal enhancement ( 82 % ) and hydrocephalus ( 77 % ) were the most common presenting findings .
outcome	Fewer patients had hydrocephalus after 60 days of treatment with dexamethasone than after placebo treatment ( p = 0.217 ) .
outcome	Tuberculomas developed in 74 % of patients during treatment and in equal proportions in the treatment groups ; they were associated with long-term fever , but not relapse or poor clinical outcome .
outcome	The basal ganglia were the most common site of infarction ; the proportion with infarction after 60 days was halved in the dexamethasone group ( 27 % vs 58 % , p = 0.130 ) .
outcome	Dexamethasone may affect outcome from tuberculous meningitis by reducing hydrocephalus and preventing infarction .
outcome	The effect may have been under-estimated because the most severe patients could not be scanned .

###6724012
population	Twenty infertile women with a history of diethylstilbestrol exposure in utero were seen in Norfolk for the purpose of in vitro fertilization .
background	Seventeen patients had undergone 25 stimulated cycles with harvest of oocytes by laparoscopy .
other	The serum estradiol response to stimulation in these patients and the number and quality of oocytes retrieved did not differ significantly from those of patients with infertility due to blocked fallopian tubes .
outcome	There were four pregnancies in 17 patients after 21 cycles of embryo transfers , for a pregnancy rate of 23.5 % per patient , or 19 % per embryo transfer .
outcome	Two of the pregnant patients have had a term delivery , one has had a preclinical abortion , and one has a single intrauterine gestation in progress .

###15478578
background	Patients with cancer who have bone metastases may live for several years following diagnosis .
background	However , skeletal disease significantly impacts quality of life , causing bone pain , pathologic fractures , spinal cord compression , and hypercalcemia .
background	This program covered the challenges of treatment , new standards of care , advances in nursing , responsibilities in supportive care , and current trials investigating options for treatment-induced bone loss .

###8594964
background	Neoplastic or traumatic lesions of the brain stem or the upper spinal cord frequently cause respiratory insufficiency necessitating permanent mechanical ventilation .
background	If the integrity of the diaphragm and its nerves is not affected , adequate ventilation can be achieved by electric stimulation of the phrenic nerves .
background	Diaphragm pacing systems mean the patients can be independent of ventilator treatment .
background	This is a psychological advantage for the patient , giving him or her the option of living in less specialized medical care units and perhaps even at home .
population	We report the case of a 47-year-old man with a brain stem tumour , which was resected in large pieces .
other	During the postoperative period an increasingly severe respiratory insufficiency developed , which finally made continuous mechanical ventilation necessary .
other	After the viability of the phrenic nerves and contractility of the diaphragm had been shown by direct stimulation of the nerves to be still intact , it was decided that a diaphragm pacer system should be implanted .
intervention	A `` Diaphragm Pacer System S232 G '' ( Avery Laboratories , Glen Cove , N.Y. , USA : external transmitter , antenna , implanted electrode and receiver ) was implanted .
intervention	Using a supraclavicular approach , phrenic nerve electrodes were placed around each nerve and connected with subcutaneous implants of radio signal receivers .
other	Six days after implantation phrenic nerves were stimulated for a first short period .
other	External antenna loops were taped to the skin over the implanted receiver sites ( Fig. 3 ) .
outcome	The impulses produced by the transmitter were delivered via these antenna loops and led to contraction of the diaphragm , providing almost normal respiration .
outcome	The duration of stimulation was increased stepwise from 1 h a day to full-time stimulation .
outcome	Three weeks after implantation of the diaphragm pacer system the patient could be totally weaned from mechanical ventilation .
outcome	After a further 2 weeks it was possible to discharge him from the intensive care unit , and he was then transferred to a rehabilitation centre .

###15784817
background	Ovarian damage following cancer therapy is dependent on age at treatment as well as the type of therapeutic exposures .
background	Older age and exposure to higher doses of alkylating agents and higher doses of radiation to the ovary are associated with a greater likelihood of ovarian failure .
background	Acute loss of ovarian function during or shortly following treatment is relatively uncommon in females treated during childhood and adolescence but can be seen following myeloablative , alkylator-based cytoreduction ( e.g. , busulfan and cyclophosphamide ) fo
outcome	For survivors who retain normal ovarian function after cancer therapy , there is an increased risk of premature menopause later in life .
outcome	The risk factors associated with an early menopause include exposure to high doses of alkylating agents and abdomino-pelvic radiation .

###2389151
population	Family stress , family and personal resources , and parental coping were operationalized from self-report questionnaires completed by mothers and fathers in 72 two-parent families who had a child with cystic fibrosis ( CF ) .
outcome	Three-month and 15-month changes in clinically recorded measures of the CF child 's height and weight data and pulmonary functioning were correlated with the family functioning variables .
outcome	Each of the four criterion indices of CF child health changes were regressed separately on the significant family functioning variables .
outcome	Twenty-two percent of the variance in 15-month height and weight changes were explained by family stress , family resources , and parental coping .
outcome	Family functioning variables also explained 17 % of the variance in 3-month pulmonary functioning changes and 15 % of the variance in 3-month height and weight changes .
outcome	These findings suggest that the way in which the family functions has indirect effects on critical indices of a CF child 's health .
outcome	These data lend support to an increased focus by physicians and other medical professionals on the health of the total family system as a way to enhance outcomes for children with CF.

###3388114
population	Sixteen patients were treated with a new anterior internal fixation device after thoracolumbar or lumbar decompression , and fusion with bone grafting .
outcome	Ten patients had acute burst fractures , four had metastatic tumors , and two had old , healed fractures with deformity .
outcome	In the acute fracture group , eight patients had neurologic deficits and seven patients experienced improvement .
outcome	Six patients had lesions of the conus medullaris , all of which improved .
outcome	The four patients with metastatic tumors underwent surgery for back and leg pain and all gained significant relief .
outcome	Two patients had correction of old fracture deformity with satisfactory outcome .
outcome	Complications were minimal .
outcome	The new anterior stabilization device provided early stability , allowed early patient mobilization , was easy to insert , and has a low profile .
outcome	Late collapse , non-union , and kyphotic deformity have not been noted thusfar .

###6829452
background	Tricyclic antidepressant drugs such as imipramine and desipramine have long been known to produce cardiovascular side effects including sinus tachycardia , prolongation of the P-R , QRS , and Q-T intervals , and decreased T-wave amplitude .
background	Life-threatening ventricular ectopic activity has occurred after tricyclic drug overdose .
background	Recently , maprotiline ( Ludiomil ) , a tetracyclic anthracene-derivative antidepressant , has become available for the treatment of affective disorders .
background	It appears as effective as the tricyclic drugs in relieving unipolar depression .
background	Although several studies have reported a low incidence of cardiovascular side effects , others show little difference between the tetracyclic and tricyclic drugs .
outcome	This report describes a patient in whom maprotiline treatment caused Q-T prolongation and life-threatening torsades de pointes ventricular tachycardia ( VT ) .

###15022947
background	The incidence of cancer increases exponentially with age and a large number of cancer patients are the older members of society .
background	In many developing and some developed countries , the disease is usually detected at a stage when it is too late for aggressive anticancer therapy to have the desired effect .
background	Most cancer patients suffer moderate to severe pain during the terminal phase of the disease .
background	This pain is unpredictable and produces fear and anxiety in patients and family members .
background	Morphine is the gold standard analgesic to control this pain , but its availability is restricted .
background	The fear of diversion of morphine for non-medical uses has led to severe control on its availability .
background	Studies have shown that diversion of medical morphine is not really an issue .
background	This paper describes attempts to increase morphine availability through the courts in India .
background	The courts have issued directives to improve the availability of the drug , yet 97 % of Indian patients have very poor access to the drug .
background	There is a need to improve access to pain-free end-of-life care .
background	In the absence of morphine , physicians lack experience in its use .
background	They need to be educated to provide for their patients a pain-free life .
background	Patients and their families need to be educated that cancer need not end in a painful death .

###14517577
background	The red flags raised by the 1990 clinical reports of increased suicidality associated with treatment with the selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor ( SSRI ) fluoxetine were followed by anecdotal reports of similar symptoms with other antidepressants of the
background	Recent discussions by Healy have argued in favour of a suicidogenic potential of the SSRIs .
background	This paper reviews the relevant literature addressing the epidemiological data of Western populations and the data accumulated from clinical trial databases in several countries .
outcome	The evidence currently available does not support the hypothesis that antidepressants or , more specifically , SSRIs cause increased suicidality in patients with depression , nor do they appear to do so in patients treated with these drugs for other reasons .

###15655637
background	In locally advanced colorectal cancer , combined modality treatment is a standard adjuvant therapy in USA and Europe .
intervention	The basic issue of the timing of radiotherapy and chemotherapy and preoperative radio-chemotherapy versus postoperative radio-chemotherapy is being addressed in prospective trials .
outcome	Preoperative radiotherapy proved that causes more radiosensitivity due to that oxygen tension within the tumour may be higher prior to surgery .
outcome	Technically , there are two approaches of preoperative radiotherapy .
outcome	The aim of this article is to report the inclusion criteria , indications , advantages and results of short course preoperative radiotherapy .

###1627632
outcome	When male weanling rats were fed diets containing either 5 % corn oil or a diet in which half of the corn oil was replaced by fish oil , the 20:5 ( n - 3 ) in liver choline and ethanolamine phosphoglycerides , not only partially replaced arachidonate but also p
outcome	The 22:5 ( n - 3 ) / 22:6 ( n - 3 ) ratio in the liver phospholipids of corn oil fed rats was similar to that found when the esterified levels of these two acids were increased 5-fold by feeding fish oil .
outcome	Moreover , the pairing of both 22:5 ( n - 3 ) and 22:6 ( n - 3 ) with palmitic and stearic acids , on a molar ratio basis , was relatively independent of the total amount of esterified 22:5 ( n - 3 ) and 22:6 ( n - 3 ) .

outcome	Conversely , [ 3-14C ] 22:5 ( n - 3 ) was a poorer substrate for retroconversion with a larger amount being esterified directly into phospholipids and , in addition , this acid served as a precursor for 22:6 ( n - 3 ) .
