###11441627
background	Inadequate pain control is a dismaying reality in cancer patients .
population	To review studies on cancer pain control interventions , and describe their findings with respect to participants ' attitudes and knowledge , pain management , and pain levels .
other	Computer searches were made in MEDLINE from January 1962 , in PsychLIT from January 1974 , and in CINAHL from January 1982 to August 1999 , using a search strategy based on a combination of key words .
other	Computerized listings from these sources contained 383 , 26 , and 85 articles , respectively .
other	After exclusion of duplicates , abstracts , editorials , letters , and irrelevant articles , we retained for review 33 articles , of which 25 ( 76 % ) were interventions targeting health professionals , and 8 ( 24 % ) interventions targeting patients and family caregivers .
other	Study reports were reviewed using the following structured framework
other	Intervention Setting , Study Methods , Process Assessment , and Pain Outcome Assessment ( Attitudes and Knowledge , Pain Management , and Pain Relief/Quality of Life ) .
outcome	Educational interventions can successfully improve cancer pain knowledge and attitudes of health care professionals , but without having much impact on patients ' pain levels .
outcome	The most promising avenue for improving cancer pain control in ambulatory settings may be brief , nursing interventions targeting patients in combination with a daily pain diary .
outcome	This review suggests that further progress may occur through incorporating a systematic and valid method of documenting daily fluctuation in pain levels , and ensuring that documented uncontrolled pain is followed rapidly by clinical reassessment and dose

###16219327
background	Oxidative stress plays an important role in the pathogenesis of neurodegenerative diseases , such as Parkinson 's disease ( PD ) .
background	There are several methods to measure oxidative stress , being lipid peroxidation ( LPO ) one of the most frequently used .
population	Endogenous plasma LPO was determined by a spectrofluorimetric method in fifty two patients with sporadic PD and in forty controls .
other	To know the maximum capacity of lipids to peroxidate , LPO was also measured after co-incubation with Fe2 + / H2O2 ( exogenous LPO ) .
intervention	All PD patients were taken L-dopa and the effect of this treatment on LPO levels was additionally studied .
other	Urine catecholamines and their main metabolites were also analyzed , and their possible correlation to LPO statistically studied .
outcome	Endogenous plasma LPO levels were 33 % higher in PD group than in control group ( P < 0.001 ) .
outcome	Exogenous plasma or oxidizability was also higher in PD patients compared to controls ( 20 % , P < 0.05 ) .
outcome	The intake of L-dopa was negatively dose-related to endogenous and exogenous plasma LPO .
outcome	In conclusion , plasma of PD patients has elevated levels of LPO and also is more prone to peroxidation than that in the control group .
outcome	The results also suggest an antioxidant effect of L-dopa .

###12816554
background	To determine the carriage rate of Staphylococcus aureus ( SA ) , both methicillin sensitive , and methicillin resistant ( MRSA ) , among employees of a nursing home in the absence of an epidemic .
study design	Observational study .
other	A 210-bed suburban skilled nursing facility with a low endemic rate of SA infection .
population	Seventy-three asymptomatic employees recruited in two waves .
other	Nasal swabs were cultured for SA ; DNA strain typing was performed on MRSA isolates from the first wave of recruits .
outcome	21 of 73 ( 29 % ) cultures were positive for SA .
outcome	Ten of these 21 ( 14 % of participating employees ) had nasal carriage of MRSA .
outcome	MRSA carriage was not significantly correlated with age , duration of employment , or job type ( clinical vs. non-clinical ) , and DNA strain typing suggested that employee carriage of MRSA was not the result of a common source .
outcome	Staphylococcus aureus nasal carriage is common among skilled nursing facility personnel , and MRSA accounts for a substantial proportion of SA carriage among employees , even in the absence of an epidemic .
outcome	Further research is needed to determine whether the high SA carriage rates among employees reflects work place acquisition , and , if so , whether it poses a hazard to the employees .
outcome	The low incidence of nosocomial MRSA infections around the time of the study suggests that with usual infection control practices ( eg , hand washing ) , MRSA-colonized caregivers pose little risk to nursing facility residents .

###12137645
background	Enuresis ( bedwetting ) is a socially disruptive and stressful condition which affects around 15-20 % of five year olds , and up to 2 % of young adults .
background	To assess the effects of desmopressin on nocturnal enuresis in children , and to compare desmopressin with other interventions .
other	We searched the Cochrane Incontinence Group trials register .
other	Date of the most recent search March 2002 .
other	The reference list of a previous version of this review was also searched .
population	All randomised trials of desmopressin for nocturnal enuresis in children were included in the review .
intervention	Comparison interventions included placebo , other drugs , alarms or behavioural methods .
other	Trials focused solely on daytime wetting were excluded .
other	Two reviewers independently assessed the quality of the eligible trials , and extracted data .
outcome	Forty one randomised trials involving 2760 children ( of whom 1813 received desmopressin ) met the inclusion criteria .
outcome	The quality of many of the trials was poor .
outcome	Desmopressin was compared with another drug in four trials , and with alarms in seven .
other	Desmopressin was effective in reducing bedwetting in a variety of doses and forms .
outcome	Each dose of desmopressin reduced bedwetting by at least one night per week during treatment compared with placebo ( e.g. 20 microg : 1.34 fewer wet nights per week , 95 % CI 1.11 to 1.57 ) .
other	Children on desmopressin were more likely to become dry ( e.g. RR for failure to achieve 14 dry nights with 20 mcg 0.84 , 95 % CI 0.79 to 0.91 ) .
other	However , there was no difference after treatment was finished .
outcome	There was no clear dose-related effect of desmopressin , but the evidence was limited .
outcome	Data which compared oral and nasal administration were too few to be conclusive .
outcome	While desmopressin was better than diclofenac or indomethacin , and comparison with tricyclic drugs ( amitriptyline and imipramine ) suggested that they might be as effective as desmopressin , the data were inconclusive due to small numbers .
outcome	There were more side effects with the tricyclics .
outcome	In one small trial , desmopressin resulted in more wet nights than alarms towards the end of treatment ( WMD 1.4 , 95 % CI : 0.14 to 2.66 ) and the chance of failure or relapse after alarms was less ( RR 9.17 , 95 % CI 1.28 to 65.90 ) .
outcome	Although there were fewer wet nights during alarm treatment supplemented by desmopressin compared with alarms alone ( WMD -1.35 , 95 % CI -2.32 to -0.38 ) , the data are inconclusive about whether this is reflected in lower failure ( RR 0.88 , 95 % CI 0.52 to 1.50
outcome	Desmopressin rapidly reduced the number of wet nights per week , but there was some evidence that this was not sustained after treatment stopped .
outcome	Comparison with alternative treatments suggested that desmopressin and tricyclics had similar clinical effects , but that alarms may produce more sustained benefits .
outcome	However , based on the available limited evidence , these conclusions can only be tentative .
outcome	Children should be advised not to drink more than 240 ml ( 8 oz ) fluid during desmopressin treatment in order to avoid the possible risk of water intoxication .

###16437475
background	Primary sclerosing cholangitis is a cholestatic disease .
background	D-penicillamine is suggested as a treatment option due to its copper reducing and immunomodulatory potential .
population	To evaluate the beneficial and harmful effects of D-penicillamine for patients with primary sclerosing cholangitis .
other	Eligible trials were identified through searches of The Cochrane Hepato-Biliary Group Controlled Trials Register ( August 2005 ) , The Cochrane Central Register of Controlled Trials in The Cochrane Library ( Issue 3 , 2005 ) , MEDLINE ( 1950 to August 2005 ) , EMBASE ( 1980 to August 2005 ) , Science Citation Index EXPANDED ( 1945 to August 2005 ) , and reference lists of relevant articles .
other	Authors of trials and pharmaceutical companies known to produce D-penicillamine were also contacted .
other	Randomised clinical trials comparing D-penicillamine in any dose , duration , and route of administration versus placebo , no intervention , or other intervention ( s ) .
other	Trials were included irrespective of publication status , year of publication , language , or blinding .
other	Both authors selected the trials , extracted data , and evaluated the methodological quality of the trials with respect to the generation of allocation sequence , allocation concealment , blinding , and follow-up .
other	The results were reported by intention-to-treat analysis .
other	The outcomes were presented as relative risk ( RR ) or weighted mean difference ( WMD ) , both with 95 % confidence intervals ( CI ) .
other	One randomised trial was identified and included in the review .
other	It was of low methodological quality .
other	The trial compared D-penicillamine versus placebo in 70 patients with primary sclerosing cholangitis .
outcome	Compared with placebo , D-penicillamine therapy had no significant effect on mortality ( RR 1.14 , 95 % CI 0.49 to 2.64 ) , liver transplantation ( RR 1.11 , 95 % CI 0.39 to 3.17 ) , hepatic histologic progression ( RR 1.17 , 95 % CI 0.79 to 1.74 ) , or cholangiographic
outcome	D-penicillamine led to a significant improvement in the serum aspartate aminotransferase ( WMD -23.00 U/L ; 95 % CI -30.66 to -15.34 ) , but not in serum bilirubin level ( WMD 0.40 mg/L ; 95 % CI -0.19 to 0.99 ) and serum alkaline phosphatases activity ( WMD 44.00
outcome	There were significantly more adverse events in patients receiving D-penicillamine ( P = 0.013 ) .
outcome	There is not sufficient evidence to support or refute the use of D-penicillamine for patients with primary sclerosing cholangitis .
outcome	We do not recommend the use of D-penicillamine for patients with primary sclerosing cholangitis outside randomised trials .

###16614019
background	Despite the high lifetime prevalence of depression in multiple sclerosis ( MS ) , its longitudinal course is poorly understood .
intervention	To examine the longitudinal course of and reliable change in different depression symptom clusters in MS , and the longitudinal association of interferon beta treatment and coping with depression symptoms .
population	53 MS patients were examined at two time points three years apart on the Beck Depression Inventory ( BDI ) and the Chicago Multiscale Depression Inventory ( CMDI ) .
outcome	Correlations from time 1 to time 2 for BDI , CMDI-total , CMDI-evaluative scale , and CMDI-vegetative scale were all highly significant , and reliable change indices reflected little change over time .
outcome	In contrast , the correlation over time for the CMDI-mood scale was significantly lower ( p < 0.05 ) than the CMDI-evaluative and CMDI-vegetative scale correlations , and over 40 % of patients showed reliable change .
outcome	Patients who improved in their mood showed increased use of active coping , while patients who worsened showed decreased active coping strategies ; the latter were also significantly more likely to have been taking interferon beta drugs at both time points
outcome	Mood symptoms of depression are significantly more variable over time than neurovegetative or negative evaluative symptoms in MS patients .
outcome	Decreased use of active coping strategies may put patients at risk of increased depressed mood , whereas increased use of active coping may result in decreased depressed mood longitudinally .
outcome	Interferon beta use may put patients at risk of increases in depressed mood .

###11313090
background	Depression is the most prevalent psychiatric disorder in the elderly and several studies indicate that 10-15 % of persons over 65 years suffer from significant depressive symptoms .
background	Despite the high prevalence , most cases of depression in the elderly remain unrecognized and untreated , maybe because of a different pattern of symptoms across age groups .
other	The objective of the study was to compare symptomatology and diagnostic profile between younger and elderly DSM-III and DSM-III-R major depressed inpatients and to advise an appropriate depression scale for the elderly .
population	The study covers 461 depressed inpatients evaluated with the Hamilton Depression Scale and the Newcastle 1965 Scale .
other	To find differences between younger and elderly patients , the symptomatology was analyzed stepwise by principal component analyses , latent structure analyses and single item analyses .
outcome	No clinically significant differences in symptomatology between younger and elderly depressed patients were found .
outcome	The DSM-IV concept of Major Depression and the ICD-10 criteria for depression was not influenced by patients ' age .
outcome	All patients were hospitalized and mainly endogenously depressed and generalization of the results to other populations should be made with caution .
outcome	Only pretreatment data was analyzed .
outcome	The DSM-IV concept of Major Depression and the ICD-10 criteria for depression can be used without modification for age .

###17297205
background	To investigate the acute results ( parameters at implant and clinical parameters ) of permanent pacemaker implantation at our institution .
population	Twenty five patients undergoing pacemaker implantation were included in this study .
other	Subjects underwent medical history and functional class was assessed using New York Heart Association ( NYHA ) classification .
other	All technical parameters ( pacing threshold , sensing , and pacing impedance ) and clinical parameters ( complication and procedure time ) were measured during and post implant .
outcome	Majority ( 80 % ) of patients were in NYHA functional class II .
outcome	The commonest indication for pacemaker implant was the complete heart block ( 56 % ) .
outcome	The most frequent pacemaker type was single chamber ( 80 % ) with the commonest pacing mode of VVIR ( 72 % ) .
outcome	Average optimal parameters achieved were pacing threshold of 0.5 volt , sensing of 12.6 mV , and impedance of 829 Ohm .
outcome	Average procedure time was 1.6 hour .
outcome	Major complication ( pocket infection ) was noted in only one patient .
outcome	It is confirmed from this study that permanent pacemaker implantation could be carried out safely and effectively with low complication rate in a general hospital .
outcome	Optimal pacing parameters could be achieved in the acute phase .
outcome	Most patients still could not afford appropriate pacing devices due to limited financial support .
outcome	Government insurance coverage for the poor should be encouraged to cover more people .

###9044514
background	Following spinal cord injury ( SCI ) , upper motor neuron paralysed muscles lose the normal type I ( slow ) and II ( fast ) fibre mosaic pattern and become predominantly composed of type II ( fast glycolytic ) fibres ) .
background	The majority of the research demonstrating this fibre type shift was based on pH sensitive myofibrillar ATPase staining techniques on muscle from longstanding paraplegics and quadriplegics .
background	The purpose of this study was to describe muscle fibre type changes over a wide time spectrum post SCI using immunofluorescent techniques which may be more sensitive to change .
population	A total of 19 vastus lateralis muscle biopsy specimens were obtained from 12 SCI subjects representing time points of 0.5-219 months post SCI .
other	Fast and slow myosin heavy chain isoform distribution was determined on single muscle fibres for each of the biopsy specimens .
outcome	Early post SCI ( < 1 month ) myosin heavy chain ( MCH ) isoform composition remained relatively stable .
outcome	A transitional period was seen between 1 and 20 months post SCI wherein there was a progressive drop in the proportion of slow MHC isoform fibres and a rise in the proportion that co-expressed both the fast and slow MHC isoform .
outcome	By approximately 70 months post SCI a new steady state had been reached characterized by almost exclusively fast MHC isoform expression .
outcome	This research has demonstrated that post SCI muscle type II transformation occurs in stages and commences earlier than previously appreciated .
outcome	Interventions aimed at preventing or minimizing the transformation would need to be instituted within weeks post SCI .

###9839825
background	Central pain following spinal cord injury is poorly understood , and is often resistant to conventional pain therapy regimens .
background	We describe an individual with paraplegia who for many years experienced rapidly fluctuating , severe , unilateral pain below the level of his lesion .
background	Prior to the initiation of pharmacological treatment , regional cerebral blood flow ( rCBF ) was measured during PAIN and NON-PAIN states using single photon emission computed tomography ( SPECT ) .
background	When experiencing pain , the subject had increased anterior cingulate gyrus blood flow , increased thalamic blood flow bilaterally and increased somatosensory cortex blood flow contralaterally but decreased caudate blood flow bilaterally .
outcome	The subject 's subsequent clinical course included a trial of gabapentin which produced a substantial reduction in frequency and average intensity of his episodic pain and which has been maintained for almost 2 years .
outcome	This case demonstrates the correspondence between rCBF and pain associated with spinal cord injury and also suggests the potential utility of gabapentin for treatment of this central pain state .

###9702884
background	The objective of this study was to demonstrate 1H MR spectroscopy ( MRS ) changes in cerebral metabolites after acute head trauma .
population	Twenty-five patients ( 12 children , 13 adults ) were examined with quantitative 1H MRS after closed head injury .
outcome	Clinical grade ( Glasgow Coma Scale [ GCS ] ) and outcome ( Rancho Los Amigos Medical Center Outcome Score [ ROS ] ) were correlated with quantitative neurochemical findings .
outcome	N-acetylaspartate ( NAA ) , a neuronal and axonal marker , was reduced ( P < .03 -.001 ) .
outcome	In children , a reduced NAA/creatine plus phosphocreatine ( Cr ) level and the presence of detectable lipid/lactate predicted bad outcome ( sensitivity , 89 % ; specificity , 89 % ) .
outcome	The first MRS examination of all patients correlated with ROS versus NAA ( r = .65 , P < .0001 ) .
outcome	Although most patients showed MRS abnormalities , striking heterogeneity of 1H MRS characterized the individual patients .
outcome	1H MRS identifies multiple patterns of diffuse brain injury after blunt head trauma .
outcome	There was a strong correlation between MRS and outcome .
outcome	Future prospective studies will be needed to determine the clinical usefulness of MRS in predicting outcome from closed head injury .

###15252824
background	The stimulant modafinil has proved to be an effective treatment modality for narcolepsy and related sleep disorders and is also being studied for use during sustained military operations to ameliorate the effects of fatigue due to sleep loss .
background	However , a previous study reported that a relatively large , single dose of modafinil ( 300 mg ) , administered to already sleep-deprived individuals , caused participants to overestimate their cognitive abilities ( i.e. ` overconfidence ' ) .
population	Because the predominant application of modafinil is in otherwise healthy , non-sleep-deprived individuals , the present study investigated the generality of modafinil-induced overconfidence in a group of 18 healthy , non sleep-deprived adults .
intervention	The design involved a double-blind , placebo controlled , fully within-subjects manipulation of placebo and modafinil ( 4 mg/kg : approximately 300 mg , on average ) over three 50-min cognitive testing sessions ( i.e. before drug ingestion , and at 90 and 180 min
other	The cognitive task battery included subjective assessments of mood , fatigue , affect , vigor and motivation , and cognitive assessments of serial reaction time , logical reasoning , visual comparison , mental addition and vigilance .
other	In addition , trial-by-trial confidence judgements were obtained for two of the cognitive tasks and more global , task level assessments of performance were obtained for four of the cognitive tasks .
outcome	Relative to placebo , modafinil improved fatigue levels , motivation , reaction time and vigilance .
outcome	In terms of self-assessments of cognitive performance , both the placebo and modafinil conditions were ` well calibrated ' on trial-by-trial confidence judgements , showing neither marked over - nor under-confidence .
outcome	Of note , the modafinil condition displayed a non-significant tendency towards ` overconfidence ' for task-level assessments of performance .
outcome	The present findings highlight the need for continued research on the many complex interactions involving fatigue states , occasional versus long-term stimulant use , and subjective assessments of fatigue and cognitive performance .

###15846703
background	Neck disorders are common , disabling and costly .
background	The effectiveness of electrotherapy as a physiotherapy option has remained unclear .
population	To assess whether electrotherapy , either alone or in combination with other treatments , relieves pain , or improves function/disability , patient satisfaction , and global perceived effect in adults with mechanical neck disorders ( MND ) .
other	Computer-assisted searches of bibliographic databases CENTRAL , MEDLINE , EMBASE , MANTIS , CINAHL , and ICL , without language restrictions , from their beginning to March 2003 .
other	Randomised or controlled clinical trials with quasi-randomisation ( alternate allocation , case record numbers , dates of birth , etc. ) , in any language , investigating the effects of electrotherapy as a treatment for MND .
other	At least two authors independently conducted citation identification , study selection , data abstraction , and methodological quality assessment .
other	Using a random-effects model , relative risk , and standardized mean differences were calculated .
other	The reasonableness of combining studies was assessed on clinical and statistical grounds .
other	Due to heterogeneity , pooled effect measures were not calculated .
outcome	Fourteen comparisons ( 525 people with MND ) , in 11 publications , were included in this review .
outcome	The analysis was limited by underpowered low quality trials , paucity of literature , and heterogeneity of treatment subtypes .
outcome	The results for the electrotherapy subtypes are : Limited evidence of benefit : low or high frequency pulsed electromagnetic field ( PEMF ) compared to placebo , provides immediate post treatment pain relief only for chronic MND , acute whiplash ( WAD ) Unclear o
outcome	We can not make any definitive statements on electrotherapy for MND .
outcome	The current evidence on Galvanic current ( direct or pulsed ) , iontophoresis , TENS , EMS , PEMF and permanent magnets is either lacking , limited , or conflicting .
outcome	Possible new trials on these interventions should have larger patient samples and include more precise standardization and description of all treatment characteristics .

###17520800
background	Flavonoids are present in fruits , vegetables and beverages derived from plants , and in many dietary supplements or herbal remedies .
background	A number of naturally occurring flavonoids have been shown to modulate the CYP450 system , including the induction or inhibition of these enzymes .
study design	This review focuses on the flavonoid effects on cytochrome P450 ( CYP ) enzyme CYP1 , 2E1 , 3A4 and 19 .
outcome	Flavonoids alter CYPs by various mechanisms , including the stimulation of gene expression via specific receptors and/or CYP protein , or mRNA stabilization and so on .
outcome	But in vivo and in vitro , the effects of flavonoids are not always coincident as a result of concentrations of flavonoids , genetic and environmental factors .
outcome	As well , flavonoids may interact with drugs through the induction or inhibition of their metabolism .
outcome	Much attention should be paid to the metabolism interaction of the flavonoids when coadministered with other drugs .

###18816309
intervention	This paper aims to present an overview of the literature relating to the effects of endotracheal suctioning ( ETS ) in children and adults with severe traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) .
background	TBI is the leading cause of death in children worldwide and continues to result in widespread mortality and morbidity .
background	In intensive care , ETS is an essential nursing procedure that is undertaken but is known to produce some adverse effects in children .
other	A comprehensive literature search was undertaken using a Parahoo and quality of reporting of meta-analyses ( QUOROM ) approach .
other	A range of databases was searched to identify published papers with key search terms .
other	The databases searched included Cochrane Library , Medline , PubMed Central , CINAHL , Proquest and Science Direct .
other	This review is based on 21 papers ( with 433 patients in total ) , but specific papers in paediatric head injury children were extremely limited , and the evidence was largely dated and inconclusive .
outcome	Although the majority of papers demonstrate an increase in intracranial pressure ( ICP ) with ETS , there are contradictory results with regard to recovery times .
outcome	Further research is needed specifically into the effect of ETS on ICP and cerebral perfusion pressure of children with severe TBI , taking into account all the known confounding variables .

###14708953
background	Our genetic make-up , shaped through millions of years of evolution , determines our nutritional and activity needs .
background	Although the human genome has remained primarily unchanged since the agricultural revolution 10,000 years ago , our diet and lifestyle have become progressively more divergent from those of our ancient ancestors .
background	Accumulating evidence suggests that this mismatch between our modern diet and lifestyle and our Paleolithic genome is playing a substantial role in the ongoing epidemics of obesity , hypertension , diabetes , and atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease .
background	Until 500 generations ago , all humans consumed only wild and unprocessed food foraged and hunted from their environment .
background	These circumstances provided a diet high in lean protein , polyunsaturated fats ( especially omega-3 [ omega-3 ] fatty acids ) , monounsaturated fats , fiber , vitamins , minerals , antioxidants , and other beneficial phytochemicals .
background	Historical and anthropological studies show hunter-gatherers generally to be healthy , fit , and largely free of the degenerative cardiovascular diseases common in modern societies .
outcome	This review outlines the essence of our hunter-gatherer genetic legacy and suggests practical steps to re-align our modern milieu with our ancient genome in an effort to improve cardiovascular health .

###7975964
background	258 patients with ovarian carcinomas who underwent surgery at the University Women 's Hospital Charlottenburg/Berlin ( during 1980-1987 ) and at the I.
background	University Women 's Hospital Munich ( during 1987-1990 ) were re-examined for the occurrence of a simultaneous primary secondary carcinoma in the upper genital tract .
other	The diagnoses were made according to strict histological criteria .
outcome	In 13 cases ( 5 % ) simultaneous carcinomas of the upper genital tract were found .
outcome	In this group we would like to especially mention 6 of the 33 patients ( 18.2 % ) with an endometroid ovarian carcinoma , 3 of the 47 patients ( 6.4 % ) with an ovarian tumor of low malignant potential and 1 of the 12 patients with a serous-papillary carcinoma o
outcome	In our opinion these carcinomas are independent multifocal primaries originating from the primary and secondary Mullerian epithelium .
outcome	Staging protocols of these simultaneous tumors , especially prognostic estimation and development of therapeutic strategies should consider this possible multifocal pathogenesis .

###11750932
background	Dysfunction of surviving axons which traverse the site of spinal cord injury ( SCI ) appears to contribute to posttraumatic neurological deficits , though the underlying mechanisms remain unclear .
background	Although demyelination of injured but surviving axons following trauma appear to be a major contributor of axonal conduction deficits , altered activity of ion channels may also play an important role .
background	It has been theorized that exposure of K + channels as a result of demyelination would result in a reduced safety factor of action potential propagation across the demyelinated region of the axon .
background	This theory and electrophysiological studies using K + channel blockers on animal nerve preparations prompted the investigation of 4-aminopyridine ( 4-AP ) , a blocker of rapidly activating voltage-gated K + channels , as a therapeutic agent in both multiple sc
population	Several preliminary clinical trials have already demonstrated therapeutic benefit of 4-AP in both multiple sclerosis and spinal cord injured patients .
study design	In this review , we shall give a comprehensive summary of the mechanisms of axonal dysfunction following SCI and how axonal dysfunction may have resulted due to specific pathological changes following trauma including the ultrastructural and molecular chan
outcome	The pathology of spinal cord injury is very complex and many different mechanisms may contribute to axonal conduction deficits and the associated sensory and motor loss .

###11284550
background	A single dose of an alpha1-noradrenergic antagonist transiently reinstates hemiplegia after recovery from brain injury , which suggests that noradrenaline ( NA ) is required to maintain recovery .
background	No systematic studies have determined the postinjury duration of this vulnerability .
intervention	This study used a within-subject , dose-response design to determine whether prazosin ( PRAZ ) , an alpha1-NA antagonist , or propranolol ( PROP ) , a beta-NA antagonist , would continue to reinstate hemiplegia over time after recovery from weight-drop traumatic b
other	PRAZ transiently reinstated hemiplegia as measured by beam walk ( BW ) score in a dose-dependent manner , with the same degree of symptom reinstatement at 1 , 3 , 6 , and 12 months post-TBI .
outcome	Between-animal variability in reinstatement of hemiplegia by PRAZ was predicted by severity of deficits in BW ability 24 h after TBI .
outcome	In contrast , PRAZ did not reinstate tactile placing deficits at 1 month post-TBI suggesting a different mechanism of maintaining recovery for each task .
outcome	Reinstatement of symptoms are not due to sedation .
outcome	Only TBI rats receiving PRAZ , not high , sedating doses of PROP or saline ( SAL ) , showed return of hemiplegia .
outcome	These data indicate that vulnerability to transient reinstatement of hemiplegia on some tasks endures long after functional recovery from TBI .

###9299247
background	Colon cancer with a synchronous ovarian metastasis is occasionally diagnosed at the time of laparotomy for a pelvic mass .
background	The purpose of this retrospective study is to evaluate the clinical presentation as well as the impact of the type of metastatic spread and surgical intervention on overall survival.We reviewed charts of 23 patients treated between 1980 and 1995 .
other	Pain was the initial symptom in 14 patients ( 61 % ) , with only four patients ( 17 % ) complaining of rectal bleeding , but with five patients ( 22 % ) complaining of uterine bleeding .
other	At the time of laparotomy , the ovarian capsule was intact in 12 patients .
outcome	Metastatic disease to the peritoneum was seen in seven patients and to the liver in six patients .
outcome	On pathological evaluation , the median ovarian tumor size was 10 cm , significantly larger than the median colon tumor size of 4.5 cm .
outcome	Surgical treatment consisted of colon resection in all but one patient , bilateral or unilateral salpingo-oophorectomy in 22 patients , and hysterectomy in nine patients .
outcome	Only one patient survived 5 years .
outcome	Sixteen patients died of colon cancer .
outcome	The median survival time was 17.8 months , ranging from 1 to 86 months .
outcome	Tumor size was of no prognostic importance .
outcome	Median survival time of patients with peritoneal disease ( 10.8 months ) was significantly shorter compared to patients without peritoneal disease ( 25.2 months ) .
outcome	In the presence of liver metastasis , the median survival time was , likewise , significantly reduced from 20.1 months to 8.1 months.In conclusion , macroscopic metastatic disease to the ovary is a poor prognostic factor in colon cancer .
outcome	In selected patients who can be rendered disease-free by surgery , prolonged survival is possible and an aggressive approach is recommended .
outcome	Survival of patients with peritoneal disease or liver metastasis is short and a mainly palliative approach is recommended .

###18458990
background	We report the case of a 19-year-old woman who consulted for low-back pain 3 weeks after her first delivery .
background	This young woman had a personal history of protein C deficiency and was treated daily during her pregnancy with low-molecular-weight heparin .
background	Her body mass index was 34 and she only gained 10 kg during her pregnancy .
background	Since the delivery - which occurred without any complication - she had suffered from a gradually increasing right-buttock pain and limp .
intervention	Magnetic resonance imaging ( MRI ) revealed a fracture of the right sacral ala. .
outcome	After analgesia and 1 month of home relative bed rest , the patient recovered her functional capacities .
outcome	Regarding our patient , who had no potential clinical risk factors for osteoporosis , the causal effect of heparin is thus possible but not certain .
outcome	This case report illustrates the fact that clinicians should have a high suspicion of pelvic fracture in post-partum women , even in very young ones , presenting sudden onset of low back and pelvic pain , especially when they have received heparin during pre
outcome	MRI seems to be the key exam because it is able to detect and stage fractures or microfractures .

###11728416
background	Pharmacogenetics is the science of the influence of heredity on pharmacological response .
background	The cost of severe adverse drug reactions in individuals has been estimated in the US alone to be in excess of US$ 4 billion .
background	It has been argued that in a significant proportion of cases , the efficacy and toxicity profiles of drug therapy would be substantially improved in individuals if characteristics due to genetic variation were taken into account .
background	Methods are now available , which make screening for susceptibility feasible .
outcome	There are several therapeutic areas in which screening may give rise to significant improvements in outcome with cost-benefits to both the individual and the community .
outcome	However , there is currently a lack of data on which cost-benefit analysis can be based .
outcome	The challenge is to provide this information for new drugs , and for drugs with established therapeutic roles .

###6263533
population	The overall efficacy and tolerance of a new skeletal muscle relaxant DS 103-282 was evaluated by treating 10 patients with chronic spinal spasticity .
background	Other agents such as baclofen , dantrolene sodium or diazepam had been only minimally beneficial in these patients .
intervention	per day at the end of the 8-week trial period .
outcome	Objective rating assessments showed improvement in spasticity , medullary automatism and clonus .
outcome	No changes were recorded in the reflex pattern nor improvement in disability scores .
outcome	Only a few mild side-effects were reported , there was a noticeable absence of sedation , but reduction in systolic and diastolic blood pressure was noted in most patients .
outcome	DS 103-282 appears to have demonstrable myotonolytic action and in view of its good tolerance it deserves further investigation .

###11460205
background	Stage IV non-small cell lung cancer is a fatal disease , with a median survival of 14 months .
background	Systemic chemotherapy is the most common approach .
background	However the impact in overall survival and quality of life still a controversy .
other	To determine differences in overall survival and quality of life among patients with stage IV non-small cell lung cancer non-metastatic to the brain treated with best supportive care versus systemic chemotherapy .
population	From February 1990 through December 1995 , 78 eligible patients were admitted with the diagnosis of stage IV non-small cell lung cancer .
other	Patients were divided in 2 groups
intervention	Group A ( n = 31 - treated with best supportive care ) , and Group B ( n = 47 - treated with systemic chemotherapy ) .
outcome	The median survival time was 23 weeks ( range 5 - 153 weeks ) in Group A and 55 weeks ( range 7.4 - 213 weeks ) in Group B ( p = 0.0018 ) .
outcome	In both groups , the incidence of admission for IV antibiotics and need of blood transfusions were similar .
outcome	Patients receiving systemic chemotherapy were also stratified into those receiving mytomycin , vinblastin , and cisplatinum , n = 25 and those receiving other combination regimens ( platinum derivatives associated with other drugs , n = 22 ) .
outcome	Patients receiving mytomycin , vinblastin , and cisplatinum , n = 25 had a higher incidence of febrile neutropenia and had their cycles delayed for longer periods of time than the other group .
outcome	These patients also had a shorter median survival time ( 51 versus 66 weeks , p = 0.005 ) .
outcome	In patients with stage IV non-small cell lung cancer , non-metastatic to the brain , chemotherapy significantly increases survival compared with best supportive care .

###15708470
background	Motoneuron damage occurs in spinal cord injury and amyotrophic lateral sclerosis .
background	Current advances offer hope that human embryonic stem cells [ Science 282 ( 1998 ) 1145 ] or neural stem cells ( NSC ) [ Exp Neurol 161 ( 2000 ) 67 ; Exp Neurol 158 ( 1999 ) 265 ; J Neurosci Methods 85 ( 1998 ) 141 ; Proc Natl Acad Sci USA 97 ( 2000 ) 14720 ; Exp Neurol 156
background	Previously , we developed a priming procedure that produced cholinergic cells that resemble motoneurons from human NSCs grafted into adult rat spinal cord [ Nat Neurosci 5 ( 2002a ) 1271 ] .
background	However , effective replacement therapy will ultimately rely on successful connection of new motoneurons with their muscle targets .
population	In this study , we examined the potential of human fetal NSC transplantation to replace lost motoneurons in an animal model of chronic motoneuron deficiency ( newborn sciatic axotomy ) [ J Comp Neurol 224 ( 1984 ) 252 ; J Neurobiol 23 ( 1992 ) 1231 ] .
outcome	We found , for the first time , that human neural stem cell-derived motoneurons send axons that pass through ventral root and sciatic nerve to form neuromuscular junctions with their peripheral muscle targets .
outcome	Furthermore , this new cholinergic innervation correlates with partial improvement of motor function .

###17711395
background	High intracranial pressure ( HICP ) may be a very early event after traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) , but in most cases , especially when contusions and edema develop over time , HICP will worsen over succeeding days .
other	This study describes the incidence and severity of elevated intracranial pressure ( ICP ) after TBI and attempts to document its time course .
population	In this prospective study , 201 TBI patients in whom ICP was monitored for more than 12 h were evaluated .
other	ICP was measured , digitalized , and analyzed after manual filtering .
other	The number of episodes of HICP and the mean ICP value for every 12-h interval were calculated .
other	When monitoring was concluded , the highest mean ICP collected in every patient was identified .
other	A total of 21,000 h of ICP monitoring were recorded .
other	Active treatment to prevent or reduce HICP was used in 200 patients .
other	HICP was documented in 155 cases .
outcome	Half of the patients had their highest mean ICP during the first 3 days after injury , but many showed delayed ICP elevation , with 25 % showing highest mean ICP after day 5 .
outcome	In these cases , HICP was significantly worse and required more intense therapies .

###14664471
population	The aim of this study was to assess the long-term safety and efficacy of glatiramer acetate ( GA ) for patients with multiple sclerosis ( MS ) who received active treatment versus those on placebo for approximately 30 months ( 24-35 months ) before receiving GA
other	Entry required two relapses in the previous two years and an Expanded Disability Status Scale ( EDSS ) score of 0-5 .
intervention	Patients ( 251 ) were equally randomized to daily subcutaneous GA , 20 mg , or to placebo .
other	After approximately 30 months , 208 patients continued in an open label study 101 continued on GA and 107 switched from placebo to active drug .
other	Groups were well matched at randomization and entry to the open label study .
outcome	Patients always on GA showed a steady decline in relapses : a mean of 1.5 per year at entry , a mean of 0.42 over the entire six years ( 95 % CI = 0.34-0 .51 ) , a 72 % reduction ( P = 0.0001 ) .
outcome	They averaged a relapse every four + years ( yearly rate 0.23 in year six ) and 26/101 remain relapse free .
outcome	Patients did less well if on placebo for 30 months , but relapses then declined , and by year six the rates were similar .
outcome	Of patients always on GA , 69 % showed neurological improvement of > or = 1 EDSS steps or remained stable compared with 57 % if GA treatment was delayed .
outcome	Of relapse-free patients always on GA over six years , only three of 26 ( 11 % ) were worse by > or = 1 EDSS steps , whereas nine of 21 ( 43 % ) in the placebo/active group were worse ( P < 0.03 ) .
outcome	Disability , measured every six months , showed that the group of patients always on GA was relatively stable over the six years , while the group who received placebo for the first two-and-a-half years did significantly less well .
outcome	Daily injections of GA were well tolerated .
outcome	This longest ever organized MS treatment trial shows that delaying therapy with GA increases the risk of neurologic disability , reinforcing the rationale for using GA as a first-line treatment early in the course of relapsing-remitting MS.

###10617256
background	To evaluate the analgesic efficacy of calcitonin suppositories ( 200 IU ) in comparison with bed rest and paracetamol tablets , as a rescue analgesic .
study design	A prospective , double-blind , randomized , placebo-controlled , clinical trial .
population	Forty patients ( 8 men and 32 postmenopausal women ) , who had recently ( within the last 5 days ) suffered a nontraumatic osteoporotic vertebral fracture .
intervention	All patients were admitted to the hospital , divided randomly into two groups and received either one calcitonin or placebo suppository once a day , respectively , for 28 days .
intervention	All patients were allowed to take paracetamol tablets ( 500 mg ) , with a maximum dose of six tablets daily .
other	Spinal pain evaluation was performed at the beginning of the study ( before the initiation of treatment ) and then daily until the end of the study ( day 28 ) using the Huskinsson 's visual analog scale ( VAS ) and a painmeter device , by direct pressure on the fractured vertebra .
other	Pain was evaluated with the patients attempting or performing four different locomotor functions , e.g. , bed rest , sitting , standing , and walking functions .
other	Biochemical urine and plasma measurements were carried out before the initiation of treatment and on days 14 and 28 .
outcome	All calcitonin-treated patients experienced an overall statistically significant ( all p values < 0.001 ) decrease of spinal pain as assessed by the VAS and the painmeter device .
outcome	Pain relief allowed for early mobilization and the gradual restoration of the locomotive functions in the calcitonin-treated group .
outcome	Placebo-treated patients remained in bed for almost the whole of the observation period .
outcome	At the end of the study ( 28th day ) , fasting osteocalcin , hydroxyproline/creatinine , and calcium/creatinine ratio values were statistically significantly ( all p values < 0.001 ) , lower in the calcitonin-treated than in the placebo-treated patients .
outcome	In the placebo group these values showed a gradual increase .
outcome	In the calcitonin-treated group side effects mainly included dizziness and enteric irritation caused by the suppositories .
outcome	Enteric irritation was also present in the placebo-treated group .
outcome	Salmon calcitonin suppositories ( 200 IU daily ) caused a dramatic decrease in spinal pain in patients with recent osteoporotic vertebral fractures and influenced the early mobilization and the gradual restoration of their locomotor functions .

###11687076
background	The n-3 and n-6 fatty acids linolenic acid and linoleic acid are precursors of the n-3 and n-6 longchain fatty acids ( LCPUFA ) .
background	Infant formula has historically only contained the precursor fatty acids .
background	Controversy exists over whether LCPUFA are also essential nutrients in infancy .
background	Over the last few years some manufacturers have added LCPUFA to formulae and marketed them as providing an advantage for the development of term infants .
population	The aim of this review is to assess whether supplementation of formula with LCPUFA is safe and of benefit to term infants .
other	Trials were identified by MEDLINE , checking reference lists of articles and conference proceedings , and by personal communication .
other	All randomised trials of formula supplemented with LCPUFA and with clinical endpoints were reviewed .
other	Ten randomised studies were identified .
other	One of these studies was excluded due to supplementation commencing after three weeks of age .
other	Eight of the nine included trials were assessed to be of good quality .
other	There was insufficient information available to assess the quality of the other included trial .
outcome	Visual acuity was assessed by visual evoked potentials ( VEP ) at 4 and 7-8 months in the studies of Makrides et al ( 1995 & 1996 ) .
outcome	The supplemented infants had an improved rate of visual maturation at both time points in the first study , but no difference was found between the groups at the same time points in the second study .
outcome	VEP acuity was also assessed in the study of Austed et al ( 1997 ) and no effect of supplementation was found at any time point over the first year .
outcome	This contrasts with the study of Birch et al ( 1998 ) where VEP acuity was better in the supplemented group compared with the control group at 6 weeks , 4 and 12 months but not at 6 months .
outcome	Visual acuity was assessed by Teller acuity cards in the study of Carlson et al ( 1996 ) , Clausen et al ( 1996 ) , Austed et al ( 1997 ) and Birch et al ( 1998 ) .
outcome	Supplementation had no effect on visual acuity over the first year of life except at one of five time points in the study of Carlson et al ( 1996 ) .
outcome	Intellectual development was measured in seven studies .
outcome	The two largest studies showed no effect of supplementation on development , either at 18 months ( Lucas et al 1999 ) or at one and three years ( Janowsky et al 1995 , Scott et al 1997 ) .
outcome	The next largest study reported better developmental scores at 18 months in the supplemented group ( Birch et al 2000 ) but when combined with data of Lucas et al , no significant benefit is shown .
outcome	Makrides et al ( 1995 & 1996 ) also showed no benefit to development with supplementation over the first two years of life .
outcome	Agostini et al 1995 reported a benefit in development at 4 months of age with supplementation but when the infants were followed up with the same test at 1 and 2 years , no difference between groups was found ( Agostini et al 1997 ) .
outcome	The Portland study showed no effect of supplementation on language development at one and three years ( Janowsky et al 1995 , Scott et al 1997 ) .
outcome	Clausen et al ( 1996 ) reported better novelty preference measured by Fagan Infant test at nine months in supplemented infants compared with controls .
outcome	Willatts et al ( 1998 ) reported better problem solving at 10 months with supplementation .
outcome	Growth was measured in the studies of Makrides et al ( 1995 & 1996 ) , Austed et al ( 1997 ) , Willatts et al 1998 , Lucas et al 1999 and Birch et al 2000 .
outcome	LCPUFA supplementation did not influence growth in any of these studies .
outcome	At present there is little evidence from randomised trials of LCPUFA supplementation to support the hypothesis that LCPUFA supplementation confers a benefit for visual or general development of term infants .
outcome	Minor effects on VEP acuity have been suggested but appear unlikely when all studies are reviewed .
outcome	A beneficial effect on information processing is possible but larger studies over longer periods are required to conclude that LCPUFA supplementation provides a benefit when compared with standard formula .
outcome	Data from randomised trials do not suggest that LCPUFA supplements influence the growth of term infants .

###7115037
population	Data from serial follow-up evaluations of 103 patients with traumatic and atraumatic myelopathy were recorded to determine rates of significant bacteriuria associated with various types of bladder emptying in an outpatient population .
other	Urine culture specimens were obtained by sterile catheterization .
other	Rates of urinary tract infection in bladder-retrained patients , patients using intermittent self-catheterization , and patients with indwelling catheters were compared at sequential follow-up visits .
outcome	Infection rates were similar ( 20 % to 30 % ) in persons with catheter-free voiding after successful bladder retraining and in those using sterile intermittent self-catheterization .
outcome	In the latter group , however , there was a trend toward higher infection rates beyond 15 months after rehabilitation .
outcome	As expected , persons with indwelling catheters had universally high infection rates .
outcome	Generally lower infection rates were found in persons with incomplete myelopathies ( 18 % ) than in those with complete myelopathies ( 34 % ) .
outcome	Tetraplegic persons had 2.5 times the infection rate of paraplegic persons in the bladder-retrained group .
outcome	Infection rates tended to be lower in persons with lower motor neuron bladder dysfunction than in those with upper motor neuron or mixed bladder dysfunction .

###10698810
background	The authors assessed changes over time in antidepressant utilization among elderly subjects regarding the prevalence of antidepressant users , shifts in prescription patterns , and related financial implications .
population	The authors conducted a population-based study of more than 1.4 million Ontario residents aged 65 years or older .
other	Cross-sectional data regarding annual antidepressant utilization were obtained from administrative databases for 1993 to 1997 .
other	Time series analysis was used to assess trends over time and to make future projections .
outcome	The proportion of antidepressant users increased from 9.3 % of the elderly population in 1993 to 11.5 % in 1997 .
outcome	Prescriptions for selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors ( SSRIs ) accounted for 9.6 % of antidepressant prescriptions dispensed in the first 30 days of 1993 and 45.1 % of those dispensed by the last 30 days of 1997 and were projected to increase to approxim
outcome	Prescriptions for tricyclic antidepressants fell from 79.0 % in the first 30 days of 1993 to 43.1 % by the last 30 days of 1997 and were projected to decline to approximately 28 % by the end of 2000 .
outcome	Annual antidepressant costs ( in Canadian dollars ) increased by 150 % , from $ 10.8 million in 1993 to $ 27.0 million in 1997 .
outcome	Population shifts and an increase in the prevalence of antidepressant users accounted for at least 20 % of this increase , whereas the prescribing transition from tricyclic antidepressants to SSRIs accounted for at least 61 % of the increase .
outcome	The introduction of SSRIs has had a substantial financial impact at the drug utilization level .
outcome	Future research should address the appropriate balancing of the cost of newer agents versus their ostensible advantages .

###15767833
background	Muscle strains and other musculoskeletal disorders ( MSDs ) are a leading cause of work absenteeism .
background	Muscle pain , spasm , swelling , and inflammation are symptomatic of strains .
background	The precise relationship between musculoskeletal pain and spasm is not well understood .
background	The dictum that pain induces spasm , which causes more pain , is not substantiated by critical analysis .
other	The painful muscle may not show EMG activity , and when there is , the timing and intensity often do not correlate with the pain .
other	Clinical and physiologic studies show that pain tends to inhibit rather than facilitate reflex contractile activity .
background	The decision to treat and choice of therapy are largely dictated by the duration , severity of symptoms , and degree of dysfunction .
background	Trigger point injections are sometimes used with excellent results in the treatment of muscle spasm in myofacial pain and low-back pain .
outcome	NSAIDs are used with much greater frequency than oral skeletal muscle relaxants ( SMRs ) or opioids in the treatment of acute MSDs .
outcome	Unfortunately , remarkably little sound science guides the choice of drug for the treatment of acute , uncomplicated MSDs , and the evaluation of efficacy of one agent over another is complicated by numerous factors .
outcome	Only a limited number of high-quality , randomized , controlled trials ( RCTs ) provide evidence of the effectiveness of NSAIDs or SMRs in the treatment of acute , uncomplicated MSDs .
outcome	The quality of design , execution , and reporting of trials for the treatment of MSDs needs to be improved .
outcome	The combination of an SMR and an NSAID or COX-2 inhibitor or the combination of SMR and tramadol/acetaminophen is superior to single agents alone .

###16034862
background	Appendicitis is the most common cause of acute abdominal pain requiring surgical intervention .
background	The cause of appendicitis is unclear and the mechanism of pathogenesis continues to be debated .
background	Despite improved asepsis and surgical techniques , postoperative complications , such as wound infection and intraabdominal abscess , still account for a significant morbidity .
background	Several studies implicate that postoperative infections are reduced by administration of antimicrobial regimes .
population	This review evaluated the use of antibiotics compared to placebo or no treatment in patients undergoing appendectomy .
other	Will these patients benefit from antimicrobial prophylaxis ?
other	The outcomes were described according to the nature of the appendix , as either simple appendicitis ( including the non-infectious stage ) and complicated appendicitis .
other	The efficacy of different antibiotic regimens were not evaluated .
other	We searched The Cochrane Central Register of Controlled Trials ( Cochrane Library 2005 issue 1 ) ; Pubmed ; EMBASE ; and the Cochrane Colorectal Cancer Group Specialised Register ( April 2005 ) .
other	In addition , we manually searched the reference lists of the primary identified trials .
other	We evaluated Randomised Controlled Trials ( RCTs ) and Controlled Clinical Trials ( CCTs ) in which any antibiotic regime were compared to placebo in patients suspected of having appendicitis , and undergoing appendectomy .
other	Both studies on children and adults were reviewed .
other	The outcome measures of the studies were Wound infection , intra abdominal abscess , length of stay in hospital , and mortality .
other	Eligibility and trial quality were assessed , recorded and cross-checked by two reviewers .
other	Forty-five studies including 9576 patients were included in this review .
outcome	The overall result is that the use of antibiotics is superior to placebo for preventing wound infection and intraabdominal abscess , with no apparent difference in the nature of the removed appendix .
outcome	Studies exclusively on children and studies examining topical application reported results in favour to the above , although the results were not significant .
outcome	Antibiotic prophylaxis is effective in the prevention of postoperative complications in appendectomised patients , whether the administration is given pre - , peri - or post-operatively , and could be considered for routine in emergency appendectomies .

###6084564
population	Fifty four cases of acute large bowel obstruction were observed in an overall groups of 266 patients with colonic carcinoma .
background	Pre-operative elements which seems to contra-indicate a primary radical surgery and advantages of the same procedure are considered .
outcome	In the experience of the Authors , primary and delayed staged resection of the cancer seems to give the same survival rate at short and long term .
outcome	Choice of surgery of obstructive large bowel carcinoma should be based pratically on general patient 's conditions .

###16854522
background	Paclitaxel-induced peripheral neuropathy is a sensory neuropathy that affects thousands of cancer patients each year as paclitaxel is commonly used to treat breast , non-small cell lung and ovarian cancer .
background	To begin to define the type and location of sensory neurons most impacted by paclitaxel , we examined rat trigeminal ganglion , thoracic and lumbar dorsal root ganglion ( DRG ) 10 days following intravenous infusion of clinically relevant doses of paclitaxel .
other	To define the population of cells injured by paclitaxel , we examined the expression of activating transcription factor-3 ( ATF3 ) , a marker of cell injury ; to define the hypertrophy of satellite cells , we quantified the expression of the intermediate filament protein glial fibrillary acidic protein ( GFAP ) ; and to define the activation of macrophages , we examined the expression of the lysosomal protein CD68 .
outcome	Intravenous infusion of paclitaxel induced a significant increase of ATF3 in mainly but not exclusively large and medium sensory neurons in all sensory ganglia .
outcome	An increase in both GFAP immunofluorescence in satellite cells and the number of activated macrophages occurred in lumbar > thoracic > trigeminal ganglia of paclitaxel-treated rats .
outcome	This differential expression of cellular markers suggests that the largest sensory cell bodies with the longest axons are the most at risk of being injured by paclitaxel ( size and length dependent pathology ) .
outcome	These results provide a pathological basis for the anatomical distribution of paclitaxel-induced symptoms in patients receiving therapeutic regimens of paclitaxel .

###6648007
background	Substantial relief of discomfort may be anticipated by most patients suffering from pelvic and lower-extremity pain who are treated by arterial infusion of nitrogen mustard .
population	Seventy-three patients with intractable pain secondary to malignancy arising in the pelvis received 83 percutaneous pelvic arterial infusions of this drug .
outcome	Sixty infusions ( 72 % ) resulted in marked relief from pain for periods averaging 6-8 weeks .
outcome	Advantages of the procedure are low toxicity , relative simplicity and availability of technique , and an acceptable rate of complications with minimal morbidity .
outcome	Patients experiencing satisfactory results may expect significant relief from a second infusion for recurrent pain .
outcome	The most rewarding result is the freedom from the cyclic return of pain characterized by oral and intramuscular analgesic therapy .
outcome	Little or no relief can be expected in patients with pain caused by compression fractures of the vertebrae , or where the tumor burden is so great that adequate perfusion of the involved nerves is not possible .
outcome	One should consider this procedure for controlling pain before resorting to the more dangerous and potentially disabling techniques of spinal cordotomy or intrathecal alcohol injection .

###16850305
background	This case report describes a 63-year-old male patient with considerably impaired postoperative wound healing in the region of the lower extremities .
intervention	After initial drug therapy for the pain was ineffectual , the patient was treated repeatedly through an epidural catheter .
outcome	In the further course , an extensive spinal epidural abscess was diagnosed as an incidental finding without neurological symptoms .
outcome	After taking into consideration the patient 's age and the risk factors present as well as inclusion of the subspecialties involved for an interdisciplinary assessment , the patient was successfully treated with a conservative approach .
outcome	Our contribution concludes with a detailed discussion and comparison of the literature .

###10364356
background	The Mahoney strain of poliovirus type 1 ( OM ) is generally unable to cause paralysis in mice .
population	We isolated a mouse-adapted mutant , PV1/OM-SA ( SA ) , from the spinal cord of a mouse that had been intracerebrally inoculated with OM .
outcome	SA showed mouse neurovirulence only with intraspinal inoculation , and the infected mice developed a flaccid paralysis , which was indistinguishable from that observed in poliovirus-sensitive transgenic mice inoculated with OM .
outcome	SA antigens were detected in neurons of the spinal cords of the infected mice .
outcome	Nucleotide ( nt ) sequence analysis revealed 9 nt changes on the SA genome , resulting in three amino acid ( a.a. ) substitutions , i.e. , one each in the capsid proteins VP4 and VP1 and in the noncapsid protein 2C .
outcome	To identify the key mutation site ( s ) for the mouse neurovirulence , virus recombinants between OM and SA were constructed by using infectious cDNA clones of these two viruses and tested for their mouse neurovirulence after inoculation via an intraspinal ro
outcome	The results indicated that a mutation at nt 928 ( replacement of A with G ) , resulting in a substitution of Met for Ile at a.a. 62 within VP4 , was responsible for conferring the mouse neurovirulence phenotype of the mutant SA .
outcome	The mutation in VP4 may render the virus accessible to a molecule that acts as a virus receptor and is located on the surfaces of neurons of the mouse spinal cord .
outcome	This molecule appears not to be expressed in the mouse brain .

###7970862
background	Chronic central pain is a frequent complication after spinal cord injury .
background	Anticonvulsant drugs , among them valproate , have been recommended for treatment .
study design	In this paper we conducted a double-blind , cross-over study comparing valproate and placebo for severe chronic central pain .
intervention	During the study , serum concentration of valproate , pain and side effects were registered and the dose was adjusted according to these .
outcome	No significant analgesic effects of valproate could be demonstrated although serum concentration and dose reached a high level .
outcome	Few studies of pain following spinal cord injury exist and we recommend that further studies be performed .

###15662542
background	In cervical spondylotic myelopathy , extended anterior spinal cord decompression necessitates subsequent stable vertebral reconstruction .
background	Reconstruction with an iliac crest graft and screw-plate fixation gives satisfactory clinical and radiological results , but they are often compromised by morbidity involving the bone harvest .
intervention	The purpose of this study was to evaluate the contribution to cervical reconstruction of a biocompatible , radiolucent cage combined with screw-plate fixation , making use of bone harvested in situ .
population	This prospective study was performed between July 2000 and March 2001 in eight women and nine men ( mean age , 55 years ) operated for cervical spondylotic myelopathy .
other	Situated between levels C3 and C6 , the cage was inserted after one corporectomy in ten patients , two corporectomies in five patients , and three corporectomies in two patients .
other	The cage consisted of a polyester mesh impregnated with poly-L-lactic acid ( PLLA ) conferring temporary rigidity to the cage during bony fusion .
other	Clinical and radiological follow-up ( plain films , computed tomographic reconstruction in three cases ) was performed at 2 months , 6 months , 12 months , 24 months and 36 months , postoperatively , with a mean follow-up of 30 months .
other	Functional results were evaluated according to the Japanese Orthopaedic Association 's scoring system .
other	An independent surgeon assessed the radiological evidence of anterior cervical fusion using the grades proposed by Bridwell [ 6 ] .
outcome	Every patient experienced neurological recovery .
outcome	At last follow-up , radiological findings were consistent with grade I ( complete fusion ) in five cases , grade II ( probable fusion ) in ten cases , grade III ( radiolucent halo in favor of non fusion ) in one case , and grade IV ( graft lysis ) in one case with pe
other	In three cases there was screw breakage ( two grade II , one grade IV ) .
other	None of these cases required surgical revision at latest follow-up .
outcome	In extensive spinal cord decompression through an anterior approach , cervical reconstruction using the present type of cage can achieve clinical results comparable to conventional techniques .
outcome	The rigidity of the cage meets biomechanical imperatives .
outcome	Its radiolucency permits one to monitor the course of consolidation , contrary to metal cages .
outcome	The cases of probable non-fusion and screw breakage were not accompanied by signs of instability on the flexion extension films .
outcome	This cage meets the biologic and biomechanical imperatives of cervical reconstruction .
outcome	It obviates complications involving bone harvest .

###17215755
background	Traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) is a major health problem , both in terms of the economic cost to society and the survivor 's quality of life .
background	The development of devices to protect against TBI requires criteria that relate observed injury to measurements of head kinematics .
background	The objective of this study is to find the best statistical correlates to impact-induced TBI in nonhuman primates using a qualified , self-consistent set of historical kinematic and TBI data from impact tests on nonhuman primates .
population	A database was constructed and qualified from historical head impact tests on nonhuman primates .
other	Multivariate logistic regression analysis with backwards stepwise elimination was performed .
other	Variables considered are the peak rotational acceleration ( Omegamax ) , the peak linear acceleration ( Amax ) , and the number of impacts ( N ) .
outcome	Bivariate combinations of angular acceleration and the number of impacts are the best correlates to all modes of TBI considered , i.e. , concussion , subarachnoid hemorrhage , brain contusion , and subdural hematoma .
outcome	For a nonhuman primate with 100-g brain mass , the criteria that the probability of TBI is less than 10 % by injury mode are : Concussion : OmegamaxN ( 0.84 ) < 70 krad/s/s SAH : OmegamaxN ( 0.70 ) < 160 krad/s/s Contusion : Omegamax N ( 0.35 ) < 160 krad/s/s SD
outcome	Based on this dataset , the best statistically based risk factor for all modes of TBI in nonhuman primates is the bivariate combination of rotational acceleration and number of impacts .

###12531372
background	The clinician manages trauma patients in the emergency room , operation theatre , intensive care unit and trauma ward with an endeavour to provide best possible treatment for physical injuries .
background	At the same time , it is equally important to give adequate attention to behavioural and psychological aspects associated with the event .
background	Knowledge of the predisposing factors and their management helps the clinician to prevent or manage these psychological problems .
background	Various causes of psychological disturbances in trauma patients have been highlighted .
background	These include pain , the sudden and unexpected nature of events and the procedures and interventions necessary to resuscitate and stabilise the patient .
background	The ICU and trauma ward environment , sleep and sensory deprivation , impact of injury on CNS , medications and associated pre-morbid conditions are also significant factors .
background	Specific problems that concern the traumatised patients are helplessness , humiliation , threat to body image and mental symptoms .
background	The patients react to these stressors by various defence mechanisms like conservation withdrawal , denial , regression , anger , anxiety and depression .
background	Some of them develop delirium or even more severe problems like acute stress disorder or post-traumatic stress disorder .
population	Physical , pharmacological or psychological interventions can be performed to prevent or minimise these problems in trauma patients .
intervention	These include adequate pain relief , prevention of sensory and sleep deprivation , providing familiar surroundings , careful explanations and reassurance to the patient , psychotherapy and pharmacological treatment whenever required .

###14534891
background	The goal of the current study was to compare the long-term ( 25-month ) safety and efficacy of zoledronic acid with pamidronate in patients with bone lesions secondary to advanced breast carcinoma or multiple myeloma .
population	Patients ( n = 1648 ) were randomized to receive 4 mg or 8 mg ( reduced to 4 mg ) zoledronic acid as a 15-minute infusion or to receive 90 mg pamidronate as a 2-hour infusion every 3-4 weeks for 24 months .
other	The primary endpoint was the proportion of patients with at least 1 skeletal-related event ( SRE ) , defined as pathologic fracture , spinal cord compression , radiation therapy , or surgery to bone .
other	Secondary analyses included time to first SRE , skeletal morbidity rate , and multiple-event analysis .
other	Hypercalcemia of malignancy ( HCM ) was included as an SRE in some secondary analyses .
outcome	After 25 months of follow-up , zoledronic acid reduced the overall proportion of patients with an SRE and reduced the skeletal morbidity rate similar to pamidronate .
outcome	Compared with pamidronate , zoledronic acid ( 4 mg ) reduced the overall risk of developing skeletal complications ( including HCM ) by an additional 16 % ( P = 0.030 ) .
outcome	In patients with breast carcinoma , zoledronic acid ( 4 mg ) was significantly more effective than pamidronate , reducing the risk of SREs by an additional 20 % ( P = 0.025 ) compared with pamidronate and by an additional 30 % in patients receiving hormonal thera
outcome	Zoledronic acid ( 4 mg ) and pamidronate were tolerated equally well .
outcome	The most common adverse events included bone pain , nausea , and fatigue .
outcome	Long-term follow-up data confirm that zoledronic acid was more effective than pamidronate in reducing the risk of skeletal complications in patients with bone metastases from breast carcinoma and was of similar efficacy in patients with multiple myeloma .

outcome	The median of the total score was 29 ( on a scale of 0-100 ) , which was considered the cutoff value for defining `` better '' ( < 29 ) and `` worse '' > or = 29 ) quality of life.A worse quality of life was associated with diabetes related complic
outcome	The last three were identified as predictor variables for worse quality of life by logistic regression ( p < 0.05 ) .
outcome	The adapted Spanish language version of Diabetes 39 is a reliable and valid instrument for measuring the quality of life of Mexican patients with DM-2 .

###15738550
background	The rising prevalence of type 2 diabetes in the UK has necessitated a change in the delivery of diabetes care , with a shift of focus from hospital to community .
background	The National Service Framework for Diabetes has enshrined this approach , and the new General Medical Services ( GMS2 ) contract rewards primary healthcare professionals for developing high-quality diabetes care .
