outcome	Conversely , the amount or rate of weight loss was less in those patients receiving conjugated estrogens , oral contraceptives , propranolol , thioridazine HCl , and those who were receiving behavior modification as treatment.age factorsbehaviorbiologybody wei

###15247569
study design	Prospective randomized blinded trial in a prehospital emergency system .
other	To evaluate the effects of external active warming on acute back pain during rescue transport to hospital .
background	Acute low back pain is one of the complaints that most often entails a visit to the physician or use of the emergency system .
background	Superficial ( e.g. , hydrocolloid packs ) and deep heating ( e.g. , ultrasound ) can relieve acute low back pain in a clinical setting .
background	Recent data showed significant benefit for patients in pain from minor trauma treated by active warming during emergency transport .
other	Accordingly , we tested the hypothesis that active warming would reduce pain and anxiety in patients with acute low back pain being transported to a hospital .
population	A total of 100 patients were included in our study .
other	We selected only those suffering from acute pain > 60 mm on a visual analog scale in the lower back .
intervention	Patients were randomly assigned to two groups : active warming with a carbon-fiber electric heating blanket ( Group 1 ) versus passive warming with a woolen blanket ( Group 2 ) during transfer to hospital .
outcome	Pain scores on arrival at the hospital differed significantly between Group 1 and Group 2 ( P < 0.01 ) .
outcome	In Group 1 , pain reduction from 74.2 + / - 8.5 mm VAS to 41.9 + / - 18.9 mm VAS ( P < 0.01 ) was noted between departure from the emergency site and arrival at the hospital .
outcome	Pain scores remained practically unchanged in Group 2 ( 73.3 + / - 11.9 mm VAS and 74.1 + / - 12.0 mm VAS ) .
outcome	Active warming reduces acute low back pain during rescue transport .

###15561385
background	The objective was to investigate the effectiveness of cannabis-based medicines for treatment of chronic pain associated with brachial plexus root avulsion .
background	This condition is an excellent human model of central neuropathic pain as it represents an unusually homogenous group in terms of anatomical location of injury , pain descriptions and patient demographics .
population	Forty-eight patients with at least one avulsed root and baseline pain score of four or more on an 11-point ordinate scale participated in a randomised , double-blind , placebo-controlled , three period crossover study .
other	All patients had intractable symptoms regardless of current analgesic therapy .
intervention	Patients entered a baseline period of 2 weeks , followed by three , 2-week treatment periods during each of which they received one of three oromucosal spray preparations .
other	These were placebo and two whole plant extracts of Cannabis sativa L. GW-1000-02 ( Sativex ) , containing Delta ( 9 ) tetrahydrocannabinol ( THC ) cannabidiol ( CBD ) in an approximate 11 ratio and GW-2000-02 , containing primarily THC .
outcome	The primary outcome measure was the mean pain severity score during the last 7 days of treatment .
outcome	Secondary outcome measures included pain related quality of life assessments .
outcome	The primary outcome measure failed to fall by the two points defined in our hypothesis .
outcome	However , both this measure and measures of sleep showed statistically significant improvements .
outcome	The study medications were generally well tolerated with the majority of adverse events , including intoxication type reactions , being mild to moderate in severity and resolving spontaneously .
outcome	Studies of longer duration in neuropathic pain are required to confirm a clinically relevant , improvement in the treatment of this condition .

###16713393
background	Consumption of trans fatty acids ( TFA ) predicts higher risk of coronary heart disease , sudden death , and possibly diabetes mellitus .
background	These associations are greater than would be predicted by effects of TFA on serum lipoproteins alone .
background	Systemic inflammation and endothelial dysfunction may be involved in the pathogenesis of atherosclerosis , acute coronary syndromes , sudden death , insulin resistance , dyslipidemia , and heart failure .
background	Evidence from both observational and experimental studies indicates that TFA are pro-inflammatory .
outcome	Limited evidence suggests that pro-inflammatory effects may be stronger for trans isomers of linoleic acid ( trans-C18 :2 ) and oleic acid ( trans-C18 :1 ) , rather than of palmitoleic acid ( trans-C16 :1 ) , but further study of potential isomer-specific effects is
outcome	TFA also appear to induce endothelial dysfunction .
outcome	The mechanisms underlying these effects are not well-established , but may involve TFA incorporation into endothelial cell , monocyte/macrophage , or adipocyte cell membranes ( affecting membrane signaling pathway relating to inflammation ) or ligand-dependent
outcome	Activation of inflammatory responses and endothelial dysfunction may represent important mediating pathways between TFA consumption and risk of coronary heart disease , sudden death , and diabetes .
outcome	Further study is indicated to define these effects of TFA and the implications of such effects for cardiovascular health .

###11852293
background	Blockade of the adenosine A2A receptor potentiates the effects of levodopa in experimental animals and may offer a novel nondopaminergic target for drug therapy in Parkinson 's disease ( PD ) .

###15632455
background	Overactive bladder is a common health problem that affects millions of men and women .
background	Despite its prevalence , provider knowledge is lacking with regard to evaluation and treatment modalities .
background	Although bladder control problems are less common in men than in women , the burden of incontinence may be more significant .
background	In men presenting with symptoms of urgency and frequency , a differential diagnosis between overactive bladder and benign prostatic disease must be made because their cause and treatment are different .
background	Empiric treatment of urgency symptoms may cause them to worsen if the diagnosis is not correct .
other	Symptom assessment should include a medical history , physical examination , urinalysis , and post void residual study .
outcome	Over the past several years , many new medications have become available to treat both overactive bladder and benign prostatic disease .
outcome	These medications , in combination with behavioral interventions , are safe and effective .
outcome	The evaluation and treatment of men with symptoms of overactive bladder and/or incontinence is discussed .

###15481727
background	The relief of intractable pain after spinal cord injury ( SCI ) is very difficult to obtain , even with dorsal root entry zone lesioning , spinal cord stimulation , and thalamic stimulation .
population	Using bilateral motor cortex stimulation ( MCS ) the authors successfully treated a woman who experienced deafferentation pain 4 years after sustaining an SCI .
outcome	To the authors ' knowledge , this is the first report of bilateral MCS for pain relief after SCI .
outcome	The success they achieved using this method indicates that MCS could be a new treatment option for deafferentation pain following SCI .

###7690198
background	The effect of the ganglioside GM1 on autotomy , a nociceptive behavioral marker for neuropathic pain , and substance P depletion was determined in a rat model of peripheral mononeuropathy , sciatic cryoneurolysis ( SCN ) .
background	SCN is produced by the application of a cryoprobe to the common sciatic nerve using a freeze-thaw-freeze cycle .
background	Due to structural sparing of the nerve , regenerative processes are not precluded .
background	After this peripheral nerve insult , behavioral and neurochemical changes occur that support the use of SCN as a neuropathic pain model .
background	These changes include : autotomy with coincident transient weight loss and paling of eye color suggestive of increased sympathetic activity , spontaneous nociceptive behaviors , touch-evoked allodynia , prolonged mechanical allodynia , ipsilateral decrease of
intervention	Incidence and severity of autotomy were assessed after the intraperitoneal administration of GM1 ( 1 , 10 , and 20 mg/kg ) or saline injected daily for 2 days before SCN , the day of surgery , and for 14 days after surgery .
other	In a subset of two rats from each treatment group , transcardiac perfusion was performed and spinal cords were processed for substance P immunoreactivity .
outcome	GM1 at 10 and 20 mg/kg doses significantly attenuated autotomy as compared with saline-treated rats ( P = 0.007 and 0.0001 , respectively ) .
outcome	However , GM1 , at the doses studied , failed to alter the spinal substance P depletion 21 days after SCN .
outcome	These results indicate that the ganglioside GM1 may have a role in the clinical management of neuropathic pain after peripheral nerve injury .

###9715923
background	Low bone mass , functional impairment , low muscle strength , and postural instability are predictors of the risk of fracture in an elderly person .
background	The purpose of this study was to investigate the functional impact of an unvarying long-term exercise program to be carried out at home .
background	The exercises had been shown to delay bone loss in an elderly population .
population	At the Department of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation , University of Vienna , postmenopausal women who had been stratified into exercise or control groups 5 to 10 yr ago were called in for a follow-up examination .
other	Frequency of training , habits , and pain causing disability in activities of daily living were recorded .
other	Walking velocity , muscle strength , and postural stability were measured .
other	Functional assessment , blood analysis , and x-rays of the spine were performed additionally .
other	One hundred twenty-four women aged 68.3 + / - 6.8 yr ( mean + / - SD ) underwent a follow-up investigation at the outpatient clinic .
outcome	After 7.7 + / - 1.1 yr the compliance of the training group was still 36 % .
outcome	Self-chosen gait velocity was slightly higher in the regular exercisers than in the controls .
outcome	No intergroup differences were found for pain induced disability , muscle strength , body sway , and fracture rate .
outcome	The pain disability index was significantly associated with corrected self-chosen gait velocity .
outcome	The results suggest that an unvarying home-based exercise program may support general agility but does not yield enough force to improve muscle strength and postural stability in healthy , nondisabled , postmenopausal women who start exercising at the age o
outcome	Further studies are needed to define more appropriate exercise programs for a comprehensive improvement of functional outcome in a population at high risk for osteoporosis .

###18828705
background	An understanding of normal cerebral autoregulation and its response to pathological derangements is helpful in the diagnosis , monitoring , management , and prognosis of severe traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) .
background	Pressure autoregulation is the most common approach in testing the effects of mean arterial blood pressure on cerebral blood flow .
background	A gold standard for measuring cerebral pressure autoregulation is not available , and the literature shows considerable disparity in methods .
background	This fact is not surprising given that cerebral autoregulation is more a concept than a physically measurable entity .
other	Alterations in cerebral autoregulation can vary from patient to patient and over time and are critical during the first 4-5 days after injury .
background	An assessment of cerebral autoregulation as part of bedside neuromonitoring in the neurointensive care unit can allow the individualized treatment of secondary injury in a patient with severe TBI .
background	The assessment of cerebral autoregulation is best achieved with dynamic autoregulation methods .
background	Hyperventilation , hyperoxia , nitric oxide and its derivates , and erythropoietin are some of the therapies that can be helpful in managing cerebral autoregulation .
background	In this review the authors summarize the most important points related to cerebral pressure autoregulation in TBI as applied in clinical practice , based on the literature as well as their own experience .

###392298
background	Percutaneously inserted spinal epidural neurostimulation has been derived as a simplified safe alternative to surgically implanted , dorsal column stimulation that is used in the effective treatment and control of spasticity and intractable pain .
population	Twenty-seven tissue specimens from fifteen patients having had percutaneous epidural neurostimulation systems implanted were studied with the aid of light microscopy .
other	The biopsies from tissues around the cables , around the receivers , and at the actual site of epidural stimulation ( at the metallic contact ) , were studied at time intervals varying from one week to two years postimplantation .
outcome	Long-term results , which only show dense fibrous encapsulation of the cables and the receiver , substantiate clinical belief regarding the `` histological safety '' of this electronic modality .

outcome	Just under 50 % of subjects ( 46/98 ) acknowledged some degree of medication nonadherence in the previous 2 years , and 32 % ( 29/92 ) reported only partial adherence in the last month ( missing 30 % or more of their prescribed medication ) .
outcome	Backward stepwise logistic regression demonstrated that partially adherent subjects were best distinguished from adherent subjects by a more frequent past history of nonadherence , denial of severity of illness , and greater duration of being prescribed a m
outcome	Rates of mood stabilizer nonadherence are high .
outcome	Attitudes and behaviors are better predictors of nonadherence than side effects from medication .
outcome	Clinicians need to inquire routinely about problems with adherence .

population	Two milligrams of morphine mixed with 2 mL of vaseline sterile-oil have been epidurally administered to 40 consecutive patients undergoing lumbar microdiscectomy , evaluating safety and analgesic effectiveness of the compound and the incidence of epidural
other	Outcome measures included ( 1 ) visual analog scale ( VAS ) to assess the intensity of spontaneous low back and radicular pain , ( 2 ) straight-leg-raising maneuver to assess the degrees of leg elevation in relation to evoked-sciatic pain , ( 3 ) postoperative time to comfortable ambulation , ( 4 ) duration of postoperative hospitalization , ( 5 ) required amount of postoperative analgesics , ( 6 ) postoperative work time loss , and ( 7 ) follow-up lumbar magnetic resonance imaging or segmental computed tomography with contrast medium for quantitative evaluation of postoperative epidural fibrosis .
outcome	Neither intraoperative nor postoperative clinically relevant adverse events , such as urinary retention , respiratory disturbances , or wound infections , were observed .
outcome	At hospital discharge , patients showed a low pain intensity score ( mean VAS 11.3 mm + / - 0.88 ; mean straight-leg-raising 64.9 degrees + / - 14.6 ) , with low consumption of analgesics ( 31.2 % in hospital , 35 % at home ) .

outcome	At the last neuroradiological control , according to the 5-grade scale of Ross et al ( Neurol Res 1999 ) , epidural fibrosis scored 0 in 8 cases and 1 in 32 cases .
outcome	Epidural application of morphine-vaseline sterile-oil compound after lumbar microdiscectomy proved to be safe and effective , improving postoperative pain control and return to function .
outcome	At clinical and neuroradiological follow-up epidural fibrosis was acceptable .
outcome	To confirm the efficacy of the compound , large prospective studies are warranted .

###15479685
background	We developed a patient centred approach to chronic disease self management by providing information designed to promote patient choice .
background	We then conducted a randomised controlled trial of the approach in inflammatory bowel disease ( IBD ) to assess whether it could alter clinical outcome and affect health service use .
study design	A multicentre cluster randomised controlled trial .
other	The trial was conducted in the outpatient departments of 19 hospitals with randomisation by treatment centre , 10 control sites , and nine intervention sites .
intervention	For patients at intervention sites , an individual self management plan was negotiated and written information provided .
population	A total of 700 patients with established inflammatory bowel disease were recruited .
other	Main outcome measures recorded at one year were quality of life , health service resource use , and patient satisfaction .
other	Secondary outcomes included measures of enablement-confidence to cope with the condition .

outcome	The two groups were similar with respect to satisfaction with consultations .
outcome	Immediately after the initial consultation , those who had undergone self management training reported greater confidence in being able to cope with their condition ( difference 0.90 ( 95 % CI 0.12-1 .68 ) ; p < 0.03 ) .
outcome	Adoption of this approach for the management of chronic disease such as IBD in the NHS and other managed health care organisations would considerably reduce health provision costs and benefit disease control .

population	We examined the relationship between daytime symptoms and respiratory disturbance indices during sleep in 60 patients with sleep apnea syndrome who had an apnea index of more than 5/hr for at least one night .
outcome	Daytime hypersomnolence , morning headache , and a history of traffic accidents did not correlated strongly with apnea index or with nocturnal desaturation .

outcome	These data suggest that diagnostic criteria should not be based on apnea index or desaturation alone .

###7580006
background	Gonal-F ( Serono , Aubonne , Switzerland ) is a recombinant human follicle stimulating hormone ( FSH ) synthesized in vitro by cells into which genes encoding for FSH subunits have been inserted .
background	This preparation exhibits physiochemical , immunological , and pharmacological properties that bear great similarity to those of native human FSH .
background	It has a high specific activity and can be administered subcutaneously .
background	To compare the efficacy and safety of Gonal-F with those of urinary human FSH ( Metrodin ; Serono ) in achieving superovulation for IVF purposes in a prospective , randomized study .
population	Twenty infertile patients ( normo-ovulatory healthy women ) were recruited for the study and allocated at random to the Gonal-F or Metrodin groups .
intervention	The treatment protocol consisted of pituitary down regulation by GnRH analog ( Buserelin ; Hoechst , Frankfurt , Germany ) employing the `` long '' protocol initiated at the mid-luteal phase ( 900 micrograms/day , intranasal administration ) .
intervention	Gonal-F ( SC ) or Metrodin ( IM ) was injected daily ( 225 IU/day ) starting on cycle day 3 .
other	Dose adjustment was performed , when necessary , from cycle day 7 .
outcome	Of the 20 cycles analyzed , none was canceled due to poor response .
outcome	No cases of adverse effects ( including local intolerance ) or ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome were recorded in either group .
outcome	They did not differ significantly in the following treatment-dependent variables : hormone profile , duration of FSH treatment , total FSH dose required to achieve follicular maturation , and the number of oocytes retrieved , fertilized , and replaced .
outcome	These preliminary data concur with previous studies in demonstrating that Gonal-F is as effective and safe as Metrodin ( when given in combination with a `` long '' protocol of GnRH analog ) in inducing controlled ovarian hyperstimulation for IVF purp
outcome	Its mode of administration ( SC instead of IM ) offers an additional advantage over the urinary human FSH .

###17033813
background	We studied if the beneficial effects of bisphosphonates are maintained after their discontinuation , and whether adverse effects may develop .
population	Seventeen children in whom I.V. bisphosphonates were discontinued for at least 12 months were included .
other	Fracture rate ( FR ) , skeletal pain , bone mineral density of total body ( TB ) and spine L ( 2-4 ) , skeletal radiographs , bone markers and kidney functions were compared between ( a ) before treatment , ( b ) end of treatment , and ( c ) last follow-up .
other	Mean treatment duration was 22 + / -2 months ( 6-43 ) and follow-up 26 + / -2 months ( 18-44 ) .
outcome	FR ( mean + / - SD ) decreased from 0.74 + / -0.21 / year before treatment to 0.35 + / -0.11 / year after treatment and 0.20 + / -0.09 / year at follow-up ( p < 0.05 ) .
outcome	Three children had bone pain before treatment , six during treatment and none at end of follow-up ( p < 0.05 ) .
outcome	TB Z-score increased from -1.24 + / -0.50 at baseline to -0.37 + / -0.44 at end of treatment and -0.39 + / -0.37 at follow-up ( p < 0.05 ) .
outcome	Spinal Z-score increased from -1.65 + / -0.57 to -0.34 + / -0.56 and 0.19 + / -0.49 , respectively ( p < 0.05 ) .
outcome	Bone turnover markers showed sustained effect of bisphosphonates .
outcome	No adverse effects on kidney functions or skeletal radiographs were noted .
outcome	We conclude that I.V. bisphosphonates continue to exert their beneficial effect for a mean of 26 + / -2 months after their discontinuation ; therefore , once therapeutic goals are achieved , the medication can be withheld , followed by periodic re-evaluation .

###4054633
other	From this and the previous article , the following points may be offered in summary
outcome	When comparing the elderly age group with the general population , the incidence of migraine headaches decreases with age , whereas other etiologies such as glaucoma , temporal arteritis , and cerebrovascular disease may assume a more prominent role in the di
outcome	Patients in the geriatric population are frequently taking a multitude of medications , and it is extremely important to carefully evaluate these for possible precipitants of headache .
outcome	Furthermore , in elderly patients with other potential medical problems , particular attention should be paid to the possibility of various systemic causes of headache .
outcome	Therapy for specific headache disorders should be tailored to the individual patient .
outcome	Consider the patient 's overall general , psychological , medical , and neurologic background .
outcome	The physician must be aware of possible interactions of medications with the therapeutic intervention , as well as possible poor tolerance to specific medications due to preexisting medical or neurologic disorders .

###8427136
background	Few options are available for patients with severe heart failure that is unresponsive to therapy with digoxin , diuretics , and vasodilators .
population	The clinical responses and predictors of survival were studied in 41 consecutive patients with New York Heart Association ( NYHA ) class IV heart failure during long-term oral enoximone therapy ( mean dose 232 + / - 15 mg/day ) .
other	The mean age was 60 + / - 1 years , and the initial left ventricular ejection fraction was 0.19 + / - 0.01 .
other	The cause of heart failure was either coronary artery disease ( n = 23 ) or dilated cardiomyopathy ( n = 18 ) .
outcome	Symptomatic improvement occurred in the majority ( 83 % ) of patients ; 24 % improved two or more NYHA classes .
outcome	Although the 12-month mortality rate for the entire group was high ( 54 + / - 8 % ) , a subgroup of patients with dilated cardiomyopathy achieved a sustained benefit with a decrease in symptoms > 1 NYHA class , fewer hospitalizations , and a survival rate at 24 m
outcome	Multivariate analysis identified the cause of heart failure , left ventricular ejection fraction , and clinical improvement within 60 days of enoximone therapy as predictors of a favorable long-term outcome .
outcome	The presence of coronary artery disease was most predictive of early mortality ( p < 0.0002 ) , with only 5 % of patients surviving > 18 months compared to 66 % of those with dilated cardiomyopathy .
outcome	Median survival rates were 132 + / - 31 and 921 + / - 214 days ( p < 0.001 ) for the coronary artery disease and dilated cardiomyopathy populations , respectively .
outcome	Oral enoximone can provide symptomatic improvement and a palliative option for the majority of patients with refractory heart failure resulting from cardiomyopathy .

###11145005
background	Efficiency and safety of amantadine sulfate ( AMS ) infusions were investigated in late stage complications of Parkinson 's disease ( PD ) .
population	In an open-label study , 21 PD patients suffering from motor fluctuations and/or dyskinesias were administered AMS infusions ( PK-Merz , 400 mg per day ) during seven days .

outcome	AMS infusions followed by oral administration appeared as a safe method for improvement of both motor fluctuations and dyskinesias in advanced PD .
outcome	In advantage to simple oral therapy , AMS infusions allowed fast introduction of a profound and durable treatment effect .

###18619990
background	Transformation of the OA-group toxins into fatty acid ester derivatives ( often designated `` DTX3 '' ) is common in many bi
background	and after 3 and 6 weeks of
outcome	Analysis of samples by HPLC-MS/MS and HPLC-MS ( 2 ) revealed some differences in identity and abundance of fatty acid moieties of the OA-group esters between species , but the 16:0 fatty acid esters dominated in both oysters and mussels , which is in accordanc
other	A wider range of PTX2 SA-esters were detected compared to esters of the OA-group toxins in both mussels and oysters , and in oysters , both 140 , 184 and 205 fatty acid side chains were more common than 160 .
outcome	OA-group toxins were esterified to a larger degree in oysters ( 83-93 % ) compared to mussels ( 21-41 % ) , and in mussels a higher proportion of OA was esterified compared to DTX1 and DTX2 .
outcome	Contrary to what was observed for OA-group toxins , PTX2 SA was esterified to a larger degree in mussels ( 81 % ) compared to oysters ( 64 % ) .
outcome	Calculations of depuration rates for all individual esters of each parent compound showed that the esters of DTX1 depurated significantly slower from both mussels and oysters compared to esters of OA , DTX2 and PTX2 SA , but overall the depuration rates of
outcome	This indicated that differences in depuration rates are not causing the large species-specific differences in levels and profiles of these toxins .
outcome	Instead , the results for the OA-group toxins suggested that a higher rate of esterification in oysters is the main factor causing the observed differences in the proportion of esters to free toxin .
outcome	For PTX2 SA , large differences in ester profiles and a higher proportion of esters of PTX2 SA in mussels compared to oysters suggested differential assimilation and metabolic rate processes for the PTXs compared to OA-group toxins between these species .
outcome	Hence , although produced by the same Dinophysis species , conclusions about the dynamics of one toxin group based on results from the other group should be avoided in future studies .

###17708471
background	Kyphoplasty , the newest of the tools treating vertebral osteoporotic compression fractures ( VOCF ) is the evolution of vertebroplasty , allowing not only pain control and strengthening of the fractured vertebra , but also offering the possibility to restore
population	We present our series of 41 consecutive VOCF treated by kyphoplasty in 30 patients between October 2003 and March 2006 .
other	Systematic spinal X rays and CT scan have be performed , occasionally followed by bone scintigraphy or spinal MRI .
other	The mean preoperative duration of symptoms before surgery was 52 days .
outcome	Pain control after the operation was considered excellent in all cases and all patients were mobilized the day after surgery .
outcome	Kyphoplasty allowed a 50 % restoration of vertebral height in 66 % of the treated vertebras .
outcome	The results were better when surgery was performed within the first three months after the fracture .
outcome	The mean vertebral deformity correction by comparison of the pre - and postoperative Cobb angles was 9.7 degrees .
outcome	One patient showed cement leakage in the spinal canal without neurological deterioration .
outcome	The mean postoperative stay was 2.5 days .
outcome	We found kyphoplasty to be a safe technique allowing immediate pain control after VOCF , with minimal risks of cement leakage or pulmonary embolism .
outcome	Vertebral height and deformity correction are best achieved with early surgery , but pain control is always excellent even with a delayed procedure .

###16496831
background	The objectives of this randomised controlled study were to determine if pre-admission patient education affects post-operative pain levels , domiciliary self-care capacity and patient recall following a laparoscopic cholecystectomy ( LC ) .
intervention	Participants were randomised to receive the standard preadmission program ( SP ) or an individualised , education intervention ( El ) .
other	A pre-operative questionnaire was administered in the pre-admission clinic to determine participants ' knowledge of LC and post-operative management .
other	Telephone follow-up and post-operative questionnaire were conducted approximately 14 days post discharge .
other	Preadmission clinic of a Sydney , Australia , tertiary referral hospital .
population	Ninety-three elective LC patients .
outcome	EI participants experienced lower pain levels and had significantly greater recall of provided information .
outcome	However , no significant differences were found between the control and intervention groups for domiciliary self-care .
outcome	Pre-admission education intervention helps reduce post-operative pain levels following LC and significantly increases patients ' knowledge of self-care and complication management .

###14632299
background	The reported incidence of bone complications after radiation therapy is quite low .
background	The most commonly seen bone complication is insufficiency fractures of the pubis and sacrum .
background	Treatment of insufficiency fractures consists of conservative care , and mineral replacement may be useful .
background	The resolution of symptoms takes at least one year with these treatments .
background	Vascular damage has an important role in the etiology of late radiation injury in normal tissues .
background	Progressive ischemic changes further weaken the bone structure , which can cause fractures , and healing is also delayed .
background	Pentoxifylline is a methylxanthine derivative that is shown to increase tissue blood flow .
population	Here , we present a 63-year-old male patient with pelvic insufficiency fractures due to postoperative pelvic irradiation for rectal adenocarcinoma .
intervention	The patient received pelvic radiotherapy to a total dose of 50.4 Gy with concomitant 5-FU .
other	Six months after the completion of radiotherapy , the patient presented with severe pelvic pain .
outcome	Pelvic magnetic resonance imaging ( MRI ) demonstrated abnormal signal intensity with insufficiency fractures at the sacrum and bone marrow edema near the fractures , but not an abnormal intensity that revealed bone metastases .
outcome	Neither distant nor locoregional recurrence was observed at his work-up .
outcome	The final diagnosis was insufficiency fractures of the pelvic bones owing to irradiation , and pentoxifylline ( 400 mg , 3 times daily , peroral , 1,200 mg/day ) was used for eight months as treatment .
outcome	Dramatic clinical improvement was obtained in six months , and objective healing was revealed with MRI .
outcome	We concluded that pentoxifylline is a cost-effective drug with minimal adverse effects in treating radiation damage of bone .

###11948388
background	To compare cranial ultrasound studies and neurodevelopmental outcome of preterm infants affected by maternal floor infarction ( MFI ) of the placenta to gestational age-matched controls over an 8-year period from a single institution .
study design	Retrospective case/control study .
outcome	Compared to gestational age-matched controls , infants born to mothers with MFI had a higher incidence of CNS injury on neonatal cranial ultrasound examinations and at follow-up were more likely to have a suspicious or abnormal neurologic examination .
outcome	MFI cases had lower developmental scores in all areas tested and were more likely to have neurodevelopmental impairment .
outcome	Infants born to mothers with MFI should have serial neonatal cranial ultrasound examinations to detect CNS injury and neurodevelopmental assessment during early childhood .

###11319657
background	To study the changes of haemostatic risk factors for coronary heart disease during a weight reduction programme in obese children and adolescents .
study design	A short-term longitudinal study .
population	Thirty-seven obese white girls ( age , 12 + / -1.8 y ; body mass index ( BMI ) , 26.9 + / -5.25 ) and 19 obese white boys ( age , 11.9 + / -1.7 y ; BMI , 26.2 + / -5.2 ) .

outcome	Changes in risk factors were correlated to changes in body composition .

###145506
background	The rare liquor leakage syndrome with cranial nerve lesion , which preferably affects the eye-muscle nerves , can be caused either by further leakage of liquor cerebrospinalis through the dura hole made by the lumbar puncture - or after a surgical operation

###15949752
background	The calculation of protein structures from nuclear magnetic resonance ( NMR ) data has been greatly facilitated by improvements in software for the automatic assignment of NOESY spectra .
background	Nevertheless , for larger proteins , resonance overlap may lead to an overwhelming number of assignment options per peak .
background	Although most software for automatic NOESY assignment can deal with a certain level of assignment ambiguity , structure calculations fail when this becomes too high .
background	Reducing the number of assignment options per peak by reducing the chemical shift tolerances can lead to correct assignments being excluded , and thus also to incorrect structures .
population	We have investigated , systematically , for three proteins of different size , the influence of the chemical shift tolerance limits ( Delta ) and of the number of simulated annealing ( SA ) cooling steps on the performance of the software ARIA .
outcome	Large tolerance windows , and the correspondingly high levels of ambiguity , did not cause problems when appropriately slower cooling was used in our SA protocol .
outcome	In cases where a high percentage of well-converged structures was not achieved , we demonstrate that it is more productive to calculate fewer structures whilst applying slow cooling , than to calculate many structures with fast cooling .
outcome	In this way , high-quality structures were obtained even for proteins whose NMR spectra showed great degeneracy , and where there was much inconsistency in peak alignment between different samples .
outcome	The method described herein opens the way to the automated structure determination of larger proteins from NMR data .

###15323217
background	Elevated levels of total and low density lipoprotein ( LDL ) cholesterol and low levels of high density lipoprotein ( HDL ) cholesterol are important risk factors for coronary heart disease .
background	Another established predictor of cardiovascular disease is obesity .

outcome	A linear correlation between the degree of obesity and plasma level of LDL cholesterol and triglycerides was shown .

###8562664
background	The aim of this study was to test the hypothesis that obsessive-compulsive symptoms are temporarily worsened by acute intravenous clomipramine , suggesting that there is a basal hypersensitivity of serotonin ( 5-HT ) receptors in obsessive-compulsive ( OC ) pa
background	We also investigated the relationship of the effects of acute ( intravenous ) and chronic ( oral ) administration of clomipramine .
population	Twenty-eight OC patients were recruited .

###15332420
background	Bisphosphonates are the treatment of choice for hypercalcaemia of malignancy ( HCM ) but there is no consensus regarding which drug or dose should be given .
intervention	We designed a systematic review to investigate the efficacy of bisphosphonates in the treatment of HCM .
other	We identified randomized controlled trials ( RCTs ) by searching electronic databases , scanning of reference lists , and consultation with experts and pharmaceutical companies .
other	Foreign papers were translated .
other	Inclusion criteria were RCTs , confirmed malignant disease and measurement of serum calcium ( ionized or corrected for albumin ) postrehydration .
other	The primary outcome was number of patients achieving normocalcaemia .
other	Secondary outcomes were time to normocalcaemia , time to relapse and toxicity .
outcome	Twenty-seven papers and two abstracts , using intravenous bisphosphonates , fulfilled the inclusion criteria .
outcome	Data from 26 studies were used in analyses .
outcome	Due to the heterogeneity of studies , meta-analysis could not be performed .
outcome	Pamidronate was more effective than placebo , mithramycin , etidronate ( 7.5 mg/kg ) and low-dose clodronate ( 600 mg ) , but equal to higher dose clodronate ( 1500 mg ) .
outcome	Clodronate and etidronate were superior to placebo ; incadronate was superior to elcatonin ; gallium nitrate was superior to etidronate .
outcome	No difference was seen between alendronate and clodronate .
outcome	Three dose finding studies showed no difference between 30-90 mg of pamidronate , but one well designed study showed increasing efficacy with increasing dose .
outcome	Studies using increasing doses of ibandronate ( 0.6-4 mg ) , alendronate ( 2.5-15 mg ) , and incadronate ( 2.5-10mg ) , showed a dose response .
outcome	Duration of administration of pamidronate did not affect efficacy ( six studies ) .
outcome	Bisphosphonates normalize calcium in > 70 % patients with minimal side effects .
outcome	Aminobisphosphonates are most effective at maintaining normocalcaemia and should be given in high dose irrespective of baseline serum calcium .

###10465501
background	Previous studies suggested that magnetization transfer ratio ( MTR ) histograms are highly correlated with other magnetic resonance imaging ( MRI ) measures and can be used as a reliable method for quantifying overall disease burden in multiple sclerosis ( MS )
background	However , the relative influence of burden and severity of macroscopic MS lesions and degree of brain atrophy on various MTR histogram parameters has not yet been fully elucidated .
other	Aim of the present study was to investigate which MRI measure best predicts the values of MTR histogram parameters in MS patients .
population	Forty-two MS patients underwent brain dual-echo .
intervention	T1-weighted and magnetization transfer imaging ( MTI ) MRI scans .
other	Hyperintense lesion load ( LL ) on proton density ( PD ) - weighted and hypointense LL on T1-weighted images were measured using a local thresholding technique .
other	A measure of brain atrophy was derived from T1-weighted images by computing the volume of brain tissue segmented from a slab of five consecutive slices rostral to the velum interpositum .
other	On MTI scans , MTR histogram analysis was performed for the whole brain and average lesion MTR was also calculated .
outcome	PD-weighted LL , T1-weighted LL and brain volume were significantly correlated with several MTI-derived measures .
outcome	When a multivariate analysis was performed , brain volume alone significantly predicted the values of all the MTR histogram-derived measures ( P values ranged from 0.003 to 0.0002 ) .
outcome	The ratio between hypointense T1-weighted and hyperintense PD-weighted LL significantly predicted average lesion MTR ( P < 0.05 ) .
outcome	Our results confirm that MTR can be used as a reliable method to assess both the overall disease burden and the individual lesion intrinsic nature in MS patients .
outcome	The significant influence of brain atrophy on MTR histogram parameters supports the concept that this method also provides information on the loss of brain parenchyma in MS.

other	Type 2 diabetes ( n = 297 ) was defined by self-report , use of insulin or other hypoglycemic agents , or a random nonfasting glucose value > or = 200 mg/dl .
outcome	In diabetic women , 3 years of ALN treatment was associated with increased BMD at all sites studied , including 6.6 % at the lumbar spine and 2.4 % at the hip , whereas women in the placebo group experienced a decrease in BMD at all sites except the lumbar spi
outcome	The safety/tolerability of ALN was similar to placebo , except for abdominal pain , which was more likely in the ALN group .
outcome	ALN increased BMD relative to placebo in older women with type 2 diabetes and was generally well tolerated as a treatment for osteoporosis .
outcome	Increases in BMD with ALN therapy compared with placebo were similar between women with and without diabetes .

###12392334
background	To review the change in number of referrals to speech and language therapy for dysphasia and dysphagia over one decade .
study design	This retrospective study analyses data collected on an information system developed specifically for the use of speech and language therapists in the management of their services .
population	Eleven health care providers used the system between 1985 and 1995 and recorded details of 73758 patients referred to speech and language therapy during that period .
outcome	Whilst there were 12 times as many dysphasic patients as dysphagic patients referred to speech and language therapy in 1987 , the position was reversed by 1995 with twice as many dysphagic as dysphasic patients being referred to these services .
outcome	Dysphagia in 1987 accounted for less than 1 % of the referrals to speech and language therapy .
outcome	This percentage increased , until in 1995 20 % of referrals were for dysphagia .
outcome	No causal relationship between the changes in referral to speech and language therapy for these two groups has been established in this study .
outcome	However , there has been a significant increase in referral to speech and language therapy of people with dysphagia .
outcome	Whilst referrals for dysphasia have increased , they represent a lower percentage increase and now receive less treatment per case than in 1987 .

###2912613
background	Atlantoaxial subluxation has been treated conventionally by Gallie posterior fusion .
background	This technique , however , has disadvantages such as the frequent occurrence of pseudarthrosis , a high probability of relapse , and the necessity of long-standing strict external fixation until bone fusion .
population	To overcome these problems , posterior occipitoatlantoaxial fusion was performed using a rectangular rod that assures strong internal fixation in 16 patients with atlantoaxial subluxation .
other	The condition was complicated by superior migration of the dens in five patients .
outcome	Clinical and roentgenographic examinations before and after the operation showed improvements in neurological symptoms and in pain in the neck and occipital region in all patients .
outcome	Bone fusion was observed in all patients and reduction , performed to the extent possible during the operation , was retained adequately .
outcome	The present method , which provides strong internal fixation , allows bone fusion and early initiation of rehabilitation with a simple external support of the neck .
outcome	It also facilitates laminectomy of C1 in patients with associated myelopathy .
outcome	This procedure , therefore , is particularly effective in patients with marked instability or with rheumatoid arthritis and makes postoperative application of a halo vest or skull traction unnecessary .

###11821967
study design	Retrospective analysis of augmentation ileocystoplasty for neurogenic bladder .
background	To analyze the effects and complications of augmentation ileocystoplasty in patients with neurogenic bladder due to spinal cord injury ( SCI ) or spina bifida retrospectively .
other	Department of Urology , Kanagawa Rehabilitation Hospital , Japan .
population	We have treated 11 patients with neurogenic bladder due to SCI and 10 patients with spinal bifida with augmentation ileocystoplasty since 1989 .
other	The purpose of the treatment was to stop vesicoureteral reflux ( VUR ) and/or amelioration of urinary incontinence .
other	In 17 of 21 cases , the antireflux operation was received simultaneously .
other	All cases performed clean intermittent self catheterization postoperatively .
outcome	Urinary incontinence improved in all cases and only transient recurrence of VUR was observed in the follow-up term .
outcome	Complications occurred in patients with SCI , but they could be treated conservatively .
outcome	Augmentation ileocystoplasty is a good treatment option for contracted bladder or VUR , which occurs in patients with neurogenic bladder .

###1848139
background	Chemosensitivity test has its role in cancer therapy .
background	Using an accurate , efficient , and simple way to choose the proper chemosensitive drugs in our clinical study will help advance our work .
background	The MTT assay is a rapid , precise , and new method to perform drug sensitivity assay .
population	We used an ovarian cancer cell line ( OC-3L-VGH ) to compare the accuracy of the MTT and the [ 3H ] - TdR incorporation assay in measuring chemosensitivity of 7 anticancer drugs .
outcome	Good correlation was observed between the MTT and the [ 3H ] - TdR assay for drug sensitivity testing ( r = 0.893 , P less than 0.001 ) .
outcome	Based on this study we found it may be preferable to use the MTT assay for chemosensitivity screening .

###14571335
background	The purpose of this research was to ascertain whether the existence of swallowing apnea ( SA ) was the sole result of glottic closure or the result of its own neural mechanism .
population	Forty individuals served as participants .
other	Groups 1 and 2 consisted of 10 individuals with laryngectomy less than one year and 10 individuals greater than one year , respectively .
other	Groups 3 and 4 comprised 20 individuals who were age - and gender-matched to Groups 1 and 2 .
other	SA duration ( SAD ) was acquired during saliva swallows and 10 - , 15 - , 20 - , and 25-ml water boluses .
intervention	A repeated measures ANOVA was performed to determine mean differences in SAD as a function of group and bolus volume .
outcome	Significant main effects of group and bolus volume were found and a significant interaction of group x bolus volume was found .
outcome	In post-hoc analyses , both groups with laryngectomy exhibited statistically longer SADs than control groups .
outcome	In single-df comparisons , the laryngectomy group over one year exhibited significantly shorter SADs on smaller versus larger bolus volumes .
outcome	Even though SA is theoretically no longer needed in individuals with laryngectomy , the presence of SA remained in both groups with laryngectomy .
outcome	Thus , these results support the hypothesis that SA is the result of its own neural command .

###9863930
background	Enoxaparin , a low molecular weight heparin , has been demonstrated to be effective in the prophylaxis and treatment of deep vein thrombosis ( DVT ) in the general population .
background	This study presents an analysis of the costs of subcutaneous ( SQ ) enoxaparin compared with intravenous ( IV ) heparin .
population	Data were gathered on six spinal cord injured ( SCI ) patients in an acute freestanding rehabilitation center who were initially treated with SQ enoxaparin ( n = 3 ) or IV heparin ( n = 3 ) for a proximal DVT .
outcome	No patients in either group developed further clinical complications .
outcome	Comparison of the total costs of each treatment was performed , including the direct cost of the drug , as well as some of the costs of administration .
outcome	Although the cost of enoxaparin per unit dose is higher , the total costs of enoxaparin are slightly lower , because its labor and administration costs are less .
outcome	Subcutaneous enoxaparin is a safe , cost-effective , and less labor-intensive treatment , and can be of substantial benefit in the treatment of DVT in SCI patients in the rehabilitation setting .

###2355747
background	In attempts to increase the specificity of the CA 12-5 test the ratio of CA 12-5 and CEA concentrations has been determined in 155 cancer patients , all of whom had an increased serum CA 12-5 .
population	The patients included 47 with epithelial ovarian cancer , 38 with colorectal cancer , 24 with cervical cancer , 20 with lung cancer , 17 with gastric cancer , and 9 with pancreatic cancer .
outcome	The CA 12-5 / CEA ratio in serum of patients with ovarian cancer ranged from 30 to 920 ( mean 251 ) , whereas in other types of cancer the highest ratio was 240 and the mean was 13 .
outcome	All 47 patients with ovarian cancer , but only 7 of the 108 patients with other types of cancer , showed a CA 12-5 / CEA ratio greater than 25 .
outcome	About 10 % of the patients with gastric or colorectal cancer but none of those with other types of cancer showed an increased ratio .
outcome	As the predictive value of a CA 12-5 / CEA ratio of less than 25 excluding ovarian cancer is 100 % , we recommend measuring the CEA concentration in all those with increased CA 12-5 and calculation of the CA 12-5 / CEA ratio .

###18068430
background	A low peak oxygen uptake ( pVO ( 2 ) ) and steep VE/VCO ( 2 ) slope are independently associated with a worse prognosis in patients with chronic heart failure ( CHF ) .
background	We wished to confirm whether combining these variables as a ratio would lead to a more accurate predictor of prognosis than using either alone .
population	388 CHF patients completed a treadmill-based cardiopulmonary exercise test ( CPET ) to volitional exhaustion using a modified Bruce protocol .
outcome	212 CHF patients completed the CPET with a peak RER > or = 1.0 .
outcome	Of these , 48 patients died and one was transplanted during follow-up .
outcome	In surviving patients , the median follow-up period was 42 months ( IQR 34-49 months ) .
outcome	The ratio VE/VCO ( 2 ) slope/pVO ( 2 ) was calculated for each individual and its ability to predict outcome compared with other variables .
outcome	The Cox multivariable survival analysis showed that pVO ( 2 ) was the strongest independent predictor of mortality in CHF patients .
outcome	Our study shows that the composite variable VE/VCO ( 2 ) slope/pVO ( 2 ) is a less effective prognosticator than pVO ( 2 ) alone in patients with CHF .

population	A total of 301 MS patients were randomly assigned to receive weekly i.m. injections of IFN-beta-1a or placebo .
outcome	The average age of the study population at entry was 37 years ; 92 % were Caucasian and 73 % were women .
outcome	The mean prestudy disease duration was 6.5 years , mean prestudy exacerbation rate was 1.2 per year and the mean EDSS score was 2.3 .
outcome	The randomization yielded well-balanced treatment arms .

###1705326
background	We observed an increase in cerebral blood flow ( CBF ) for control of pain but were otherwise normal .
population	Based on that observation , we implanted stimulators for cervical spinal cord stimulation ( cSCS ) in three patients who had symptomatic cerebral ischemia .
other	Two had severe basivertebral occlusive disease and one had bilateral carotid occlusive disease .
outcome	In all three cases , cSCS alleviated the symptoms of ischemia .
outcome	Xenon-CBF studies or single-photon emission computer tomography ( SPECT ) showed increased CBF in response to cSCS .
outcome	Although no mechanism clearly responsible for this remarkable therapeutic efficacy can be proposed yet , further clinical trials of cSCS for inoperable cerebral ischemia may be justified .

###14659506
background	Clinically , chronic pain and hyperalgesia induced by muscle injury are disabling and difficult to treat .
background	Cellular and molecular mechanisms underlying chronic muscle-induced hyperalgesia are not well understood .
population	For this reason , we developed an animal model where repeated injections of acidic saline into one gastrocnemius muscle produce bilateral , long-lasting mechanical hypersensitivity of the paw ( i.e. hyperalgesia ) without associated tissue damage .
other	Since acid sensing ion channels ( ASICs ) are found on primary afferent fibers and respond to decreases in pH , we tested the hypothesis that ASICs on primary afferent fibers innervating muscle are critical to development of hyperalgesia and central sensitization in response to repeated intramuscular acid .
outcome	Dorsal root ganglion neurons innervating muscle express ASIC3 and respond to acidic pH with fast , transient inward and sustained currents that resemble those of ASICs .
outcome	Mechanical hyperalgesia produced by repeated intramuscular acid injections is prevented by prior treatment of the muscle with the non-selective ASIC antagonist , amiloride , suggesting ASICs might be involved .
outcome	ASIC3 knockouts do not develop mechanical hyperalgesia to repeated intramuscular acid injection when compared to wildtype littermates .
outcome	In contrast , ASIC1 knockouts develop hyperalgesia similar to their wildtype littermates .
outcome	Extracellular recordings of spinal wide dynamic range ( WDR ) neurons from wildtype mice show an expansion of the receptive field to include the contralateral paw , an increased response to von Frey filaments applied to the paw both ipsilaterally and contral
outcome	These changes in WDR neurons do not occur in ASIC3 knockouts .
outcome	Thus , activation of ASIC3s on muscle afferents is required for development of mechanical hyperalgesia and central sensitization that normally occurs in response to repeated intramuscular acid .
outcome	Therefore , interfering with ASIC3 might be of benefit in treatment or prevention of chronic hyperalgesia .

###15065482
background	The commissioning of healthcare services is increasingly linked to the availability of rigorous evidence of clinical and cost effectiveness .
background	In the current climate , ` rigorous evidence ' is synonymous with the randomised controlled trial ( RCT ) .
background	Consequently , health technologies are often funded in preference to service developments due to an imbalance in the availability of strong evidence to support service developments .
background	Simultaneously , there is an increasing policy emphasis on patient choice and individualized care in the NHS .
background	In this paper Bill Watson , Susan Procter and Wendy Cochrane discuss the implications of using experimental methods in service development research , with reference to an ongoing RCT evaluating the component parts of pulmonary rehabilitation in people with

###15140518
other	Objectives
background	To evaluate the psychometric properties of the Body Image Scale ( originally designed for use in cancer ) in women with benign gynaecological conditions .
population	Prospective completion of the Body Image Scale by women participating in the EVALUATE Hysterectomy Trial .
other	The scale was completed pre-operatively , then 6 weeks , 4 and 12 months post-operatively .
other	The psychometric properties were evaluated by assessing the reliability , response prevalence , discriminant validity and sensitivity to change .
other	Factor analysis was also conducted to determine the scale structure .
outcome	The Body Image Scale showed good reliability and clinical validity .
outcome	Differences between sub-groups of women were detected , demonstrating good discriminant validity .
outcome	The Body Image Scale was shown to be responsive to changes in body image .
outcome	The Body Image Scale was shown to be a reliable and valid tool for assessing body image in women with benign gynaecological conditions and for use in clinical trials involving such women .

###9988054
study design	We report results from a multicenter , placebo-controlled , randomized , double-blind comparison of the efficacy and tolerability of paroxetine and fluoxetine in outpatients with major depression .
population	Across five U.S. sites , 128 outpatients ( mean age : 41.3 + / - 12.6 ; 63 men and 65 women ) with moderate to moderately severe major depression without a history of mania or hypomania were recruited between 1993 and 1994 .
intervention	All 128 patients completed a 1-week placebo washout period , and were then randomized to 12 weeks of double-blind treatment with paroxetine up to 50 mg/day ( n = 55 ) , fluoxetine up to 80 mg/day ( n = 54 ) , or placebo ( n = 19 ) .
other	Subjects were evaluated weekly for the first 4 weeks , then at weeks 6 , 9 , and 12 with the 21-item HAMD and the Covi Anxiety Scale .
outcome	There were no significant differences among the three treatment groups in baseline and endpoint depression and anxiety severity , as well as in the degree of depression and anxiety improvement .
outcome	There were no statistically significant differences in rates or mean numbers of adverse events between paroxetine-treated patients and fluoxetine-treated patients .
outcome	In summary , our results , although limited by the lack of a significant difference from placebo in treatment outcome , suggest that the SSRIs paroxetine and fluoxetine have comparable antidepressant and antianxiety efficacies among depressed outpatients , as

###2300240
population	We performed 15 dynamic gadolinium-DTPA ( Gd-DTPA ) - enhanced MRI studies in 8 patients with relapsing and remitting multiple sclerosis ; 7 were follow-up studies .
other	We measured the time course of enhancement in 102 enhancing lesions for up to 384 minutes , with rest breaks .
outcome	Immediate postcontrast MRIs demonstrated many different patterns of enhancement .
outcome	We observed both uniformly enhancing and ring enhancing lesions .
outcome	The enhancing regions were often less extensive than the corresponding high signal on T2-weighted images .
outcome	Three lesions were seen with Gd-DTPA but not on unenhanced scans ; 1 was seen on unenhanced scans 10 days later , suggesting that blood-brain barrier disturbance may precede other MRI signs of MS lesions .
outcome	Three months later , some high-signal areas on T2-weighted scans had decreased in size to resemble the areas previously outlined by Gd-DTPA .
outcome	This technique provides useful information about the pathogenesis and behavior of MS lesions .

###15158021
population	We tested the effect of age at the time of spinal cord injury ( SCI ) on locomotor recovery , in open field tests , and mechanical hyperalgesia , using paw withdrawal frequency ( PWF ) in response to noxious mechanical stimuli , in male Sprague-Dawley rats after
other	Behavioral outcomes were measured weekly for 4 weeks in both SCI and sham groups .
outcome	Following SCI , the young and adult groups recovered significantly more locomotor function , at a more rapid rate , than did the middle-age group .
outcome	The PWF of the young group was significantly increased , the adult group was significantly decreased , and the middle-age group showed no significant change in fore - and hindlimbs when compared to other age groups , pre-injury and sham controls .
outcome	These results support age-dependent behavioral outcomes after SCI .

###7487440
background	Employers and insurers are interested in being able to use cost-effective interventions for returning injured workers to the workplace .
background	Unfortunately , truly objective information is lacking .
background	The purpose of this and two subsequent review articles was to perform thorough scrutiny and methodologic comparison among all obtainable , published randomized and controlled studies on low back pain ( LBP ) interventions leading to return to work .
other	The study was confined to English language articles published from 1975 through 1993 .
other	Of more than 4,000 LBP citations , more than 500 were chosen for review .
other	Of that number , 35 articles met the selection criteria of randomization , reasonable controls , and work return comparisons .
intervention	This paper focuses on the 10 articles relating to interventions for acute ( less than 4 weeks ) LBP , and considers bed rest , exercise , spinal manipulation , back school , and case management .
other	A 26-point quality system was used to compare the methodologic rigor of each article .
outcome	This literature survey demonstrated the meager scientific foundations on which our industrial rehabilitation programs are based .

###8242577
background	Normal skeletal integrity is maintained by physiological bone turnover through a coupled process of bone resorption , mediated by osteoclasts , followed by new bone formation , mediated by osteoblasts .
background	Major features of the pathogenesis of cancer-associated skeletal destruction are enhanced osteoclast-mediated bone resorption and disruption of normal bone formation .
background	In this article , the literature on the pathogenesis and clinical manifestations of metastatic bone disease is discussed .
background	Animal and clinical trials investigating novel bone targeted agents , emphasizing the bisphosphonates , are critically assessed .
background	The most frequent clinical manifestations of bone metastases are pain , fracture , immobility , spinal cord compression , and hypercalcemia .
background	New treatments under study for patients with bone metastases include agents specifically targeted to the skeleton such as bone-seeking radioisotopes and bisphosphonates .
background	Studies in animal models of metastatic bone disease show that these bisphosphonates are able to inhibit tumor-induced osteolysis and are potentially useful in this condition .
background	Bisphosphonates have been investigated in several clinical trials of patients with skeletal metastases from breast cancer , prostate cancer , and multiple myeloma .
background	Overall , the studies investigating bone targeted radioisotopes or bisphosphonates for the treatment of morbidity due to skeletal metastases have been inconclusive .
background	An improved understanding of the pathogenesis of metastatic bone disease and preclinical studies with bisphosphonates suggest that these agents may have a role in the treatment of this disorder .
background	Additional trials of new generation bisphosphonates , employing a rigorously controlled , randomized study design with adequate numbers of subjects , are needed to demonstrate the safety and efficacy of this class of agents in this setting .

population	In this paper are assessed through ENT-exam , rhinomanometry and cephalometry both bipedal and in dorsal decubitus , the anatomical alterations occurring in the upper airways in 100 consecutive patients , polysomnographically diagnosed of SAOS .

background	Occasionally alternative approaches are required .

###19607887
background	Effective treatment of chronic pain with morphine is limited by decreases in the drug 's analgesic action with chronic administration ( antinociceptive tolerance ) .
other	Because opioids are mainstays of pain management , restoring their efficacy has great clinical importance .
background	We have recently reported that formation of peroxynitrite ( ONOO ( - ) , PN ) in the dorsal horn of the spinal cord plays a critical role in the development of morphine antinociceptive tolerance and have further documented that nitration and enzymatic inactivat
outcome	We now report for the first time that antinociceptive tolerance in mice is also associated with the inactivation of MnSOD at supraspinal sites .
outcome	Inactivation of MnSOD led to nitroxidative stress as evidenced by increased levels of products of oxidative DNA damage and activation of the nuclear factor poly ( ADP-ribose ) polymerase in whole brain homogenates .
outcome	Co-administration of morphine with potent Mn porphyrin-based peroxynitrite scavengers , Mn ( III ) 5,10,15,20-tetrakis ( N-ethylpyridinium-2-yl ) porphyrin ( MnTE-2-PyP ( 5 + ) ) and Mn ( III ) 5,10,15,20-tetrakis ( N-n-hexylpyridinium-2-yl ) porphyrin ( MnTnHex-2-PyP ( 5 + ) ) ( 1 )
outcome	The more lipophilic analogue , MnTnHex-2-PyP ( 5 + ) was able to cross the blood-brain barrier at higher levels than its lipophylic counterpart MnTE-2-PyP ( 5 + ) and was about 30-fold more efficacious .
outcome	Collectively , these data suggest that PN-mediated enzymatic inactivation of supraspinal MnSOD provides a source of nitroxidative stress , which in turn contributes to central sensitization associated with the development of morphine antinociceptive toleran
outcome	These results support our general contention that PN-targeted therapeutics may have potential as adjuncts to opiates in pain management .

###11082454
background	Adenosine kinase ( AK ; EC 2.7.1.20 ) is a key intracellular enzyme regulating intra-and extracellular concentrations of adenosine ( ADO ) , an endogenous neuromodulator , antinociceptive , and anti-inflammatory autocoid .
background	AK inhibition provides a means of potentiating local tissue concentrations of endogenous ADO , and AK inhibitors may have therapeutic potential as analgesic and anti-inflammatory agents .
population	The effects of ABT-702 , a novel , potent ( IC ( 50 ) = 1.7 nM ) , and selective non-nucleoside AK inhibitor were examined in rat models of nociception and acute inflammation .
outcome	ABT-702 was orally effective and fully efficacious to suppress nociception in a spectrum of pain models in the rat , including carrageenan-induced thermal hyperalgesia , the formalin test of persistent pain , and models of nerve injury-induced and diabetic n
outcome	ABT-702 was also effective in the carrageenan-induced paw edema model of acute inflammation ( ED ( 50 ) = 70 micromol/kg p.o. ) .
outcome	The antinociceptive and anti-inflammatory effects of ABT-702 were blocked by selective ADO receptor antagonists , consistent with endogenous ADO accumulation and ADO receptor activation as a mechanism of action .
outcome	The antinociceptive effects of ABT-702 were not blocked by the opioid antagonist naloxone .
outcome	In addition , ABT-702 showed less potential to develop tolerance to its antinociceptive effects compared with morphine .
outcome	ABT-702 had no significant effect on rotorod performance or heart rate ( at 30-300 micromol/kg p.o. ) , mean arterial pressure ( at 30-100 micromol/kg p.o. ) , or exploratory locomotor activity ( at < / = 10 micromol/kg p.o. ) .
outcome	Thus , ABT-702 is a novel , non-nucleoside AK inhibitor , with a nonopioid , non-nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug mechanism of action , which shows antinociceptive and anti-inflammatory activity in vivo .

###11532478
background	To compare the outcome of second and third cycles of in vitro fertilization with blastocyst transfer to the outcome of first attempts at IVF with blastocyst transfer .
study design	Retrospective study .
other	Private ART center .
population	Three hundred and four patients undergoing treatment with in vitro fertilization with blastocyst transfer , 87 of which underwent at least one cycle of re-treatment after failing to achieve pregnancy in their first cycle .
intervention	Bipronucleate oocytes were grown for up to 144 hours and subsequently transferred when at least one embryo attained the expanded blastocyst stage .
other	Pregnancy and implantation rates .
outcome	Pregnancy rates per retrieval were significantly higher for patients undergoing their first cycle of in vitro fertilization with blastocyst transfer ( 36 % ) compared to those undergoing their second ( 19 % ) or their third ( 9 % ) cycles of treatment .
outcome	Implantation rates per embryo were also higher for first cycles of in vitro fertilization with blastocyst transfer ( 30 % ) compared to second ( 18 % ) or third cycles ( 8 % ) .
outcome	Pregnancy and implantation rates decline dramatically in repeated cycles of in vitro fertilization with blastocyst transfer following one or more unsuccessful cycles of in vitro fertilization with blastocyst transfer .

###15616405
population	To discuss the appropriate standard of care in randomized controlled trials of titrated therapies in critically ill patients .
background	The debate over the appropriate standard of care in randomized controlled trials was sparked by the Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome Network trial of low tidal volume ventilation .
outcome	In this trial , patients were randomized to either low or traditional tidal volume ventilation , and the investigators reported that low tidal volume ventilation significantly improved survival in patients with acute respiratory distress syndrome .
outcome	However , it was argued that the control group used in this trial was not reflective of current practice patterns and that the improvement in survival may have been derived from patients in the control group being placed at increased risk .
outcome	This debate forced intensivists to consider what defines an appropriate standard-of-care control group in randomized controlled trials of titrated therapies .
outcome	If titrated therapies are to be studied safely , the mechanism behind the titration must be understood and incorporated into the control group .
outcome	Failure to include a comparator group receiving current practice creates a study design that may jeopardize patient safety because there is no control group representing probable patient outcome outside of the trial .
outcome	Additionally , randomizing patients to the extremes of a range of care without incorporation of a current practice control group prevents the investigators from making valid recommendations for changing current practice .
outcome	The incorporation of current practice patterns into randomized controlled trials of titrated therapies is essential for producing generalizable results and safeguarding patients .

###12686402
background	The use of induced hypothermia in the treatment of traumatic spinal cord injury ( SCI ) has been studied extensively between the 1960s and 1970s .
background	Although the treatment showed some promise , it became less popular by the 1980s , mainly because of its adverse effects .
background	However , a revival of hypothermia in the treatment of traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) in the last decade has encouraged neuroscientists to conduct experiments to reevaluate the potential benefits of hypothermia in traumatic SCI .
background	All laboratory investigations studying the mechanisms of action and/or the efficacy of induced hypothermia in treating experimental traumatic SCI published in the last decade were reviewed .
background	Although efficacy of hypothermia in improving functional outcome of mild to moderate traumatic SCI has been demonstrated , hypothermia may not be protective against severe traumatic SCI .
background	At present , induced hypothermia has yet to be recognized or approved as a potential treatment having therapeutic value for traumatic SCI in humans .
background	The continued search for a possible synergistic effect of induced hypothermia and pharmacological therapy may yield some promise .
background	It has also been deduced from these laboratory studies that hyperthermia is deleterious and rigorous measures to prevent hyperthermia should be taken to minimize the propagation of secondary neuronal damage after traumatic SCI .

###10863050
background	A 78-year-old male patient had chronic , unrelieved abdominal pain due to mesenteric ischaemia .
background	Unsuccessful pharmacological approaches included oral morphine plus coadjuvants as well as a sympathetic celiac plexus block which gave pain relief that lasted for 72 h.
intervention	In order to obtain long-lasting relief , a trial epidural stimulating electrode was implanted after obtaining informed consent and Ethical Committee approval .
outcome	Complete analgesia was achieved during a trial period of 2 weeks .
outcome	Thereafter , a spinal cord stimulator was implanted .
outcome	At the time of writing , 11 months after implantation , the degree of analgesia is complete .
outcome	We believe that spinal cord stimulation may represent an alternative approach in controlling pain due to mesenteric ischaemia .
